Name: Pennsylvania State University-University Park
Overview: The Pennsylvania State University-University Park is a university located in State College, USA. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. The main campus of Pennsylvania State University-University Park is located in State College. The university offers over two undergraduate programs and 14 postgraduate programs. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. The estimated average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenditure for an international student, is around 4170979 INR. Pennsylvania State University-University Park offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship.

Name: International College Portsmouth (ICP)
Overview: Established in 2009, International College Portsmouth (ICP) is an Associate College of the University of Portsmouth and a member of the global Navitas Group. It is a campus-based college part of the city centre campus of the University of Portsmouth. Being located in the heart of Portsmouth, students from central London can reach here within 90 minutes by train, and it is just a five-minute walk from the main railway station (Portsmouth & South sea). This heart of Portsmouth location implies that this college is not very far away from the city centre or beaches along England’s south coast. It extends several pathways to more than 100 different degree programmes of the University of Portsmouth, enabling students to choose the best course for themselves. The intakes take place in September, January or June. Since 2009, more than 4000 ICP students have progressed to the University of Portsmouth. As per The Economist 2017, this university ranked #1 for boosting graduate salaries. The various undergraduate programmes offered at International College Portsmouth are divided into two categories – Foundation and First Year Degree. Besides these, there are a number of postgraduate programmes that this institute provides. The Undergraduate Foundation programmes are offered in Engineering, Mathematics, Science, Computing, Pre-sessional English (10 weeks), Business and Management, etc. A few areas in which Undergraduate First Year Degree programmes are provided include Property and Surveying, 13 weeks pre-sessional English, Engineering, Accounting and Finance, etc. Some areas in which postgraduate ICP programmes are offered include Finance, Logistics and Supply Chain Management, Education, International Relations and Criminal Justice, etc.
Eligibility Overview: English language requirementsThe language of instruction at ICP is English. Name: Carlow University
Overview: Carlow University is a university located in Pittsburgh, USA. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Art. The main campus of Carlow University is located in Pittsburgh. The university offers over four undergraduate programs and two postgraduate programs. Eligibility Overview: Enrolment RequirementsBefore registering for classes, you must submit the following financial documentation if you have been accepted to Carlow University. They are not required for Carlow to issue a Form I-20, the Certificate of Eligibility for Nonimmigrant Student Status, but they are required for Carlow to issue an admissions decision.The Office of Admissions will send you a notarized affidavit of support. Affidavits must be submitted in their entirety; copies will not be accepted.Official/Notarized Bank or Employer's Statement: All affidavits of support must be supported by an official/notarized bank or employer's statement demonstrating that the pledged amount is accessible. Each sponsor must submit a Carlow notarized document with an accompanying statement if a student has more than one sponsor. Bank statements must be accurate.
Placement: Nil
Accommodation: Housing At CarlowFrances Warde Hall and Dougherty Hall are the two residence halls of Carlow University. They are interconnected, and they are situated in a central area on campus.The assistant director of campus life, three live-in graduate resident directors, and 12 resident assistants staff the residential halls (RAs). On their various floor sections, RAs reside with the students. They assist in the management of the residence hall, the communication of important information to residents, the advice and referral of students who are having difficulties, the planning of programmes and events, the adjustment of students to a group-living environment, and the maintenance of an atmosphere conducive to academic pursuits.Check: https://www.carlow.edu/student-life/campus-life/housing/

Name: Texas Southern University
Overview: Established in 1927, Texas Southern University is a public university located in Houston, Texas, USA. This university was developed with the intention to provide African-American students with a college education. In 1931, the Southern Association of colleges approved Texas University. The Texas Southern University is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges (SACSCOC) and has around 11 schools and colleges. Texas Southern University has around 1400 faculty members and enrolls more than 7500 students in various fields, including business, education, engineering, behavioral science, health science, law, psychology, public affairs, science, arts, pharmacy, communication, computer science, and languages. The university is known for offering over 100 undergraduate, graduate, and professional courses online and offline. The university also consists of a career center that provides career development services to its students to help them achieve their goals. The university campus is spread over 150 acres, consisting of 45 buildings, including professional schools, a radio station, a performance center, a health complex, and so on. In addition, over 80 student organizations are situated on the campus. B.Sc. in Computer Science, BS in Biology, MS in Computer Science, and BS in Civil Engineering Technology are some of the top courses that are offered by the university. In addition, special research programs like Religious and Socinian Studies, Center for Philosophy are also offered by Texas Southern University. The university offers on-campus accommodation in its four major residential houses, which includes the University Courtyard, University Towers, Tier wester Oaks, and University academic village. The rooms are equipped with all the necessary things. The Texas Southern University offers excellent skill development programs and workshops to train the students and help them get employed.

Name: University of California-Merced
Overview: The University of California, Merced (UC Merced) is a public land-grant research university in Merced, California. It is the University of California's tenth and newest campus. UC Merced was formed in 2005 to "address the region's historically low levels of educational achievement." UC Merced has 8,321 undergraduates and 772 graduates, with 63.8 per cent of students getting Pell Grants, more than 99 per cent of UC Merced students hailing from California, and the university's lowest-income students from underrepresented ethnic groups.UC Merced is one of Merced County's largest employers, contributing $1.7 billion to the San Joaquin Valley economy. Under the university's Triple Zero Commitment, every building on campus is ecologically certified, making it one of the most sustainable campuses in the country. The U.S. News & World Report ranks UC Merced's undergraduate programmes 97th overall among U.S. national research universities, with "R2: Doctoral Universities - High Research Activity."

Name: University of Maine
Overview: The University of Maine is a land, sea, and space grant institution located in Orono along the banks of the Stillwater River. Founded in 1865, it offers more than 100 degree programs through graduate certificates, master's, doctoral or professional science master's degrees. The University of Maine offers study programs and interdisciplinary students in engineering, business, natural science, liberal arts, and many more. The popular majors include business management, engineering, and education. It also offers a 1+3 engineering pathway program. It also offers a general MBA, specialized MBA programs, MS degrees in engineering, educational administration, natural sciences, etc. There is an emphasis on academic research at the undergraduate and graduate levels, especially in environmental studies, climate change, marine sciences, etc. The tuition fee is between USD 24,345 to 33,240. The cost of living, including meals, is about USD 10,088. The university provides student loans and various scholarships for international students. Some of the scholarships are international presidential scholarships and international Dean's scholarships. Also, career services are provided, including an engineering job fair, UMaine career fair, focus-career assessment services, and online walk-ins.

Name: Vanderbilt University
Overview: Nashville, Tennessee's Vanderbilt University is a private research institution and was founded in 1873. The university promotes cross-disciplinary research in the fields of arts, sciences and public health that have a lasting and positive impact on society. It offers undergraduate, graduate, professional degrees and doctoral degrees, with a total of 197 programs. The most popular courses at Vanderbilt University include Masters in Business Administration (MBA), M.A in Economics, B.Sc in Computer Science and M.Sc in Mechanical Engineering. The university's main campus is situated there in the heart of Nashville. The 330-acre grounds are home to four undergraduate schools as well as six graduate schools. The Peabody College of Education and Development is located across the street opposite the Vanderbilt University Medical Center. The average annual cost of attending Vanderbilt University comes to around USD 73,000, with the fee structure varying depending on the program. International students are awarded scholarships on the basis of merit and need. Facilities on campus provide world-class facilities that ensure the holistic development of students graduating from the university. These include the Memorial Gymnasium, Vanderbilt Stadium and the Vanderbilt University Medical Center. The campus also has a historic feel to it, with a number of buildings displaying ancient architecture from back in the day and surrounded by around 190 species of shrubs and trees. The Jean and Alexander Heard Libraries ensure students have access to the best academic resources from around the world. The campus accommodates nearly 50% of the students studying at the university. The 500 clubs and 14 fraternities and sororities provide a great network for students to mingle and collaborate on various projects. The performing arts community here provides students with a way to learn and practice dance forms from across the world.

The university received great marks for income increases following MBAs. For a continuous ten years, all first-year MBA candidates who were looking for work received and accepted offers for summer internships.

According to popular rankings, Vanderbilt University's Graduate Business School is ranked #23 for the year 2021 by US News & World Report. The PG Business & Economics courses offered by Vanderbilt University are ranked between 251-300 for 2021 by THE and QS, respectively. While US News & World Report ranks Vanderbilt University's various specialisations, THE ranks the university's PG Engineering & Technology courses in the range of 176-200 for the year 2021. The following disciplines are listed in order of importance: Biomedical Engineering (#19), Chemical Engineering (#36), Civil Engineering (#43), Mechanical Engineering (#40), etc. THE has also ranked Vanderbilt University's PG Computers courses, placing them between 301 and 400 for the year 2021.
University Ranking: While it is ranked between 70 and 200 globally, Vanderbilt University is on the list of 50 top universities in the United States. Vanderbilt University is ranked #14 nationally and #72 globally for the year 2021 by US News & World Report. While worldwide rankings have maintained their position for three years, national rankings have decreased by one point from 2020. The acceptance percentage for Vanderbilt University was as low as 12%, and rankings are often based on statistics for 2020 admissions. Only a select few applicants with above-average ACT or SAT scores received admission offers. THE places Vanderbilt University at #111 for the year 2021, a drop of 5 points from its rating in the year prior. THE receives a score of 94.1 for its citations, followed by 56.9 for industry outcome and 48.7 for a global outlook, giving it an overall above-average score of 61. In contrast, QS has moved Vanderbilt University from #200 in 2020 to #187 in 2021. The university receives an average score of 41.7 from QS, with a faculty-student ratio of 100 and a ratio of 35.9 for international students.

Name: Benedictine University
Overview: The Benedictine University, located in Lisle, U.S.A., was established in 1887. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. There are master's degree programmes in nursing, nutrition, reading and literacy, taxation, values-driven leadership, business analytics, clinical exercise physiology, clinical psychology, accounting, business administration, finance, linguistics, management information systems, dietetics, public health, management, and organisational behaviour. The school provides 34 graduate certificates, 19 graduate degrees, and four doctoral programmes. A D.B.A. degree in values-driven leadership, an Ed.D. programme in higher education and organisational change, and programmes in organisation development and values-driven leadership all provide PhD programmes. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. The estimated average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenditures for an international student, are around $29,500. Benedictine University offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students.Read more details about Benedictine University on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.
Eligibility Overview: Requirements in EnglishIf English is not your first language, you must demonstrate English competency by providing one of the following:TOEFL or similar test: A minimum TOEFL score of 577 on paper and 90 on the internet is required.An IELTS score of at least 7.0 is required.A minimum of 540 points on the SAT ERBW component.An ACT English component score of at least 23 is required.a minimum score of 75 on the Duolingo English TestUndergraduate Admissions at Benedictine UniversityMore than 60 undergraduate programmes are available at the institute, some of which are traditional and others of which are online. Biology, Business Analytics, Chemistry, Marketing, Finance, Computer Science, and Data Science are just a few examples. Following the methods outlined below, you can apply to these programmes quickly and easily:For the fall semesters, the University offers rolling admissions throughout the year. Students should apply during the first semester of their senior year of high school, and overseas students should apply and prepare their documents at least three months ahead of time. It takes roughly a week for the application to be reviewed.Admissions CriteriaFill out your application form using one of the methods listed above.Official high school transcripts, as well as SAT and ACT results, are required.A minimum GPA of 2.5 on a 4.0 scale is necessary, as well as an ACT minimum score of 21 and a SAT minimum score of 800. 1060 is the minimum score that is recommended (Math and Critical Reasoning combined score)If you have less than 20 credits, your high school credits will be required as well. International students would be required to submit an evaluation of their foreign credit.If an undergraduate applicant does not satisfy the standards, a personal statement, seventh-semester transcripts, and a letter of recommendation from a high school counsellor may be required. Graduate Admissions at Benedictine UniversityBenedictine University offers over 16 graduate programmes in clinical psychology, business analytics, nutrition and wellness, accounting, and business administration, among others, to students from all over the world who want to study in the United States. Some of the courses at the university are also available online. The application process is the same as for on-campus programmes, however overseas students do not need to apply for a visa.
Placement: Placements at Benedictine UniversitiesIn 2020, the predicted pay for MBA graduates was $84,580 USD.MBAs in consulting, financial services, technology, and other fields are among the highest-paid.The average salary of Benedictine University graduates and alumni is 69,696 USD, according to payscale. Graduates with fewer than 5 years of experience earn 46,800 USD in their early careers.

Name: King's College
Overview: Established in 1946, King's College is located in Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania. The campus is spread over 50 acres offering a bachelor's degree in 40 majors across subjects including business, education, humanities, science, social science, and allied health programs. The school has introduced programs in civil and mechanical engineering and nursing. The college offers a Master of Science (M.S.) degree in health care administration and a Master of Education (M.Ed.) degree in reading and instruction. Additionally, Kings College also offers the M.D. in Physician Assistant Studies program for 5 years. The total tuition fee is USD 19,411 per semester and about USD 38,822 per annum. The part-time undergraduate fee is USD 633 per credit for international students. The average cost of living is USD 17,450 for the students living on campus. The institution offers scholarships, financial aid, and work-study programs for international students and is funded by state and federal sources. The university organizes recruitment programs for professional development seminars and job fairs for placements with internship opportunities throughout the session.
Eligibility Overview: The following are the requirements for undergraduate and graduate students:Undergraduate Admissions:Applicants for undergraduate admissions must have a high school diploma or a Grade 12 pass certificate. At King's College, the average GPA requirement is 3.57, and the applicant must be 18 years old or older when the course begins.Graduate Admissions: To be admitted to a graduate programme, students must have a high school diploma and an undergraduate degree or diploma. Course-specific prerequisites can be found on the university's website on the course pages. Students must be fluent in both written and spoken English, as well as have high English proficiency test scores.Optional SAT/ACTThe college does not need you to take a test; but, if you submit a SAT or ACT score, the college will take it into consideration. Except for a few degrees, such as Physician Assistant and Engineering (3+2), the SAT or ACT are not required for most programmes. The college requires an average SAT score of 1140 (combined Critical Reading + Math) and an average ACT score of 23. Students with below-average characteristics, on the other hand, may be chosen if their academic achievement is extraordinary.Language Proficiency in EnglishStudents must also submit their English language proficiency requirements, such as TOEFL, IELTS, or PTE. There are eight men's sports programs and ten women's, which include American football and women's lacrosse. The tuition fees, including the accommodation for the year 2021-22, were 65,240 USD. At Stetson University, 67% of full-time undergraduates receive need-based financial aid, and the average need-based scholarship or grant award is 33,564 USD.

It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Mechanical Engineering. The cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. Course Description: The University of Illinois at Chicago is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. The University of Illinois at Chicago was founded in 1859. Located in Chicago,USA the university is home to about 3845 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.The University of Illinois at Chicago is ranked 250th in Top Universities by US News. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 5 undergraduate and 3 postgraduate programs. The University of Illinois at Chicago has 9 intakes in Jan,Sep,Fall (Aug), Spring (Jan), Summer (May),Aug,May,Feb, Jul. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 4 years and master’s degree courses is 2 years.The average yearly tuition fee of The University of Illinois at Chicago is around $17,138 - $22,324 USD.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by The University of Illinois at Chicago include USC Associates Scholarships UG Business Programs,Horace W Goldsmith Fellowship,You Are Welcome Here Scholarship Bs In Kinesiology Michigan State University,Graduate Incentive Award MS Applied Economics.The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to The University of Illinois at Chicago is the post-study work opportunities in USA. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.The University of Illinois at Chicago has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: Hofstra University
Overview: A private university in Hempstead town of New York, Hofstra University was established in 1935 as an extension of New York University (NYU). Formerly known as the Nassau College - Hofstra Memorial of New York University, it became an independent college in 1939 before getting the status of a university in 1963. The university is Long Island's largest private institution and comprises thirteen schools, namely the College of Liberal Arts, School of Government, School of Education, School of Humanities, School of Natural Sciences and Mathematics, School of Health Professions, School of Nursing, School of Medicines, Honors College, School of Business, School of Engineering, School of Communication and the School of Law. Maintaining a balanced 13:1 student-faculty ratio throughout its courses ensures an engaging and nourishing academic life. The university offers undergraduate and graduate programs in diverse fields of film studies, sciences, cultural studies, finance and language. The university, situated 25 miles east of New York, has hosted three consecutive US Presidential debates.As disclosed by the US Department of Education, the average annual cost for a university without financial aid comes to around $67,000. Still, many grants and scholarships are offered by the university, which can bring down the cost to $33,000. The 240-acre lush campus of Hofstra University offers 35 residence halls, cultural centres, nurseries, libraries and theatres to ensure an enriching and holistic experience for its students. With a focus on presidency and politics, the university promises a 90% placement rate while encouraging the students to explore the world on their own. The university guides its students towards a consistent career by ensuring personal and professional growth.
Eligibility Overview: For Undergraduate courses: International students interested in pursuing undergraduate studies at Hofstra University must complete their high school education in an international school or college where English is the primary medium of instruction. If not, a student must have completed four years of high school studies in a US high school or have attended a US university or college with English as the primary language of instruction for at least the last two years. English language  proficiency requirements are:           For Postgraduate courses: To enrol in a PG programme, international students must hold a graduate degree from a US-authorised school or a college or university that teaches in English. English language  proficiency requirements are:

Electronics USA, Inc, etc.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation The university provides a safe and comfortable place for the students ensuring an inclusive and friendly atmosphere. Residence Halls for First-Year students Stuyvesant Hall First-year students are housed in suites at Stuyvesant Hall, which have two double rooms, a bathroom, and a living area. The hall is on the opposite side of the parking lot from the Student Center. The High Rises North of the Student Center, five residential towers may be found.  There are 225 to 300 pupils per high-rise structure consisting of single, double, triple, and quad rooms in the high rises with shared bathrooms at each end of the hallway. Only Honors College students live in Vander Poel Hall.  Residence Halls for Upper-class students The High Rises Same as first-year students. Suffolk Hall Approximately 230 undergraduate students are housed in a six-story suite-style housing with four or five students per room and a shared bathroom. Single or double rooms make up the bedrooms, while some suites have a communal lounge. Colonial Square Three courtyards where approximately 65 people can live in each residence and a total of 14 two-story homes make up the largest residence hall complex on campus. For more information, visit: https://www.hofstra.edu/residence-life/residence-halls.html

The UG Business programme was ranked 132 in 2021, 128 in 2020, and 127 in 2019 by US News & World Report, which also ranked the Graduate Business School between 99 to 131 for 2021.

Name: San Diego State University
Overview: Founded in 1897, San Diego State University, located in California, USA, is the oldest and largest higher education institution in San Diego. The University offers various programs- 96 Bachelor's, 80 Master's, and 21 Doctoral degree programs taught in over eight colleges. Along with that, it also provides over 350 programs in more than 50 countries. Some popular courses are Business Administration and Management, Psychology, Criminal Justice/Safety Studies, Health and Physical Education/Fitness, and Biology/Biological Sciences. The top programs of the University include- M.Sc. Information Systems, M.Sc. Computer Science, M.Sc. Mechanical Engineering, M.Sc. Nursing, and MBA. Along with academics, the University has over 300 organizations- Accounting Society, American Indian Student Organization, Artist Management and many more in which students with different interests participate. It also conducts various annual artistic events like plays, dances, films, music, etc. The University also provides a few scholarships for students. The scholarships are only available to the freshman. The student's admission application is the application for the scholarships. The Office of Undergraduate Admissions determines merit scholarships.
Eligibility Overview: Admissions For Undergraduates Candidates from abroad who are undergraduates should fit the following requirements: Complete secondary or high school courseworkHigher Secondary/Intermediate Examination Certificate or Secondary School Examination Certificate are accepted for an Indian applicantMinimum GPA of 3.0 (Grade B or 80% in its US equivalent) or better Admissions For Postgraduates The minimal SDSU criteria given in the university's Graduate Bulletin as well as the requirements of the particular academic programme,s must be met by international graduate applicants. A minimum US equivalent GPA of 3.0 (B grade or 80% ) or above is necessary to be considered for admission. According to course requirements, test results like the GRE or GMAT may be needed. In order to apply to SDSU, candidates must: Possess a valid baccalaureate degree obtained from an authorised or Ministry-approved school, orWill receive an acceptable baccalaureate degree from an accredited institution or one approved by a Ministry of Education, in the term immediately before to admission The admission of candidates with a three-year bachelor's degree from a foreign university may be taken into consideration. Students who are enrolled in a three-year bachelor's programme but have not yet submitted their applications are not eligible for graduate consideration. And have completed at least 60-semester units with a minimum GPA of 2.85 or at least 2.85. English Language Proficiency:

Accommodation: Howard Payne University's residential communities offer students a comfortable living environment and a supportive framework for personal development. Students are obliged to live in the residence halls due to our dedication to the residential experience unless they meet one or more of the following exemptions:Residents of the Brownwood region who live within a 30-mile radius of HPU.I spent four semesters in a residence hall (i.e. fall and spring semesters).60 hours of academic credit at HPU.Legally married to a person of the opposite sex and have a marriage license by August 1 (autumn semester) or January 1 (spring semester) (for spring semester).Students under the age of 17 are not permitted to live on campus.All students residing on campus must complete a housing application/agreement and pay a housing deposit. Name: Education Training & Employment Australia (ETEA) - Victoria (Melbourne)
Overview:
Education Training & Employment Australia (ETEA) falls under a registered training organisation (RTO) and it is located at 113 Burgundy Street, Heidelberg, Victoria, Australia. The Melbourne campus boasts training programs in various areas of study, for instance, Allied Health and Community Services courses, Leadership and Management, Business, etc. The college is now associated with the automotive industry and the first workshop was established in Melbourne. 
The Victoria (Melbourne) campus of Education Training & Employment Australia welcomes Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander students, including those who are from different cultural backgrounds, and have diverse work and life experiences. The application process involves applying via its official website; however, international students are required to follow certain instructions in this regard. They have to go through some English language tests like PTE, TOEFL, CAE, etc., and the minimum IELTS score should be 5.5. 
The approximate annual cost of education while studying in this college is AUD 4,000. There are several funding options provided by the local state Government which can help students finance this. The department of Education Training & Employment Australia boasts qualified faculty members who provide high-quality training to instil the required skills students need.  
Furthermore, students also get access to library and accommodation facilities, registered automotive workshops, fully equipped clinical labs, etc.

Name: Xavier University
Overview: Established in 1915, the Xavier University of Louisiana is the only historically black Catholic University in the USA known for providing education to black students. It is a small university located in New Orleans, Louisiana and enrols more than 3300 students. Among these students, around 2,512 are undergraduates pursuing arts and science, 187 graduate students, and 608 pursue medicinal courses. This university has provided African American students with immense knowledge and is known for being the top producer of African American pharmacists. In addition, international students from around 16 countries are accepted into this university. However, it is a private university that offers full-time and part-time courses and online courses. The university offers more than 50 programs for students in public health, pharmacy, counselling, educational leadership, health communications, theology, arts, and science.The tuition fees depend on the course a student chooses. However, the average tuition fee for an undergraduate student is USD 15,751, and for graduates, it is USD 8,250. The students of the university are offered scholarships and financial aid. ICSP Scholarship, Indian Trust Fellowship, Clark Global Scholarship Program, Civil Society Leadership Award, and Stanford Reliance Dhiru Bhai Fellowship for Indian Students are some scholarship opportunities provided by private organizations. The university is also known for offering excellent placement opportunities to its students. Within two years of university graduation, around 94% of students get employed with an average salary package of USD 49,800.
Eligibility Overview: What are the requirements for participation?Students are accepted to Xavier University based on their academic abilities and knowledge. To apply for UG and PG programmes, international students must have completed Grade 12. At the end of the semester, students should achieve a cumulative GPA of 2.5.The following are the curriculum requirements:Science is required for three years.Mathematics for three yearsEnglish for four yearsSocial Sciences for three yearsWith the exception of English, two years of language study are required.The university's minimum entry criteria are as follows:According to the university's requirements, international students must be 18 years old.Standardized Exams and English Proficiency Tests: Take a look at the table below:TOEFL (iBT) score of 79 or higherA TOEFL (PBT) score of 550 or above is required.Academic 6.5 or above on the IELTSA PTE Academic score of 55 or higher is required.MELAB 75 or greater

Name: Arkansas State University
Overview: Arkansas State University was established in the year 1909. It is a Public Flagship Research University. The Arkansas State University is known as the Cultural and Economic Engine of Northeast Arkansas. There is another campus in Mexico, known as Arkansas State University, Queretaro. Spread across 1376 acres of land, the university is located in Jonesboro in Arkansas in the US. It is affiliated with Space Grant. It is a part of Arkansas State University. With 518 academic staff, the overall student-faculty ratio is 16:1. 7% of students studying in this College are international students. The acceptance rate of Arkansas State University is 80%. Some of the most preferred majors in this university include Registered Nursing, General Studies, Business Administration and Management, Early Childhood Education and Teaching, Biology/Biological Sciences. In-State Tuition fee for UG is around 4,450 USD, and Out-of-State is 7,930 USD. For Graduates, the In-State tuition fee is 4,273 and the Out-of-State fee 7,597. The university utilizes a semester-based academic calendar. The Structured Learning Assistance Program provides educational support for difficult classes for students who want extra help academically. Around 15% of ASU's undergraduates are members of 21 Greek Organizations on campus. There are 16 sports teams, known as the Red Wolves. They participate as a member of NCAA Division I in the Sun Belt Conference. The Arkansas State University provides Internships on an hourly basis, through which students can experience real job scenarios, even before placements. ACCUPLACER, a placement test, is conducted to measure the correct level of coursework. In addition, the university provides on-campus residence. There are Arkansas Hall, The Circle, The Collegiate Park, Greek Village, Honors Living Learning Community, Kays Hall, Northpark Quads Park Place, Red Wolf Den, ROTC, Stem Den, University Hall, The Village; all with basic amenities for students.
Eligibility Overview: Submit a completed online application for admission to Graduate School Admissions, along with the required programme documents and the nonrefundable application fee of $30 for U.S. Applicants/$40 for International Applicants/$50 for Doctoral Applicants, by the deadline listed on the department website.A baccalaureate degree from an authorised institution is required (or its equivalent as determined by the Graduate School).A minimum cumulative undergraduate grade point average of 2.75 on a scale of 4.00 or a 3.00 GPA in the final 60 hours was required.Any previous graduate courses completed at Arkansas State University or another accredited university have a minimum 3.00 GPA.As requested by the Graduate School, I submitted official transcripts from each institution or university.
Accommodation: University Housing provides a safe, diversified, and well-maintained environment that supports and complements the University's academic objective. We provide a dynamic living/learning environment that encourages and inspires people to become active citizens of their communities.The collegiate experience is incomplete without living on campus. Students who live on campus have higher grades, are more involved in campus activities, and are less likely to drop out of college, according to studies. Several independent investigations undertaken by experienced instructors over the last few years have documented these sometimes surprising statements. We provide a residence hall structure that is both academically and socially sound. Each resident hall is equipped to meet the demands of our students on a regular basis.for more information click on this link-https://www.astate.edu/a/university-housing/

In addition to other considerations, the approach used by US News & World Report to rank subjects includes consideration of student selection (25%), the views of business school administrators (25%), and job outcomes (21%).
University Ranking: In Jonesboro, Arkansas, there is a public research institution called Arkansas State University. Students may enrol in various doctoral, master's, bachelor's, and associate degree programmes at the university through its many colleges. In addition to other rating factors, the US News & World Report bases its rankings on the number of publications cited, global research reputation, and regional research reputation (12.5% each). Name: Seattle Central College

It also provides industry-specific training for fast employment following their graduation.

Name: William Paterson University
Overview: William Paterson University of New Jersey (WPUNJ), a public university in Wayne, New Jersey, was established in 1855. The beautiful suburban campus spreads across 370 acres, and the university has around 11,000 students.William Paterson, the second oldest university in New Jersey, comprises five colleges, namely the College of Humanities and Social Sciences, College of Arts and Communication, College of Education, Cotsakos College of Business and College of Science and Health, which offer 59 undergraduates, 27 postgraduate and two doctoral degrees. Honours programs in 10 diverse disciplines, certificate and pre-professional programs are also provided. Some popular courses are arts, management, music, education, psychology and nursing. Undergraduates should apply through the Common Application Portal or WPU Admissions Portal. William Paterson University is one of the top-ranked universities which prepares students for placements, and graduates secure well-paid jobs at an average annual package of $65711.On-campus accommodation is available in 10 residential halls with double room suites and apartments. The campus has facilities like graphic design studios, a student-run radio station, the David and Lorraine Cheng Library, laboratories and research centres in the Science Complex, the University Commons for social gatherings and the multicultural Power Art Center.The average undergraduate tuition fee is $17,868, while that for postgraduate programs ranges from $18,706- 23,808. International students benefit from the various Donor Scholarships awarded by the university, apart from the work-study programs available on campus.

Name: University of New Orleans
Overview: The University of New Orleans is located in New Orleans, USA. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. The main campus of the University of New Orleans is located in New Orleans. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. The estimated average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenditure for an international student, is around INR 2098449. The University of New Orleans offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship.
Eligibility Overview: If you are seeking for freshman admission as an out-of-state or home-schooled student, you must complete the following requirements:On a 4.0 scale, a 2.0 grade point average is required.OUT-OF-STATE freshmen must also fulfil ONE of the following requirements:Complete all 19 units of the Louisiana Board of Regents' high school Core 4 curriculum, as well as the in-state freshmen requirements listed above.ORComplete 17 or 18 credits from the Core 4 curriculum with a 2.5 core grade point average AND an ACT Composite score of 23. (1140 SAT)A composite ACT score of 26 is required. Students who have not submitted their test scores are required to take the Accuplacer exam. More information can be found here. All applicants are urged to submit an application. Students who do not meet all of the prerequisites may be admitted to the University of New Orleans. In such circumstances, the university's admission decision will be influenced by the student's potential for degree completion as well as the desire to diversify the student body. Age, experience, cultural background, and creative talent are all things to consider.
Accommodation: Accommodation is supplied by UCC Campus Accommodation in the form of apartment-style apartments. We'll be living in Victoria Mills, which is just a short walk from school and close to public transportation. Each apartment has a private bedroom with a bed, a bathroom, a desk, and plenty of storage. Kitchens and living areas are shared by four programme participants on average. Self-service laundry, a copy room, on-site home security, and wireless internet access are also available at the property.Taxis, city buses, and Aircoach are all options for getting to the flats after you arrive in Cork. For additional information and to see more photographs, go to the UCC Campus Accommodation page.

Name: University Bridge at Santa Monica College
Overview: University Academy 92 Global (UA92) is a renowned higher education institution in Old Trafford, England. UA92 is in collaboration with Class of 92 and Lancaster University focusing solely on the development of the students both academically and professionally. In addition, the university aimed to offer various training on business and work in partnership with top-notch companies including Microsoft, KPMG, Lancashire Cricket Club and Trafford College. University Academy 92 Global (UA92) popular majors are provided in the fields of Accounting and Business, Computer Science, Journalism, Media and Communication, Physical Education etc. certificates in Higher education are also offered to the applicants. After completing graduation, students receive diplomas from the University of Lancaster. The university also offers a specialised training program, The Target Talent Curriculum, which enhances the aspirant's cognitive and social intelligence and determines whether the student is ready for employment. All the Undergraduate Academic Regulation and procedures of UA92 curriculum are discussed in detail in the MARP (Manual of Academic Regulations and Procedures) A global education provider Navitas operates University Academy 92 Global (UA92) to support international students in choosing the type of university they want to go for. Each student will be provided with a personal development coach who will give the students structured methods for preparing them for the job. Students will receive unique education in UA92 as it combines with the academic rigour of Lancaster, one of the topmost ranked Universities. The University Academy 92 Global (UA92) degree which the student will receive will be awarded by Lancaster University. UA92, apart from providing academic assistance, also offers unique and practical advice to their students to maximise their potential. From guiding for study applications to arrival and accommodation, the university takes care of all the needs of the international students. Students also receive financial aid like scholarships starting from 20% of the annual cost of training for students who enrolled six months before their studies.

Name: Northeast Wisconsin Technical College - Sturgeon Bay
Overview: Established in 1912 and situated in 2740W Mason St, Green Bay, USA, Northeast Wisconsin Technical College is primarily a public technical college with various locations in Wisconsin. This college is comprised of nine counties with three major campuses in Marinette, Sturgeon Bay and Green Bay and 5 regional learning centres in different parts of the country. It is a significant part of Wisconsin Technical College System. This institution provides necessary education to nearly 41, 500 students every year. All the students of this college are provided with necessary resources to pursue their education conveniently. Students can avail top-notch training and education from Sturgeon campus. Candidates can opt for different courses, earn degrees, or begin their bachelor’s degree. Some of the top-notch academic programs of this college include Practical Nursing, Diesel and Welding, Nursing-Associate degree etc. Every year, approximately 2, 000 students choose to study on this campus. This campus extends 4-year transfer opportunity with an associate degree. Additionally, it offers effective internship programs to achieve real-world experience before entering the job market. Students can explore a wide range of courses involving technical diplomas, associate degrees, apprenticeships and 84 certificates in the fields of business, marketing, engineering technologies, health professions and related programs, engineering-related fields etc. It also provides beneficial employee training, consultant and technical assistance through Corporate Training and Economic Development and serves nearly 1, 083 businesses with personalised training either on-site or in the classrooms. To pursue education seamlessly, individuals can avail scholarships and financial aid. With a student-to-faculty ratio of 17:1, this college offers interactive classes for the candidates. With substantial computers and study rooms, individuals can pursue necessary courses conveniently. In addition, the Job centre of this Northeast Wisconsin Technical College assists the students with necessary placement services, career development and planning, guidance on occupational education.

Name: San Francisco State University
Overview: A private Jesuit research university in Missouri, Saint Louis University was founded in 1818 and is the second oldest Jesuit university in the United States. The programs and the disciplines at SLU are organized into the College of Arts and Sciences, College of Philosophy and Letters, Doisy College of Health Sciences, School of Medicine, School of Nursing, Center for Advanced Dental Education, College for Public Health and Social Justice, School of Social Work, Richard A. Chaifetz School of Business, School of Education, School of Law, Parks College of Engineering, Aviation and Technology and School for Professional Studies.The university offers 91 undergraduate and 83 programs for graduate degrees while ensuring a relevant and recognized curriculum for assorted students from different countries. With an acceptance rate of 58%, this elite university has some of its best computer, business, health care and engineering courses. The average annual cost, which includes the living charges, can come to around $ 76K, but with many grants and scholarship programs offered by the university, it can be brought down to $41K.With a successful alumni network and an impressive placement rate, it guides its students towards an effective and successful career by ensuring their personal and professional growth.

Be academically prepared for college/universityComplete a secondary/high school curriculum that totals 12 years of primary-secondary education, be qualified to enter a university in your home country and have a good scholastic record from an accredited/recognized school. 2. Meet the GPA requirementHave a 2.5-grade point average (GPA) on the 4.0 grading scale or B- average in academic courses completed after 9th grade. 3. Graduate from high school ​You should have or will have, the equivalent of US high school completion.See specific secondary school credentials by country. 4. Meet the English Language Proficiency RequirementSee the English Language Proficiency section on the official website.

Name: University at Buffalo
Overview: Established in 1846, the University at Buffalo (UB) is also regarded as the State University of New York (SUNY) and holds 88 positions in the 2021 ranking of Best Colleges in National University. Founded by U.S. president Millard Fillmore, UB is a member of the prestigious Association of American Universities, located in Buffalo, New York. It has an undergraduate enrollment for more than 21,000 students and 10,000 masters degree enrollment and offers more than 140 undergraduate, 55 combined degrees, 220 masters, and 95 doctoral programs. It has three extensive campuses: the North Campus in Amherst, the South Campus in the University Heights neighborhood, and the Downtown campus. As the most comprehensive campus amongst the 64-campus State University of New York (SUNY) systems, UB has 13 colleges and schools, spread across an area of 1,350 acres. This flagship institution is open to dental science, engineering and applied science, education, management, nursing, public health, social work, and others, maintaining a 14:1 student to faculty ratio. It is the only university in the SUNY systems to provide an accredited master of architecture degree in architecture and planning. UB is also the no. 1 research university in New York and stands The university libraries is a warehouse of more than 4 million print volumes maintained by more than 35 subject librarians. It receives more than 11 million website page views and a yearly 3.5 million footfall on the premises. University at Buffalo ranks 296 out of 20,000 universities by the Center for World University Rankings. It has more than 96 partnerships with different universities worldwide and 1000+ study abroad programs with scholarships. Life in UB is engaging with 400 student clubs, concerts, division I athlete program, and on-campus living.

Name: Marshall University
Overview: Marshall University is a private university located in West Virginia. Originally founded in 1837 as Marshall Academy, it is named after the fourth Chief Justice of the United States, John Marshall. Over the years, the university has risen in prominence thanks to its high research output and rural healthcare delivery programs. The university comprises nine undergraduate schools and three graduate schools. Together, they offer over 150 undergraduate, graduate and doctoral programs across various disciplines. The best programs at Marshall University include MS in Forensic Science, Doctor in Psychology (PsyD) and Bachelors in Business Administration (BBA). The university's main campus is located in Huntington and covers a total area of around 114 acres. The campus has rapidly expanded its infrastructure over the years. Research facilities like Edwards Comprehensive Cancer Centre, John Deaver Dinko Library and engineering labs equip students with the tools and space they need to achieve academic excellence. A secondary campus is located in South Charleston, with other centres for undergraduate programs located in Gilbert, Point Pleasant and Hurricane, all located in West Virginia. The average annual costs of attending university here comes to around USD 22,500. The university has over 230 student organizations and clubs on campus. This gives them the chance to interact with their peers and gain different perspectives on various issues in society. The sororities and fraternities on campus provide them with the chance to build a professional network with alumni and fellow students, giving them a headstart in their careers as a result. The university is represented by the Thundering Herd sports teams in various college sports events. A number of alumni have gone on to make a name for themselves in the field of sports. Prominent personalities include basketballer Hal Greer and quarterbacks Chad Pennington and Byron Leftwich.
Eligibility Overview: Applicants must be over the age of compulsory school attendance in West Virginia and have a high school diploma (official transcript with graduation date necessary).Regular freshman entry requires an overall Grade Point Average of 2.00 on a 4.00 scale, an ACT Composite score of 19 or SAT Total Score1 of 990, or an overall Grade Point Average of 3.00 on a 4.00 scale, and an ACT Composite of 16 or SAT Total Score1 of 880. Admission standards for majors in the College of Engineering and Computer Sciences are more stringent. For specific information on requirements, please reference the current undergraduate academic catalogue.
Accommodation: You'll feel perfectly at home in one of Marshall University's nine undergraduate residence halls or our graduate student residential apartment community. You'll live close to campus facilities, activities, and services in any case, and you'll be a part of a vibrant college community where you'll study, grow, and make lifelong friends.for more information click on this link-https://www.marshall.edu/housing/

Name: Ross University School of Veterinary Medicine
Overview: Ross University School of Veterinary Medicine established in 1982, is a university providing the Doctor of Veterinary Medicine degree. This institution is approved by the American Veterinary Medical Association Council on Education. Since its foundation, this educational institution has graduated more than 4, 000 veterinarians who are now practicing in Canada, the US state, Puerto Rico and more. The university is furnished with a technologically advanced campus that extends a broad-based curriculum, unique research exposures, clinical training, effective classroom study etc. The faculties of this institution possess immense knowledge of teaching credentials and research and dedicatedly share the same with the students. This educational institution started offering Master of Science and PhD. degrees in different disciplines such as conservation medicine, public health, global animal health and various other research areas, assisted by the school. The school is situated in St. Kitts. The faculties of this academy have been honored with various prestigious awards for research and teaching. In 2013, the Association of American Veterinary Colleges had felicitated one of the faculties with the Distinguished Teacher Award, a leading national teaching award. Additionally, the majority of faculties are the top researchers in their respective disciplines and fields. Besides, the pre-clinical program conducted by this institution involves a series of “introduction to clinics” courses that extend small-group instructions and hands-on experience through ambulatory practice, working with the university-owned herds of cattle, community practice etc. Moreover, this institution has been associated with Mordern Research Institute in 2012 to initiate scientific research opportunities and training opportunities for veterinary students and research scientists. Ross University School of Veterinary Medicine is proudly accredited by more than 20 American Veterinary Medical Association, allowing students to avail of top-notch education while pursuing their clinical training.

Placement: Ross Vet (Ross University School of Veterinary Medicine) candidates gathered essential information about the next step in their academic career while being joined remotely by friends and family. A group of 133 students gathered for the clinical placement ceremony, both excited and nervous, to learn whether they had been assigned to a stateside or international clinical rotation. Ross Vet is one of the few institutions that allows students to complete their clinical year at AVMA-accredited affiliates throughout the United States and abroad. The beginning of the seventh semester is when Clinical Placement takes place. Students at Ross Vet choose four clinical affiliates that best fit their professional ambitions. While enrolled in Ross Vet, students rotate through numerous rotations to get clinical experience during their clinical year.

Name: Bridgewater State University
Overview: Bridgewater State University is a public university spread across 278 acres of land with its main campus in Bridgewater, Massachusetts, USA. It also has other satellite campuses in Attleboro, Cape Lod and New Bedford. The University is accredited by the New England Commission of Higher Education. With an acceptance rate of 80%, there are around 10,881 undergraduate and graduate students with a student-faculty ratio of 18:1. Bridgewater State University offers about 36 Undergraduate courses and over 60 graduate degrees. They also have Continuing Studies programmes which begin at 4 pm from Monday- Friday and all Saturdays and Sundays. Popular majors include Business, Management, Psychology, Law, Enforcement etc. The fee structure per year for Undergraduate Programmes comes around 10,732 USD, exclusive of accommodation and books. For Graduate Students, it is about 475..25 USD/credit hour, and for Continuing Studies, it is 443.25 USD/credit hour. The university also provides scholarships and need-based financial aid for the students. In addition, there are over 90 student clubs and organizations and 22 NCAA Division III sports teams for the students to explore during their academic life. 93% of Bridgewater State University Students are placed in jobs or enrolled in graduate school within 6 months to one year with a salary of 36,400 USD per annum. In addition, the University provides paid internships in collaboration with the Bridgewater State University Foundation to make students gain practical work experience. There is also an Office of Career Services which assists studentäó»s connection with employers. In addition, the University has around 1000 study abroad programmes in 50 countries around the world to impart world-class education. There are around 41% UG students accommodated in 11 residence halls and 1 student apartment on campus with all basic facilities for the students with 24/7 help services to ensure safety.
Eligibility Overview: Bridgewater State University's average GPA is 3.13.(A weighted GPA of 4.0 is used by most colleges, however some report an unweighted GPA.)Bridgewater State University welcomes students with a GPA of 3.13 or lower. It's fine to have a B average with some A's thrown in. It's better to stay away from Cs and Ds, as application readers may wonder if you can take the pressures of college.Each school has its own set of standardised testing standards. The SAT or ACT is required by most schools, and many also need SAT subject assessments.To apply to Bridgewater State University, you must take either the SAT or the ACT. More significantly, you must do well in order to submit a strong application.

Name: Northeastern State University
Overview: Northeastern State University is located in Tahlequah, the U.S.A. was established in 1909. The three campuses of Northeastern State University are Tahlequah, Muskogee, and Broken Arrow. N.S.U. provides its students with many exciting options with more than 90 student clubs, 10 NCAA sports teams, and a wide range of activities on campus and in the surrounding area. The institution hosts festivals and cultural events throughout the year. There are many outdoor attractions near campus, such as the Illinois River and Lake Tenkiller, as well as arts, entertainment, dining, and retail opportunities in the surrounding metro region.Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. The following academic colleges at N.S.U. offer programmes: College of Education, College of Business and Technology, Gregg Wadley College of Science and Health Professions, College of Liberal Arts, and College of Extended Learning.  Some undergraduate programmes include B.A. in Communication Studies, B.B.A. in Management, B.S. in Computer Science, etc. The most well-known graduate programmes are business administration, criminal justice, early childhood education, and more.The average tuition fee for international students per credit hour is approximately $276.70. Northeastern State University offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. Read more details about Northeastern State University on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.

Name: Glasgow Caledonian New York College (GCNYC)
Overview: Glasgow Caledonian University has its roots way back from 1878. The university is one of Scotland's most prominent universities, with around 20,000 students from 100 countries. The university is ranked 1,125th Best Global Universities by the U.S. News & World Report in 2021. Glasgow Caledonian, New York College, offers merit-based scholarships up to $10,000 and believes in the motto 'For the Common Good' so that nothing can hinder a students educational quest. Financial aid is also available in the form of the Eva Haller Scholarship, which is a prestigious need-based scholarship. The three Masters of Science (MS) courses offered at GCNYC are Business for Social Impact and Sustainability, sustainable fashion and Risks, Resilience and Integrity Management. A business-related Master's degree at GCNYC lays emphasis on practical applications of applied research, whereas most other business degrees usually focus on theory and management. Students build critical thinking abilities and leadership skills that can be immediately applied in actual life situations, current careers and even fuel career changes. Social responsibility and impact are central aspects of the Master of Science degrees in business, sustainable fashion and risk management. The coursework is inspired by the U.N. Sustainable Development Goals. GCNYC allows international students to pursue their Master of Science degree on an F-1 student visa. International students with an F-1 visa are eligible for U.S. citizenship and Immigration Services. Glasgow Caledonian, New York College, offers students career services, such as career counselling, which helps students understand their needs and roles aligned with their skills and goals and prepares them to build their skills for an ideal career. Around 5% of the students of the college get placed within six months of course completion. Through research, community engagements and cross-sectoral collaborations, the college strives for social impact, innovation and seeks to re-imagine business and consumption as innovative forces for a regenerative future.
Eligibility Overview: What are the course's eligibility requirements?The following sections discuss the eligibility requirements for various courses.Criteria for UG Students' EligibilityThe grades and qualifications required for admission vary depending on the programme and personal factors such as the student's home country. SQA Highers, IB, and A-Levels are the key prerequisites taken into account throughout the admissions process. The entrance requirements are outlined in the points below.2 passes at Ordinary or Standard grade and 3 passes at Higher ('H') grade or 4 passes at 'H' grade on the Scottish Certificate of Education (SCE).A minimum of two passes at Advanced level ('A') and two passes at Ordinary ('O') level is required for the General Certificate of Education (GCE).International Baccalaureate and other foreign school systems have equivalent grades.Criteria for PG Students' EligibilityStudents applying to GCU's postgraduate programmes must provide academic and professional certifications demonstrating that they have finished their course and all of its requirements. Academic transcripts can also be requested throughout the application process to obtain information about the modules taken during the undergraduate degree. Indian Students' Eligibility CriteriaStudents must also have the following qualifications in addition to the specific entry criteria mentioned for each degree. UndergraduateIn the XII Board exams, you must have received 60 percent in each subject from any registered and recognized education board in India.A student must have achieved an equivalent bachelor's degree to advance to Level 2 or 3. PostgraduateA four-year bachelor's degree with a minimum 50 percent or second-class average throughout.A three-year bachelor's degree with a minimum 60% or first-class average throughout the programme.

Name: University of South Dakota
Overview: The University of South Dakota is a public research university located in South Dakota, a state in the Midwestern United States. The university was founded in 1862 and has since gone on to become the flagship university in South Dakota. The university is also the oldest public university in the state and is renowned for its high research output. The university has seven schools and colleges, including the only medical and law school in the state. They offer 205 undergraduate, 75 graduate programs and doctoral programs in multiple fields of education. The best programs at the University of South Dakota include MS in Biomedical Engineering, Masters in Business Administration (MBA) and Bachelors in Business Administration (BBA). The main campus of the university is spread over 216 acres by the Missouri River in Vermillion, South Dakota. It is home to a number of historically significant academic buildings like Old Main, where multiple classrooms and a 190 seat theater are located. The Theodore R. and Karen K. Muenster University Center provides students with lounges, dining and a Student Activities Center to promote student welfare. The campus also houses a Wellness Centre that promotes a healthy lifestyle during their education. The average annual costs of studying at the university can cost around USD 23,500. The university has an active student community that promotes a holistic learning experience on campus. With over 120 student clubs and organizations, students can unwind and interact with their fellow peers outside of their academics. Fraternities and sororities also encourage students to interact with alumni and peers, helping them build strong professional networks in the process. The University of South Dakota has produced many notable alumni in the past, including Nobel laureate Ernest Lawrence, politician Dusty Johnson and former TV personality Tom Brokaw.

Name: John Carroll University
Overview: The Society of Jesuits founded John Carroll University. It is one of the best colleges in Ohio and attracts more than 3,000 students yearly. It offers a diverse range of subjects for graduate, undergraduate, major, and certificate programs. The university provides psychology, Business, Accounting, Finance, Management, Biology, Communications, and many more subjects. John Carroll University is known as "Blue Streaks" during sports competitions. The university has a residential hall that is separated for men and women for the students who live in on-campus facilities. Every room has all the basic facilities. The university also has an excellent reputation for providing placements. It organizes on-campus placements for full-time jobs and internships for students every year. Its students achieve placement after a few months of completing graduation. Along with all these above facilities, the average tuition fee can be around $45 000 for undergraduates. For international students opting to study here, the average cost of living can be about $61,900 per year. The university spends approximately $36 Million annually to provide scholarships to students. Students who excel in academic performance are awarded grants and financial aid. There are various scholarship awards for national and international students.

Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation The Office of Residence Life at Wilkes University is dedicated to assisting residential students with any issues that may arise on campus. The live-in hall staff consists of resident directors and resident assistants who are invaluable resources and have been trained to help the students in various scenarios. Residence Life's director and deputy director live on campus and can respond promptly and effectively to any crisis. There are different styles of housing provided to the students, such as: 1. Mansion-style Housing Wilkes University's mansion-style accommodation is as distinctive as you are. After class, you can unwind on the stone patio of Catlin Hall. The National Register of Historic Places lists Weis Hall. There is a pool table in Sterling Hall. Residence Halls provided are: Catlin HallDoane HallPearsall HallRoss HallSchiowitz HallSterling HallSturdevant HallWaller HallsWeiss HallFor more information, visit: https://www.wilkes.edu/campus-life/campus-housing/residence-halls/mansion-style-housing/index.aspx  2. Traditional-style Housing Each hall houses 50 or more students, and the former mansions have been converted into coed dormitories with a mix of single, double, and triple rooms available. The traditional-style residences, which bear the names of influential local historical personalities and civic leaders who left their mark on the University, serve as a bridge between the past and the present. Residence Halls provided are: Fortinsky HallsEvans HallRoth HallSlocum HallSullivan Hall For more information, visit: https://www.wilkes.edu/campus-life/campus-housing/residence-halls/traditional-style-housing/index.aspx  3. Apartment-style Housing These residence halls hold between 32 and 353 students, acting as small communities within the greater university community. Private balconies, roomy rooms with stained glass windows, and other benefits are unique to each structure. Residence halls provided are: Michelini HallRifkin HallUniversity Towers40 West Apartments For more information, visit: https://www.wilkes.edu/campus-life/campus-housing/residence-halls/apartment-style-housing/index.aspx  For general enquiries, visit: https://www.wilkes.edu/campus-life/campus-housing/index.aspx

Name: Northern Michigan University
Overview: Northern Michigan University is a renowned educational institution. Initially, Northern Michigan University was named Northern State Normal School with a small number of students. It is one of the popular public universities in Marquette, Michigan, established in 1899. The campus is expanded over 360 acres comprising 52 different facilities for refreshment and academic activities. It has a sports arena, world-class and award-winning labs, theatre, and many more. Along with that, it also has public broadcasting radio stations to provide updates on education, news, and other things. Around more than 7,600 students are admitted for undergraduate and graduate courses. Northern Michigan University offers around 25 graduate programs, above 170 degrees and other programs. The faculty comprises more than 300 doctoral degree holders and professionals to provide knowledge and education. Masters, Bachelors, Honours, Online and Associate degrees are offered to the students. The university is popular for offering education in subjects like Clinical Science, Mathematics, Art and Design, health, Philosophy, Biology, Chemistry, Nursing, Economics, Sociology, Business, and many more. Some of the popular programs of the university are Environmental Science, Criminal Justice, Medical Laboratory Technician, Liberal Arts and Humanities, Accounting, Nursing, and others. Marquette city is a safe and secure place near the lake that provides a peaceful and healthy environment for learning. It provides hostel facilities comprising eight residence halls with apartment-style living. The residence is regularly maintained and provides basic facilities. The average tuition fee cost can be around 17,000 USD for undergraduates and 1300 for graduates.
Eligibility Overview: Freshman applicants will no longer be required to submit their ACT or SAT scores in order to be considered for admission. Only your high school grade point average (GPA) will be considered for general admission. GPA is a greater predictor of college achievement, according to research.You will be admitted to NMU if you have a total high school GPA of 2.25 or better.We'll look at your courses and grades, your grade trend, the academic programme you chose, and any other information you give, including test scores if you wish to provide them, if your GPA is below 2.25. You may be admitted conditionally or just to that specific programme for some certificate and associate degree programmes.
Accommodation: Northern Michigan University may become your second home. Whether you are a returning student or new to NMU, you will discover that living in a resident hall community enhances your college experience greatly.Our resident hall staff will assist you in achieving your academic goals, learning more about yourself, and dealing effectively with the obstacles of college life. You'll meet new people, form lasting friendships, and be part of a welcoming, diverse community.for more information click on this link-https://nmu.edu/housing/

Name: Michigan State University
Overview: Established in 1855, Michigan State University(MSU) is a public research university in Lansing, Michigan, USA. Previously, it was known as the Agricultural College of the State of Michigan, and in 1964, it was renamed Michigan State University. The university campus has grown to over 5,200 acres with various modern facilities. It has an events centre, sports arena, cafeteria, museums, and many more. Also, it has more than 900 clubs for students where they can take part in various activities. Michigan State University is one of the largest universities in the state. It offers educational programs for bachelor's and master's degrees, short-term courses, and certificate courses. Various subjects like Pharmacy, Journalism, Dentistry, Packaging, Engineering, Law, Literature, Art, Science, Environmental Studies, and many more are taught here. It also facilitates quality education in performing arts, music, theatre, dance, and other diverse subjects. The university also provides financial aid and scholarships to its students. Around 65% of international and national students receive scholarships and financial aid.The university also provides campus placements. It is noteworthy that many MSU alumni work for popular companies across the world.
Eligibility Overview: International admission criteria There are no minimum prerequisites. It is strongly advised that students pursue their education in college in a manner which will prepare them for University. Students should also apply as soon as possible. First-year undergraduate admission is based on: High school academic performanceFor non-U.S. citizens or permanent residents whose primary language is not English, English language competency is required. Required Proficiency in English

Placement: Career servicesThe Career Development and Placement Office is committed to providing you with the resources and services you need to connect with top recruiting firms for your internship and a full-time job.One of the main reasons MSU's Master of Human Resources and Labor Relations(MHRLR) programme is regarded as one of the best in the country for HR and labour relations is their job placement and development.A personal peer career coach and student mentorship are two of the HRLR features.They provide tailored support and one-on-one assistance to ensure that each of their Master's students is prepared and confident when over 40 organizations come to meet, interview and recruit them for summer internships and full-time positions. Every student is assigned a personal peer career coach and a student mentor to ensure that their resume is flawless and that they are ready to shine in interviews.Placement rate of 95–100%MSU's curriculum typically places 95–100% of our students in summer internships averaging $32/hour and full-time jobs with current average earnings of $83,000 at or before graduation.Enormous alumni network MSU helps students connect with its enormous alumni network through the SHRLR lifetime networked community so that they can get the most out of their internships and early careers. HRLR alumni who are currently leaders in the field of Human Resources and Labor Relations are available to MHRLR students.

All residence halls in Brody Neighbourhood include common toilets, and each wing is co-ed.
