Name: Lincoln University - USA
Overview: Established in 1919, Lincoln University of Oakland, California, is a private non-profit educational institute accredited by the WASC Senior College and University Commission. Named after President Abraham Lincoln, LU offers bachelor's in arts and science and masters in business administration and science, enrolling almost 500 students annually. The university is ranked 119 by U.S. News and World Report in the Regional Universities North list. It is regarded as America's top school for business studies and receives special accreditation by the International Accreditation Council for Business Education.Moved from San Francisco to Oakland in 1999, Lincoln University harbours a Multidisciplinary Research Center, working on solutions to complex problems through applied and fundamental research. LU offers degrees in business administration, diagnostic imaging, international business, finance management, a doctorate in business administration, certificate courses like intensive academic English preparation (IAEP), and an executive master of business administration (EMBA). LU has recently started the master in science degree in International Finance and Business Management in 2014 to expand the horizon. The average tuition fee for an undergraduate is $11,000, and the average tuition fee for a graduate is $ 9,000. Many scholarships like the Leadbetter scholarship and others are available to support the fees and tuition costs.
Eligibility Overview: The following are the eligibility criteria and language requirements for enrolling to various programmes at Lincoln University that are available to overseas students:International Undergraduate Eligibility RequirementsUndergraduate admittance is determined by high school grades or SAT or ACT scores. To be admitted to undergraduate programmes, students must have a high school diploma or certificate with a minimum GPA of 2.0 on a 4.0 scale.International Graduates' Eligibility RequirementsTo apply for a PG programme at the university, students must have an undergraduate or bachelor's degree from an approved institution with a minimum GPA of 2.0 on a 4.0 scale. For a few courses, a GRE or GMAT score may be required.International Students' English RequirementsInternational students from non-English-speaking countries, such as India, must demonstrate their language competency using one of the standardised English exam scores listed below:

Name: Lindenwood University
Overview: Lindenwood University, founded in 1827, is a private liberal arts university in Saint Charles, Missouri. The main campus spreads over 500 acres and a satellite campus known as Lindenwood UniversityäóñBelleville in Belleville, Illinois. With an acceptance rate of 88%, Lindenwood has a total enrollment of 10,000 students. Lindenwood is subdivided into ten academic colleges and schools, which offer over 100 undergraduate majors and minors, 70 postgraduate and various certificate programs. On-campus accommodation in seven female, five male, and three co-ed residential halls is provided to all students. Traditional dorms and non-traditional apartments with facilities like fully-furnished rooms, Wi-Fi, TV, lounges, laundry, etc., are available to choose from. The campus is also equipped with classrooms, Margaret Leggat Butler Library, Lindenwood's main library, health centers, shops, a student-run radio station, and an athletic stadium called Harlen C. Hunter Stadium. Academic transcripts, LORs, essays, CV and scores of English Language Proficiency tests, SAT, ACT, etc., should also be submitted along with no application fee. The average undergraduate tuition fee is 18,500 USD per annum, whereas postgraduate programs are program-dependent. International students are awarded various merit-based and need-based scholarships to provide financial aid and several athletic awards accessible to all students. Lindenwood University assists students through internships, and graduates secure jobs with an average package of 41,300 USD.
Eligibility Overview: Our values at IWU are centred on community, and the residence hall experience is, in some ways, the culmination of that commitment.Lindenwood requires ONE of the following standardised examinations for undergraduate entrance consideration.1.ACT – A minimum score of 20 is required.2.SAT – A minimum score of 1020 is required.3.TOEFL – A minimum score of 61 is required.4.IELTS – A minimum score of 5.5 is required.5.Duolingo – A minimum score of 85 is required.We will not accept emailed or uploaded copies as official unless they come directly from the testing company.
Accommodation: Students who choose to live on campus at Lindenwood have a range of options. Upperclassmen can choose between standard dorms and non-traditional residences. In the Lindenwood University dining halls, you'll also find some intriguing new food options.Residential Life encourages students to participate in academic, athletic, and social activities, giving them the opportunity to get involved, make lifelong friends, and be a part of a supportive community. Residential life at Lindenwood University is viewed as an opportunity to live among people of varying ages, cultural backgrounds, and personal interests.for more information click on this link-https://www.lindenwood.edu/student-life/housing-dining/residential-life/

Name: Eastern Illinois University
Overview: Eastern Illinois University is a public regional institute located in Charleston, United States. Established in 1895, the university offers 32 graduate degree programs, including majors and minors in arts and humanities, business and applied sciences, education, professional studies, and the sciences. Popular programs offered across seven colleges are arts, biochemistry, biotechnology, business administration, chemistry, communication studies, and cybersecurity. The institution organizes career fairs and workshops to bridge the gap between students and employers. Also, the university provides internship programs for practical work experience and includes campus interviews with graduates.The institution provides housing facilities across 11 residence halls, fully-furnished with laundry services, work orders, TV, internet access, linens, and blankets. The student recreation center includes a fitness center, booth library, jogging track, multi-purpose room, and dance studio. Additionally, the campus has over 170 student organizations. The tuition fee is around USD 25,290 for undergraduates and USD 30,179 for graduate programs. The cost of living is around USD 10,140. Easters Illinois University offers bursaries for overseas college students to study in the USA. The Board of Trustees established the International Student Scholarship to help students from different nations attend EIU.

Placement: In today's competitive employment market, getting a job after graduation requires more than a degree. As a result, an internship is critical to your educational experience. When choosing candidates, employers search for work-related experience. An internship demonstrates that you are capable of performing the work and gives you a distinct advantage over other candidates who have not completed an internship.  When it comes to filling positions, many firms go first to their own internship pool. Internships give you the chance to learn in a real-world setting from professionals in your industry. Employers value talents and work traits that students can develop, such as improving communication and interpersonal skills and learning how to cooperate with others. In addition, the learner will have a greater grasp of what individuals in your area do, increase their confidence in their talents, and learn how to complete tasks. In general, they will be more equipped to enter the workforce in their chosen sector.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation Students will be able to pick a housing option that meets their needs among the 11 residence halls, two apartment complexes (University Court and University Apartments), and Greek Court. For both students and communities, living on campus is a fantastic experience. The institution takes pleasure in putting a strong emphasis on student development both in and out of the classroom. They assist students in their personal, intellectual, and professional development through departmental programmes such as the Panther Success Initiative. The caring and dedicated team of professional and student staff members are always accessible to aid students through organisations like the hall council, the National Residence Hall Honorary, or the Residence Hall Association. The university provides the students with a safe and peaceful place to form memories that will last a lifetime.  Everyone is rooting for you at Eastern. Be assured that as a part of the Panther Family, the authority cares about the students when they live on campus. For more information visit: https://www.eiu.edu/housing/

Name: Texas State University
Overview: Texas State University is a public research university founded in 1899 in San Marcos, Texas. The university is the fifth largest in Texas, formerly being recognized as Southwest Texas State University. The university consists of 10 colleges offering over 200 programs in various fields of education. This includes 99 undergraduate, 93 graduate and 14 doctoral programs. Faculty belonging to the university have been the recipients of numerous Fulbright Scholarships for their research activities. The top programs at Texas State University include BSc/B.A. in Psychology, B.Sc in Electrical Engineering, M.A. in Mass Communication and Masters in Business Administration (MBA). The main campus is located in San Marcos, with the 492 acre campus located between Austin and San Antonio. The Texas State University Round Rock campus is located 30 minutes to the north of Austin. It was opened in 1996 to upskill the local population with specialized skills that companies needed. The cost of studying at university varies depending on the program that's chosen, with average fees coming up to around USD 24,000. The Masters programs at the university cost upward of USD 30,000 annually. The university has state of the art infrastructure to provide its students with the best of facilities and opportunities. It is home to the Forensic Anthropology Center at Texas State, the largest in the whole world. The Alkek Library provides students access to literature in various academic fields, as well as historical documents belonging to Texas and Mexico as well. Other renowned buildings and locations at the San Marcos campus include the Bobcat Stadium, Old Main and Sewell Park.
Eligibility Overview: Proof of English ProficiencyStudents who do not speak English as their first language must show proof of English proficiency. For regular admission, Texas State accepts one of the following English proficiency tests:Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) minimum score of 78 total score (internet-based test) with the following minimum section scores: 19 in Reading, 19 in Listening, 19 in Speaking and 18 in WritingInternational English Language Testing System (IELTS) minimum score of 6.5 with at least a 6.0 in each section
Placement: Career PlacementCareer Services serves as a link between students' college experience and life beyond Texas State University, preparing, inspiring, and empowering them for career success. The University supports students throughout their career journey, beginning in their first year and continuing after graduation. They also assist students in connecting their classroom, campus activities, on- or off-campus work, internships, and even graduate school experiences to their post-graduation aspirations.Check here: http://mycatalog.txstate.edu/undergraduate/general-information/career-services/
Accommodation: The University's objective is to provide inviting, inclusive living communities that support academic performance, campus involvement, and personal development for their diverse student community.Check here to know everything about accommodation at TSU: https://www.reslife.txstate.edu/

This shows that the university did poorly on important criteria, including teaching, research, and citations (research influence).

Name: Bentley University
Overview: Established in 1917, Bentley University is a private university located in Waltham, Massachusetts. The campus is spread across 163 acres and divided into upper, lower, and north campuses. The upper campus north of Beaver Street houses all the classrooms, academic buildings, bookstores, and freshman dorms. The lower campus has The Dana Athletic Center, a multipurpose arena. The north campus is located on Forest Street and houses residence halls.The university provides 24 bachelor's and 14 master's programs in science, business, finance, social studies, economics, humanities, and accounting. The university has academic departments such as accountancy, law & taxation, computer information system, natural & applied sciences, sociology, philosophy, management, and marketing. The university offers arts and science majors in language, culture, business, philosophy, health studies, international affairs, history, media, and culture. Additionally, the college offers honors programs, advanced standing programs, integrated double majors, master certificates, executive education, PhDs, and women's leadership programs. The institution provides internships and career development services. It also organizes career fairs yearly for graduating students for internships and job opportunities. It has partnered with various organizations to enhance diversity-related activity. The university provides on-campus and off-campus housing facilities ranging from dorms and apartments to houses. The residence halls have laundry, study space, a fitness studio, etc. The average tuition fee per annum is around $46,116 to $53,790, and the cost of living is approximately $19,260. Bentley University offers merit and need-based student scholarships based on academic performance and community services.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission at Bentley University, candidates must submit proof of their Academic and English proficiency test scores.  Academic Requirements:  All students must earn a passing grade of at least D- in each course, meet a minimum cumulative grade point average (GPA) of at least 2.0 in all courses completed at Bentley, and attain an overall GPA of at least 2.0 in all courses in the major. English Proficiency Test:  If English is not your first language, you will need to submit official results from one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Duolingo or Cambridge English Assessment. The preferred overall scores are noted below:

The public institution offers degrees and certificates in over 15 areas of study. Students will find some popular programs like General Studies and Humanities, Business Management, Liberal Arts and Sciences, Marketing, etc., to pursue. Name: Mississippi State University
Overview: Mississippi State University officially called Mississippi State University for Agriculture and Applied Science is a public land-grant research University. It was established in 1878 in the city of Starkville, Mississippi. The university has nine colleges and three schools offering more than 175 graduate, specialized degree programs and baccalaureates. Popular majors that students can opt for are Education, Business, Management, Marketing, Engineering, Leisure, Recreations and Fitness and Multi/Interdisciplinary and related support services. The Main Campus of the University is spread across 4,200 acres and is home to more than 730 buildings. In addition, Mississippi State has various schools and colleges like Dave C. Swalm School of Chemical Engineering, School of Human Sciences, Richard C. Adkerson School of Accountancy, College of Agriculture and Life Sciences, College of Education, James Worth Bagley College of Engineering more. At MSU, the student-faculty ratio is 17:1. The average in-state tuition and fees for undergraduates is about USD 9,020, and out-of-state costs about USD 24,420, regardless of all other expenses. The university also provides students with financial assistance in financial aid or grant awards or scholarships up to USD 7,395. At Mississippi University, all students can apply for different career options offered by institutions like the Federal Work-Study program, Part-time jobs on and off-campus, and Cooperative Education and Internships. Mississippi State University also provides accommodation facilities with 17 residence halls in the community and apartment-style residences. All First-Year students must stay on campus. For students with disabilities, adequate accommodations are available, and students can apply for their slot through Student Support Services. Being one of the prime universities, Mississippi focuses on students' overall growth and development by providing them with an interactive learning approach and different mediums to sharpen their skills.

(some departments require a higher score)A 6.0 on the IELTS exam is considered satisfactory (some departments require a higher score)A 19 on the ACT's English portion is considered acceptable.On the Evidence-Based Reading and Writing part of the SAT, a score of 510 is considered acceptable.For those applicants whose test centres have been closed owing to covid-19 restrictions, the Duolingo English Test (DET) will be temporarily approved on a case-by-case basis. Name: Massachusetts Institute of Technology
Overview: Founded in 1861, the Massachusetts Institute of Technology is a private research university located in Cambridge. One of the world's most prestigious colleges world, the Massachusetts Institute of Technology is a pioneer in education, research, and innovation. A profoundly global university, MIT has an inclusive approach to education. The roots of MIT date back to the industrial revolution of the United States, and thus, it is driven by a shared mission: to make the world a better place. Some of the top programs at Massachusetts Institute of Technology are MBA, M.S. in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, B.S.in Chemistry, M.Arch, M.S. in Atmospheric Science, etc. Spread across a campus of more than 168 acres, the MIT Campus is located between Kendall and Central Squares, and across the Charles River from Boston Back Bay. Accommodating a student population of over 11, 520 students, the Massachusetts Institute of Technology comprises 30 departments across 5 schools. Each school is unique and a forerunner of new innovative ways of learning. MIT's faculty is globally renowned and equipped with cutting-edge knowledge. MIT has numerous internship programs for its students where they can participate in professional fields to gain work experience. The average tuition fee at MIT is $73, 160. International students are eligible for MIT Scholarships. MIT's curiosity-driven principle extends beyond the classrooms. Campus Life at MIT is vibrant. The institute has 500 student clubs, including the student newspaper, and the campus radio station. Students at MIT are also involved in community outreach programs through the MIT Museum and Edgerton Center. With its commitment to inclusivity, MIT also has 20 recognized chaplains for different faiths. To complement their academics, students are encouraged to choose their extracurriculars. MIT Housing operates several residence halls along with five dining halls.

Name: University of Maryland Baltimore County
Overview: Established in 1966, located in Baltimore, Maryland, USA, it is home to the University of Maryland Baltimore County.The University of Maryland Baltimore County's main campus is in Baltimore. The University offers eight undergraduate programs and 19 postgraduate programs. Students in a variety of fields can choose from undergraduate, graduate, and certificate programs as well as online degree programs for distance learners. It provides instruction in a variety of subject areas, including science. In addition, the University has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, a part-time job, a summer job, or an internship. All UMB students, teachers, and employees have access to UMB housing. All academic buildings are three blocks or less away from the accommodations. Applicants should have completed a strong college preparatory programme at a recognised high school or secondary school.

Additionally, UMBC's ranking in Times Higher Education (THE) dropped from 401–500 in 2017 to 601–800 in 2022. We can see that all of the major publishers have lowered UMBC's standing if we closely examine their university rankings.

Name: California State University, Channel Islands
Overview: Incorporated in 2002, California State University Channel Islands (CSUCI) is a public university and the youngest in the CSU family. The Accrediting Commission accredits it for Senior Colleges and Universities of the WASC (Western Association of Schools and Colleges). CSUCI has a 22:1 student-to-faculty ratio and an admission rate of 84%. The various fields in which students can opt to pursue a major or minor at CSUCI include Applied Physics, Biology, Art, Anthropology, Chemistry, Communication, Early Childhood Studies, Global Studies, Liberal Studies, Mathematics, etc. For safety and security, CSUCI has an on-campus CI Police Department.This institute provides various kinds of student housing on Campus. This Campus also boasts an active Student Veterans Group. This institute is also known to offer financial aid to 83% of its students. In the Social Mobility Index 2020, CollegeNET ranked California State University Channel Islands 20th out of 1449 universities in this nation. California State University extends several scholarships, and international students can apply for several outside international scholarships to finance their studies in the United States. This university also offers the Gates Millennium Scholars Program (GMS) and CSU Trustees’ Award for Outstanding Achievement to deserving candidates.

Name: Walla Walla Community College
Overview: Walla Walla Community College was founded by Peter Dietrich in 1967. It is a public institution in Walla Walla, Washington, with an area of 130 acres. Additionally, it got accreditation from Northwest Commission on Colleges and Universities and gained certification from Washington State Board for Community and Technical Colleges. As per U.S. News and Report, this public college is a medium-size institution that follows an open admission policy. The college offers degrees in 22 disciplines, including agriculture, Anthropology, Business, Biological Sciences, Chemistry, Earth Sciences, History, Geology, Political Science, and others. As per niche.com, Walla Walla Community College has an acceptance rate of 100%, with a graduation rate of 40%. Furthermore, deserving students also receive financial aid and scholarships. A few of the worth mentioned scholarships available at the Walla Walla Community College are Walla Walla Community College Foundation Scholarships, Markforged Distinguished Women Engineers Grant, Hispanic Scholarship Fund, and others. The tuition and fee at the Walla Walla Community College depend on various factors, including the course. For example, for 2021-22, the tuition and fee for international students for 1st credit level is $654, whereas, for Washington residents, it is $243. As per niche.com, the net cost for Walla Walla Community College after financial aid is $6,795, with a total $5,734 average total aid awarded, with 81% of the students receiving financial aid. Additionally, according to U.S. News & World Report, the student-faculty ratio at the institution is 16, with a gender distribution of 54% male and 46% female. As per the same, for fall 2018, the college's total enrollment is 3,860, with a full-time enrollment of 2,270 and part-time enrollment of 1,590. At Walla Walla Community College, students can choose from a variety of on-campus courses. Apart from this, students can also choose from online courses on selected disciplines.

Name: Melbourne Language Centre
Overview: With an experience of around three decades, Melbourne Language Centre works closely with networks of independent, government and private schools and is present at two locations – Perth and Melbourne. It received recognition as an Endorsed Online Centre from NEAS which is the peak ELICOS accreditation body in Australia. Melbourne Language Centre offers professional student services along with personal and academic counselling. The various courses offered at this institution are for IELTS preparation, General English, English for Academic Purposes, English Plus Nursing Education, English for Secondary Schools (High School and Junior School Preparation) and English for Health Professionals (OET Preparation). The institute campuses provide access to an array of conveniences and services. Some of these include multiple theory classrooms with smart boards, interactive screens and high-end data projectors (Perth and Melbourne City), Hearing augmentation (Melbourne City), Resource library (Perth and Melbourne City), Front desk student support (Monday to Friday in Perth and Melbourne City), etc. The tuition fees for the English courses at Melbourne Language Centre range anywhere from $200 per week to $500 per week. The actual value applicable is determined based on certain parameters like the particular course chosen, course duration, whether the candidate is an international student or a permanent citizen, age group of student. The Years 11 – 12 VCE course of Senior Secondary School is characterised by tuition fees in the range of $17000 per year to $18500 per year. There are some other Melbourne Language Centre fees that students need to pay wherever applicable. These include enrolment fee, administration fee, eCoE amendment fee, etc. This institute offers weekly work placement seminars covering several topics. These include resume writing tips, placement internship program, Work Health and Safety (WHS), handling customers complaints, Work placement responsibility, networking, etc.

Name: University of South Carolina
Overview: With an acceptance rate of 69%, the University of South Carolina in Columbia, South Carolina, is a public research institute with a student enrollment of 35,468 founded in 1801. There are 15 schools and colleges like the College of Pharmacy, School of Law and Darla Moore School of Business that offer 300 undergraduate degree programs. Some courses are Anthropology, Music, Theatre, Visual Communications and Retailing.  Palmetto College provides online undergraduate, and graduate degree programs in Interdisciplinary Sciences, Mass Communications and Tourism Management, et. Professional programs are available in pharmacy, law, public health and more. The Continuing Education initiative, comprising Personal Interest Courses, Test Preparation, Professional Education and Certificate Programs etc., allows people to add to their education. Youth and Teen Pre-University programs for grades 5-12 enable school students to explore professional domains. Military/defence personnel and their family members can earn associate degrees through the Fort Jackson Program. The estimated undergraduate cost of attending is USD 26,373 and USD 47,613 for SC residents and non-resident students. Loans, grants, student employment and scholarships like the Alumni Scholars Award, LIFE Scholarship, Federal Direct PLUS, Federal Work-Study etc., are some financial aids. 97% of University of South Carolina business graduates find employment upon program completion and earn an average salary of USD 84,800.
Eligibility Overview: Because this school is moderately selective, a strong academic record will almost certainly ensure your acceptance. An SAT score of 1370 or an ACT score of 31 or higher almost guarantees admission. Because the institution admits 68.6% of all candidates, being much above average increases your admission rate to nearly 100%.The remainder of your application is largely irrelevant if you can earn a high SAT/ACT score. You must still complete the other application criteria, and your GPA should be close to the school's average of 4. To get accepted, though, you won't need scintillating extracurriculars or breath-taking letters of recommendation. You may get admitted only on the basis of your academic performance.

Name: Academy of Art University
Overview: Academy of Art University is an accredited art university offering more than 40+ courses in art and design. Its inception was in 1929 to introduce the first fashion illustration course by Richard S. Stephens. It is certified by National Architectural Accrediting Board, University Commission, WASC Senior College, and Council for Interior Design Accreditation. The present campus is in San Francisco, U.S. The campus is full of amenities, a studio for art practice, resource centres, classrooms with technical facilities, etc. The Academy of Art University rating is among the top art colleges in the country for its training precision, facilities, and regulatory team. Academy of Art University training module includes subjects from disciplines like fine arts, photography, graphic designing, advertisement, acting, media, etc. On-campus, online and virtual modes of training programs are available here. Besides domestic candidates, the Academy of Art University provides education to international students comprising 36% of the total strength from 115 countries. The admission process is seamless, and the selection process is standard. Academy of Art University tuition fees range from $29,005 to $30,486. The university arranges for scholarship programs, grants, and loans to support students get an education and accomplish the basic cost of living while pursuing the course. Blending creative aspirations, talent, technical skills, and professional knowledge, the Academy of Art University is effective in departing education and training. The alumni of this university are earning handsome packages from multinational companies. Top-notch companies across the world prefer hiring their students for an important position in art and design. Moreover, jobs in art and design will rise from 10% to 30% by 2024. Therefore, to meet the increasing number of students in arts, this university has expanded its resource, capacity, and training modes to meet the market demand.
Eligibility Overview: Each department and course at the institution has its own set of eligibility requirements. As a result, applicants should review the course pages for specific eligibility and credit requirements. International applicants must have the following academic credentials in order to be considered for admission:Students must have a 2.0/4.0 GPA in Grade 12 to be considered for undergraduate enrollment.A bachelor's degree from an approved university with a 2.0 GPA or a minimum C grade is required for graduate applicants (US equivalent).To be considered for admission to the university, international students must complete the Duolingo English Test (DET). Although no minimum score is required, you should always strive for a high score. If DET is not accessible in your country, the institution will accept IELTS and TOEFL scores. If you fail to satisfy the university's basic requirements, you will be asked to enrol in their English for Art Purposes (EAP) programme.
Placement: Every semester, industry partners provide an event with in-class talks and portfolio reviews.Students are prepared for either on-campus or off-campus interviews.Walmart Labs, Accenture, Apple Inc., Ann Taylor, BuzzFeed, Burberry, Deutsch, Disney Channel TV Network, e.l.f. Cosmetics, Fox News, Gucci, GUESS, and several other corporations have all hired graduates from the university.According to Payscale, university students make an average salary of 67,770 USD. Placement: The university provides the job profile of the Department Chair. The job requires certain qualifications and is given huge responsibilities too.The department chair is a full-time faculty member who oversees all aspects of the academic department's administration. Academic and support staff recruitment, evaluation, and supervision; faculty and staff orientation and onboarding; curriculum development and implementation; student advising; budget development and administration; and department continuity and administrative support functions are among the responsibilities. The department chair represents the faculty to other departments and colleges, as well as higher levels of administration, and is the person in charge of implementing and administering rules and procedures set at higher levels. Qualifications required are :  A PhD, DBA, or other relevant terminal degrees must be earned in order to be considered for a faculty position in the particular College.Ability to raise significant amounts of money from outside sources.Demonstrated managerial experience at progressively increased levels of responsibility and authority in business or allied organisations and/or higher education business programmes.Demonstrated capacity to provide creative and imaginative leadership within the College and University, as well as the ability to create effective working connections with other schools and the community, through an open and collegial management style.Strong interpersonal skills, including demonstrated communication and collaborative engagement skills with a wide range of people and groups.Sensitivity to different cultures.In addition to English, a working understanding of a second language is preferred.A high degree of computer skills and a complete understanding of instructional materials on the Internet are required.

Name: University of Delaware
Overview: The University of Delaware in Newark, Delaware, is a public land-grant research university established in 1833. With the main campus in Newark, the institution also operates satellite campuses in Dover, Wilmington, Lewes and Georgetown. Delaware University has been ranked among the top 100 universities nationally and has over 24,000 students. Being the largest university in Delaware, UD comprises nine colleges, five academic schools, and several research centres offering 148 undergraduate, 121 postgraduate, 60 doctoral, and 13 joint degrees in full-time, part-time, and online. Computer Science, Engineering, Business, Chemistry and Finance are some of the most popular courses. The very diverse study-abroad program having multiple options is also very famous because the university manages ties with more than 40 countries. With an acceptance rate of 65%, the applications must be filled through the official website for intake into the Fall and Spring semesters. Academic transcripts, LORs, essays, CV and scores of English Language Proficiency tests, SAT, ACT etc., should also be submitted along with an application fee of 75 USD. The average undergraduate tuition fee is 17,080 USD, and postgraduate programs are around 34,164 USD. Need-based loans and merit-based scholarships like UD Trustee Scholarship worth 16,000 USD and the UD Presidential Scholarship worth 13000 USD are awarded. On-campus accommodation in 22 residential buildings accommodating up to 7500 students is provided in traditional rooms, suites and apartments at the starting price of 8,152 USD per year. More than 400 student clubs and organizations and the Morris Library at the main campus are also available for assistance. Fighting' Blue Hens, the athletic teams of UD, consist of sports like hockey, rowing, basketball, soccer, golf and lacrosse, having 36 club sports. More than 95% of Delaware graduates get employed or pursue further education, and the average annual package for an MBA graduate is 88,632 USD.
Eligibility Overview: University of Delaware expects you to have a 3.77 GPA and be above average in your high school class. At the very least, you'll need a mix of A's and B's, with more A's than B's. You can make up for a low GPA by taking more difficult classes, such as AP or IB. This demonstrates that you can handle more challenging academics than the ordinary high school student.If you're a junior or senior, changing your GPA in time for college applications is difficult. You'll need a better SAT or ACT score to compensate if your GPA is at or below the school average of 3.77. This will enable you to effectively compete against applicants with greater GPAs than you.

Name: University of the Pacific
Overview: The University of The Pacific is a private Methodist university founded in 1851. UOP was the very first medical school and conservatory of music in the West Coast. It offers a variety of courses comprising 30 professional & graduate programs, 80 undergraduate programs, and 12 accelerated programs. The popular majors at UOP are Business, Psychology, Liberal Arts & Humanities, Biology, Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, Communications and more. Previously known as the College of the Pacific & California Wesleyan College, the campuses of UOP are located in different cities like Stockton, San Francisco, and Sacramento, California. In addition, the University of the Pacific has its own Liberal Arts College, School of Health, Sciences, Law, Pharmacy, Music, Engineering, International Studies, Dentistry, Education, Graduate School and School of Business. With broadly structured programs in all four campuses of UOP, students get a chance to directly connect with California and the ecosystem of social, cultural, industrial, technological and economic growth of the country. The Student-Faculty ratio at the University of Pacific is 14:1. Students can find their ideal career options in student work programs, stipend based internships, part-time and full-time job opportunities. The average cost of attendance at UOP is about USD33,178/year, excluding various other expenditures. The university also entitles students with various merit-based scholarships to international students who have applied there as transfer students or freshers. UOP owns A Biological Sciences Center worth $20 million to provide advanced classroom facilities and fully-equipped laboratories for the students studying natural and health science. The equilibrium of dynamic cultural environment and the student-faculty ratio is the best indicator of the quality of education that UOP gives away. Being one of the oldest comprehensive educational institutes, it offers student-focused and deliberate education to guide and create meritorious and wilful graduates for personal and professional growth & development.
Eligibility Overview: If English is not your first language, you must submit scores from one of the following English proficiency exams:Scores to be submittedPlease read our Application Materials page for a list of TOEFL codes. IELTS scores can be emailed to gradadmission@pacific.edu or sent directly to the Office of Graduate Admission via the testing service. Minimum Admissions Scores TOEFL score: 80 (90 for Graduate Assistants)6.5 on the IELTS Applicants who do not meet the minimum requirements for a Graduate Assistantship may be asked by a unit's admissions committee to submit scores from the ETS-administered Test of Spoken English (TSE). Admission does not require official copies of international transcripts. All overseas applicants must have their foreign transcripts evaluated course by course by an accredited transcript evaluation agency (see Transcript Evaluation below).Transcripts in ProgressPlease request transcripts from your university showing the work you have completed to date if you have not completed your bachelor's degree (or master's degree if appropriate) at the time of your application to University of the Pacific. These are known as IN PROGRESS transcripts, and they will be labelled with the phrase "No Degree Indicated." These documents will be considered acceptable for admissions reasons, and a decision will be made.Finances CertificationInternational students must demonstrate their ability to meet the financial needs of their education, living expenses, and incidental expenditures, according to government laws. This necessitates the filing of a Certification of Finances form in an amount sufficient to cover all of the above costs for a year.

Name: San Mateo Colleges - College of San Mateo
Overview: Formed in 1922, the San Mateo Colleges - College of San Mateo has been instrumental in offering higher education and academic services to students from across the globe. As a public community college, it is currently located in San Mateo, California. Initially, William L Glascock proposed the idea of the college, and it started with the name of San Mateo Junior College. The current name was adopted in 1954. San Mateo Colleges - College of San Mateo serves more than 10,000 students in the different shifts of morning, evening and weekend classes. It offers more than 75 programs at undergraduate, postgraduate and doctoral levels. Some of the popular courses here include Business studies, Humanities, Mathematics, Engineering, Architecture, IT, and others. With the high-quality STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Art, Math) study options, students get a first-hand understanding of the practical requirements in the employable fields. The San Mateo Colleges - College of San Mateo acceptance rate is currently at 100%. The classes here have maintained a general student-faculty ratio of 26:1. Moreover, the college has been successful in generating a student retention rate of 71%. The college has encouraged international enrollment by setting a high acceptance rate. Currently, the college has developed an affordable fees structure for out-state students, ranging between $6,000 and $10,000. Moreover, there are also scholarship plans based on the merits of the applicants. The college ranked 16th as the “Best Community Colleges in California 2022”. The college has collaborated with California Community Colleges: Assessment and Placement for employing the students. The CCCApply procedure is followed to keep the students updated regarding the latest employment and internship opportunities in their respective fields of study. About 47% of the alumni have received a job within months of their graduation.

Placement: At Tennessee Tech, students from all over the world have found a home. They come for a variety of reasons, but a safe and comfortable campus that fosters personal attention and a good academic reputation are two of the most frequently noted. With degrees in agricultural and human ecology, arts and sciences, business, education, fine arts, engineering, nursing, and more, Tech provides a well-rounded education. The university is able to provide students with a collegiate experience that allows them to grow intellectually inside and across academic subjects while earning an affordable degree and developing into ready-to-work graduates because the university is a Carnegie Classification "R2" institution.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation Living on campus puts students in the heart of the university community and allows them to take advantage of opportunities for academic and extracurricular activity. The university provides both classic residence halls and apartment-style housing. The staff is dedicated to providing each resident with the necessary assistance, whether they live in one of the residence halls or apartments. 1. Residence Halls All residence halls provide accessible laundry facilities, community and study rooms, vending machines, and utilities (electricity, water, phone with voice mail, cable, and internet access/Wi-Fi) (drinks and snacks). Each room has a bed with a mattress for each occupant, a desk, a chair, a chest of drawers, and a closet. Additionally, each hall has a separate study space and a classroom. Browing & Evins Hall The only all-male residence halls on campus, Browning and Evins Halls, are accessible to students of all majors. The academic calendar at Browning/Evins includes lectures by academic staff from many fields, seminars on students' time management and study skills, and workshops on undergraduate research techniques. Cooper & Dunn Halls The only residence hall for females is Cooper & Dunn. There are 220 students living there in a residence hall with a classic design. Standard double rooms predominate, however, there are also a few single rooms. Cooper/Dunn is a conventional hall with public bathrooms. Each building has a laundry room on the first floor. Ellington & Warf Halls Warf and Ellington are coed residence halls. The result would be a floor with only men and women on it. There are a few single and triple rooms among the standard double rooms.  Jobe & Murphy Halls This traditional coed hall has been refurbished. The building is the same, with Jobe on one side and Murphy on the other.Standard male and female double rooms make up most of the residential spaces, while single (mainly male) and triple rooms are also present (mostly male). Female rooms are found on the second and third floors, while male rooms are located on the first, fourth, and fifth floors. Maddux & McCord Halls Specifically designed for engineering majors, Maddux/McCord is a coed Engineering Specialty Hall. Numerous events and activities related to the Engineering Specialty Hall are planned for students enrolled in College of Engineering classes during the academic year. MS Cooper & Pinkerton Halls MS Cooper and Pinkerton Halls have three residential floors, and the traditional co-ed hall is accessible to all majors. Anyone who wants to live here and interact with a vibrant multinational community is welcome.  2. Tech Village Apartments Students who reside on campus may choose to rent apartments at Tech Village, which lies across Willow Avenue on the northwest side of campus. The university works to make sure the apartments give you a cosy and homey atmosphere at the most affordable price. The majority of students believe that the location is ideal for maximising their college experience. For more information, visit:  https://www.tntech.edu/reslife/housing/index.php

Name: Mills College

If 24 or more transferable semester courses have been completed, the necessity for a high school transcript is waived. Placement: Students have the chance to deepen their comprehension of what they learn through fieldwork in almost every session. They are able to use what they have learned in practical situations thanks to these encounters. For instance, in the urban education course, groups of students visit into the neighbourhood to map the educational opportunities or assets within a several block radius. Later, they build a small-scale research project around interviewing locals based on the questions raised by this investigation.  Each Early Childhood Education Programs participant spends at least one semester in a classroom at the laboratory school Mills College Children's School.Early childhood-focused students in the Educational Leadership Programs have the option of taking part in year-long field placements. These internships broaden students' professional networks while enhancing students' leadership abilities and comprehension of the intricate problems that affect the early childhood industry.
Accommodation: Depending on your class year and age, the university offers a variety of accommodation alternatives for both undergraduate and graduate students (and families, too). We can also accommodate students with specific needs such as impairments, allergies, service or emotional support animals, and other needs. Additionally, they provide gender-neutral housing that is quiet around the clock. If you need assistance settling in or have questions about campus life, student resident assistants (RAs) and professional area coordinators can assist you. RAs are current Mills students who live in each house and use their knowledge to ease the transition to college by fostering an environment that is safe, supportive, and enjoyable for everyone. To ensure that you maximise your study time, the university wishes to make living on campus a location where you can engage with other people and discover a supportive community. First-Year Student Housing Our storied Warren Olney and Orchard Meadow residence halls in the heart of campus are traditionally where first-year undergraduate students dwell. Students establish a strong sense of community that aids in their integration into college life, campus exploration, and exposure to the Bay Area and beyond. Housing for Continuing, Transfer & Graduate Students Graduate students, undergraduates who have completed their first year, and students who are 21 years old or older may select to live in residence halls, campus residences, or shared cooperative housing. Online housing applications are available for incoming transfer and graduate students, and they include special requests and a roommate matching service. Residence halls and apartments have everything you need to make campus life a home away from home. Amenities provided by the university are:Free Wi-FiLaundry facilitiesKitchens 24-hour security doors  The following facilities are also available in residence halls: single or double rooms with furniture Apartment choices include:Apartments with two bedrooms for familiesFurnished, shared apartments with four or five bedrooms  For more information, visit: https://www.mills.edu/student-life/living-on-campus/housing.php

Name: South Dakota State University
Overview: South Dakota State University is the largest public university located in Brookings, South Dakota. The university was established in 1881 and offers nearly 200 programs that contain 82 majors, 35 specializations, 94 minors, 36 master's degree programs, 15 Ph.D. programs, and two professional doctorates. The university offers bachelor's degree programs in nursing, animal sciences, farming, liberal arts, humanities, accounting, biology, computer education, cyber operation, finance, management, marketing, physical science, and engineering. The university has innovative faculty that actively pursue research projects, providing valuable research opportunities for graduate students. The popular graduate programs offered are education, engineering, nursing, philosophy, arts, architecture, and science. The university offers some online programs in research and economic development. The tuition fee is about USD 9,200. The university's hostel and meal expenses per year are around USD 12,675. DSU South Dakota State University offers scholarships, grants, and loans for its international students to afford their studies in the USA. ﻿The university gives internships, full, part-time, and summer jobs.
Eligibility Overview: A freshman is a student who is enrolling for the first time at SDSU. The student is usually fresh out of high school or secondary school and has no prior university experience. Admission to freshmen is determined in part by the applicant's high school academic performance and the amount of available spots. The International Admissions Office is aware that secondary/high school graduation ages differ from country to country. To be eligible for admission, students must be at least 17 years old at the time of the program's start date.Applicants must have an academic record that is at least equivalent to a "B-" average (2.60 out of 4.00) or be in the top 60% of their class with appropriate academic preparation for the selected major.While not compulsory, the SAT (Scholastic Aptitude Test) is greatly advised and recommended for freshman applications. Students who graduated from a high school in the United States are required to submit a SAT score.Originals or authentic certified accurate copies of academic transcripts are required. If your transcripts aren't in English, you'll need to provide certified genuine translations. All work completed in upper secondary school must be documented on your transcripts. Transcripts are frequently submitted by applicants before the end of their senior year of high school. Please state your projected graduation date if you must submit transcripts prior to completion.Proficiency in EnglishAll applicants who are not native English speakers must demonstrate English proficiency by passing one of the following exams with a minimum score.TOEFL iBT (internet-based TOEFL): 61 *MyBest Score is now approvedTOEFL PBT (Paper-based TOEFL Test): 500IELTS Academic: 5.5E3PT Online Exam: 623.6 on the online iTEP exam90 points on Duolingo
Placement: Recruiting Companies3M | CITI Bank | IBM | General Electric | Intel | Microsoft | Motorola
Accommodation: On-Campus AccommodationOn-campus housing is available.All students are housed on campus at the university.Students get access to halls and meals in one location.Ben Reifel Hall, Binnewies Hall, Brown Hall, Caldwell Hall, and Hansen Hall are among the university's 13 residence halls.On-campus housing information can be found here.http://www.sdstate.edu/reslife/index.cfm
Course Description: South Dakota State University is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. South Dakota State University was founded in 1881. Located in Brookings,USA the university is home to about 810 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.South Dakota State University is ranked 880th in Top Universities by Webometrics - World. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 3 undergraduate and 5 postgraduate programs. South Dakota State University has 4 intakes in Aug,Sep,Jan,May. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 4 years and master’s degree courses is 1 years.The average yearly tuition fee of South Dakota State University is around USD 9,200 Approx.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by South Dakota State University include USC Associates Scholarships UG Business Programs,Horace W Goldsmith Fellowship,You Are Welcome Here Scholarship Bs In Kinesiology Michigan State University,Graduate Incentive Award MS Applied Economics.The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to South Dakota State University is the post-study work opportunities in USA. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.South Dakota State University has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: Clemson University
Overview: Clemson University, established in 1889 in Clemson, North Carolina, is a public research institute with an acceptance rate of 51%. It offers over 80 majors, 90 minors and 130 graduate programs to 20,868 undergraduate and 5,538 postgraduate students with seven colleges and a graduate school. The College of Education, College of Science, College of Architecture, Arts and Humanities etc., provides courses like Civil Engineering, Marketing, World Cinema and Psychology. The Cooperative Education Program enables students to test their knowledge under the guidance of employers and includes several internship programs. Clemson Online is a way to pursue a degree or certificate program like Biological Sciences, Literacy and Cooperative Extension wholly online or in a blended format. There are several Scholar Programs, like Chapman Scholars and Duckenfield Scholars. Numerous pathway courses are available to prepare for graduate-level studies like Bachelor-to-Graduate Programs, medical partnerships and pre-law programs.The Call me MISTER program helps find more teachers, especially those from diverse and socially disadvantaged backgrounds. In contrast, the PEER/WISE program aims to mentor students in the science and engineering fields. Study abroad and English Language programs are made available through the Hendrix Center for Education Abroad. The average undergraduate tuition fee is USD 7,560 and USD 19,056 for NC resident and non-resident students. Financial aids include loans, scholarships, grants and student employment like the Federal Pell Grant, Diversity Scholarships, Federal Direct Loan etc. Accommodation is available at Benet, Byrnes Hall, Geer, apartments, suites, and traditional rooms. 96% of Clemson University graduates found employment within six months of graduating.
Eligibility Overview: After high school graduation, transfer applicants must have achieved 30 hours of transferable credit. The 30-hour requirement does not include Advanced Placement, International Baccalaureate, or dual-enrollment credit. On a 4.0 scale, transfer candidates should have a cumulative GPA of 2.5 or better. 3.0 is recommended. Transfer applicants should take freshman-level English, science, and mathematics courses relevant to their desired major at Clemson. All transfer students must be in good standing and eligible to return to their previous school.
Accommodation: To acquire accommodations at Clemson, you will generally need to make arrangements with either Student Accessibility Services or the Office of Access and Equity.for more information click on this link-https://www.clemson.edu/accessibility/access/accommodations-services.html
Course Ranking: When we look more closely at Clemson University's course rankings, we can see that its engineering and business degrees are relatively well-liked in the US. From 301–400 in 2020 to 401–500 in 2021, THE (Times Higher Education) has lowered its ranking for PG Business and Economics. However, Clemson has a solid reputation in the USA as a top business school. It has been listed in the top 100 graduate business schools in the US by US News & World Report since 2018. Additionally, Clemson's standing in the US-published UG Business ranking has improved over time. It was ranked 79th in 2018 but will be in the 67th position in 2021.In terms of engineering course rankings, Clemson has established a reputation for excellence in US engineering programmes. Nevertheless, it has been ranked among the top 500 programmes in the world for engineering and technology. Many of Clemson's engineering programmes are not in the top 100 in the US according to US News & World Report. In addition, its Computer Engineering programme has been ranked 69th in the US for 2021.
University Ranking: Public research university Clemson University was established in 1889 and is located in Alabama, USA. From 2017 to 2020, it maintained a standing in the Academic Ranking of World Universities (Shanghai Ranking) between 601 and 700. Additionally, it was ranked between 601 and 800 by THE (Times Higher Education) for 2020 and 2021. Clemson has consistently produced top-notch faculty, instruction, and research over the years. According to US News' rankings of the top 100 institutions since 2018, Clemson has performed well in the US. It has done well in the primary metrics used by US News to determine national rankings—graduation and retention rates, undergraduate academic reputation, and faculty resources.

Name: University of St Thomas
Overview: The University of St. Thomas in Saint Paul and Minnesota was founded in 1885. The private Catholic university has its main campus in Saint Paul and two others in Minneapolis and Rome. With a high acceptance rate of nearly 80%, the institution ranks 81st among the Best Value Schools in the US. St. Thomas offers 88 majors and 59 minors at the undergraduate level, 41 postgraduate, seven pre-professional, two education specialist programs and five doctorate degrees. The AACSB has accredited the Opus College of Business, and the Engineering program has been ranked 38th across all universities in the country. Arts, Natural Sciences, Humanities, Social Sciences, Law, Business, Management and several interdisciplinary programs are the most popular majors offered. The applications for admissions into St Thomas are to be filled through the University's Application Portal for intake into the Fall and Spring semesters. Academic transcripts, LORs, essays, CVs, program-specific documents and scores on English Language Proficiency tests, SAT, ACT, GMAT, GRE etc., should also be submitted with no application fee. The average undergraduate tuition and fee is 23,174 USD per semester, whereas postgraduate courses are 21,785 USD per semester. Financial aid is provided to international and domestic students through loans, grants and several merit-based and need-based scholarships, which waive off up to 21,000 USD per year. Around 93% of the graduates from Saint Thomas secure well-paid jobs with an average annual salary of 49,400 USD.

Name: Manhattan College
Overview: Located in Riverdale, Bronx, New York City, Manhattan College is among the top 1% of colleges in the US. Manhattan College is a popular private and Catholic college that offers many subjects. It offers master's, bachelor's, and post-graduate courses for students. The renowned subjects offered by the College are Medicine, Management, Science, Engineering, IT, Economics, Environmental Science, English, Marketing, and many more. The overall neighbourhood of the campus environment is lively and vibrant, with shopping malls, bookstores, and restaurants. More than 3,485 students enrol yearly on the campus, spread over 22 acres. The campus has two different sections and has over 100 student clubs and organizations. It comprises more than 240 faculty members with a ratio of 12:1. This helps to provide quality education and equal attention to the students. More than 75% of students opt for on-campus accommodation. It has two huge residential buildings for the students. Hence, the average attendance cost for studying at Manhattan College is 60,700 USD annually. Students are also given financial aid and scholarships based on their academic performance. About 94% of students receive financial aid every year. Notable Alumni of Manhattan College are Rudy Giuliani, a former mayor of New York, and James Patterson and Raymond Kelly.Renowned companies like Turner, Fox News, Google, Tesla, Universal, IBM, and MetLife offer internships to students. Also, during campus placement, the graduates get jobs in Disney Television, JP Morgan Chase, Newsweek, Merrill Lynch, etc.. The average salary of Manhattan College graduates is around 125,700 USD.

Name: New Mexico Highlands University
Overview: The New Mexico Highlands University is located in Las Vegas, USA. Established in 1893, students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. The main campus of New Mexico Highlands University is located in Las Vegas. The university offers over eight undergraduate programs and nine postgraduate programs. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. The estimated average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenditure for an international student, is around $6,718. ﻿New Mexico Highlands University offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding. A full-time scholarship comes with a $7,200 stipend per school year. Read more details about New Mexico Highlands University on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.

Name: Kaplan International Languages - Berkeley
Overview: Kaplan International Languages is the world’s largest language school that offers English, German, and French courses to those visiting or studying abroad. The institute is located in 28 countries and trains over 1 million students worldwide. It has 7 campuses across the United States of America, among which is the San-Francisco - Berkeley campus. Kaplan International Languages- Berkeley is located in one of the most culturally and academically renowned cities. The school is close to Claremont Canyon and just 20 minutes from San Francisco. The students at this campus get a magnificent view of the famous Golden Gate Bridge. Being part of Berkeley school provides a pathway for students to apply to UC Berkeley through Extension Programmes. Those who complete Kaplan’s Higher Intermediate level get direct admission to Berkeley City College. There are various English language courses available at Kaplan International Languages- Berkeley. These courses are Flexible English Courses, Long-term English Courses and Exam Preparation Courses. There are 90 students in Berkeley School representing 53 nationalities. 96.8% of these students opted for recommending Kaplan International Languages to their friends. Recognizing that most students come from countries outside of the USA, the school arranges various activities to enhance the social life of the students. The students can indulge in games of golf, soccer, or baseball, and visit the campus of UC Berkeley. Weekend getaways to cities of Yosemite, Wine Country, and Lake Tahoe are also arranged by the institute. There are various housing facilities for the students. They can opt to live in on-campus dorms, hostels, apartments or in a local homestay chosen by the institute.

Name: Lehman College
Overview: Lehman College, a public liberal arts college, is located in The Bronx Borough of New York City in the US. Lehman College is the only four-year College at the City University of New York. The College is spread across 37 acres of land. Lehman College offers 50 undergraduate degrees, 48 graduate programs, PhDs and other certificate programs. The most popular majors students choose are Nursing, Business Administration, and Psychology. Sociology, Health Service Management. There are full-time, part-time and online degrees available. With a student-faculty ratio of 18:1, the acceptance rate for Lehman College is 38%. The in-state tuition fee is around 7,210 USD, and the out-of-state tuition fee is approximately 18,480 USD. Students can also avail themselves of financial aid in Grants, Scholarships, Pell Grants and Student Loans. Lehman College provides housing facilities for students with all necessities. The accommodation is a 7-10 minute walk from the campus. To avail of accommodation, the student must be a full-time student of Lehman College.  Students can find their other extracurricular interests through various clubs and organizations like Adventure Club, Dance Club, Anthropology Club etc. There are also other intercollegiate and intramural sports competitions in which students can participate. Lehman College has a Career Exploration and Development Centre for students to find a better career. They help students with career counselling, job listing services etc., Acting as a mediator between the students and the employers. This centre helps students find internships and job opportunities. They also conduct mock interviews, workshops, seminars and career fairs. The starting salary of Lehman alumni would be around 34,400 USD.
Eligibility Overview: Nonimmigrant alien students are permitted to attend Lehman College under federal law. Any person studying in the United States on a nonimmigrant visa is considered a "international student" at Lehman. Except for nationals of English-speaking nations, international students must take the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL). For admission at Lehman, a minimum TOEFL score of 500 is required, with most fields requiring a higher level. TOEFL/ Educational Testing Service, Princeton, NJ 08541-6151, can provide more information. The test is not required for residents of English-speaking nations.To qualify for and maintain this visa status, all students on F-I or J-I visas must be full-time students every semester, taking at least 9 credits. Full-time students who have supplied the requisite financial paperwork to the Office of Admissions and have been admitted to the College will receive Form I-20 or IAP-66. Nonimmigrant aliens with B (visitor) visas who plan to attend or have already begun attending Lehman College must apply for a change of status to F (student) visa through the International Student Adviser two months before their current B visa expires. The International Student Certification Officer can offer the appropriate papers for the student's Lehman status.
Placement: CUNY Lehman College's Career Exploration & Development Centre (CEDC) offers a variety of career services and tools to its students and graduates. The CEDC is dedicated to assisting students with their education, career counselling, and post-graduation options. Name: University of Central Florida
Overview: A public research institution affiliated with Florida's State University System, the University of Central Florida was established in 1963. Established to further the cause of the U.S Space Program, the university has an acceptance rate of 44% and an enrollment of 71,948 students, the largest student body in the country. Conferring over 17,000 degrees annually, it comprises 13 colleges offering over 230-degree programs; 103 bachelor's, 91 master's, 34 doctoral, and three specialist degree programs. The other campuses/centers are Lake Nonagons Medical City, Downtown, south Orlando, Ocala, Palm Bay, South Lake, etc. All the campuses offer housing options, though first-year students are mostly granted residence on the main campus. There are fully equipped shared suites and luxury apartments with bathroom and dining facilities. One of the 650 student groups and organizations, intercollegiate sports and other activities are available to students (baseball, tennis, track, etc.), attend art shows, concerts, and more. According to placement records, UCF students have acquired annual income packages of USD 46,419.The estimated annual cost of attending UCF for Florida residents is USD 17,879, while that for non-residents is USD 33,978. Placement: 97% = Employment Rate94% = Response RateA degree-granting programme at Cleary University graduated 143 individuals (associate, bachelor and master degree programs). Cleary grads responded to demands for information in 94 percent of cases. Only fifteen (15) of the 143 graduates completed their education and did not look for work. Nine (9) graduates, or 6%, did not answer to Career Development office inquiries for information and/or were not available for employment (self-declared) and were not continuing their schooling or in active military service. One hundred nineteen (119) of the remaining graduates were rated employable. At the end of the reporting year, 116 of the 119 graduates were employed (97%) and three (3) were unemployed (actively looking for work).Visit:- https://www.cleary.edu/about-cleary/consumer-right-to-know/graduate-employment-outcomes/

Name: Northeast Wisconsin Technical College - Marinette
Overview: Established in 1912, Northeast Wisconsin Technical College is a public technical college. It has three campuses – Green Bay, Sturgeon Bay, and Marinette. The Higher Learning Commission accredits this college. NC-SARA recognises this institution to deliver online and distance learning programs. Moreover, the Wisconsin Technical College System Board authorises it to operate as a technical college. This campus specialises in offering subjects like health, information technology, business, engineering, manufacturing and automotive.Students can also opt for a 1-year college diploma in Accounting Assistant, Welding, Metal Fabrication, Practical Nursing etc. Other subjects include Medical Assistant, Office Professional, CNC Machinist, Automotive Maintenance Technician etc. Individuals keen to improve their existing skills can opt for a short-term certificate course in Business Operation, Ethical Leadership, IT-Technology Support, etc. They can also select other subjects such as Healthcare Leadership, MIG Welding and Supervision. The Marinette campus also offers a bachelors degree through pathway options in business management, psychology, BS in nursing etc. It offers financial aid through scholarships like NWTC Promise Scholarship to fund a student’s education. NWTC students can earn Accounting Associate, Business Management Associate degrees, technical diplomas in Digital Marketing, Medical Coding, Healthcare Business Professional, etc., online. Individuals can complete courses in Business Professional Essentials, Customer Service, etc., earn valuable certificates, and advance their careers. The college received the Leah Meyer Austin award in 2021. Moreover, it won Achieving the Dream Leader College in 2020. Insight into Diversity Higher Education Excellence in Diversity Award 2019 recognised it as one of the top colleges for diversity on campus. Students of Northeast Wisconsin Technical College can approach the Career Services Office to learn about writing resumes, preparing for interviews etc. Moreover, students can find internship and full-time job opportunities through the Handshake portal.
Placement: Nil
Accommodation: Campus HousingThe Orchards, a student residential neighbourhood, is just steps away from the Green Bay campus.Why will you enjoy The Orchards?Make friends with other students and participate in activities and events.Save money on transportation by walking to class.You'll be able to live in a fully equipped apartment. Rooms are available in both private and communal configurations.Utilities, cable, and internet are all included in the price.Check here: https://www.nwtc.edu/student-experience/student-involvement/housing

Name: University of Massachusetts Amherst
Overview: The University of Massachusetts is one of the most popular public universities in the USA, established in 1863. Located in Amherst, Massachusetts, USA, it stands in the 24th position among all the public universities in the USA. The University of Massachusetts also called UMass Amherst consists of 10 colleges and schools which offer over 100 undergraduate majors, 48 doctorate degrees, and 78 masters degrees. There are 20 courses, and the top fields of the university include management, business, social sciences, health professions, psychology, biomedical and biological sciences. UMass Amherst has spent over $200 million on development and achieved a rank of 111th in the country. Currently, the university consists of more than 31,000 students spread across five campuses - the University of Massachusetts Dartmouth, University of Massachusetts Boston, the Massachusetts Medical School, University of Amherst, and the University of Massachusetts Lowell. M.Sc in computer science, M.Sc in Business and Analytics, M.B.A, B.Sc in Nursing, and M.Sc in Mechanical Engineering are the top courses that most students are enrolled in. The university is also known for offering several scholarship programs to its students, which include Davinci Body Sculpting Women in STEM Scholarship, Barbara B. Burn Memorial Scholarship, Merit-based scholarship (awarded by StorageArea.com), and other external scholarships for international students. Though the university's fee structure depends on the type of course applied to, an average estimation of the total fees is USD 54,462. Both on-campus and off-campus accommodation are available at the University of Massachusetts. One of the biggest on-campus accommodations in the US is the Residential Life at the UMass Amherst, where more than 13,000 students live. Off-campus housing is just a few minutes away from the university and offers all kinds of facilities.
Eligibility Overview: English proficiency Test RequirementsTOEFL: a minimum composite score of 80 is required, with no subscores below 20 (code #3917). TOEFL MyBest scores are not accepted. IELTS: academic test must have a minimum composite score of 6.5 with no subscore below 6.0. (We will not accept paper IELTS test report forms).
Placement: Check here for career placements at UMass: https://www.umass.edu/economics/graduate/career-placements
Accommodation: Housing AccommodationsResidential Life is dedicated to collaborating with students and their providers to provide appropriate accommodations for students with documented and specified needs. Students who have had their accommodations approved will be given first priority in the assignment process. Students with accommodations, on the other hand, are still responsible for submitting an on-time Preference Application (new students) or selecting housing through the appropriate Online Room Selection process (returning students).
Course Ranking: According to QS Subject Ranking, the Global MBA programme and Accounting & Finance courses are ranked at 201+ and 151-200 (2020), respectively. The Graduate Business School and Undergraduate Business Program both received rankings of 53 from US News & World Report for 2021 and 2020, respectively.US News & World Report has put PG Chemical Engineering at 36, PG Civil Engineering at 46, PG Electrical Engineering at 58, and PG Mechanical Engineering at 56 for 2021 when speaking of engineering courses. The PG Computer Engineering course is listed at 45 for 2021 by US News & World Report. The approach used by US News & World Report to rank subjects includes, among other things, considerations such as student selection (25%), the views of business school administrators (25%), and employment outcome (21%).
University Ranking: Five years in a row, the university has received an ARWU (Shanghai Ranking) - Universities Rankings ranking between 151 and 200. In the Shanghai ranking, universities are not ranked according to their standing among academics or employers; instead, they are ranked according to the calibre of academic research they produce and the number of Nobel Prizes their team has earned.The University of Massachusetts Amherst has improved significantly from its previous ranking of 305 in 2020 to a new high of 270 in the QS - World University Ranking for 2021. The university has also received rankings from US News & World Report's Global Universities. It is listed in the publication's National University Ranking, which now holds the 142nd and 66th positions for the years 2021 and 2022, respectively.While the US News & World Report uses global research reputation, regional research reputation, and several publications cited (12.5% each) among other ranking characteristics, QS places the most emphasis on academic reputation (40%) followed by faculty/student ratio and citations per faculty (20%).
