Name: Webster University - (Orlando, Florida)
Overview: Webster University Orlando is a university campus in Orlando, Florida, that is located in the heart of the city. Webster University's main campus in St. Louis, Missouri, has an expanded campus at this location. Webster University previously had two extended campuses in the Orlando metro region, one in Longwood and the other near Williamsburg. In June 2016, those two college locations were merged to form a larger campus in downtown Orlando near the Amway Center. From the historic Webster Groves campus to locations worldwide, every Webster University campus is inviting and personal — with an esteemed student-focused faculty. Their programs are flexible and their reach is global; both their students and faculty are from around the world creating a diverse learning environment. The university is just one block from the home of the Orlando Magic basketball team, within walking distance from many major downtown corporations and only blocks away from the proposed Creative Village educational hub. The new location is centrally located at the intersection of I-4 and Hwy. 408, students find the location, small class sizes and individual attention result in better networking opportunities and successful learning outcomes within their profession or local community.  Webster University Orlando’s accelerated graduate degree programs in business, counselling and human services target the adult professional student with convenient evening classes and flexible schedules. Those that qualify can receive financial assistance. Webster University is military friendly and admits international students for graduate school enrollment.

Name: Georgia Institute of Technology
Overview: Georgia Institute of Technology, or Georgia Tech, is a public research university established in 1885 in Atlanta, Georgia. It is a part of the University System of Georgia.Georgia Tech has 28 schools and six branch campuses in Savannah, Georgia, one in Metz in France, Athlone in Ireland, Shenzhen in China and one in Singapore. All the six Georgia Tech campuses offer specialization in business, computing, engineering, sciences, design and liberal arts, having 31 different units/departments emphasizing science & technology. Some popular majors are Architecture & related services, Business, Marketing, Management, Computer & Information Sciences, Engineering, Foreign Language & Linguistics. The University is one of the South's largest industrial and engineering research centres.At Georgia Tech Institute, the average cost of attendance for undergraduate programs is USD 31,370, excluding additional expenditures. In addition, Georgia Tech offers students various career opportunities in the form of work while they study, On-campus & off-campus employment, placement after study completion, training and internships. Georgia Tech University also has an Advanced Technology Development Center (ATDC), the oldest technology incubator in America.

Placement: The institute offers bachelor's, master's, and doctoral programmes in business and commerce. It provides comprehensive career development services to undergraduate and MBA business students. Despite the fact that Georgia Tech Career Services provides services to all College students, students bear the main responsibility for internship and permanent employment searches. The objective of the college's career centre is to provide assistance throughout this process. The career centre team assists students by preparing, coaching, and leading them every step of the process, as well as encouraging them to utilise all of the services and tools available. The major job profiles offered are: Data EngineerTechnical Product ManagerConsultantData ScientistData AnalystOthers The major industries which recruit from here are: TechnologyManufacturingFinancialConsultingRetailConsumer Packaged GoodsTransportation/LogisticsHealthcareNonprofits & Social EnterprisesReal Estate The leading companies which recruit from this university are: AmazonBlackRockCarMaxDell TechnologiesDeloitteFord MotorsIBMKettle and Fire, Inc.London Stock Exchange GroupMercedes BenzMicrosoftNovoPaymentThe Home DepotUPSVisaWalmart
Accommodation: By supporting intentional opportunities for residents to live, learn, work, and play, the institution pledges to create surroundings that are in line with the Institute's ideas. Students will be motivated to serve as Georgia Tech leaders in society if they are exposed to such environments and activities. Many study rooms have reopened for resident use, as announced by the Housing & Residence Life Team. As a resident at Georgia Tech, you play an important part in reducing the negative environmental effect of our residence halls in crucial areas like trash, electricity, and water. Residence Hall Association (RHA) Provides the opportunity to make a difference on campus. As an official, you'll be able to disburse funds, join committees, advocate for critical topics, and develop as a person. FLO (First-Year Leadership Organization)Is a non-profit organisation with strong Georgia Tech departmental ties that aims to improve the Georgia Tech community by offering a one-of-a-kind programme that enhances the first-year experience for its members as well as the entire freshmen class. Emerging Leaders (EL), Suite Up (SUPP), and the First-Year Activities Board (FAB) are all supported by Housing & Residence Life. The experiences that the students receive are : First-Year Experience program: The First-Year Experience Program is a living option that you choose, aimed at assisting first-year residents in establishing a strong personal and academic foundation while living in a varied and inclusive community.The organic core of the First-year Experience is that the entering class begins to form a strong community by eating together and living in traditional-style residence halls. Second-Year Experience program: Housing and Residence Life offers the Second-Year Experience Program, which is a self-selected housing option. Our goal is to assist second-year residents in finding services and resources that are appropriate for their current situation. Students have the opportunity to participate in programming and activities, as well as get "just in time" information about on-campus initiatives that are relevant to second-year students. Living Learning Communities Living Learning Communities (LLCs) are a type of academic practice that connects academics with on-campus living. Each Georgia Tech community offers a cohesive experience that encourages cross-community connection between teachers and students, develops student cooperation, improves student GPA, improves campus and civic involvement, increases retention, and makes the academic and social transfer to college easier.  For more information, visit: https://housing.gatech.edu/

Name: Hult International Business School - USA
Overview: Hult International Business School is the largest and top-ranked international business school, a non-profit organization. It is located in the heart of London in the United Kingdom. Established in 1964, it is recognized by the Association of MBAs, The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business, and The European Quality Improvement System. The school provides undergraduate degrees, master's degrees, MBAs, and executive education through Ashridge Executive Education. They also conduct various business and market research in its global research centres. Through their Global Rotation Program, students can see the school's global sites in New York, Boston, Dubai, San Francisco and Shanghai. Some famous courses are One Year MBA, Master of International Business, Bachelor of Business Administration, Master of International Marketing, Masters in Finance, and Part-time Executive MBA. An international fee structure for studying in this business school is 12,000 GBP - 13,200 GBP. Merit-based or need-based scholarships are provided to all aspiring students. Hult International Business School is a sponsor of the Hult Prize, which is the largest student competition for social welfare. Hult professors are corporate executives, entrepreneurs and researchers who are well-experienced in the subject. The school conducts various on-campus career events, which help students to get knowledge about their employment. In addition, a Personal Career Advisor helps students by advising them to pursue suitable careers. In Hult International Business School, students are given practical teaching by solving real-world problems and improving their knowledge and skills. Coaching and other employment support include resume writing, interview preparation, internships, job search, etc.

Name: Salisbury University
Overview: Salisbury University in Salisbury, Maryland, is a public institute with an acceptance rate of 74%, established in 1925. Six schools and colleges, namely the Fulton School of Liberal Arts, Clarke Honors College, and Perdue School of Business, offer 100+ undergraduate and graduate programs to over 8,000 students. Geography, Business Economics, Theatre, Data Science, and Physical Education are some courses. Some SU Certificate courses are Educational Leadership, Health Care Management, and Fraud and Forensic Accounting. The English Language Institute offers various courses for academic and professional purposes, like the Summer English Program, Language Experience in America Program, and Bridge Program. Salisbury University ensures students outside of Maryland can access its education through Satellite Programs held at Cecil College and Eastern Shore Higher Education Center locations. The schools and colleges also provide internship opportunities like field placements, working with elected officials, work-site experiences, etc. The estimated undergraduate cost of attending is USD 26,778 and USD 37,048 for Maryland residents and non-residents. Scholarships, loans, grants, and student employment like the Good Neighbor Scholarship, SU Fund, Direct Subsidized Loan, and Federal Work-Study are some financial aids. Accommodation is available in the cluster, suite, apartment-style residence halls, and cottages at Dogwood Village, Chester Hall, Nanticoke Hall, etc. Off-campus housing is available at privately rented apartments, houses, and rooms. 92% of SU graduates find employment within a year of graduating and earn a median salary of USD 50,000.
Eligibility Overview: Undergraduate Admissions at Salisbury University in the United StatesEngineering, Arts and Sciences, Nursing, Applied Social Sciences, Dental Medicine, Graduate Studies, Law, Medicine, and Management are among the undergraduate programmes offered by the university.To be considered official, aspirants must present transcripts that are in an unopened envelope from the sending institution and printed within the last 6 months.Admissions Requirements: During the admissions process, candidates must submit the following documents:Transcripts from High SchoolTranscripts for all college-level courses are required.1 recommendation letter from a counsellor or teacherGraduate Admissions at Salisbury University in the United StatesStudents from all around the country and the world desiring to study in the United States can pursue graduate degrees in Arts and Sciences, Engineering, Biomedical Sciences, Nursing, Management, and Applied Social Sciences at the institute. Students applying must have a 2.73 GPA overall.
Placement: Placements at Salisbury UniversityStudents can access a variety of job options in the United States through SU's Career Services. Here are a few examples:First-year students can begin taking career-related examinations, set up a Career Connections account, search for volunteer opportunities, join student clubs that are relevant to their interests, and attend events and workshops.Sophomores can meet with an academic counsellor and enroll in a career planning course as sophomores.Graduate students are encouraged to attend events or speak with a Career Coach at SU.Alumni have access to the Career Connections job posting system and are invited to attend SU and The Maryland Career Consortium job fairs.NASA, Disney, J.P. Morgan, Peninsula Regional Medical Center, Perdue, and Under Armour are among the top recruiters at SU.The average base wage for SU graduates is 64,000 USD per year, according to Payscale. The highest-paid position is Senior Financial Analyst, with a salary of 92,000 USD, followed by Software Engineer, with a compensation of 86,000 USD.With a somewhat selective acceptance rate, being admitted to SU is a breeze, as long as study abroad applicants meet all of the prerequisites. In addition, SU is less expensive than other universities, with low course fees and a lower cost of living.As a result, the university's population is highly diversified and worldwide. 95 percent of students are satisfied with their degree of preparedness for employment at SU, and 78 percent say SU prepared them for their current position. Furthermore, within one year of graduation, 92 percent of students seeking work were employed full-time or part-time.

Name: The University of Alabama, Tuscaloosa
Overview: The University of Alabama, Tuscaloosa, was founded in 1831 and is a public research university in Tuscaloosa, Alabama. It has consistently ranked among the top universities, and as per QS World University Ranking 2022, it stands at 801-1000. The acceptance rate at The University of Alabama, Tuscaloosa is 80% for fall 2021. As per the Carnegie Classification of Institutions of Higher Education, The University of Alabama achieved R1: Doctoral Universities – Very High Research Activity status in the research field. Most sought-after courses at the University of Alabama include Nanoscience, Engineering, Biological Sciences, Law, Business and Management.U.S. News & World Report ranked the University of Alabama's School of Law at No. 9 among the public universities. In fall 2021, about 38,320 undergraduate, graduate and professional students were enrolled. Among those, 57.9% of students are out-of-state, including international students from 92 countries. The cost of attending varies for in-state and out-of-state students. For example, the direct cost for undergraduates is $25,514 for in-state and $44,984 for out-of-state students. The University of Alabama won various prestigious awards. In 2021-22, 6 students of UA were awarded Fulbright Awards. Besides these, UA made it into the Forbes list of the Best Employers for New Graduates 2021. The total impact of the university on the state-wide economy is $2.905 billion. The University of Alabama also provides online courses other than its on-campus courses. There are 11 online bachelor's programs on various subjects. The university also provides financial aid and scholarships for deserving students. Famous alumni of The University of Alabama include Mel Allen, Winston Groom, Jimmy Wales and others. The university has a graduation rate of 71%, and 93% of the students are employed after two years of graduation.

Name: Kent State University
Overview: Established in 1910, Kent State University is a public institution in the Great Lakes region in Ohio, USA. Its eight campuses are located in Cleveland, New York City, and Columbus in the USA. Worldwide, the university is spread across Italy, Switzerland, and India. The university provides around 300 degree courses at undergraduate and graduate levels. The programs offered by the university are biological sciences, health & wellness, business, communication, journalism & media, computer, mathematics, information sciences design, education & teaching. Additionally, the college offers programs like public policy & justice, human services & social sciences, language, literature & cultures, physical sciences, sports, recreation & hospitality, and visual & performing arts. The university provides online degrees and certificates. The university additionally offers interdisciplinary programs in biomedical sciences and design innovation. The faculty of aeronautics and engineering delivers a flight training program in Ohio recognized by the U.S. military as a top-flight college. The annual fee of the course ranges from USD 21,400 to 18,957, and the total cost is around USD 13,064. Kent State University offers merit scholarships, grants, loans, and work-study funding. The Career Service Office provides multiple resources and services, including resume and cover letter reviews, full-time job searches, career exploration, and mock interviews for graduating students.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic requirements: Grade Point Average (GPA) : Students should have a Bachelor's degree in mathematics or a related field and a Grade Point Average (GPA) of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scaleConditional Admission will be considered for students with a 2.75 Grade Point Average (GPA)You must submit proof of your Master's degree alongside your transcripts for Doctoral admission Graduate Record Examinations (GRE): GRE scores are not needed for admission, although they are used in decision-making if available. English language proficiency test: Candidates must submit proof of the following academic and English language proficiency requirements:

Placement: By following defined protocols for providing examinations in a professional and standardised manner, the Placement and Testing office improves student learning experiences. The university works hard to ensure that students are placed in courses that are appropriate for their skill level, laying the groundwork for future success. They assist students, Kent State University instructors, and test sponsors domestically and internationally by administering examinations in a timely, fair, and accurate manner. The National College Testing Association's Professional Standards and Guidelines have been adopted by the centre.  Mathematics Placement Most incoming New Freshman and transfer students who have not completed a college-level mathematics course at another college or university, earned scores of 3 or higher on the Advanced Placement (AP) Calculus AB or Calculus BC test, or earned course equivalent college credit through an alternative credit-granting programme such as CLEP, will be required to take mathematics placement. Foreign Language Placement Even if they have never studied a foreign language before, newly admitted students majoring in programmes with a foreign language requirement or who plan to study a foreign language should complete the foreign language placement questionnaire prior to their initial advising visit. Returning students who have not completed a language placement test but want to learn a foreign language should fill out the placement questionnaire as well.  English Placement Undergraduates are assigned to an initial English course depending on their standardised test scores (ACT/SAT, Accuplacer). If a student believes their course placement is incorrect, they can contest it.  Major companies recruiting from the university are:  Centene Corporation, Cleveland Clinic, IDP Education Ltd, JP Morgan Chase, KeyBank, Lenovo, Safeguard Properties, Santander Consumer USA, 3M Health Care etc. Positions majorly held by the students are: Analyst, Data Analyst, Economist, Financial Analyst, Behavioural Modelling Analyst, Mutual Fund Administrator, Lecturer in Economics, Portfolio Risk Specialist, Quantitative Analyst, Regional Sales Manager, Research and Development etc.
Accommodation: All of these communities provide students with the staff, security, and services they require, including: A professional, full-time resident hall director or area coordinator. The director collaborates with graduate and resident assistants to provide healthy and pleasant learning environmentsAll entrance doors and student rooms have swipe-card locksFor enhanced security, there are safety helpers and campus escortsWireless connectivity throughout the buildingThe building has laundry facilitiesCommunity connectivity, maintenance, and cleaning concerns are handled by area service desks Note: During the fall, Thanksgiving, winter, and spring breaks, Kent State residence halls remain open. The residence halls provided by the university are: Eastway Allyn HallClark HallFletcher HallManchester Hall Twin Towers Beall HallMcDowell Hall New Front Dunbar HallEngleman HallPrentice Hall Tri-Towers Koonce HallKorb HallLeebrick HallWright Hall Centennial Courts Centennial Court ACentennial Court BCentennial Court CCentennial Court DCentennial Court ECentennial Court F The Quad Johnson HallLake HallOlson HallStopher Hall For more information, visit: https://www.kent.edu/housing
Course Ranking: Kent State University has four top-ranked schools that provide a variety of degree-level programmes at all levels. In the fields of business, sciences, engineering & technology, nursing, etc., there are more than 500 courses available. According to the US News & World Report ranking for 2022, the College of Business Administration places #190 for its undergraduate business courses. The University of Kentucky's PG Economics & Business courses is ranked by THE above #601+ for the 2022 rankings, and QS - Global MBA ranking above #251. According to THE's rankings for 2022, PG Engineering & Technology courses place between 201-250, while PG Computers courses place between 601 and 800. For further information, see Kent State University Courses.
University Ranking: According to US News & World Report's rankings for 2022, Ohio's public university Kent State University (KSU) is ranked #213 in the nation. KSU is eligible to be included in the top 250 US universities due to its higher acceptance rate of 86% for admissions in 2020. Admissions decisions are primarily based on the background checks performed on applicants through letters of recommendation, with little emphasis placed on GPA or high school rank. In 2022, Kent State University is ranked #738 among all universities in the world by US News and World Report. Since 2021, this rank position has dropped from #683 to #684. Visit Kent State University Admission for information about admission. In the rankings of the best universities in the world for 2022, QS and THE place KSU in the 1000–1200 and 800-1000 ranges, respectively. KSU receives below-average rankings from QS in the following categories: citations per faculty (26.1), international student ratio (7.3), faculty-student ratio (7.2), academic reputation (6.3), employer reputation (5.4), and no overall ranking. On the other hand, THE does not give points to universities that do not meet the criteria for the top 500 universities list. Therefore, KSU does not have access to pillar-wise scores.

Name: Weber State University
Overview: Weber State University is a public university founded in 1889 in Ogden, Utah. It is well known for access to various educational opportunities, quality education and engagement with the community. The university is accredited by Northwest Commission on Colleges & Universities. Weber University offers 225 undergraduate and 11 graduate degree courses to all the students in various streams. Some popular majors are Business, Administration & Finance, Communication & Marketing, Education, Health Professions, Engineering & Technology, and Visual & performing arts. Weber's Main Campus is located at the east bench of the Wasatch Mountain in Ogden and spread across 523 acres. It is home to about 63 buildings on the campus. WSU has 7 schools and colleges: College of Engineering, Applied Science and Technology, Jerry and Vickie Moyes College of Education, John B. Goddard School of Business & Economics, Telitha E. Lindquist College of Arts and Humanities, College of Science, Dr Ezekiel R. Dumke College of Health Professions and College of Social & Behavioral Sciences. At WSU, the student-faculty ratio is approx. 21:1. The average in-state cost of attendance at Weber State University is USD 7,103, excluding all the sundry expenditures. In addition, Weber State has a placement cell known as Wildcat Handshake, which provides various career opportunities like on-campus work while you study, full-time job, part-time jobs and internships on paid basis are offered to students. Weber State University is one of the most promising and affordable state universities with various programs and an atmosphere where students learn practical aspects of a subject with theory. At WSU, the accommodation facility is available as both apartment and community-style with a capacity of 1,000 students. Apart from this, students can also look for off-campus housing options if they don't wish to stay on campus.
Eligibility Overview: Applicants may have an official score report from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) forwarded to the MPC Office if it is less than two years old. On the exam, students must achieve a minimum score of 550 (paper-based), 223 (computer-based), or 85 (internet-based).Applicants may have an official score report from the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) forwarded to the MPC Office if it is less than two years old. A minimum score of 6.5 is required.Completion of an English as a Second Language (ESL) or Learning English for Academic Purposes (LEAP) programme at a regionally accredited, U.S. institution of higher learning, such as the Learning English for Academic Purposes (LEAP) programme at Weber State University.

Name: Indiana Wesleyan University
Overview: With an acceptance rate of 67%, Indiana Wesleyan University is located in Marion, Indiana and is a private evangelical Christian university founded in 1920. Over 13,000 students are pursuing 280+ academic programs (80+ undergraduate majors) across nursing, technology, business etc. The university comprises six academic units, namely the School of Health Sciences, College of Arts and Sciences, Graduate School etc., that offer courses like Accounting, Communication, Human Trafficking Studies, Music Therapy and Visual Arts Education. Wesley Seminary was established to provide online/offline degree programs to working ministers; Master of Divinity, Doctor of Ministry and Master of Arts, are some programs available. Several undergraduate and graduate certificate programs are offered in Cyber Analyst, Addictions Counselling, Human Services and Special Education Training. The John Wesley Honors College is open to a select group of bright students dedicated to exploring the Christian truth. The estimated undergraduate tuition fee is USD 42,002 per year. Financial aid options include loans, grants, scholarships and student employment like Church Matching Scholarships, Luther Lee Scholars Program, Federal Direct Loan etc. Accommodation is available in traditional residence halls, suite-style residences and apartments at Beckett Hall, South Hall, Kem Hall, University Court etc. There are numerous service, multicultural, fitness and particular interest student organisations like Reclaiming Eros, IWU Community Folk Dance, Spikeball Club etc. Students can also play intramural sports like flag football, volleyball, racquetball etc. 97% of IWU graduates find employment upon program completion.
Eligibility Overview: Admission Requirements1.Academic requirements: Minimum GPA of a 2.6 on a 4.0 scale*2.Personal requirements: Applicants must agree to abide by the university’s community guidelines and behavioral expectations3.Required documents: In addition to a completed application, applicants are required to submit an official transcript(s). First-time freshmen must submit an official High School Transcript from their current or most recent high school; transfer students must submit official transcripts from all currently-attended or previously-attended college(s)/university(ies).An admissions counsellor will request further information about your academic history if your academic achievement falls short of one or more of the mentioned standards.** There are extra prerequisites for international students. Homeschooled students must present a transcript with a 4.0 grade point average and a parent's signature.
Accommodation: Our values at IWU are centred on community, and the residence hall experience is, in some ways, the culmination of that commitment.One of the most profound experiences a student can have at IWU is living in one of our intentional, Christ-centered residence hall communities.We believe that living in community with other people makes us unique and allows us to grow in ways we couldn't otherwise. Faith and learning, we believe, are community activities—things we undertake together and require one another for.Residential Learning is happy to support 12 undergraduate residential communities that provide difficult yet supportive living, learning, and growth environments for our students.for more information click on this link-https://www.indwes.edu/undergraduate/life-at-iwu/residence-halls/

Placement: InternshipObtaining course credit for an internship validates the experience by adding it to your academic transcript. You can use the Handshake system to find and apply for internships or find one on your own. Your internship course teacher will use these three documents to submit your final grade for the course, and you must evaluate your academic achievement as an intern. Any changes in status at your internship site should be communicated to your internship course instructor and the Office of Career Services. The documents are:Choose a member of your program's faculty to teach your internship course. Consult your programme advisor if the program is sure who to ask. You and your internship course instructor will complete the Internship Learning Contract together. By establishing the academic significance of the work experience to your degree programme, the Internship programming Contract will function as your course curriculum. You will select the frequency of interaction with your internship course teacher and the academic coursework necessary to augment the work experience based on the number of credits requested for the course during this phase of the course development. Your site supervisor will also outline your obligations as an intern on the job site.The supervisor supervising the site will be requested to fill out a questionnaire. Student Internship Employer Evaluation at the end of your internship to provide feedback to the internship course teacher on your performance at the internship site. The student will also be requested to complete a Student Internship Evaluation at the end of the internship to provide their comments on the value of the internship experience.

Name: American English College - Branch Campus
Overview: American English College is an ACCET-accredited institute specialising in languages and English test preparation (ESL). The institute also possesses the ability to issue Form I-20s for F-1 international students. Helping students for the last three decades, this institute is also a Saudi Arabia Cultural Mission (SACM) approved institution.  Regarded as the safest and most affordable place for living in California, Rowland Heights can be easily accessed by public transportation. The campus is situated at a highly convenient location with shopping areas, markets, and cafes within a 15-minute walking distance. The graduate students from USC visit AEC to receive training and mentorship from experienced staff. Interested students can choose from over 30 partner schools and reap the benefits of TOEFL waivers guaranteeing admission. The institute offers three English programs – a semi-intensive English program, an intensive English program and a TOEFL preparation program. Semi-intensive and intensive English programs are recommended for working professionals or students. While the duration of the intensive one is 28 hours per week, the semi-intensive one is 18 hours per week. Both of these have a maximum student-to-teacher ratio of 1:15. The duration of the TOEFL preparation program is 20 hours per week. This institute has mutual agreements with several institutions. And there are several community colleges, universities, private specialty schools and other institutes that the students can attend after finishing AEC’s Level 6 without a TOEFL score.
Placement: Nil

Name: Ball State University
Overview: Located in Muncie, Indiana, USA, Ball State University is a public research university founded by the Ball Brothers in 1918. The university consists of two major satellite facilities in Indianapolis and Fishers. The university is home to more than 22,541 students spread across the eight schools and colleges, which includes College of Sciences and Humanities, Estopinal College of Architecture and Planning, College of Communication, Information, and Media, College of Health, Teachers College, College of Applied Sciences and Technology, Miller College of Business, and College of Fine Arts. Ball State University offers a wide range of courses, including 178 undergraduate courses, 99 postgraduate courses, 17 doctoral courses, seven associate courses, and two special degrees courses. M.Sc in Computer Science, B.Sc in Biology- Aquatic Biology and Fisheries, M.Sc in Software Engineering, and March in Architecture are some of the university's top courses for its students.The university also offers the MBA program in both online and offline mode. It is affordable for international students because four out of every five students receive scholarships or financial aid from the university. The university makes sure that every student participates in the voluntary services so that they grow academically and socially. The university's main campus is spread across 1,140 acres, which consists of 15 residential halls that can accommodate around 17,000 students. The houses are well equipped with the necessary facilities required by a student.Ball State University also consists of around 400 organizations and clubs that are handled by the students. This university offers excellent placement opportunities. Around 93% of students get employed after graduating from university. Various activities, workshops, and on-campus interviews are also held by the university to help the students secure the best opportunities and get employed within a few years of graduation.

Name: Hult International Business School Boston,San Francisco campus
Overview: Hult International Business School Boston is a non-profit business school that aims towards educating and bringing some of the forward-thinking business minds together. Its San Francisco campus is located at 1355 Sansome St, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA, opposite Levi Strauss’ global headquarters, and just minutes from the Bay. While studying here, the MBA students get access to all the Silicon Valley Giants, global companies, on-campus career events, etc. This business school has designed programs entailing a guide to tackle real-world business challenges. It secured the 99th position in the Overall Ranking of Financial Times 2021 MBA Ranking, and also became the recipient of the bronze award for Best Lifelong Learning Initiative 2021. It also has an affiliation with the world’s largest private education organization, the EF Education First Group. Hult International Business School Boston hosts international students and ensures that they get to make the most of their course offerings. During their first week, the institution organizes an orientation program called Welcome Week where the students stay involved in team-building activities, getting to know their classmates, etc. They can use the on-campus accommodation facilities, provided by the institution, during the first year of their course. Hult International Business School Boston students boast all the necessary skills to get into globally recognized companies. This has helped the institution to secure the 10th position for employer satisfaction among international schools, as per Bloomberg BusinessWeek.

Accommodation: On-Campus Housing More and more, NJIT students are choosing to live on campus. Over 2,000 students live on campus at NJIT in one of its four residence halls.Each room is air-conditioned, completely furnished, and equipped with high-speed internet and cable television. University Ranking: According to the US News & World Report's national university ranking for 2022, the New Jersey Institute of Technology, also known as NJIT because of its common abbreviation, ranks 103rd. As a result, NJIT is now ranked among the top 200 universities in the United States in terms of admission. The rankings moved up from #118 in 2021 to #103 in 2022, representing a significant improvement. Because of the high selectivity rate of 73% at NJIT, it suggests that LORs and high school rank hold more importance when it comes to selection. The Global University ranking (US News & World Report) has NJIT ranked at #813 for 2022, up from #803 in 2020 and #847 in 2021. This is a change from when NJIT was ranked at #803 in 2020. The reason for this is that it has an average freshman retention rate of 88% according to the data from 2019. Because of its low overall score of 4.5, employer reputation – 8.5, citations per faculty at 25.5, international students' ratio at 74.2, and international faculty ratio score at 47.1, QS – World University ranks NIJT between 751 and 800 for the years 2019 through 2021. The position rose from 701-750 in 2022 thanks to this improvement. Since 2017 and continuing through 2022, NJIT has maintained a rank within the range of 501-600 in THE – University ranking. In 2021, THE gave NJIT the following score based on the given parameters: an international outlook of 86, citations of 58.3, and an industry outcome of 35.4.

Name: University of Miami
Overview: A private research institute in Miami, Florida, the University of Miami was established in 1925 and has a student enrollment of over 17,000 and a faculty of 3,216. Eleven schools and colleges (College of Arts and Sciences, Miller School of Medicine, Frost School of Music etc.) offer 180+ undergraduate majors and programs. Some courses include Entrepreneurship, Oceanography, Electronic Media, Judaic Studies and Vocal Performance. Students can pursue a Dual-Degree program in areas like Law, Marine Geology and Engineering. The Cognate Program of General Education (a cognate consists of 3 related courses) is an excellent way to explore interests and acquire skills. The Division of Continuing & International Education provides courses like Marketing, Consulting and Interior Design. The Intensive English Program helps develop English-language proficiency for professional and academic purposes and understands American culture. Study abroad and summer programs are part of the initiative; students can study at partner universities, participate in exchanges, attend Summer Intersessions, online courses etc.UOnline offers the possibility of pursuing graduate degrees (like Master of Science in Finance and Master of Business Administration) entirely online. The estimated undergraduate cost of attendance is USD 73,712. Financial aid options include loans, grants, scholarships and student employment like the Stamps Scholarship, Yellow Ribbon Grants, Rowe Fund, Federal Work-Study etc. University of Miami graduates earn an average salary of USD 55,656.
Eligibility Overview: The following are the prerequisites for applying to the University of Miami's various programmes:Eligibility for UndergraduatesStudents must submit official high school transcripts, ACT and/or SAT scores, school reports, and other educational activities in order to be considered for undergraduate programmes. A upper secondary school certificate is required for entrance to undergraduate programmes for Indian students. Certain program-specific criteria, such as internship exposure or an art portfolio, may also apply.Eligibility for GraduatesStudents must provide official score reports or GRE or GMAT scores, as well as English proficiency exam scores, in order to be admitted to graduate programmes. There may also be program-specific criteria, such as job experience or a minimum level of education.Requirements in EnglishInternational students from non-English-speaking countries, such as India, must demonstrate their language competency using one of the standardised English exam scores listed below:

Name: The University of New Mexico
Overview: The University of New Mexico is among the top public universities in Albuquerque, United States, established in 1889. It has been recognized internationally for leadership in research, teaching, and student satisfaction, focusing on interactive learning. The popular majors at the University of New Mexico are Business, Biology, Psychology, Nursing, Humanities and Arts, and Criminal Justice. The university offers over 94 bachelor's, 71 Master's, and 37 Doctoral degrees. Moreover, the university also has several online degree course programs. The University of New Mexico has branch campuses in Taos, Gallup, Los Alamos, and Valencia. It is spread across 800 acres and boasts a Pueblo Revival architectural theme. The campus is divided into three segments- Central, North, and South. The North Campus consists of law and medical schools and is situated on the north side of the central campus. The south campus of the university has athletic facilities. The University of New Mexico's NCAA Division I program offers 16 sports and special teams. It also has student government offices, food courts, event facilities, movie theatres, organization offices, and recreational areas. In addition, the university has eight residence halls and 15 living-learning communities for student accommodation facilities. Student Housing facilities include three types of residence hall living: Traditional, Apartment style, and Suite style. The yearly hostel and meal expenses would be around CAD 8,397. Tuition fees range between CAD 14,982 to 32,934 per year for different courses and programs.

Name: Central Michigan University
Overview: Central Michigan University is a public university located in Michigan, United States. The university was established in 1892 in Mount Pleasant, growing over the years to become one of the largest public universities in the country. The university is renowned for its high research output, becoming a favored institution for students to pursue their doctoral studies. The eight colleges of the university also offer over 200 graduate and undergraduate programs across various fields. The top courses at Central Michigan University include B.Sc in Neuroscience, B.Sc in Computer Engineering and M.Sc in Information Systems. The university has a single campus located in Mount Pleasant, spread over an area of 871 acres. The campus is home to the Clarke Historical Library and Park Library, providing students with the latest academic literature to aid them in their academics. Other facilities on campus include lecture theatres, book stores and auditoriums to assist students in a variety of needs. The campus also has a sizable online program which enrolls students from over 60 countries. The average cost of attending university here comes to around USD 25,500 with the tuition fee structure for each course depending on the length of the course. Students enjoy an active campus life thanks to the variety of student clubs and organizations. These help students interact outside of their academic routines, facilitating a healthy social life during their stay on campus. Sororities and fraternities help the students build their network amongst peers and alumni, helping them develop professional relationships for the future. The Central Michigan Chippewas participates in a number of collegiate sports tournaments across the country. It has found success in the fields of American football and basketball, with athletes like Antonio Brown going on to achieve All-Star status in the NFL.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Requirements for UndergraduatesTo be eligible for undergraduate programmes, international undergraduates must show documentation of completing a minimum of 12 years of elementary and secondary school study.To apply for these programmes, you must have a least 2.0 GPA on a 4.0 scale. If they come from a country of problem, only students from accredited/recognized universities and colleges are accepted.Students who have finished a recognised undergraduate degree with a GPA of at least 2.7 on a 4.0 scale for at least 24 credit hours of study are not required to take the English proficiency test. Their language of instruction, however, should be English.Academic Requirements for Graduate StudentsInternational grads must show proof of a bachelor's degree that shows they completed 12 years of high school and 3 years of professional courses. For a few courses, a GRE or GMAT score may be required.International Students' English RequirementsInternational students from non-English-speaking countries, such as India, must demonstrate their language competency using one of the standardised English exam scores listed below:

Name: California State University Northridge
Overview: Established in 1958, California State University Northridge is a public university with its campus located in Northridge, Los Angeles, California. The university offers 4-year bachelors, masters and doctoral degrees. The college offers more than 133 undergraduate programs and 84 masters degrees. The university offers programs through nine colleges. The programs in various fields include anthropology, art, biology, business law, philosophy, nursing, real estate, social work, sociology, theater, etc. The college also offers 14 teaching credential programs in the field of education. The popular masters programs at California State University Northridge are education, social sciences, marketing, communication, journalism & related programs, psychology, business, management, and related support services. The tuition fee for out-of-state students is about USD 17,622 and for domestic students is USD 5,742. The university has three types of residence facilities available for the students on campus. All residences have accessible wireless internet facilities and many more. The university campus is spread across 356 acres and has a student recreation center promoting health and fitness through various exercises and activities. The Oviatt Library on campus gives access to all essential educational resources. The campus has multiple clubs and organizations, volunteer projects, resources for leadership development, fraternities, and sororities. The cost of living, including meals, is about USD 7,506. The college provides various on-campus and off-campus scholarships for international students. The university offers work-study programs in student assistant positions, teaching assistant positions, or services in the food court, bookstore, and cafeteria. The students can access the career center of CSUN to find employment opportunities after graduation. The career services offer the students with job search strategies, career explorations, and advertisements. Various events on campus take place for career services like career center open house, STEM career day, job fairs, etc.

Name: University of Iowa
Overview: The University of Iowa from Iowa City was founded in 1847 and is the oldest university in the state. As the 2nd largest university of Iowa, it is famous for the Big Ten athletes and offers over 200 areas of academics with seven professional degrees from twelve colleges under its authority. The University of Iowa, with a 96% placement rate, has been ranked the 34th best public research university by the U.S. News & World Report. As the first developer for the degree of Master of Fine Arts, it takes pride in producing 46 winners of the Pulitzer Prize to date, especially with its Iowa Writers Workshop. Over 200 major undergraduate areas include health sciences, business, economics, management, computing and engineering, social and natural sciences, literature, media, writing communications, quantitative science and cultural studies. There are also graduate, professional and doctoral programs for branches like urban and regional planning, theatre arts, and school psychology.  The average on-campus cost, including housing, meals, and tuition, is USD 21,600 for local students, while that for non-residents is about USD 43,600. Financial aid is offered along with literacy resources and counselling.
Eligibility Overview: Many colleges stipulate a minimum GPA requirement, however this is frequently the bare minimum to submit an application without being rejected right away.The only GPA criterion that matters is the one that will allow you to have a realistic chance of getting in. We do this by looking at the school's current students' average GPA.University of Iowa expects you to have a 3.76 GPA and be above average in your high school class. At the very least, you'll need a mix of A's and B's, with more A's than B's. You can make up for a low GPA by taking more difficult classes, such as AP or IB. This demonstrates that you can handle more challenging academics than the ordinary high school student.Requirements for the SAT and ACTEach school has its own set of standardised testing standards. The SAT or ACT is required by most schools, and many also need SAT subject assessments.To apply to the University of Iowa, you must take either the SAT or the ACT. More significantly, you must do well in order to submit a strong application.
Accommodation: SDS is committed to assisting students in locating and implementing suitable academic accommodations. Both the student and the instructor are involved in the accommodation process.SDS conducts an individualised inquiry to determine necessary accommodations, balancing the student's needs with the course or program's academic objectives.

While US News & World Report ranks different PG Engineering & Technology specialisations for 2021, such as Civil Engineering: #53, Biomedical Engineering: #55, Computer Engineering: #61, Mechanical Engineering: #65, etc., THE ranks PG Engineering & Technology courses in the range of 301-400 for the year 2021. The University of Iowa's PG Computers courses is ranked by THE as well, although, for the year 2021, they fall in the 201-250 area.
University Ranking: The University of Iowa has been included in the top 100 universities in the USA thanks to its position in US News & World Report's national rankings at #88. These rankings are based on academic performance, course evaluations, and admissions of the University. In terms of admissions, the University of Iowa achieved an acceptance rate of 84% in 2020, indicating a more significant inclusion of applicants. The University of Iowa is ranked between 201 and 250 by THE for the year 2021 compared to other rankings.THE has given the University of Iowa an average ranking across all categories, including citations (76.7), industry income (48.5), worldwide view (47.3), etc. On the other side, QS also places the University of Iowa at #420 for the year 2021, a rating drop of 1 point from the position in 2020. In contrast, all other metrics—citations (29.1), academic reputation (20.7), and the total score (25.7)—were below average.

Name: Tulane University
Overview: Located in the Greater Western region of Sydney in Australia, Western Sydney University, formerly known as the University of Western Sydney, was established in 1989. Western Sydney University, or WSU, is a multi-campus public research university founded as a federated network university, which later transformed into a single multi-campus university in Australia, ranked 474 by QS World University Rankings 2021. WSU has a strong network of 48,000+ students from 70 countries involving its 400+ courses in the 13 academic schools, namely business, computer, education, engineering, psychology, science, social science, humanities, law, medicine, and a few more. A leading university in research in Australia, WSU is the recipient of 5 ARC DECRA awards and has been a participant in 5 LIEF grants. They also organize research scholarships for domestic and international students to pursue research. For foreign exchange programs, students can also get benefits from the Fulbright scholarship. The current total undergraduate number of students is 38,500+ and 1675 academic and 1700 administrative staff with knowledge and adequacy. WSU libraries comprise 70 million+ digital resources and can download 700,000 e-books anytime. Globally acknowledged courses of WSU include business, nursing, agricultural science, education, tourism, and others. The university comprises six extensive campus locations like Liverpool city campus, Parramatta city campus, Bankstown, Campbelltown city campus, Parramatta south, Hawkesbury, Penrith, Lithgow, Nirimba, and the off-shore Vietnam campus with the ASEAN hub. The university offers the iconic Sydney Olympic Park right in Sydney's Olympic precinct and has started courses in Sydney city in partnership with the Sydney Institute of Business and Technology. There are options for on-campus accommodation in the Western Sydney University Village. The average cost of attendance for international students ranges between 22,000 to 35,000 Australian Dollars

Name: Oregon State University
Overview: The Oregon State University is the largest international public research university in Oregon. Its main campus in Corvallis is spread across 400 acres. This university is one of the only 3 college-level institutions in the US to obtain the titles of sea-grant, space-grant, and sun grant institutions. The school began offering college-level education in 1865. The university consists of two main campuses- Corvallis and Benda, 11 colleges, 12 experiment stations, and extension programs in 36 different counties. It offers 200 undergraduate programs and 100 graduate programs. Along with conducting classes in the university, the E-campus offers 70 degrees and programs and over 1300 online classes. The programs opted by most of the students include- anthropology, biology, comparative literature, earth sciences, physics and psychology. Out of the total students enrolled, 60% of the students are from Oregon. There are innumerable courses offered by the university but the main schools and colleges are- College of Agricultural Sciences, College of Business, College of Earth, Ocean and Atmospheric Sciences, College of Engineering, College of Forestry, College of Liberal Arts, College of Public Health and Human Sciences. Tuition fees vary depending on certain criteria like that of academic program, residency campus and student or course level but the fees for most of the courses for the first year is between 27000-31000 USD and the yearly hostel and meal expense is 8800 USD. Once enrolled the students can register for housing. The university provides on-campus accommodation so that the students get an opportunity to learn more about the campus. First year students live in the residential halls in the campus. The ratio of faculty to students is 1:19, proving that the teachers of the university aim to provide high quality education to all its students.
Eligibility Overview: Admission requirementsThe Graduate Pathway programme at Oregon State University offers overseas students a straight path to a variety of graduate degrees. The programme provides students with the intellectual foundation and necessary language abilities to pursue a Master's degree. All students receive academic advising and a study plan tailored to their unique Graduate Pathway programme.Check here: https://catalog.oregonstate.edu/admission/international-admissions/#:~:text=Entry%20to%20this%20program%20requires,options%20have%20higher%20entry%20requirements).

Name: Wright State University
Overview: Named after the Wright brothers, the Wright State University is a public research university established in 1967. Located in Dayton, Ohio, the university is accredited under Higher Learning Commission and was formerly a Miami University and Ohio University branch. Ranked 1304 and 298 under Global Universities and National University Ranking by the US News and World Report, Wright State University is a Carnegie classified research university. It has three colleges, six schools, and a separate branch campus known as the Wright State University - Lake Campus in Celina, Ohio.There are 276+ undergraduate, graduate, doctoral, certificate, and professional courses in accountancy, cybersecurity, history, physics, agriculture, public health, and urban affairs. The research topics range in different fields, funded by organizations like the National Institute of Health, Office of Naval Research, National Science Foundation, and others. It also has a Wright State University Nutter Center, regarded as the premier sports and entertainment complex for NCAA Division Athetits, with an average seating capacity of 11,000+. The estimated undergraduate cost for Ohio residents living off-campus is $11,362 per year, and the same for an Ohio student living on-campus is $21,910 per year. For an international undergraduate student, living off-campus at Wright State University will have an average cost of $32,322 per year, and the same for living on-campus will be $33,090 approximately.
Eligibility Overview: Admissions For Undergraduates To be accepted for admission in their secondary education, international Undergraduate applicants must have a cumulative GPA of 2.5 on a scale of 4. Any secondary school diploma is accepted if the applicant's nation accepts it. Additionally, students should have studied science and mathematics in secondary school. In addition, students from non-English-speaking countries must submit the following results from their English proficiency test:                 Graduate Admissions To enter a graduate programme, applicants must possess a four-year bachelor's degree or an international, three-year bachelor's degree (equivalent to a US bachelor's degree). A master's degree in the relevant field is required for entrance to doctorate programmes. Graduate programmes are not open to students from Bangladesh, Burma, India, Nepal, Pakistan, or Sri Lanka who have a three-year bachelor's degree in arts, commerce, or science. They may, however, submit applications for undergraduate degree programmes. Additionally, one of the following English proficiency ratings is needed:

Name: Ohio University
Overview: Ohio University is a public research university located in Athens, Ohio. Founded in 1804, it was established as the first state university in Ohio. The university offers a total of 250 programs. These include undergraduate and graduate programs alongside PhD and certificate courses. Some top courses at Ohio University include B.Sc in Communication, B.Sc in Nursing, Bachelor in Science in Journalism, MS in Engineering: Chemical and MS in Biomedical Engineering. It also has five regional campuses spread across the state to provide locals with a chance for good education while working part-time or full-time.Students from the university are chosen for internships and full-time jobs at leading companies like NASA, the National Institute of Health and Tesla, to name a few. The average fee for out-state and international students is about USD 36000. The campus offers scholarships to international students. University students have also availed of the Fulbright, Udall and Halling scholarships programs.
Eligibility Overview: Before applying to any programme at Ohio University, international students must complete the following requirements:Eligibility Requirements for UndergraduatesIndian students must achieve at least 6 passes with a grade of C or better in the IGCSE or GCSE curriculum. Students who have completed the IB curriculum, often known as the International Baccalaureate, must get a score of at least 5 out of 7 on their college preparatory coursework. Students from India who desire to enrol as freshmen in undergraduate programmes must get a minimum score of 60% on their higher secondary school examination.Requirements for Undergraduate Standardized Qualifying ExamsScores from the SAT and ACT are recognised but not required. Some courses may require a SAT score.English Requirements for UndergraduatesThe following table outlines the English language requirements:Requirements for Graduate EligibilityStudents from India who want to enrol in a postgraduate programme must have a master's degree in their discipline. They must also keep in mind that a bachelor's degree earned after three years of study is not equivalent to a bachelor's degree earned in the United States. This is due to the fact that graduate studies in the United States must last at least four years. Students can, however, submit additional graduate-level coursework to improve their prospects of acceptance to Ohio University.Requirements for Graduates to Pass a Standardized Qualifying ExamFor Business and Management courses, the GMAT exam is required, and for a select graduate degrees, such as Engineering, the GRE exam is necessary.English Requirements for Graduate StudentsThe following table lists the language requirements:

Name: Berkeley College
Overview: Berkeley College, established in 1931, is a private for-profit college accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education. More than 130 academic departments and 80 interdisciplinary research units are divided into 5 colleges and 1 school. The College has a 100% acceptance rate with more than 5700 students in New York, New Jersey and online, out of 2221 UG students. In addition, more than 280 international students from over 40 countries study at Berkeley College. Berkeley College provides a Master's degree, Bachelor's degree, Associate's Degree and other certificate courses. Popular Majors for Bachelor's Degrees include Business, Healthcare Management, Fashion and Apparel Merchandising. Top associate degree programs include Justice Studies, Health Services Administration, Medical Insurance etc. There are also around 20 certificate programmes and Evening Degree Programmes with an overall Student-Faculty ratio of 22:1. The fee structure is approximately 24,800 USD. In addition, the College provides Direct Grants, Scholarships and Financial Aid for eligible students. The students compete in various intercollegiate athletics as members of the United States Collegiate Athletic Association and the Hudson Valley Intercollegiate Athletic Conference. There are many faculty-monitored internships to gain practical knowledge for the students. The College also hosts career fairs and campus recruitment days. The Career Service Department assists in full-time or part-time employment opportunities for students exclusively. The total expenses for a student throughout an academic year will cost around 32,500 USD

Placement: Berkeley College places a strong focus on internships and offers comprehensive career services.It offers internships, placement programmes, and employment possibilities, as well as a wide range of help and experience.Berkeley College's career resource assists students in developing good resumes, communicating with companies on a variety of platforms, and navigating their career and job options.Berkeley College also has employer resources, where they collaborate with other businesses and organisations to link them with interns, recent grads, or seasoned alumni, which benefits both sides.Berkeley College alumna working in the highest sector earn an annual average of USD 180,000- USD 107,000, according to emolument.com, a job-based website.Berkeley College alumnus gets an annual average of USD 68k working as an average academic advisor/designer, according to Payscale.com, another job-based website.

Name: Kennesaw State University
Overview: Kennesaw State University is one of the most prestigious public research universities in the state of Georgia. Founded in 1963 by the Georgia Board of Regents, Kennesaw State University is a leader in innovative learning with a multidisciplinary approach to higher education. Kennesaw State University is home to over 41, 000 students and offers courses in over 150 undergraduate, postgraduate and doctoral degrees. The top programs at Kennesaw State University are Architecture and Construction Management, Humanities and Social Sciences, Business, Education, Health and Human Services, etc. Kennesaw State University has two main campuses, the Kennesaw campus, and the Marietta campus. It is home to about 11 colleges and is the second-largest university in Georgia. KSU is a Carnegie-designed doctoral research institution, making it a part of the elite group of U.S. colleges with R1 or R2 status. It is an internationally accredited institution that has a student base from over 130 countries. Kennesaw State University is also known for its career resources, including internship offers, and on-campus positions. It allows its students to connect with industry experts and gain significant work experience. The average tuition fee at KSU is CAD 18k. International students receive financial aid and Kennesaw State University Scholarships. Spread across two huge campuses, the university boasts of vibrant campus culture with a diverse population and global connection that draws students from all corners of the world. KSU has around 300 student organizations including the Student Board and African-American Student Alliance. Besides, it also has many religious groups and global societies that promise an inclusive environment. Kennesaw State University Housing offers several on-campus housing facilities with all-inclusive rates and individual contracts. The University also aids off-campus housing facilities including fully-furnished apartments close to the campus. KSU embraces the true spirit of openness by encouraging diverse perspectives to its students.
Eligibility Overview: If a first-year student has a GPA of 3.2 or greater and applies to Kennesaw State University for the fall 2022 semester, they may be admitted without an ACT or SAT score. To be eligible for admission, students with a GPA of less than 3.2 should submit valid ACT or SAT results together with their high school transcript. To get admitted, all students must be on pace to finish the Required High School Curriculum. On the Freshman Requirements page, you can learn more. Kennesaw State uses 17 required high school classes to compute your high school GPA for admission.Test results are still necessary for some scholarships and programmes (e.g., Zell Miller) (eg. Architecture, KSU Journey Honors College).

Name: Tacoma Community College
Overview: Tacoma Community College is a public institution in the South of Seattle, Washington, in Tacoma. The college is accredited by NWCCU (Northwest Commission on Colleges and Universities). It has two campuses- Tacoma and Gig Harbor, offering credit and non-credit classes to the students. Students in their two years at the college receive a slew of popular programs, which include Liberal arts and sciences, Humanities, Management, Marketing etc. Aspirants will also get an Associate Degree for University Transfer. Tacoma Community College tuition fee ranges from ($4,276-$9,706) for both in-state and out-of-state students. Tacoma Community College (TCC) programs include EAP (English for Academic Purposes) courses focusing on enhancing students' English proficiency and helping them cope with the American college environment. Apart from offering numerous courses, the college also assists applicants by offering multiple free student services, including tutoring, counselling, immigration, academic advising, and many more. There are placement options, and above 47% of students receive financial aid. Students will also benefit from the exceptional homestay programs and other health services which make Tacoma Community College feel like home for international students.The average placement here is 86%.
Eligibility Overview: Apply to Tacoma Community College Eligibility:By the start of the programme, the applicant must be at least 16 years old.A high school diploma is not required (see High School Completion Program)Documents Required for Admission:At least USD $21,783 is shown on the bank statement (proof of funding).Checking and savings accounts, equities, certificates of deposit, and other easily liquidated assets may be included in the "Bank Statement." In the online application, please specify the relationship between the student and the person named on the bank statement. All proof of funding documentation must be recent (6 months) in date.Transcript from high school or collegePassport Photo Page CopiesAre you transferring from another school in the United States? Fill out the Transfer In Form and attach it to your application.Are you under the age of 18? With your application, include the Under 18 Consent Form.$50 non-refundable application fee  English Proficiency:English Proficiency is not required for admission. However, students who have taken an English proficiency test within the last two years are encouraged to submit their score with the online application. The following scores will place a student directly into college-level English (ENG 101). IELTS: 5.5TOEFL: 65 (iBT or iBT Special Home Edition)Duolingo: 90SAT: 470 Reading ScoreACT: 19Pearson: 46Cambridge A & O Level Scores: C in EnglishIB Diploma: Completion of full diploma or a score of 3 in EnglishU.S. High School: Completion of two years at a U.S. high school with a 2.5 GPA in EnglishU.S. College: Completion of one year with an overall 2.0 college level GPAOther Assessment: CEFR B2 LevelNative-English proficiency: Ask our team if this applies to you!

Name: Stanford University
Overview: Stanford University was established in 1885 as a private research university in the USA. It is in the heart of Northern California in the dynamic Silicon Valley, home to leading companies such as Yahoo, Google, HP, etc. Stanford has a diverse student body across 48 US states and 77 other countries. Stanford's academic excellence is unparalleled. They have high standards for both professors and their pupils. With courses in more than 25 fields to study, the university has seven schools, three dedicated to 40 academic departments at the undergraduate level. The remaining four are purely professional schools focusing on graduate law, medicine, education, and business programs. The institution has famous alums worldwide and has created companies like eBay, LinkedIn, Instagram, and Google.Stanford University is noted for its success in various academic and technical sectors, allowing students to develop in-depth knowledge. The university ranks third according to the QS World University Rankings, 2022.The college has a sprawling and one of the most beautiful campuses with 700 buildings, 150 companies located in the 700-acre Stanford Research Park, 140 retail stores in the Stanford Shopping Centre, and more. Stanford academics are top-notch. The professors are among the best in their respective fields. Apart from academics, students participate in many fun activities and annual traditions that help them boost their personalities and have an active social life. Stanford is known for its academic prowess, but this does not limit success in other areas. More than 2,000 Olympians have come from Stanford, and its varsity teams have won over 150 national championships.
Eligibility Overview: Stanford University accepts applications from students worldwide. The application criteria are the same whether a student is a domestic or an international applicant. The application form, as well as the appropriate supplements, must be completed by all candidates. The university has no bias, and the Admissions Committee treats all applications equally.  However, the college maintains a low acceptance rate of only 3.9%.  English Language Requirements:The minimum scores required in the English proficiency test are listed below.

Accommodation: There are 81 student residencies at Stanford, with over 11,000 students living on-campus. More than 97% of eligible undergraduate and 66% of qualified graduate students live on campus. Housing choices for single students, couples (with or without children), and others are available.  There are plenty of housing options that you can choose from. The on-campus accommodation can range from 900 to 3,065 USD (~66,000 to 2.26 lakh INR). The residences range from residence halls, apartments, suites, and row houses. Residences include apartment buildings, single-family homes, and residence halls. Stanford provides some of the world's best facilities in its residences. Besides, they are incredibly considerate about everything going on your mind since you are moving away from home and aim to make it stress-free and as easy as possible. In all of its apartments, Stanford offers some of the top amenities in the world. They provide a tonne of materials to assist you in managing your time between college and life, getting along with your roommates, caring for your new house and more. Furthermore, they know everything on your mind while you move away from home and work to make it as smooth and stress-free as possible.Stanford also offers off-campus accommodation. They have subsidized housing and community housing options that are as good as on-campus housing. You may find more information on both on-campus and off-campus housing here.
Course Ranking: The University of Oxford alone provides over 350 graduate courses in a variety of fields, and they work tirelessly to expand their offerings every year. Whatever you need, whether it be in the performing or business arts, the university provides it. Let's examine the historical performance of some of the University of Oxford's most popular courses, including those in business, engineering, and computer science.From the table, it is clear that Oxford University's business programs might use some work. While the university has been ranked among the top five by The Guardian, Times Higher Education, and QS Subject Ranking, the University of Oxford has been ranked number 10, number 16, and number 21 for pursuing business courses in 2020 by FT (Financial Times)-Master in Finance, QS-Global MBA, and FT (Financial Times)-GMBA Ranking.Due to its consistent improvement over time and ranking among the top three institutions for engineering courses, the university has expanded to become a key center for engineering studies. For its PG Engineering and Technology programme, the university was ranked second by The Times Higher Education. The university is ranked third for its civil engineering and mechanical engineering programmes and second for its chemical engineering and electrical & electronic engineering programmes in The Complete University Guide.Times Higher Education has ranked the university first for pursuing PG Computers five years in a row, from 2017 to 2021, when it comes to computer studies. In the years 2020 and 2021, The Complete University Guide listed the university's computer science programme at number two.

Students should be aware that rankings are determined by polls taken over a specified time period by various ranking agencies. Academic Reputation, Faculty/Student Ratio, Employer Reputation, Citations per Faculty, and International Faculty Ratio/International Student Ratio are just a few of the metrics used to rate universities that are important in determining which universities are the best.The Times Higher Education has ranked the University of Oxford first for five years in a row, from 2017 to 2021, when we talk about the university's ranking. For five years in a row, from 2017 to 2021, The Complete University Guide, a publication unique to the United Kingdom, rated the university second.
