Name: Alabama State University
Overview: Alabama State University (ASU) is a public university founded in 1867 in Montgomery, Alabama. It has been accredited by the Commission of Colleges of the Southern Association of Colleges & Schools on Colleges (SACS) with a motive to provide interactive and practical learning. ASU offers education in 50+ Undergraduate, graduate and continuing programs in different streams. Students get the opportunity to choose from various majors like Communications, Rehabilitation and Therapy, Biology, Psychology, Biology, Business, Information Science, Social Work and Youth Services, and more.Alabam State University has eight different degree-granting schools, colleges or divisions, which are the College of Health Sciences, College of Education, College of Science, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, College of Liberal Arts & Social Sciences, College of Visual & Performing Arts, Harold Lloyd Murphy Graduate School and Percy J. Vaughn, Jr. College of Business. It also has a dual engineering program in collaboration with the University of Alabama at Birmingham (UAB), where qualified ASU students can enter the UAB engineering program directly. The average cost of attendance for an undergraduate student is USD 25,986. Scholarships are also offered to international students to learn in the USA. The academic scholarships are offered for eight semesters at maximum, and awardees must enrol in a full-time course to avail themselves of the scholarship advantage.Alabama State University has an excellent placement cell which brings job opportunities in different modes like part-time, full-time, student-work programs, stipend-based internships and more.
Eligibility Overview: Undergraduate Admissions at Alabama State University Students must submit their applications using the ASU Application Portal.For local students, the application price is $25; for overseas students, the application fee is $30.The admissions procedure is as follows:Apply online or in person using the official application.All documentation should be sent to the Office of Admissions.Pay the application cost.Transcript from high schoolScores on the ACT and SAT.Scores on the English Language Proficiency Test.Alabama State University also offers a unique admission programme that allows students to take classes without earning a degree.Applicants must have a good GPA or a high ACT/SAT score to be considered. The table below provides several examples:GPA2.00-2.492.50-2.993.00-3.493.50 OR ABOVEACT/SAT18/940-97017/910-94916/870-90915/830-869 Graduate admissions at Alabama State UniversityApplicants must submit their applications using the GradCAS platform.The application fee is 49 dollars (non-refundable)Requirements for a Basic Application:Resume/CVScores on the GRE and MAT tests.Transcripts from all colleges and universities are required.Recommendations lettersThe Statement of Purpose is a document that explains what you want to achieve.Scores on the English Language Proficiency Test.Supporting affidavit
Placement: Alabama State University Placements  The Office of Career Services at Alabama State University assists students who require assistance with job and employment options after completing their degrees. Handshake is one of the best online tools for helping job seekers write resumes, practise interviews, and apply for the correct positions.Career Services connects the university's 5,600 undergraduate and graduate students with job possibilities and on-campus recruiting activities. Within two years of graduation, 92 percent of students are employed. An Alabama State University graduate's average base pay is $59,000 USD.
Accommodation: On-Campus AccommodationOn-campus housing is available.All students have access to on-campus housing at the university.On campus, there are 13 living halls available to all students, from freshman to graduate students.Furniture, parking, entertainment areas, laundry facilities, and residential life activities are all available in the accommodation.On-campus housing information can be found here.http://www.alasu.edu/student-life/residence-life/index.aspx

Name: University of Central Arkansas
Overview: The University of Central Arkansas is located in Conway, USA, established in 1907. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. It provides five doctoral degrees in five fields and more than 90 undergraduate and 60 graduate certificate and degree programmes. Business, management, marketing, engineering, communication, journalism, and social sciences are a few of the university's well-liked majors.Students living away from home can stay in residence halls provided by the university. Around 3,800 students are living on campus. Students can select from one of three styles of residence halls, community-style, suite-style, or apartment style.In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. An international student's estimated average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenditure, is around $24,150. The University of Central Arkansas offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. Name: California State University, Stanislaus
Overview: California State University, Stanislaus, has received regional accreditation from WASC, the Western Association of Schools and Colleges. Established in 1957, CSU Stanislaus has two campus locations: Stockton and Turlock. The one in the city of Turlock is a vast 228-acre campus, and the other is an off-campus centre at University Park in Stockton. The Princeton Review consistently ranks CSU Stanislaus among the Best Colleges in the nation. This distinction is awarded to only 15% of universities and colleges throughout the US. The American Association of State Colleges and Universities recognized this institute as one of 12 public universities in the nation performing exceptionally in improving graduation and retention rates. This institute features a 22:1 student-to-faculty ratio and offers graduate courses and undergraduate programs.This institute has four colleges - College of Arts, Humanities, & Social Sciences, Business Administration, Education, Kinesiology & Social Work and College of Science. With an acceptance rate of 89%, California State University Stanislaus is a moderately selective university. There are roughly 11,164 students enrolled at this public university. CSU Stanislaus has a Warriors Cross-Cultural Center for supporting and promoting diversity. This entity works to eradicate cultural, social, and racial discrimination. It accepts students from over 50 nations globally every year.CSU Stanislaus offers an on-campus housing facility to students. The accommodation facility has single and double occupancy rooms, and the maximum number of residents permitted for each unit is four.

Placement: Internships At California State University, Stanislaus, an internship is one of a student's most significant learning experiences. Students can use what they've learned in class to apply what they've learned in the internship, create critical networking and reference relationships, confirm (or deny) career plans, and improve their resumes and portfolios, all of which are important for the future success. Internships with advertising agencies, public relations firms, insurance companies, hospitals, non-profit organisations, pharmaceutical companies, event management firms, radio and television stations, counties, chambers of commerce, human resource departments, consulting firms, politicians, and more have been completed by Communication Studies students at CSU, Stanislaus. There is a slew of internship possibilities to choose from. An internship is not the same as working part-time. Internships provide students with professional learning opportunities through focused observation and practical activities. Every internship is jointly supervised by the Department of Communication Studies Internship Coordinator and representatives from the cooperating organisation.
Accommodation: The Residential Life Village is Stanislaus State's sole on-campus student housing complex. Everything we do is motivated by our desire to see you succeed academically and socially. When you live here, you'll have access to an all-inclusive lifestyle that includes academic assistance resources and social activities that you won't find anywhere else.  You are fully involved in the collegiate experience when you live on campus. You have a community of professional staff and peer mentors that will support your professional and personal goals and provide guidance as needed. Your roommates and neighbours become study partners, and your study partners become lifelong friends, as you are surrounded by a student community. For more information, visit: https://www.csustan.edu/housing

Name: Baldwin Wallace University
Overview: In Berea, Ohio, the United States, Baldwin Wallace University, also known as BW, is a private, independent liberal arts and sciences college that offers bachelor's and master's degrees, certifications, and professional education programmes. John Baldwin, a Methodist representative, founded the university in 1845 as Baldwin Institute. Baldwin Wallace holds classes at Corporate College East, a part of Cuyahoga Community College in Warrensville Heights, Ohio, and its main location in Berea.More than eighty majors and several cooperative and pre-professional programmes are available at Baldwin Wallace. These majors result in either a Bachelor of Arts, Bachelor of Science, Bachelor of Science in Education, Bachelor of Music, Bachelor of Music in Education, or a Bachelor of Science in Nursing for undergraduate studies. Additionally, BW offers master's degree programmes in business (MBA), accounting (MAcc), and management (MAM); education (MAEd) and leadership in higher education (LHE); and health sciences (PA), public health (MPH), and speech-language pathology (SLP). BW also provides online programmes and courses. BW accepts students from throughout Ohio, as well as from all over the rest of the United States and the world. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship.The estimated average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenditure for an international student, are around INR 29,34,084. Baldwin Wallace University offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students.

Name: Christian Culinary Academy
Overview:
Located in Cannon Beach, Oregon, Christian Culinary Academy is a private, non-denominational college with a maximum enrollment of 16 undergraduate students. This college is dedicated to providing matchless education at an affordable cost compared to other culinary schools. The experienced professionals give personalised attention to the students in a one-year intensive program that makes this academy unique.
Christian Culinary Academy is considered one of the most affordable culinary institutions. Many students have benefited by utilising the necessary financial assistance that involves payment plans and tuition discounts, work-study during the school year, CCA scholarship, personal connections support grants and loans, additional scholarships etc. From this academy, students can receive in-hand experience through their theory and practical learning. Additionally, students can participate in different field trips and Biblical training to get real-life experience working in the kitchens. After completing a semester, students have the option to work with an experienced chef to reaffirm their training. After completing this program, students will receive a Certificate in Culinary Arts.
Instead of getting approved as a degree-granting institution, this academy is a certificate-granting trade school, which enables students to obtain affordable education through a one year program instead of a two-year program. To attain academic goals, students usually spend 24 hours per week in classroom kitchens or 8 hours a week through mini-internships which is a substantial amount of school work along with the homework. Some of the Christian Culinary Academy curricula include Introduction to Gastronomy, Nutrition, Regional Cuisines, Beverages, Culinary Math, Purchasing and Receiving, Sanitisation and Equipment, Foodservice Management, etc.
The amenities of Christian Culinary Academy include Wi-Fi, lounge and activity areas and free student parking. This academy's students and alumni enjoy a wide range of career placement services through job listings, effective networking within Christian Chefs International and Christian Chefs Conference and placement recommendation from the academy's faculty.

Name: Pace University
Overview: Pace University is a private university founded in 1906 in New York. The university was founded by the Pace brothers to provide quality education that transforms the professional and academic prospects of its students. The university comprises six schools, offering over 100 undergraduate, graduate and doctoral majors. The top courses at Pace University are M.S. in Computer Science, BBA in Accounting, M.A. in Psychology and BFA in Acting. The average annual costs of studying at Pace University are around USD 68,500. The course fee structure varies depending on the duration and type of program. The university provides world-class facilities to help students excel in various fields. Over 85% of undergraduate and 90% of graduate students from the university secured employment or successfully pursued higher studies as of 2018. Name: Southern Utah University

Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Engineering. The main campus of Southern Utah University is located in Cedar City. The university offers over one undergraduate program and one postgraduate program. Accommodation: Residential halls are available to students at the institution in the United States. The University's official website lists a number of off-campus lodging options, although the accuracy of the information cannot be guaranteed. Each student is accommodated in one of four residential halls, each with its own distinct flair. Students can look through the available housing alternatives, fill up an online application using their login credentials, and pay a non-refundable charge of $50.Freshmen live in the following residence halls at Southern Utah University:Cedar Hall is a type of house where two bedrooms share a bathroom. Each bedroom can accommodate two people. Study areas, a communal lounge, and a kitchen are all included in the suites' price. A twin bed, desk and chair, dresser, and closet are included in each bedroom.Ecclesiastical learning Rooms designed in the style of an apartment for community living in the centre. Each apartment has four to five bedrooms, with private and shared spaces. There is a kitchen, a living room, and an eat-in area in each apartment.Founders Hall is a 320-student residence hall with apartment-styled quarters for personal growth. Each unit is fully equipped with a kitchen, communal lounges, workout equipment, television, and internet access.The following meal plans are required for Cedar Hall residents: Unlimited 5, Unlimited 7, Block 150, or Block 100. Students can get these at the Thunder Circle Dining Facility, and Dining Dollars can be used at places like Chick-fil-A, Papa Johns, and the market.

Name: New Jersey City University
Overview: New Jersey City Institution (NJCU) is a public university in New Jersey. NJCU is divided into three colleges, each offering 41 undergraduate and graduate degree programmes.Psychology, Nursing, Early Childhood Education, and Music are the largest and most popular programmes at NJCU. Furthermore, the NJCU Fire Science programme is the state's only university-based bachelor's degree fire science programme. The annual Black Maria Film and Video Festival, international juried competition and traveling exhibition that acknowledges and encourages independent film, is hosted and sponsored by the NJCU Media Arts Department.NJCU has launched a "Professional Security" programme to assist students in gaining admission to agencies such as the FBI, NSA, and CIA. Most NJCU graduates have gone on to become teachers in grades k-12.

Name: University of West Georgia
Overview: The University of West Georgia in Carrollton, Georgia, was founded in 1906. The sixth-largest public institute has its main campus in Carrollton, a satellite instructional site in Newnan, and other campuses and study centres in Douglasville, Atlanta, and Tyus Road. The university offers 100 undergraduates, 40 postgraduate, eight specializations, five doctorates, 29 certificates, and seven endorsement programs through its academic colleges. Popular courses include psychology, Nursing, Business Administration, Management, Criminology, Public Affairs, and marketing. On-campus accommodation is provided in residential halls and apartments such as Arbor View Apartments, Bowdon Hall, Strozier Complex, Center Pointe Suites, The Oaks, Tyus Hall, University Suites, and The Village; the rent ranges from 2,500 - 3,700 USD along with an application fee of 150 USD. All halls are equipped with fully furnished rooms, a kitchen, study areas, social spaces, lounges, fitness centres, laundry, and dining options. The student union manages more than 160 student clubs and organizations, 24 fraternities and sororities, and sports like basketball, football, golf, cross country, etc. UWG conducts a Student Externship Program, and graduates are met with an average annual salary of 43,800 USD. The undergraduate tuition fees for graduate programs are 7,750 USD and 8,450 USD per semester. International students benefit from over 300 merit-based and need-based scholarships like Bill Cummings Scholarship Fund, Carrollton Junior Woman's Club Scholarship, and Chuck Puckett Family Endowment are awarded.

Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation All first-year college students are required to enrol in a freshman meal plan for both semesters and live on campus for two semesters (Fall/Spring or Spring/Fall). A Residency Requirement Waiver is available to students who have already completed two semesters at another university and who will be 21 years old on the first day of classes in the Fall semester. In the US, they have the option of living off-campus. The following housing options are available to first-year students at the University of West Georgia. Bowdon Hall: This is a conventional hall with rooms that sleep two people each. It provides amenities like individual study rooms, a full kitchen, a movie theatre, and music venues.Strozier Complex: There are 62 single rooms in this pet-friendly residence hall. The Strozier complex features a designated dog walk area in addition to full-sized mattresses in a single room and an on-site kitchen.Center Pointe Suites: For first-year students, this is their initial choice. It offers single and shared bathrooms, wardrobes, and furniture in its single and shared occupancy rooms. The resident hall also features a grill-equipped terrace.The Oaks: Both single and double rooms with private or semi-private baths are available in this hall. The Oaks includes amenities like a meeting/presentation room, a pool table, as well as a vending machine den and is located near to East Commons eating hall.University Suites: Residence halls in the suite type with semi-private toilets are available at University Suites. Additionally, it houses a conference room and the Academic Resource Center. On-campus housing can be found here. Off-Campus Accommodation Studio apartments, 4 bedroom apartments, 3 bedroom, 2 bedroom, and single bedroom are among the residential types.The typical monthly rent is between 1000 and 1400 dollars.All of the necessary amenities are included in the student apartments, including power, water, gas, a modular kitchen, and unrestricted internet access.The majority of the units are leased. Name: La Salle University
Overview: La Salle University is a Catholic university located in Pennsylvania, United States. This privately owned university was founded in 1863 by the Institute of the Brothers of the Christian Schools, who named it after St. Jean-Baptiste de La Salle. The university is home to three schools; Business Administration, Nursing and Health Sciences and Arts and Sciences offering undergraduate, graduate and doctoral programs in these fields of education. The best programs at La Salle University include Masters in Public Health (MPH), Masters in Business Administration (MBA) and MS in Speech-Language Pathology. The university's main campus is located in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. As part of its vibrant student community, the university has several fraternities and sororities to help students form a strong professional network. The campus faith ministry promotes Christian values and morals on campus, irrespective of one's religious beliefs. The La Salle Explorers sports teams represent the university at numerous sports tournaments, finding success in basketball and producing athletes who have participated in the Olympic Games. Famous alumni who completed programs from La Salle University include Mayor of Philadelphia Jim Kenney, actor Peter Boyle and current director of the Central Intelligence Agency William Joseph Burns. The average cost of studying here can come to around USD 49,000 every year.

Name: Simmons University
Overview: John Simmons established Simmons University in 1899. This non-profit private University is based in Boston and holds affiliation with the Colleges of the Fenway. The New England Commission of Higher Education accredits this institution.According to the Times Higher Education 2022, Simmons University ranks 128th nationwide. It ranks 136th among the national universities in the U.S. News & World Report 2022. It ranked 53rd as Best Value School and 82nd among the top performers in social mobility. The University provides undergraduate women and co-educational programs in health sciences, liberal arts, communications, social work, public health, library and information science, business and nursing. Students can opt from 50+ Major programs. Apart from this, graduate and certificate programs in Behavior Analysis, Children’s Literature etc., are also available. Financial assistance to undergraduates and graduates is available through scholarships such as Dorothea Lynde Dix and Boston Scholarships. Moreover, 100% of first-year students of SU receive financial support. The University also encourages sports as its athletics team, ‘Shark,’ participates in NCAA Division II. Individuals busy with their professional lives can opt for online graduate and undergraduate programs in Behavior Analysis, Nursing, Public Health etc.Approximately 91% of undergraduates of Simmons University have secured jobs or got admission to graduate schools within 6 months of completing their programs.

The college has about 65 undergraduate programs with other minors and specializations,30 graduate and 28 certification programs. The tuition fee for Seattle University is 48,390 USD.

Name: Cornell University
Overview: Cornell University is an Ivy League institution located in the picturesque city of Ithaca, New York, in the United States. The iconic Morris Hall was the first building to be made in 1868. Spread over 2300 acres, the campus also administers two satellite medical campuses- one in the States and the other in Education City, Qatar. Cornell has made a mark with rankings for the diverse courses at the undergraduate and graduate programs. Presently, it offers around 80 majors and 100 fields of graduate study with several minor and online courses. Engineering, Business Management, Marketing and Computer and Information Sciences are some highly coveted courses. Famous for its uniquely structured courses in psychology, oceanography and human bonding, it also continues to be the mecca of research and development globally.It is well known for what is popularly called the Cornell University Library - the 16th largest library in the United States. Being an Ivy League institution, Cornell is highly selective in its admission process. Most courses require a reasonably high GRE/ SAT score for graduate and undergraduate programs, respectively. The acceptance rate is close to 11%. The average cost of a full-time degree program with tuition is around 76,000 dollars.The university also grants scholarships and fee- waivers to its students, making the teaching-learning process an inclusive one. The campus houses seventeen residential halls for undergraduate students and eight program houses and residential communities for graduate and professional students.On-campus housing is guaranteed to sophomore students. Cornell has stupendous placement records for various professional courses, including MBA and engineering, with graduates receiving an average salary of $100,000. Owing to its rich culture and rigour, the institution has produced stalwarts in various fields. Popular alumni include Ratan Tata, Abraham Maslow, Ruth Ginsberg and so on.

Name: Saint leo University
Overview: Saint Leo University, founded in 1889, has more than 2,282 undergraduate and 4,598 graduate students. It bagged 4th position in Best Value Schools by US News and World Report, 2021. This is a mere catholic school which is situated in West Central Florida, around 30 minutes north of Tampa. The institution offers around 159 programs and some doctorate, associate programs as well. More than 5,351 students are pursuing these courses where 22% of this total number are international students coming from over 101 countries. In terms of the admission process for these international students, Saint Leo University looks for English proficiency test scores apart from previous academic records. It follows a selective admission policy and the acceptance rate stays at 72%. This means interested students will be facing strong competition during this procedure and the GPA has to be good enough to get approved. The institution has a full-time faculty percentage of 21%. The teachers are well experienced and dedicated to help students acquire in-depth knowledge regarding some unique courses like Law enforcement, Biological and Biomedical Sciences, Homeland Security, etc. The average cost of attendance for the Saint Leo University students stays between $16,804 and $24,301. However, the institution also provides scholarship facilities and about 95% of the total enrolled students receive monetary assistance every year. Around 63% of the student population get on-campus accommodation facilities. Apart from financial aid and accommodation, the institution takes care of students’ other requirements as well, for instance, permit to work while studying, access to extracurricular activities, etc. Saint Leo University has its very own Saint Leo Lions sports teams which take part in several competitions in nearly 20 sports in the NCAA Division II Sunshine State Conference.
Eligibility Overview: In order to be admitted to Saint Leo International University, international students must meet the following prerequisites for both undergraduate and graduate degrees: -A filled-out application formTranscripts- mark papers from high school and secondary school, as well as the credits earnedSAT and ACT scores are taken into account, but they are not required for admission.Proof of financial assistanceLOR's personal statementResumeScore on an English proficiency examAn example of scholarly work completedA photocopy of the passport's biographical section.
Placement: The Career Service Centre at Saint Leo University assists recent graduates in preparing for interviews, job hunting, and choosing the best career path for internships or full-time employment. Candidates gain professional visibility through LinkedIn and Handshake, as well as participation in university-hosted career fairs and events. A Saint Leo graduate's average salary is 67,909 USD. Name: Illinois Institute of Technology
Overview: The Illinois Institute of Technology is a university located in Chicago, USA. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programs for distance education students. The university offers over 10 undergraduate programs and 17 postgraduate programs. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ from course to course.The estimated average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenditures for an international student, are around INR 46,86,285. Additionally, the men's and women's athletic teams at the Illinois Institute of Technology compete in baseball, soccer, cross country, swimming, basketball, tennis, track, and field. The women's teams compete in volleyball, basketball, soccer, lacrosse, cross country, swimming, and tennis. For its students, it has a top-notch, built sports facility.Illinois Institute of Technology offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship.
Eligibility Overview: Qualifications for Undergraduate Level Basic Education: Grade 12 in the pertinent subject English Proficiency Score: Students who want to enrol in undergraduate programmes can either submit a minimum score on the English Language Proficiency Test to the institution, or they can take an additional English proficiency test created by Illinois Tech. To meet these criteria, you must obtain the following scores:A minimum score of 110 on the Duolingo English Test (DET)Minimum TOEFL score of 90IELTS: Minimum score of 6.5PTE Academic: 53 is the minimum score SAT or ACT standardised exam score:By submitting a minimum score on one of the following standardised tests, the English proficiency score requirement may be waived:SAT: Critical reading part minimum score of 550 and reading section minimum score of 30English part of the ACT requires a minimum score of 25  Requirements for Graduate Level Eligibility Basic Education: Bachelor's degree with at least a 3.0 GPA on a 4-point scale and one of the following qualifications:For engineers or medical students, a four-year undergraduate degree in a relevant field is requiredAny three-year undergraduate degree from an Indian university with a NAAC Grade A The score for English Proficiency: One of the followingIELTS: 5.5 bands or moreDET: 95–109 minimum scoreMinimum TOEFL score of 70 GRE and GMAT test scores are standardised.GMAT: 500 to 650 depending on the prerequisitesGRE scores range from 298 to 316 depending on the course. Work Experience: Five years minimum for MBA
Placement: Within six months of graduation, 88% of Illinois Institute of Technology graduates find employment. While 14.3% of students continue their education, around 66.4% of students are employed.Graduates from the institute typically start out making 62,654 USD.According to Payscale, the Armour College's engineering programmes have the 24th best return on investment for graduates in the country.The following are the salaries awarded to institution graduates, according to Emolument:             Accenture, Amazon, Google, SpaceX, Booz Allen Hamilton, Boston Scientific, Caterpillar, Deloitte, Oracle, Shure, Siemens, Southwest Airlines, Twitter, Slalom Consulting, Texas Instruments, Uber, Underwriter Laboratories, Wolverine Trading, and others are notable employers of recent graduates. The institution provides career services that make it simple for students to find jobs and internships. In addition, the institution offers alternatives for micro internships, enhanced internships, internships for international students, and other types of internships.

Name: University of Colorado Denver

With an acceptance rate of 64%, the university ranks 113th among the Top Public Schools. Applications through the University's Application Portal will be filled for intake in Fall, Spring, and Summer semesters. Academic transcripts, LORs, essays, CVs, program-specific documents, and scores on English Language Proficiency tests, SAT, ACT, GMAT, GRE, etc., should also be submitted with a non-refundable application fee of 75 USD. The average undergraduate tuition and fee are 29,300 USD, whereas that for postgraduate courses is 16,789 USD. Several merit-based and need-based scholarships like International Freshman Scholarships worth up to 16,250 USD and Lynx Grant are awarded to all students. Work-study options are also available on-campus. CU Denver has a high placement rate, and graduates are placed in well-paid jobs with an average annual salary of 56,400 USD.

Studios with double and triple occupancy fully-furnished rooms are available with facilities like television, laundry, Wi-fi, etc. The campus also has around 100 student organisations, recreational centres, sports like volleyball, tennis, and basketball, a well-equipped Auraria library, classrooms, wellness centres, and an Arts and Science building. On-Campus Accommodation Living in an on-campus residence helps students concentrate more on their studies and allows them to make new friends and be a part of numerous projects. Name: University of New Hampshire
Overview: A public university in Bellingham, Washington, the Western Washington University was established in 1893 as a state-funded school. Promoting the importance of active minds in the current global world, the university remains invested in learning, innovation and determination while ensuring the future of its students as critically aware and responsible world leaders. With the main campus at Bellingham and other branching campuses at Anacortes, Bremerton and Lakewood, the university offers its students multiple state-of-the-art educational and cultural facilities. It is organized into several colleges which include the College of Business and Economics, College of Fine and Performing Arts, College of Humanities and Social Sciences, College of Science and Engineering, Fairhaven College of Interdisciplinary Studies, Graduate School, Huxley College of the Environment and the Woodring College of Education. With a 90% acceptance rate, the university offers over hundreds of undergraduate and graduate programs in different fields of study. One extraordinary and popular aspect of the university is that it allows the students to design custom degree programs at Fairhaven College while symbolizing the importance and inclusive nature of interdisciplinary programs. The university serves as a home for thousands of students hailing from different parts of the world by ensuring a vibrant and discrimination-free campus life. The average annual tuition and accommodation fee can come to around $35K but through many of the scholarships and grants provided by the college, the cost can be brought down to $ 26K. Covering 215 acres of green land, the university overlooks Bellingham Bay and plays host to the Public Sculpture Collection featuring artists like James Fitzgerald and Anthony Caro. It remains equipped with libraries, residence halls, laboratories, organizations, transport facilities and athletic centres. With a brilliant alumni network, also ensures a promising placement rate for the graduating batch.

Specific courses may require an average SAT score of 1175 or an ACT composite score of 25, but they are not mandatory. For PG Students : Applicants for the postgraduate programme must meet subject-specific eligibility standards, which vary by major. To be eligible for any graduate programme at the university, international applicants must have completed a four-year baccalaureate or equivalent degree. Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation There are numerous diverse halls to call home and a kind and inclusive community. Living on campus makes it easier to make friends, obtain homework help, and get involved in the community.  Residence Halls Adams Tower West One sizeable triple room with a private bathroom, air conditioning, and floor-to-ceiling windows make up each suite. Residents of ATW enjoy a sense of freedom within a tight-knit upper-division community. Alexander Hall Alexander Hall is situated in the centre of the campus and has a shared outdoor quad space with several other dorms. Christensen Hall It is a handy spot to call home because it is close to Philbrook Dining Hall and our twin building Williamson Hall and is minutes from several academic buildings. Congreve Hall First-year students are drawn to live in Congreve for various reasons, including its proximity to the campus centre and recreational activities. Engelhardt Hall Being a tiny residence hall on campus, Engelhardt makes it simple to get to know everyone there. Residents pledge to keep drugs and alcohol away from the residence hall. Fairchild Hall Fairchild, the International Connections-themed Hall, is home to international residents and local students seeking a broad and varied cultural experience. Gibbs Hall You'll reside in "The Clubhouse," a small, close-knit neighbourhood in Gibbs. The Gibbs staff and Hall Council give residents chances in this active community to get to know one another by focusing on sports, fitness, and wellbeing. Haaland Hall Haaland Hall finished in 2008, houses students from a wide range of backgrounds and reflects a wide variety of identities and personalities. Handler Hall One of the newest living halls on the campus is called Handler. The facility is home to one full-time professional staff member and nine resident assistants. Hubbard Hall Hubbard is a medium-sized co-ed resident hall with two themes: "Honors" and "Making the Grade," giving students who desire to live in a setting with solid academic standards a chance to do so. Hunter Hall A modest but active coed hall with both upperclassmen and first-years. For more information, visit: https://www.unh.edu/housing/housing-options/residence-halls  Apartments The Gables Academic buildings, athletic facilities, and UNH sporting arenas are all conveniently close to the vibrant and bustling community of The Gables Apartment Complex. Woodside The majority of the students in the close-knit community of Woodside are transfer, sophomore, and junior students. For more information, visit: https://www.unh.edu/housing/housing-options/apartments  Graduate Housing Babcock Hall Babcock Hall is a distinctive and energetic group of people aged 21 and above that includes a variety of international, graduate, and non-traditional students. The hall blends the ease of on-campus housing with social, educational, and cultural possibilities. For Babcock Hall, a meal plan is not necessary. For more information, visit: https://www.unh.edu/housing/housing-options/graduate-housing  Block Housing In specific on-campus residence halls, a phase of room selection called "block housing" enables groups of residents to choose a "block" of rooms next to one another. A terrific place to live with your pals is in a block house. Participants are strongly encouraged to be current first-year students and groups of students waiting for apartments. Block Housing groups must have a minimum of 6 residents. For more information, visit: https://www.unh.edu/housing/block-housing  Summer Internship Housing Congreve Hall, located on the UNH campus, offers single rooms that are tastefully furnished, cosy with air conditioning, and equipped with Wi-Fi. Boston is barely an hour away and only a few minutes only a few minutes away from where we are. Other seacoast cities like Dover and Rochester are also nearby. The beaches, White Mountains, and Lakes are close to our campus and are easily accessible. You can even board a train during your stay at the UNH Dairy Bar to travel from Brunswick, Maine, to Boston, Massachusetts, and other destinations. For more information, visit: https://www.unh.edu/housing/housing-options/summer-internship-housing  Vacation Housing All academic year breaks are available for residents of vacation housing (Thanksgiving, Winter and Spring). You can come and go as you want during the break from the academic year if you are assigned to one of the buildings indicated below. The charge for all vacation housing residence halls is an extra $50.00 that is already included in the housing cost for each semester. For more information, visit: https://www.unh.edu/housing/housing-options/vacation-housing   Off-Campus Accommodation 260 Mast Rd. Durham's off-campus, privately owned facility also offers graduate student housing.There are 1, 2, 3, and 4 BR apartment apartments in this building, each with a full kitchen, bathroom, flat-screen TV, desk, and armoire. Free parking, a workout centre, a resident study room, and on-site laundry exist. Except for a 1-bedroom apartment, which generally costs $1600 per month for a couple, rent is $800 per person. Included are heat, hot water, cable, and Wi-Fi. Electricity usage will be the tenant's responsibility. During the academic year, Wildcat transportation runs frequently, and the distance may be travelled by bike and on foot.  For general enquiries, visit: https://www.unh.edu/housing/

Name: University of Wisconsin-Madison
Overview: The University of Wisconsin-Madison is a public research university and the official state university of the state of Wisconsin. Founded in 1848, the university is now the premier institution of the University of Wisconsin system. The university has 20 colleges and schools that offer 136 undergraduate, 148 graduate and 120 doctoral programs. The top-ranked courses at the University of Wisconsin-Madison are Masters in Business Administration (MBA), MS in Mechanical Engineering and MS in Chemical Engineering. The average annual university study costs come to around USD 26.500, with fee structures varying according to course type and duration.
Eligibility Overview: A minimum undergraduate grade-point average (GPA) of 3.00 on the equivalent of the last 60 semester hours (about two years of work) is required, or a master's degree with a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.00. Applicants from overseas institutions must have an excellent academic record, with a GPA of at least 3.00 for a bachelor's or master's degree. Your institution's grading scale will be used by the Graduate School. Don't convert your grades to a scale of 4.00.The GRE is not required by the Graduate School. It may or may not be required by your academic programme. Please see your program's website for further information. Some programmes have decided to eliminate or offer flexibility with their GRE requirement due to difficulties around COVID-19.An English proficiency test score is required for any applicant whose native language is not English or whose undergraduate education was not completed in English. ETS requires TOEFL scores to be submitted electronically. Scores for the IELTS exam can be submitted either electronically or on paper. Our mailing address is: Office of Admissions, UW-Madison Graduate School, 232 Bascom Hall, 500 Lincoln Drive, Madison, WI 53706. If your score is older than two years from the start of your admission period, it will not be accepted. Applicants are not exempt from this criterion because of their country of citizenship. The language of teaching at the college or university level, as well as how recently the language instruction was taken, determine whether or not this condition is met

Name: University of North Georgia
Overview: North Georgia University is a public senior military college in Georgia, United States. It is one of the six military colleges in the United States, offering the US Army Reserve Officer Training Corps (ROTC) program for those wishing to join the military. The University was founded in 1873 as the North Georgia Agricultural College. The University of North Georgia attained its current status after the conglomeration of North Georgia College and State University and Gainesville State College in 2013, making it the sixth-largest public University in the state. The University comprises five colleges offering undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral programs. The top courses at the University of North Georgia include a BS in Psychology, a Bachelor in Business Administration, and a Master of Business Administration. The University has four campuses located across Georgia. The Dahlonega Campus was the former site of North Georgia College and State University. It is also home to the William J. Livsey Drill Field for military exercises. The University follows several military traditions, paying homage to its roots. It also has an Arch and Memorial Wall to commemorate the fallen soldiers from wars in the past. Fraternities and sororities help students build professional networks to further their career prospects. The University hosts several events and intramural sports to ensure a vibrant campus life. Other facilities include wellness centers and dining services.The average cost of attending University is around USD 21,000 per year.

Name: Robert Morris University Illinois
Overview: Robert Morris University Illinois is a university located in Chicago, USA. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Business. The main campus of Robert Morris University Illinois is located in Chicago. Robert Morris University accepts students at both the undergraduate and graduate levels. The institution has about 4,000 students and provides over 80 undergraduate and graduate courses. The university participates and competes primarily in the Chicagoland Collegiate Athletic Conference as a member of the National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics (NAIA) (CCAC). United States Collegiate Athletic Association membership is held by the university branch in Peoria (USCAA). The university offers both men's and women's sports, including softball, basketball, football, ice hockey, and bowling.The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. The estimated average tuition and fees excluding miscellaneous expenditure for an international student are around INR 28,97,934. Robert Morris University Illinois offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. Name: Appalachian State University
Overview: Appalachian State University is a public university located in the state of North Carolina in the United States. The university was founded in 1899 as the Watauga College by B.B. and D.D.Dougherty with Lillie Shull Dougherty. Established as a teachers college, its steady growth as an educational institute resulted in its eventual renaming in 1967 after achieving university status. Now part of the University of North Carolina institutions, its various faculties offer over 150 undergraduate degrees, 70 graduate degrees and 2 doctoral programs. The top courses at Appalachian State University include MS in Computer Science, MS in Nursing (MSN) and MA in Psychology. The campus of the university covers an area of 1,300 acres in the Blue Ridge Mountains of Boone, North Carolina. It is one of the highest university campuses in the eastern parts of the country. The campus is home to the Carol Grotnes Belk Library & Information Commons, providing students with access to the latest literature and books in various academic fields. The university also has three other centers located in Hickory, Lenoir and Morganton as well as an online program. The average costs of attending university here come to around USD 20,000 per annum, with tuition fee structures varying depending on the type of course and its duration. The university has a large number of student communities and organizations that help students develop a healthy social life. Cultural activities and festivals on campus promote interaction amongst the multicultural student society for a well rounded student experience. The university also promotes a variety of outdoor and adventure sports thanks to its location in the mountains. The university also provides healthcare and mental wellness services to students to ensure they enjoy good health during their stay and education on campus.

Name: Baruch College
Overview: Baruch College is a public college named after former statesman Bernard M. Baruch. The college is located in New York City, where it was founded in 1919 to provide education for those who could not afford private tuition. The college has three schools that offer 29 undergraduate majors, 56 graduate level specializations and 2 doctoral courses. The best programs at Baruch College are BA in Psychology, MA in Corporate Communication and Masters in Business Administration (MBA). The Baruch College campus covers a total area of 3 acres located in Manhattan. The Marxe School of Public and International Affairs is located in the Lawrence and Eris Field Building. The Newman Vertical Building was inaugurated in 2001 and is home to the Zicklin School of Business and Weissman School of Arts and Sciences. The campus provides students with facilities like the William and Anita Newman as well as the Baruch Computing and Technology Center. These ensure that they have all the resources they need to receive quality education. The average cost of attending college here comes to around USD 33,000 per annum. Tuition fee costs vary depending on the program chosen and the length of the course. Baruch College has more than 130 student clubs for graduate and undergraduate students. This helps the diverse student community build relations and networks amongst alumni and faculty, giving them a headstart in their careers. The college is also home to the Bearcats, which represent Baruch College at various state level collegiate events. The Athletic and Recreational Complex (ARC) gives students the opportunity to train and work out on campus. Baruch College has seen a number of prominent personalities graduate from various programs. Notable alumni include pop singer Jennifer Lopez, fashion designer Ralph Lauren and politician Michael Grimm.

Students at Georgia University also have special programs like Border Free Education facilities for students promoting cross-cultural learning and the large Ina Dillard Russell Library. Students of GC have more than 24 leadership programs with an economic impact of $75,000. The approximate cost of attendance or COA for the courses for in-state students is $9, 524 and those for out-state students are $28,704. Georgia College also has university housing facilities in traditional campus living and village apartment-style living on the west campus. Having seven residence halls like the Foundation hall, Wells Hall, Sanford Hall, Napier Hall, and others, campus life in GC includes active sports and recreation life, music, concerts, theatres, observatory, and more than 150 student organization groups for active involvement. Notable alumni of Georgia College actress Tanvi Ganesh Lonkar, activist Helen M. Lewis, CEO of GEICO Tony Nicely, and many others.

Name: University of Phoenix
Overview: The University of Phoenix, founded by John Sperling is an institution of higher study located in Phoenix city of the southwestern state of Arizona in the United States. It was founded in 1976 and got its accreditation in 1978. This for-profit institution currently operates over 200 campuses worldwide. The University of Phoenix offers a wide range of courses at the undergraduate, masters and doctoral level. The main schools of instruction include Business, Social Sciences, Education and Health. It also has a repertoire of online courses that are instructor-led which includes Criminal Justice, Cyber Security, Public Administration to name a few. To enhance the efficiency of the teaching-learning process, transcripts of these courses are also made available to the students. With an open admission policy, the criteria for enrollment is a high-school diploma and GED. The admission procedure involves a compulsory test in English Language, official transcripts, and a resume/ CV for masters. Apart from these requirements, there are also some state-specific guidelines for applicants hailing from Hawaii, Carolina, Connecticut, Massachusetts, New Jersey, Oklahoma and Tennessee. The acceptance rate is close to 100%. The tuition fees per credit are $398 USD, $698 USD and $810 USD for undergraduate, masters and doctoral programs respectively. Students having a permanent residential address of the States are eligible for federal financial aid and scholarships. Popular scholarships awarded by the institution include Federal Pell Grant, Federal Direct Student Loan Program, National Science and Mathematics Access to Retain Talent Grant (National SMART Grant) to name a few. Owing to the fact that most students attending the university are working professionals, it does not have extensive housing facilities on campus. It has an active collegiate athletic association that is very popular with the student community. Amenities like the university library with over 200 online resources, life resource center offering clinical counselling services and life coaching as well as academic counsellors are available on campus.

Placement: Professional practice allows students studying exercise and sports science and sports management to participate in practical work rotations in the sports sector. The students must conduct practical job placements, which can take place in places like sporting clubs and organisations, recreational facilities, local and state government, and research. Placements can be done on a part-time basis on an ongoing basis or in a block style for a few weeks, such as a 2-4 week period.  The following is a summary of the professional practice program's focus : Students are given the opportunity to apply the ideas they have learned in their studies in a real-world setting.Students learn about the sports industry's scope and the numerous opportunities available to them.Students learn how to apply the skills, information, attitudes, and characteristics needed to work in the sports sector in a practical setting.Students have the opportunity to network, be mentored, and learn from respected sports industry representatives.

Name: BridgeEnglish  - Denver
Overview: BridgeEnglish Denver has been one of the world-leading English training institutes delivering quality education for the last 25 years. It is accredited by the Accrediting Council of Continuing Education & Training (ACCET) under the USA education department. The institute is renowned for its focus on cross-culture communication and language competency. Over 350 teachers and 80 employees from diverse nationalities and cultures work together to offer an exclusive learning experience in English. Students, professionals, and entrepreneurs can enrol in many courses specially designed to ace multiple proficiency tests depending on their career requirements. It has a diverse student population from 16 to 70 years old. The study material, classes, facilities, and curriculum are high-quality, as experts undergo rigorous quality checks to ensure that students get the best resources to enhance their learning experience. It aims to provide education at every level based on the current proficiency level of the student and has developed courses for basic, advanced, and intermediate levels. It offers courses in general English, academic English, standardised English exam preparation such as IELTS, business English, pathway programs, tailor-made courses, etc. Students across the globe get admission to this institute and unite under a common cause of getting a sound language education. Under Federal law, it can also enrol non-immigrant candidates and thus helps non-native speakers increase their chances of accessing better employment opportunities. BridgeEnglish Denver is a member of StudyColorado that aims to promote Denver, Colorado as an important study destination. It is rated as one of the best places to learn English and enhance the efficacy of language.

Name: Kaplan International Languages - Boston (Harvard Square)
Overview: Kaplan International Languages - Boston (Harvard Square) is situated 10 minutes from the centre of Boston and located in a modern building near Harvard University. This location is also close to rail and bus links through which students can quickly access Downtown Boston and historical sites such as Fanueil Hall, Boston Common, and the rest of the Freedom Trail. The Boston Harvard Square School of Kaplan International Languages is accredited by the Accrediting Council for Continuing Education and Training (ACCET). This institute arranges weekend trips to New York and Washington D.C. There are a total of 13 classrooms at this institute, and it houses over 200 students. This institute boasts of a recommendation rate of 95.9%. Kaplan International Languages - Boston (Harvard Square) school extends several English courses to the students. These include Long-term English courses, Flexible English courses, Business English courses, and Exam Preparation courses. Besides having a degree level of education, the teachers in this institution boast of a CELTA or equivalent qualification. Some of them also hold an MA in applied linguistics, a higher level DELTA qualification, or PGCE. The University Placement Service enables students to benefit from the vast network of partner colleges and universities. The institute helps them to get entry to undergraduate and graduate courses. This school also hosts a dedicated social program that is curated for helping individuals explore the city and build friendships through activities and organized events. Boston also offers homestay and student residence facilities through which students enjoy an excellent living experience.

Name: University of Wisconsin–La Crosse
Overview: Established in 1909, the University of Wisconsin–La Crosse is a public university in La Crosse, Wisconsin. It is one of the University of Wisconsin System institutes that provides a world-class education for international and domestic students.Students at the University of Wisconsin–La Crosse can choose from more than 90 undergraduate majors, the most famous being Biology. Within Biology, various concentrations are available for study, including Biomedical Science, Aquatic Science, and Plant and Fungal Biology. For graduate studies, degrees are offered through the College of Science and Allied Health, the Department of Physical Therapy, and others. For deserving students, the university provides financial assistance. The net price after financial aid is $12,197 per annum, with 78% of the students receiving this award. Among those, about 19% receive federal grants, 21 % receive institutional grants, and 20% receive Pell Grant. As per Times Higher Education World University Rankings 2022, the University of Wisconsin–La Crosse ranks 501-600 in U.S. College Rankings 2019. Based on the same, the out-of-state tuition and fees are $17,612, and the in-state tuition and fees are $9,109. Additionally, the university ranks 380 in ‘Top Colleges 2021’, 179 in ‘Public Colleges’ and 265 in ‘America’s Best Value Colleges 2019’ on the Forbes list. As per the same, the total student population at the University of Wisconsin–La Crosse is 10,623, with 9,663 undergraduates. The University of Wisconsin–La Crosse has an acceptance rate of 73%, with an annual cost of $26,720 for 2021-22. The university follows a semester calendar system, with 81% of the students are from in-state and 18% being out-of-state students. According to Forbes, the median salary of the University of Wisconsin–La Crosse graduates after 10 years of graduation is $89,700.

Name: Schiller International University
Overview: Schiller International University is a for-profit university present at four campus locations and an SIU Virtual campus. The four campuses are Madrid, Heidelberg, Tampa, and Paris. The various degrees offered at this institute are classified into Bachelor's degrees, Master's degrees, Continuing Education, and Associate degrees.The tuition and fees at this institute correspond to the course level and not to student classification – this implies that graduate rates are applicable for an undergraduate student opting for a graduate-level course. The tuition fees at Schiller International University include the costs of personal development seminars and workshops, integrated language classes throughout a program, all materials and books, and campus-specific student activities. Deserving students can also benefit from various Schiller International University scholarships. The institute offers up to a 50% scholarship for all its master's degree programs. Some scholarships available for students include Inter-campus Transfer (ICT) Scholarship - Undergraduate and Graduate, Diplomatic Scholarship - Undergraduate and Graduate, Golden Key Honor Society Scholarship - Undergraduate and Graduate, Presidents’ Undergraduate and Graduate Scholarship, and several others. The international learning community of this institute features a network of over 20000 graduates in more than 200 cities.
Eligibility Overview: Schiller's TOEFL number is 0835. Masters students must have a TOEIC (Test of English for International Communication) score of at least 700. A Master's degree requires an IELTS (International English Language Testing System) score of at least 6.5.Students must submit proof of English competence if they are not native English speakers, did not complete their post-secondary education entirely in English, or did not complete at least 24 academic credits in an English-taught university program.1. TOEFL 89 (IBT – Internet version) for Masters, Schiller, TOEFL number 0835.2. For a Masters's, a TOEIC (Test of English for International Communication) score of 700 is required.3. A master's degree requires an IELTS (International English Language Testing System) score of at least 6.5.4. A CAMBRIDGE FCE (First Certificate in English) grade of "B" (B2 level) or better is desired, with Cambridge Advanced (CAE) or Proficiency (CPE) being preferred.5. For all programs, a score of at least 105 on the Duolingo English Exam is required.
Accommodation: On-campus accommodation The University does not provide on-campus accommodationStudents generally prefer living off-campusOff-campus accommodationThe average rent is 550 to 650 Euros/monthThe residence type includes studio apartments, 3 bedroom apartments, 4 bedroom apartments, and shared apartmentsThe apartments have a fully equipped kitchen with stove, oven, dishwasher, fridge with deep freeze, coffee machine, and an eating facility (table with 3-4 chairs)Centrally located, within walking distance to the city center and railway stationAll amenities (several supermarkets, shops, restaurants/coffee shops, bakery etc. ) within walking distance

Name: University of Mary Hardin-Baylor
Overview: The University of Mary Hardin-Baylor, or UMHB for short, was founded in 1845.  It provides master's, doctorate, and undergraduate academic facilities. The university is renowned for its music and scientific programs. 94% of the people there are full-time first-year students. SAT and ACT exams are mandatory for undergraduate courses. IELTS, TOEFL, or other English proficiency exams are mandatory for post-graduate courses.More than 90% of the students at the university get financial aid of some type to continue their education. The school also keeps the student-to-faculty ratio at 18:1 to foster a positive learning environment.The graduates of this university have distinguished careers in their disciplines. Sybil Leonard Armes (author and former university trustee), Jerrell Freeman (football linebacker), Miriam "Ma" Ferguson (the first female governor of the state and the second woman to be elected governor of any state in the nation), Buddy Groom (Major League Baseball pitcher), and Lucy Wilson Rice (Texas painter) are a few of the notable ones.

Name: Lourdes University
Overview: Lourdes University is a Catholic institution which was established in 1958 by the Sisters of St. Francis. It offers  undergraduate and graduate degrees, Lourdes is known for its diverse academic programs and personalized attention afforded to students. Lourdes, a private Catholic and Franciscan institution, in Sylvania, Ohio, in 1958. It offers professional studies education of the highest caliber. The institution's dedication to hard work has earned it respect in the fields of nursing, business, social science, and liberal arts. The 127-acre campus of the institute offers thousands of students enrolled in various disciplines a sustainable and forward-thinking environment. The college was initially established as a campus for the College of St. Teresa in Winona, Minnesota. In 1958, Lourdes Junior College was established to provide instruction for the sisters of St. Francis. In 1964, the North Central Association of Colleges and Schools' Higher Learning Commission granted the liberal arts college accreditation. Both undergraduate and graduate programmes are available through the university. To make the studies unique and notable, the experienced faculty have combined professional and artistic studies in a creative programme. Because of their comprehensive abilities and employability, industry executives choose to hire campus graduates. Thousands of Lourdes University graduates are working in various technological, business, medical, artistic, and government-supported fields, creating a sustainable world full of chances. Lourdes University is renowned for having one of the highest placement rates among the top colleges. A student who is interested in studying business, the arts, social science, environment, health and wellness, education, music, nursing, psychology, philosophy, political science, sociology, or theology, for example, can enroll in a university and learn the fundamentals and more advanced concepts in those fields. At Lourdes University, 97 percent of students get financial help in the form of institutional scholarships, grants, and/or need-based funding. Our financial aid specialists and admissions counsellors are committed to working with students to find the greatest financial aid options for their education.The amenities offered aid the students in learning and expanding their knowledge through group participation, gatherings, talks, trips to businesses, group activities, performances, and debates. The university also has units to assist students with mental and social concerns, where a counsellor talks about the problems and aids the students in finding answers.Read more details about Lourdes University on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.

Name: IGlobal University
Overview: IGlobal University (IGU), established in 2008, is a private for-profit institution located in Vienna, Virginia, USA. The university boasts a 1:8 student-to-faculty ratio, which is better than the national average of 1:11. The five recognized programs provided by IGU are MBA, Master of Science in Information Technology, BBA, Bachelor of Science in Information Technology, and English as a Second Language (ESL).IGlobal University is nationally accredited by the Accrediting Commission of Career Schools and Colleges (ACCSC) to award MBA, MSIT, BBA, and BSIT degrees on-campus and online. IGU is acknowledged by the Council of Higher Education Accreditation and the US Department of Education due to its national accreditation status (CHEA). Additionally, Immigration and Customs Enforcement have been permitted to issue Form I-20 for the admission of overseas students through the Student and Exchange Visitor Program (SEVP).IGU tuition fees for international students start at USD 10800. The university offers its students state-of-the-art facilities and services to facilitate their academic and personal development. It also provides qualified students with scholarships, financial assistance, and on-campus employment opportunities. IGU boasts 66 databases and more than 1,75,000 digital books, and students can access many journals, books, newspapers, and online learning materials. Graduating students also benefit from the university’s Career Planning Service team, which supports them in finding jobs and internships.
Eligibility Overview: To study in the United States, international applicants from non-native English-speaking countries must submit the following English-language proficiency test scores: IELTS score of 5.5TOEFL score 70 on iBT or TOEFL iBT home editionPTE score of 50iTEP score of 3.7 WAEC score of C6Duolingo English Test (DET)score of 90 or higher.

Name: Kansas State University
Overview: Established in 1863, Kansas State University is a  public research university for higher learning in Kansas, Manhattan. It was the first public college in the province of Kansas. The university offers bachelors in 100 fields, masters in 75 and 45 doctoral degree courses with various other graduate & undergraduate certificates in their Nine colleges and a Graduate school. Some of the top programs at KSU are Agriculture, Agriculture Operations, Education, Marketing, Biological & Biomedical Sciences, Engineering, Human Ecology and Technology & Aviation. KSU is the first university in Kansas State to have an exclusive collection of indigenous knowledge, top-notch infrastructure, and a bilateral learning atmosphere. The Main Campus of KSU is located in Manhattan, spread across 2,320 acres and a Branch campus in Salina and Olathe. KSU Polytechnic Campus in Salina is well known for Aviation and Technology. The Olathe Innovation Campus aims to graduate research in plant science, bioenergy, food safety & security and animal health. In addition, it has an on-campus horticulture display garden, a vast education hub and a learning research center. The Student-Faculty ratio at KSU is 18:1. The average tuition fee at Kansas State University is about USD 10,320/year for in-state tuition, excluding extra expenditure. The university is also at the forefront of providing financial support to students in the form of scholarships, financial aids, or grants. Currently about more than 2000 International students are enrolled with Kansas State University. Students have various career options at Kansas to explore, like on and off-campus training, internships, in-house placements, and research opportunities. Kansas State University also provides on and off-campus residence facilities. Manhattan Campus has ten residence halls with all required housing and dining services. Despite offering expertise in interdisciplinary fields, Kansas State University is focusing on the transformational development of the student.

Name: State University of New York, Geneseo (SUNY Geneseo)
Overview: The SUNY Geneseo was formed in 1948 as a liberal arts college. It is a part of the State University of New York, the most extensive education system in the U.S. With an affiliation of the Space-grant, the college has received its accreditation from the Middle States Commission on Higher Education. It was initially formed as Geneseo Normal School before becoming a part of SUNY. At present, SUNY Geneseo is serving more than 4,900 students worldwide. It offers about 50 undergraduate degree programs and nearly 26 minors in graduate programs. Some of the popular areas include Applied mathematics and science, Fine Arts, Business administration, Women and Gender studies, etc. Located in Geneseo, New York, the college ensures that students can avail themselves of the facilities of heating plant, garage and parking lot, cleaning staffs, electrical and plumbing services, and several others. The university's success is evident from SUNY Geneseo ranking, which is currently at the third position for "Top Public Schools" in the North by the U.S. News & World Report's Best Colleges list. The acceptance rate of 61% makes the university moderately selective of the new applicants and enrollments. The student-faculty ratio followed in the classes is about 18:1, making an effort towards smaller class sizes. The currency student retention rate has increased to 85%, thereby showing a general satisfaction among the students. The fees structure set here is affordable for most, currently ranging from $15,000-$19,000. The university aims at the development of placement for the students following their graduation. The two types of placement schemes followed here include Out-of-Area Placements and international placements. Students applying in these have the opportunity to get hired within months of their graduation.
Eligibility Overview: SUNY Geneseo requires you to have a 3.61 GPA and be above average in your high school class. At the very least, you'll need a mix of A's and B's, with more A's than B's. You can make up for a low GPA by taking more difficult classes, such as AP or IB.This demonstrates that you can handle more challenging academics than the ordinary high school student. If you're a junior or senior, changing your GPA in time for college applications is difficult. You'll need a better SAT or ACT score to compensate if your GPA is at or below the school average of 3.61. This will enable you to compete effectively against applicants with better GPAs.
Accommodation: All exchange students are highly encouraged to live in university-run residence halls for a full-immersion, American college experience. First-year and second-year exchange students are obliged to live on campus in university-operated residential halls at SUNY Geneseo, according to the SUNY Geneseo Residency Requirement. The SUNY Geneseo International Student and Scholar Services Office, in collaboration with Residence Life, arranges on-campus housing. Off-campus housing is available to students in their third year or later. For more information, see the "Off-Campus Accommodation" section below.for more information click on this link-https://www.geneseo.edu/incoming-exchange-students/accommodation

Name: Suffolk University
Overview: Established in 1906, Suffolk University is a private research university located in Boston, Massachusetts. It was founded as a law school and became a university in the 1930s, offering bachelor's, master's, and doctoral programs. It now holds accreditation by the New England Commission of Higher Education American Bar Association and others. The university has its main campus in Beacon Hills surrounded by nine buildings and is named one of the Princeton Review's best business schools. In addition, it is ranked 31 in the Regional Universities North by the U.S. News and World Report. Suffolk University has 900+ courses and 70 academic courses and is managed by 356 full-time and 284 faculty members. The various schools and colleges of Suffolk university include the Sawyer Business School, Suffolk college of Art and Science, Suffolk University Law school, and has a Madrid campus for study abroad programs along with continuing education courses in fields like art and design, psychology, data science, and others. It is also a member of NCAA Division III, having 19 NCAA Division III teams. The university is home to more than 9,000 undergraduate and graduate students. Apart from the courses and degrees offered, Suffolk university is actively engaged in research. Some of the research centers include the Center for Entrepreneurship, Center for Executive Education, Poetry Center, Sagan Energy Research laboratory, and many more. In addition, more than 60% of the freshman and 25% of the undergraduate students can find residential facilities in its four co-ed halls, namely Smith hall, Nathan R. Miller Hall, 10 West hall, and Modern Theatre Hall.The average cost of attendance for an off-campus undergraduate full-time student in the Boston campus is approximately USD 66,201, and the same for a resident student is USD 63,138.

Name: Frostburg State University
Overview: Frostburg State University is a public university located in Maryland, United States. The university was founded in 1898 as the Frostburg State Normal School 2, with State Senator John Leake being the driving force behind its establishment. Since then, it has become a residential university with three different colleges; College of Business, College of Liberal Arts and Sciences and College of Education. The university offers 47 undergraduate and 16 graduate degrees, apart from multiple specialized study programs and doctoral studies—Maryland, covering an area of 280 acres. The top courses at Frostburg State University include MS in Applied Computer Science, BS in Mechanical Engineering and BS in Engineering. The university's main campus is located in the rural setting of Frostburg. The campus provides students with residential facilities, access to high-speed internet, free laundry and campus parking facilities, and other utilities. The average annual costs of studying at the university come to around USD 25,000, including tuition and other expenses. Several student clubs and organizations allow students to participate in co-curricular activities, helping them enjoy a well-rounded experience during their stay. The university offers an Adventure Sports concentration in collaboration with Garrett College for students looking for professional certification. Notable alums from Frostburg State University include astronaut Richard Arnold, politician John N. Bambacus and actress Debra Monk.

Name: University of Oklahoma
Overview: The University of Oklahoma, located in Norman, Oklahoma, is one of the top prestigious public research institutions in the United States. Founded in 1890, the University of Oklahoma is internationally acclaimed and classified among R1: Doctoral Universities. As it is popularly known, OU is home to over 20,000 undergraduate students pursuing their majors in over 170 fields. The most in-demand courses at the University of Oklahoma include Marketing and Related Support Services, Business, Management, Journalism, Atmospheric Sciences, Liberal Arts and Sciences, and Engineering. Appointing over 3000 faculty staff, the University of Oklahoma offers 160 master's programs, 152 baccalaureate programs, 20 majors at professional levels, and 75 doctorate programs. The University of Oklahoma is internationally recognized for its Oklahoma-Tulsa Schusterman Centre, which offers health sciences-based specialist programs on its Tulsa campus. At the Norman campus, students are rewarded with great career opportunities, including full-time and part-time internships. The placements at OU are incredible, as some top hiring firms include names like Amazon, AT&T, The Boeing Company, Goldman Sachs, etc. The average tuition fee at the University of Oklahoma is CAD 21K. Besides, the university offers ample scholarship opportunities to international students.
