Name: The University of Akron
Overview: The University of Akron was established in 1870. The main campus of The University of Akron is located in Akron. Over 200 undergraduate majors, minors, and certificates are offered. The university offers the following degrees: MA Master of Arts, MSA MS in Accountancy, MT Master of Taxation, AUD Doctor of Audiology, MAP Master of Applied Politics, and Certificate Program.The university offers student employment in UA offices and departments on campus. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. Federal work study positions are included in this.The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. The estimated average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenditure for an international student, is around Rs. 2331252. Each year, the university provides more than $250 million scholarships, including the new Presidential Scholarship. An exclusive award for out-of-state students, the Akron Advantage Award is renewable as long as the student maintains a strong GPA. The scholarship would lower the tuition from $15,500 to $12,500. A Presidential Scholarship of between $1,000 and $7,500 each year will also be given to you.Read more details about The University of Akron on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.

Placement: Internships The Career Advantage Network (CAN) provides students at The University of Akron with opportunities to get meaningful work experience through a variety of experiential learning programmes. Employers that declare that they are looking for students with career-related experiences in their field of study benefit from the programme, as do students who receive firsthand knowledge of their prospective occupations.  When working on a cooperative education/internship field assignment that has been approved and following the rules and regulations of the cooperative education programmes, participating students are considered full-time students at The University of Akron. Internships are usually one-time only tasks for which an academic department awards academic credit, and they are sometimes unpaid. Students can develop these experiences in consultation with the Center for Career Management and the internship coordinators in their particular departments. Internships are usually accepted as elective credits toward graduation. In some departments, an internship is a prerequisite for graduation.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation At UA, living on campus is easy, pleasant, and full of facilities. Students here will form memories which will remain for a lifetime. Living in a residence hall on campus is an integral part of many people's college experience. Finding the correct housing match can lead to once-in-a-lifetime connections and activities. Only a tiny percentage of UA's student body resides on campus, offering our resident students a flavour of small-college life. The university wants you to feel at ease in your accommodation. Thus, each one is designed and furnished with that in mind. Co-ed residential halls, double rooms, suites, and high rises are also available. There are even apartments on site. Although they cannot guarantee students their first choice of room location, they will do everything possible to locate the most excellent housing match available. Life on-campus provides certain facilities for students, which are: smoke-free FacilitiesEach residence hall is looked after 24*7. To gain access to the building, residents will scan their Zip CardThe use of air conditioning (early May through early October)Internet access (both hardwired and wireless)Laundry services are available at no additional costMachines that sell thingsAnywhere on campus is within a 15-minute walk  Housing halls are located in three quads. They are as follows: North Quad Bulger Hall Each floor of this 16-story building includes 21 pupils. The suite-style double rooms share a communal living space and bathrooms. Single rooms are also available. Honors Complex This six-story structure houses the Honors College offices, classes, and conference rooms. It houses 300 honours students in suite-style accommodations with private and shared bathrooms. Orr Hall This three-story structure accommodates 120 students in double rooms with shared bathrooms. Ritchie Hall The Ritchie Emerging Leaders are housed in separate rooms with shared bathrooms. The Residence Life and Housing offices are housed in this three-story structure. Sisler-McFawn Hall This structure is three stories tall. Single rooms with shared toilets are available for up to 64 Emerging Leaders. Spanton Hall This 10-story building with 200 residents is next to Rob's Café. Choose from double rooms with shared living space or suite-style double rooms (both with common bathrooms). South Quad Exchange Street It's similar to living off-campus, but with all of the advantages. Participation in the meal plan is only available in the apartments. Shared single rooms and four-person apartment units are available to up to 475 students. Summer lodging is also available in this hall. South Hall The 530 members of this community share single and double-occupancy suite-style bedrooms. This six-story structure houses several speciality housing groups. East Quad Spicer Hall More than 450 students are housed in shared single and double occupancy suite-style bedrooms in this five-story facility. This structure houses several specialist housing communities. Summer Housing Summer lodging in the Exchange Street Residence Hall will be charged a fee. Students will have their apartments. For more information, visit: https://www.uakron.edu/reslife/halls/all-halls.dot  For general enquiries, visit:  https://www.uakron.edu/reslife/

Eligibility Overview: Admissions to Lebanon Valley College for International UndergraduatesUndergraduate applicants from outside the United States may apply using either the Common Application or the LVC Application (mentioned in the Highlights table above).The following items will be required of applicants:Academic records from high school and secondary school.Certificate of completion of secondary school.The outcome of the examination.3.0 GPA or a B average is required.At least $43,893 in financial statementsWith all of these documents, candidates will fill out a Certification of Financial Support form as proof of sufficient means to attend the LVC.Along with the signed enrollment form, applicants must provide a $500 non-refundable enrollment deposit fee. Admissions to Lebanon Valley College for International GraduatesApplicants who are graduate studentsOfficial evaluations should be sent to the LVC immediately.In their personal statement, applicants should explain how an MBA from LVC will benefit them, as well as their contribution to the programmes.Financial statements are needed to demonstrate that the applicant has sufficient funds to cover tuition, fees, housing, and living expenses in the United States.Admission and visa applications both demand proof of financial support.MBA courses at LVC are evening classes that meet one night a week for extra work outside of the classroom.Following the submission of the application, the office will contact the applicant with additional questions to determine if on-campus housing is required.To assist the office in satisfying housing requirements as quickly as possible, applicants should include their arrival date and accommodation needs on the Commitment to Attend form.
Placement: Placement at Lebanon Valley CollegeThe college includes a career development department that helps students find suitable jobs in the United States. The centre offers training on resume and cover letter writing, as well as feedback on interviews and instruction on how to create online portfolios.The centre also assists students in navigating and searching for suitable employment opportunities.Lebanon Valley College had a placement rate of 95.63 percent in 2020. It was placed 5th in the United States among all colleges and universities. Salary after ten years for Lebanon Valley College students is 45,600 USD, according to data collected for the 2021 US Rankings.

Placement: Career and Internships Maths Teaching and computer-related occupations are two of the most popular possibilities for math majors. A major in mathematics also gives a very plausible entry into academic and actuarial professions, as well as several roles in industry, the computer field, and government service, with a significant shortage of mathematicians in academia and industry looming shortly. Computer Science The MIS and Web Development programmes prepare students for jobs in small businesses, non-profit organisations, industry, and government agencies, to mention a few. Students will be able to progress quickly from entry-level positions to more rewarding tasks in information, systems management, web development, and problem-solving through our programme.Web developers, computer network architects and information security analysts are predicted to grow by 22% between 2010 and 2020.Because organisations are enhancing their IT systems and shifting to newer, faster, and more mobile networks, employment for computer and information systems administrators is predicted to grow 18 per cent between 2010 and 2020. Physics Physics is an essential aspect of preparing for a variety of jobs. While physics is required for other scientific fields such as biology, chemistry, engineering, and medicine, physicists have also worked as consultants for businesses, governments, entrepreneurs, secondary school teachers, lawyers, and video game creators, to mention a few. In essence, physics training creates a skill set applicable to the most accessible professional pathways.

Name: University of Georgia
Overview: Established in 1801, the University of Georgia is located in Athens and is spread over 762 acres, and has 465 buildings. The university has 18 schools and colleges enrolling more than 38,000 students every year. The institution is recognized for its impeccable student excellence with the best learning experiences, including research and leadership opportunities. The University of Georgia offers plenty of programs in agriculture, environment, arts, sciences, business, ecology, education, engineering, design, forestry, natural resources, journalism, mass communication, law, pharmacy, health, social work, and medicine. The University of Georgia has five campuses in Georgia, Washington, D.C., England, and Italy. The well-known majors are corporate finance, psychology, biological science, marketing management, and international relations and affairs. The oldest campus is the north campus, located in the city of Athens. The south campus houses a few science and mathematics departments, athletic facilities, College of Pharmacy, College of Veterinary Medicines, and College of Engineering. The central campus is the place where all the student activities take place, all year. The health science campus houses the College of Public Health, AU/UGA medical relationship, and other health-related programs. The top courses offered by the university are MBA, MSc in computer science, artificial intelligence, statistics, and masters in public health. The University offers on-campus housing facilities spread across 27 residencies providing furnished accommodation with all available basic facilities. The annual fee of the courses offered at the university ranges from USD 27,000 to 31,120. The cost of living is around USD 15,000, including room, transport, and meals. The institution offers a wide range of scholarships for international students in academics and need-based. It also has career centers for students to help them in counseling, job opportunities, and workshops for recruiting placements.
Eligibility Overview: INTERNATIONAL ADMISSION REQUIREMENTSApplicants must submit the following documents to be considered for admission to a Georgia College undergraduate programme:Successful completion of the foreign equivalent of a U.S. college-preparatory high school curriculum for incoming first-year students.- For overseas applicants who graduated from a high school in the United States or who live within the educational jurisdiction of the United States: The accomplishment of the prerequisites for the College Preparatory Curriculum.A minimum 2.5 grade point average is required for transfer applicants with 30 or more semester credit hours achieved (out of a 4.0 grading scale).- The International Education Center at Georgia College examines submitted educational documents and converts previously completed coursework to US grade equivalents.If you don't have any university transfer credit, you'll need to submit your SAT or ACT scores. Transfer students who have completed less than 30 credit hours of undergraduate study are also eligible.English language proficiency:               -Official TOEFL score report with a minimum score of 69 on the Internet-based test or 523 on the paper-based test                   for English language competence.               -An official IELTS score record with a minimum of 6.0 is required.               -With a minimum Reading + Writing score of 480 on the official SAT score report Official ACT score report with at                      least a 17 in English.Sufficient financial assistance, as stated on the applicant's financial declaration.Continued enrollment in a current or former educational institution (i.e. not on academic exclusion, suspension or dismissal).

The different PG Engineering & Technology specialisations are ranked by US News & World Report for 2021 as follows: computer engineering is ranked at #86, biomedical engineering is ranked at #93, electrical engineering is ranked at #106, etc. The THE has also placed Georgia University's PG Computers courses between 401 and 500 for the year 2021.
University Ranking: The University of Georgia is in the top 100 universities in the USA, but it just barely makes it into the top 500 worldwide. US News & World Report's rankings for 2021 place the University of Georgia at number 47 overall, a drop of three points from the rankings for 2020. However, according to US News & World Report's rankings, University of Georgia is ranked #310 globally, an increase of 20 places from the rankings for 2020. Thus, the ranking graph shows a decreasing movement. Rankings published by US News & World Report rely mainly on admissions to the University of Georgia during the preceding year (2020 in this case). Less than 25% of applicants had ACT or SAT scores above average, while the University of Georgia had a 48% acceptance rate.Georgia University is now ranked between positions 401 and 500 by THE, however this range hasn't changed in three years. The University of Georgia receives the greatest marks for citations and global outlook according to THE ranking criteria (53.2 and 47, respectively). According to QS rankings, University of Georgia is ranked between 501 and 550 for 2021, up one spot from the previous year, 2020. With 36 citations, a 28.8 employer reputation score, a 21.1 academic reputation score, and no overall score because Georgia University is ranked in the higher range of 501-550, QS rates Georgia University generally averagely in major ranking criteria.

Name: University of Denver

The campus of this university is located between the Great Plains and the Rocky Mountains in Denver, Colorado.Denver University is ranked 4th for Best Abroad Study for International Students by Open Doors, and it offers 300 courses for both undergraduate and graduate students through its ten schools and colleges. Name: Northeastern University

The university has six campuses: London (UK), San Francisco, Portland, Seattle, Vancouver, and Toronto. The university offers courses in various fields like Business, Marketing, Management, Engineering, etc. Some of their courses, like MSc in Computer Science and MBA, are ranked among the best in the world.Northeastern students follow the philosophy of value Cooperative Education (co-op for short) that sets them apart and places them as key differentiators in their academic experience.NU prepares its students to be culturally agile in today's increasingly global business world. It ensures that each gets the right student sort of exposure to develop deep insights. The university is buzzing with an entrepreneurial spirit. The Princeton Review even named NU the #6 Undergraduate Program for Entrepreneurship, making it the best platform to kickstart your career in entrepreneurship.

Name: Harding University
Overview: Harding University is a private, residential coeducational liberal arts university. Apart from the main campus at Searcy, Arks, the college has three remote campuses - Harding University in Rogers Ark, Harding School of Theology in Memphis, and Harding Academy in Searcy, Ark. The university has international campuses across seven countries. Harding University offers ten undergraduate degrees in more than 100 academic majors. In addition, it provides 14 pre-professional programs and more than 50 graduate and professional programs. Other degrees it offers are Master's, specialist and doctoral degrees, graduate certificates and endorsements. The broad study areas are Art & Design; Bible & MInistry; Biology; Business; Broadcast Journalism; Chemistry & Biochemistry; Communication; CSD; Computer Science; Criminal Justice; Education; Engineering & Physics; English; Exercises & Sports Sciences; Fashion & Merchandising; Foreign Language; Mathematics; Music; Interior Design among others. The university uses a standard of 27 USD per credit hour and calculates the course and other program-related costs on that basis. The university awards 22 Million USD every year in institutional scholarships. More than 350 recruiters representing 230 organisations meet the students. The university provides on-campus residence facilities. The women's and men's halls are separate. It has seven halls for women's accommodation and six halls for men's accommodation. For a typical resident student, the regular expenses of tuition, required fees, and room and food services for 30,000 USD for the school year. The university's goals include the development of Christian Scholarship, the promotion of Christian ethics, and citizenship from a global perspective, among others.

This university comprises 5 colleges and schools providing top-notch education in arts and sciences, fine arts, business and technology, fine arts, education communications etc. Besides, this institution provides 50 graduate, undergraduate and certificate programs. The online courses by this university are of the similar standard that is taught on the campus. The academic facilities are offered under the supervision of highly skilled professionals. Presently, Webster University is home to approximately 12,000 students and is dedicated to providing top-notch learning experiences. The most popular major courses offered at this university include Visual and Performing Arts, Communication, Business, Marketing, Journalism, Communication technologies etc. The students are provided with an online platform to deliver online programs through WebNet+. There are few scholarship programs for international students in the undergraduate programs. Also, this university offers study loans and scholarships to international students to pursue their education in the US. The alumni association of this university is active and assists students in finding internships and jobs. Also, the career centre service helps students in mock interviews, advising, workshops and more. As per U.S. News & World Report, Webster University is in the list for the Best College of Veterans and positioned in 15th place in the current year.
Eligibility Overview: The Admission Committee reviews each application individually in order to evaluate demonstrated academic ability. During this review the University looks for evidence of potential academic success at Webster. Particular emphasis is given to the applicant's grades in academic courses, achievement on standardized tests, and class rank, when available. The essay, the recommendation(s), and school/community achievements are also important considerations in the University's decision-making process.Applicants most likely to be admitted will have a cumulative grade point average of at least a 3.0 on a 4.0 scale, a minimum ACT composite score of 21 or an SAT score of 1000 (Evidence Based Reading and Math combined), and a class rank in the top 50 percent of their high school class, if applicable.Within the first term of enrollment at Webster, each applicant to the freshman class is required to submit a final high school transcript and/or external examination certifying the date of graduation within the first term of enrollment at Webster. Students who fail to do so will not be permitted to register for subsequent terms.Test Score Requirements

Name: University of North Texas
Overview: Located in Delton, Texas, the University of North Texas is a public research institution established in 1890. The university is ranked 249 in the National University Ranking and 658 in the Global Universities by the US News and World Report. It offers 109 bachelor's programs, 94 master's programs, and 36 doctoral degree programs in its 14 schools and colleges.A minimum of 6.0 in IELTS and 79 in TOEFL is mandatory for admission.  The approximate cost of attendance (COA) for an in-state on-campus undergraduate residing student attending 15 hours per semester is $25,680, while for an out-state student is $38,370. For an in-state on-campus graduate residing student attending 9 hours per semester, the COA is $22,568 and for an out-state student is $30,164.Offering $49 million annually as scholarships and employing more than 5,000 students annually, the campus also focuses on sustainability and enables 50 courses to focus.The University of North Texas (UNT) has global partnership programs and receives faculties and visiting scholars from more than 50 countries for global outreach.

Placement: Numerous student services are offered by UNT, such as academic and career counselling, employment assistance for students, and placement assistance for graduates. With an average salary of around USD 120,000 per year, financial services professionals are the top compensated North Texas University alums.Companies that collaborate extensively with the UNT Career Center in an advising capacity and donate money to support its activities and services are known as Employer Partners. Some employer partners are Albertsons Companies, Cintas Corporation, Enterprise Holidays, GM Financial, HCL Technologies, NTT Data, Schneider, Service King Collison Repair, Westin Irving Convention Center etc.
Accommodation: Spread across 900 acres, the campus life at UNT offers 15 residence halls for more than 5,500 students living an on-campus life. There is Bruce Hall, Clark Hall, Crumley Hall, Maple Hall, and Rawlins Hall for freshman students. There is Honors Hall and the Santa Fe Square hall for upperclassmen students. The university offers more than 300 student organizations, more than 1,000 annual performances, and an exclusive Outdoor Pursuit Center for active engagement.  On-Campus Accommodation An essential component of the UNT educational process is the on-campus living experience provided by UNT Housing and Residence Life. The live-in housing ambassadors are staff members whose residence hall rooms serve as models for other residents. They are eager to show you around so you can truly understand what it's like to live on campus. The university provides residence halls for students to feel comfortable and at home. The following are some residence halls: Bruce Hall The university living hall with the best location is Bruce Hall, situated at the intersection of Chestnut Street and Avenue C. The Bruclelings community, a freshman living hall that houses students from many fields, has a long history of artistic expression. The oldest residence hall still in service for housing students on campus was built in 1946 and is named Bruce. For more information, visit: https://housing.unt.edu/residence_halls/bruce_hall  Clark Hall One of UNT's freshman residential halls, Clark, is situated on the corner of Maple Street and Avenue C. It offers primarily double rooms with a small number of triple spaces. The Engineering Living Learning Community resides at Clark Hall.Clark is a well-liked neighbourhood for locals to interact and hang out because of the nearby Clark Park. For more information, visit: https://housing.unt.edu/residence_halls/clark_hall  Crumley Hall Crumley Hall, one of UNT's residence halls, is situated at the intersection of Highland Street and Avenue C. It will predominantly house first-year students in 2022–2023 and host the Latin Dreams housing cohort.Crumley has a tight-knit community because of its small size. Crumley is particularly alluring due to its proximity to the Onstead Promenade and Willis Library, which make up the centre of campus. For more information, visit: https://housing.unt.edu/residence_halls/crumley_hall  Honors Hall Upperclassmen members of the UNT Honors College reside at Honors Hall, which is situated at the intersection of Eagle Drive and Avenue C on the southern edge of campus. Students admitted to the UNT Honors College can stay in private single-occupancy rooms through Honors. Private single occupancy rooms offer a private bedroom area for each occupant in addition to a communal living area and bathroom.Honors Hall was built with the academically-focused student in mind, with most of its residents being members of the UNT Honors College. Numerous study rooms, intimate conference spaces, two music practice rooms, activity spaces, and lounges are available in Honors. For more information, visit: https://housing.unt.edu/residence_halls/honors_hall  Joe Greene Hall Joe Greene Hall, a 500-bed residence hall with double occupancy rooms for the majority of its occupants, who are freshmen, is situated on the southeast corner of campus at the intersection of Eagle Drive and Avenue A. For more information, visit: https://housing.unt.edu/residence_halls/joe-greene-hall  Kerr Hall On Maple Street lies Kerr Hall, which primarily accommodates first-year students. With more than 900 residents, Kerr is the largest residence hall at UNT.In Kerr, three living-learning communities offer the chance to live in specialised groups that share majors or mutual interests. These communities primarily have double occupancy rooms with a small number of triples.Kerr Hall, a central location on campus, is a lively, buzzing place where people study in groups or socialise in the lobby. For more information, visit: https://housing.unt.edu/residence_halls/kerr_hall  Legends Hall Legends Hall is situated across from the Pohl Recreation Center at North Texas Boulevard and Sycamore Street intersection.Legends residents can live in single occupancy rooms or private single occupancy rooms with suite kitchens. This option is only available to upperclassmen residents. For more information, visit: https://housing.unt.edu/residence_halls/legends_hall  Maple Hall One of UNT's residence halls for predominantly first-year students is Maple, which is situated at the intersection of Maple Street and Avenue C.Mostly double occupancy and occasionally triple occupancy rooms are available at Maple.Near the back of Maple Hall lies Mean Greens Café, the only vegan restaurant on campus. For anyone looking to eat a balanced diet that provides various health benefits, including vegans, Mean Greens offers an all-vegan cuisine. For more information, visit: https://housing.unt.edu/residence_halls/maple_hall  Mozart Square At the juncture of Eagle Drive and North Texas Boulevard, right outside the University of North Texas' main entrance, sits Mozart Square. Residents of Mozart Square can choose private single occupancy for upper-level students or a double room for newcomers.Women's soccer and men's and women's basketball for UNT are played at Mozart. For enhanced comfort, each room has individual settings for heating and cooling. For more information, visit: https://housing.unt.edu/residence_halls/mozart_square  Rawlins Hall On the southern end of campus, across from the Gateway centre, Rawlins Hall may be found near the intersection of Maple Drive and Avenue D. For first-year students in the UNT Honors College and the UNT SERVES Living Learning Community, Rawlins only provides double-occupancy rooms. The potential for a classic first-year residence hall experience is offered by the double-occupancy rooms with suite-style bathrooms.With an abundance of study rooms, intimate meeting spaces, music practice rooms, activity spaces, and lounges for residents to use throughout the building, Rawlins Hall is built with the academically-focused student in mind. Residents of Rawlins Hall benefit from a studious atmosphere thanks to its proximity to the Honors College. For more information, visit: https://housing.unt.edu/residence_halls/rawlins_hall  Santa Fe Square Santa Fe Square, built with a Southwestern aesthetic in mind, is located on the west side of campus on W. Prairie Avenue. The two distinct structures are referred to as "SFT" and are next to Traditions Hall. For more information, visit: https://housing.unt.edu/residence_halls/santa_fe_square  Traditions Hall Traditions Hall is at the juncture of North Texas Boulevard and West Prairie Street. Traditions Hall contains single, mainly occupancy rooms with a small number of double-occupancy rooms, and it will only be open to upperclassmen residents starting in the autumn of 2019. The two distinct halls are jointly referred to as "SFT" and are situated next to Santa Fe Square. For more information, visit: https://housing.unt.edu/residence_halls/traditions_hall  Victory Hall On South Bonnie Brae, across from Apogee Stadium and the main campus of UNT, Victory Hall is situated. Victory offers a combination of single occupancy rooms for upper-level students and double occupancy rooms for newcomers. A few of the UNT varsity sports teams also call Victory home.Champs Café, Apogee Stadium, the Athletic Center, and Mean Green Village, including the Athletic Academic Center, the Mean Green softball field, and the Warranch Tennis Complex, all share space with Victory. For more information, visit: https://housing.unt.edu/residence_halls/victory_hall  West Hall Most first-year students are in the north and south towers of West Hall, which is situated at the intersection of North Texas Boulevard and Chestnut Street. West inhabitants are recognised for having an abundance of hall pride.Offering double and triple rooms, tenants at West enjoy large living spaces with lofted beds. The big lobby with a pool table, ping pong and TV is a favourite hangout. West Hall also features an on-site eating hall. For more information, visit: https://housing.unt.edu/residence_halls/west_hall  For general enquiries, visit: https://housing.unt.edu/

Name: Binghamton University
Overview: Binghamton University, also known as the State University of New York in Binghamton, is a public research university located in the state of New York. Founded in 1946 as the Triple Cities College, it was renamed in 1965 and joined the State University of New York system. The university is made up of seven different colleges, offering over 130 undergraduate programs along with 80 graduate programs across its various campuses. The best programs in Binghamton University include MA in Economics, MS in Geological Sciences and Ph.D in various fields of Psychology. The main campus of the university is located in Binghamton. Spread over 930 acres, the campus is uniquely shaped like a brain above the Susquehanna River. Additionally, the university also has a Health Sciences Campus in Johnson City and the Downtown Center Campus. The university also has three libraries; Glenn G. Bartle Library (arts and humanities), Science Library (engineering and sciences) and University Downtown Center Library (public administration). Other facilities on campus include the Center of Excellence, a research facility which has helped the university establish itself as a campus for very high research activity. The fee structure varies depending on the program chosen, with average annual costs estimated at USD 29,000. The university has over 400 clubs, fraternities, sororities and student organizations that encourage students to participate in various activities in the university. The Binghamton Bearcats represent the university at various college sports, giving students the chance to participate and grow in a holistic manner during their education. The residential complexes surrounding the campus provide a great opportunity for students to mingle and interact with the diverse community. Notable alumni from the Binghamton University include Bob Swan, former CEO of Intel, molecular biologist Arnold J. Levine and Steven Fulop, mayor of New Jersey.
Eligibility Overview: To apply for various undergraduate programmes, the university establishes precise basic eligibility requirements. Applicants must provide a set of undergraduate transcripts as follows:A bachelor's degree from a college or institution that is nationally or regionally accredited.Within one year of graduating from a nationally or regionally accredited college or university with a bachelor's degree.Binghamton University and the applicant's existing university have signed a Memorandum of Understanding.In addition to the following, applicants must have achieved specified grades throughout their undergraduate studies, such as:Over the length of your undergraduate studies, you must have a 3.0 GPA.A 3.0 GPA in the final 60 semester credits or 90 quarter credits of the degree is required.A graduate degree with a 3.0 GPA is usually graded on a regular basis.All international or non-native students applying to any programme at Binghamton University must submit test scores from one of the following examinations to demonstrate their English language competency. Binghamton University accepts TOEFL, IELTS, PTE Academic, and Duolingo English Test scores as proof of English competence.

Name: Columbia University
Overview: Columbia University is a private research university established in 1754 and located in Manhattan, New York, USA. The institute hosts three undergraduate schools across a vast area of nearly 40 acres. Apart from the main campus, the institute has two other campuses outside of Manhattan that offer various courses and programs.The university has an acceptance rate of only 5%. Some popular programs at Columbia University are B.E, B.Tech, MBA, M.A, B.Sc, LLB, etc. Columbia University is an Ivy League School and one of the country's top private research universities. The institute offers over eighty courses and bachelor's, PG, certification, diploma, and Ph.D. programs. The programs feature special research options and summer research jobs, among other great facilities. The university also has a record-breaking 100% placement for all its students within three months of graduation. The university houses some of the world's best writers, artists, scientists, and scholars. More than 90% of the students stay at the on-campus accommodation available at 20 residence halls, and the living expenses would be around 11,000 USD per year for housing and meals. The average tuition fee at the university is around 61,000 USD per annum, and the institution offers several grants even at the entry level, has on-campus accommodation, and has top faculty for students to hone their skills.
Eligibility Overview: Since Columbia University has a very low acceptance rate, you should aim for a 75th percentile, with 1560 SAT or a 35 ACT, to have the highest chance of getting in. A GPA of at least 4.12 is also required.

The college has a placement rate of 95% right after graduation, and the percentage is believed to increase to 100 within three months of graduation. The university also offers many programs to the students to make them industry ready and help them with career guidance and advising. The average base salary for Columbia graduates is 107,373 USD, with the highest being 500,000 USD and the lowest being 90,000 USD per annum.
Accommodation: Columbia University offers on-campus accommodation to its students. 92% of the students at Columbia opt for on-campus residence. The residence halls are 20 minutes from the main campus. But, one has to understand before deciding that while the accommodations have all the facilities, New York and Columbia are very expensive in terms of cost of living. It costs around 14,500 USD for first-year students per annum and 15,300 USD for other students, which includes housing, meals, and other living expenses.
Course Ranking: Three recognised undergraduate colleges of Columbia University—Columbia College (CC), Fu Foundation School of Engineering and Applied Science (FFEAS), and The School of General Studies (GS)—offer a variety of course options for students. A few graduate schools that fall under the university are the Graduate School of Arts and Sciences, Graduate School of Architecture, Planning and Preservation, Columbia Business School, and Columbia Law School.The university is one of the top five universities to study for a Finance MBA, as seen in the table, according to US News & World Report's rating of universities' course offerings. The university has been listed in the top 10 for the past six years, from 2016 to 2021, by the Graduate Business School ranking by US News & World Report, the Global MBA ranking by QS Subject Ranking, the Global MBA ranking by Financial Times, and the Best Business School ranking by Bloomberg. The university has been listed in the top 20 for accounting and finance by QS Subject Ranking, MBA business analytics by US News & World Report, and PG business and economics by Times Higher Education (THE).Candidates interested in studying an MBA in entrepreneurship may wish to think about CU since it has been ranked 24 (2021) by US News & World Report for this particular programme. Candidates should be aware that the major rating groups supplied have various ranking standards, but they nonetheless offer a comprehensive view of the calibre of the university's courses. The institution has once again shown its mettle in taking engineering courses. For various subjects, the university typically ranks in the top 20 universities.While the university's engineering and technology programmes were ranked 51 by QS Subject Ranking for 2020 and 29 by Times Higher Education for 2021. US News & World Report ranked the university at number nine for its Biomedical Engineering programme, and all other programmes, such as Chemical Engineering, Civil Engineering, and Mechanical Engineering, have received extraordinarily high rankings, as seen in the chart below. The university, a centre for computer education, received rankings of 14 and 16 from US News & World Report for its PG and UG Computer Engineering programmes, respectively.
University Ranking: The esteemed Ivy League of Universities includes the 1754-founded Columbia University. The oldest university in New York City and one of the oldest in the country is Columbia University, which was established before the Declaration of Independence.In terms of US rankings, US News & World Report gives the highest weight to the university's reputation, and global and regional research has Columbia University placed third for the past four years (2018-2021). The university has been ranked among the top 10 over the past five years by the Shanghai Academic Ranking of World Universities, which factors in research output (40%) and quality of faculty (40%) as well as the quality of instruction (10%). Check out the 2021 Columbia University Admissions page.For the past five years, Columbia University has been ranked in the top 20 by international ranking experts, QS University Rankings, and Times Higher Education (THE) (2017-2021). When ranking universities on a global scale, Times Higher Education (THE) gives equal weight to teaching, research, and citations at 30% each, whereas QS University Rankings prioritise academic reputation (40%) and employer reputation (30%).

Name: University of Rochester
Overview: University of Rochester is a private research university located in the state of New York. Founded in 1850 in Rochester, the university has established itself as a pioneer in various fields of arts and sciences. The university conducts over 200 academic programs, including undergraduate, graduate and doctoral studies. The College of Arts, Sciences and Engineering as well as the Eastman School of Music are amongst the highest ranked institutions on campus. The best courses at University of Rochester include Bachelor of Music, MS in Biomedical Engineering and MS in Optics. The university has 6 campuses located in Rochester. The 200 acre River Campus is the main campus located by the Genesee River. The University of Rochester Medical Center, an exclusive medical campus is located next to the River Campus. The Eastman School of Music has its own campus located in Downtown Rochester. Other campuses include the South Campus, Mount Hope Campus and Prince Street Campus. The university has state of the art facilities to promote research amongst its students in various academic fields. Facilities of note include the Laboratory for Laser Energetics, Sibley Music Library (the largest music library in North America) and Nuclear Structure Research Laboratory. The annual cost of attending programs at the University of Rochester averages around USD 75,000. The university has a vibrant campus life with over 200 student organizations, helping them connect and collaborate with other students. The Yellowjackets represent the university at collegiate sports events, with soccer and rugby being amongst the most popular sports on campus. A number of alumni from the university have gone on to win Nobels, Grammys and Pulitzers. This includes Nobel laureates Harvey J. Alter and Paul Romer, as well as actor Robert Foster and Attorney General of Pennsylvania Josh Shapiro.
Eligibility Overview: Admission RequirementsInternational students are encouraged to apply because the University of Rochester celebrates the diversity of a global campus. International applicants must submit the same materials as domestic applicants, but they must also show proof of financial assistance and English language proficiency.For students who choose to submit testing, a wide variety of test results can be submitted, including:SAT reasoning examsACTSAT subject exams (two or more results)Advanced PlacementInternational BaccalaureateAS- and A-level exams (in UK and Commonwealth countries); Gao Kao (China); results from many other national secondary exams
Placement: Placements of GraduatesMany of this generation's intellectual luminaries have come from Rochester's economics programme. A diverse range of schools and companies employ Rochester graduates on their faculty.We've placed PhDs at a variety of elite schools over the previous two decades, including Northwestern University, Cal Tech, Wisconsin, University of Michigan Ann Arbor, NYU, and other universities and colleges throughout the world.2021 PlacementsJihwan Do - Wuhan UniversityMin Fang - HEC Lausanne, post docVictor Hernandez Martinez - Federal Reserve Bank of ClevelandZibin Huang - Shanghai University of Finance and EconomicsChen Kan - Jinan University Armen Khederlarian - University of Connecticut, post docAlexis Orellana - Boston University, post docYuki Tamura - New York University Abu Dhabi, post docCheck here for more details: https://www.sas.rochester.edu/eco/graduate/placement.html

Name: Elgin Community College

It can be used to make appointments with our staff and look for a full-time, part-time, internship, and on-campus job possibilities: employer networking, reading employer ratings, and more. The professional support a student receives from the organisation are: Job and internship search assistanceResume, Cover Letter and Application review Mock interview trainingCareer and major explorationOnline Image and Grad School essay review
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation All residential students at Drury have a one-of-a-kind experience. Residents' retention percentages for freshmen-to-sophomore and sophomore-to-junior are consistently higher than commuters'.  Facilities a student can expect from a live on-campus experience Halls are equipped with a mini-fridge and microwaveIncluded are Internet, wireless printing, utilities, trash/recycling, laundry, and mealsFees for housing and meals are added to the student bill, which can be paid for using grants, scholarships, and loansFor all 3-4 years of student living, there is only one refundable deposit  Housing options & resources Residence Halls Smith, Sunderland, and Wallace are the three residence halls where the bulk of freshmen and sophomores dwell. A professional live-in Hall Director or Graduate Assistant, as well as a number of Resident Assistants, staff the halls (RAs). Smith Hall Smith Hall, which opened in 1966, seats 152 students in a classic suite-style configuration, with two students per room and four students per suite sharing a bathroom. The sole facility with a shared kitchen is Smith Hall. Sunderland Hall Sunderland Hall, which first opened its doors in 2005, has 132 inhabitants living in suites with two baths and four private bedrooms with closets. A microwave and a small refrigerator are included in each unit. Wallace Hall Wallace Hall, which was restored in the summer of 2010, has roughly 130 students in a classic suite-style arrangement: two students per room, four students per suite, and each suite have its own bathroom.  Apartment-Style Housing In Springfield's historic Midtown district, Drury's apartment-style accommodation offers the ultimate in privacy with community life. Apartments and houses provide students with a self-contained living environment that includes many of the same amenities, conveniences, and security as do residence halls. The academic buildings are within walking distance of all flats. Like the residence halls, every campus accommodation has miniblinds, access to laundry facilities, internet, and utilities. Returning students choose their own roommates, and residences are assigned to groups depending on the total number of credits earned unless a unique application process is mentioned. Gender-inclusive or same-gender roommate groups are possible. Students with a limited number of credit hours are more likely to live in resident halls. Note: Full-time undergraduate students who graduated from high school at least one full year previous to the planned move-in date are eligible for apartment-style living.  College Park College Park is a full-time day school that was built in the late 1990s. There are some ADA-accessible units in College Park. There are completely furnished 4-bedroom flats, 3-bedroom cottages, and 1-person studios available at the property. Honors House The Honors House is meant to provide students admitted into Drury's Honors Program with opportunities to engage in co-curricular events that enrich the honours experience, such as discovery, exploration, creativity, and leadership. Residents of the Honors House will create social and cultural programming for the Honors Student Association, organise a year-long service-learning project for the Honors Program, and improve their social media skills by publicising the Honors Program's events. Most importantly, living in the honours house will allow students to continue their intellectual exploration. Jefferson Park North & South The 2-bedroom, 2-bath homes in Jefferson Park North and South have a master bedroom with en-suite bathroom and a smaller second bedroom with a bathroom off the corridor. There are only a few 1-bedroom and 3-bedroom flats available.To allow students to bring their own furniture, the first level of Jefferson Park North is unfurnished. Pets are welcome in these flats. The Pet Agreement and essay must be on file with the Housing office before a student can choose a pet-friendly unit. In Jefferson Park, a student may live with family members. A student living with a non-student family member would pay full price for the accommodation and meal plan, plus a "family charge." If both adults in a household attend Drury, they will be allocated to a 2-bedroom unit and will be responsible for their own housing and meal plan (but no family fee). Jefferson Park West Full-time day school students at Jefferson Park West can live in UNFURNISHED housing. There are four one-bedroom units and four studio apartments. Manley Hall In Manley Hall, a student may live with family members. A student living with a non-student family member would pay full price for the accommodation and meal plan, plus a "family charge." If both adults in a household attend Drury, they will be allocated to a 2-bedroom unit and will be responsible for their own housing and meal plan (but no family fee).Manley Hall has 1-bed, 1-bathroom units as well as 2-bed, 1-bathroom units. Midtown Properties For the full-time day school students, the institution maintains numerous historic 2, 3, and 4-bedroom residences near to the campus. Some houses have only one bathroom, while others have two. Several Midtown residences are reserved for student groups and may require a separate application. The Parsonage Full-time day school students who graduated from high school at least one full year prior to the projected move-in date are eligible to live at the Parsonage, situated at 517 E Calhoun Street. There will be additional criteria. Patterson House Patterson House has studios, one-bedroom, two-bedroom, and three-bedroom units. In the summer of 2018, the structure was renovated. University Suites The University Suites apartments first opened their doors in August of 2012. 72 full-time day school pupils are housed in the suites. Four-bedroom, four-bathroom apartments with in-unit laundry machines are available at the property. The complex has units that are ADA-compliant.  Fraternity Houses Drury's Greek chapters have a long history, a distinct past, and distinct principles. The different members in each chapter, the leadership opportunities offered, and the pleasant social events that chapters sponsor are just a few of the aspects that make fraternity life so fantastic. The residences are for full-time day school fraternity members who graduated from high school at least a year before their expected move-in date. The Fraternity Houses consist of 4 housing options, such as Kappa Alpha, Lambda Chi Alpha, Sigma Nu, Sigma Pi. For more information, visit: https://www.drury.edu/housing/housing-options/  Housing amenities in Drury University include: MaintenanceFood servicesInternet and Cable servicesLaundry and vending servicesMail service and deliverySafety and securityTrash and recycling services For more information, visit: https://www.drury.edu/housing/housing-amenities/  For general enquiries, visit: https://www.drury.edu/housing/
Course Description: Drury University is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. Drury University was founded in 1873. Located in Springfield,USA the university is home to about 120 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.Drury University is ranked 6753th in Top Universities by Webometrics - World. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 1 undergraduate and 3 postgraduate programs. Drury University has 3 intakes in Sep,Jan,Aug. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 4 years and master’s degree courses is 2 years.The average yearly tuition fee of Drury University is around $31880 USD approx.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by Drury University include USC Associates Scholarships UG Business Programs,Horace W Goldsmith Fellowship,You Are Welcome Here Scholarship Bs In Kinesiology Michigan State University,Graduate Incentive Award MS Applied Economics.The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to Drury University is the post-study work opportunities in USA. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.Drury University has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: Stevens Institute of Technology
Overview: Stevens Institute of Technology, established in 1870, is one of the oldest technology institutes in the United States. It is a private institution located in New Jersey, USA. The university is ranked 80th on the list of National University Ranking ( US News and World Report 2021) and follows a semester-based academic calendar. The university consists of three academic colleges and one college, which includes Charles V. Schaefer, Jr. School of Engineering & Science, School of Business, School of Systems & Enterprises, and College of Arts and Letters.It offers 35 undergraduate degrees, 58 Master's degree programs, over 100 Graduate certificates, 22 Ph.D. programs, and two interdisciplinary programs. It has a faculty-student ratio of 1:11.Some popular subjects offered include civil engineering, chemical engineering, mechanical engineering, computer science, chemistry, business, mathematical science, physics, finance, and information systems. The total fees, including tuition fees, cost of room and board, books and supplies, transportation, and personal expenses, are 55,952 USD. Name: Nova Southeastern University
Overview: Formerly known as the Nova University of Advanced Technology, Nova Southeastern University is a private university with its main campus in Davie, Florida and was founded in 1964 and is spread over an area of 314 acres. It is certified by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges. The student to faculty ratio is 17:1 and the college has 73.8% of classes with less than 20 students. The university consists of 18 colleges and schools and offers over 150 programs to study which includes- sociology, law, business, osteopathic medicine, allopathic medication, pharmacy, optometry, physical therapy, education, occupational therapy and nursing. The college is selective in the admissions of the students with an acceptance rate of 80%. Undergraduate students are given the option to live on-campus in the various residential halls of the university. Nova Southeastern University has housing & dining facilities for all its undergraduate and graduate students. Every room is equipped with beds, desks, desk chairs, dressers, and a built-in storage/counter facility. Off-campus accommodation is also available. The residence type includes studio apartments, 3 bedroom apartments, 4 bedroom apartments, and shared apartments. Also, shopping, dining, and entertainment centers are within a walking distance from the university. Various scholarships are offered - Narotam Sekhsariaäó»s Scholarships, Gates Millennium Scholarship, Hani Zeini Scholarship, and many more. These scholarships are offered to both graduate and undergraduate students. The fees for both in-state and out-state students are 50,597 USD including tuition fees, book supplies, room and boarding costs, and also other expenses.

Name: Heidelberg University - USA
Overview: Heidelberg University was founded in 1850. Spread over an area of 115 acres, the university is located in Ohio, USA. They have one of the best architecture on the campus that has been listed on the National Register of Historic Places. The university has about 1,186 students, of which 52% are men and 48% are women. The university uses a semester-based academic calendar and has a student-faculty ratio of 16:1. The university offers 74 majors, minors, and pre-professional programs. The various fields include MBA, IT, Engineering, Hospitality and Tourism, Management, Science, Arts, Media Films, and Law.The Heidelberg University provides on-campus housing options to its students through the residential halls- traditional dorms, pod-style rooms, gender-neutral housing, and apartments. Each facility in the residence hall has the basic amenities- bed, desk, chair, closet, bookshelf, Wifi, the primary kitchen, and laundry facilities. The university also provides a fantastic meal option to its students, with a dining hall and coffee shop open seven days a week. Heidelberg University has over 70 student organizations that allow the students to participate according to their interests. Some popular organizations are- Catholic Newman Club, Morpheus Literary Magazine, Online Radio Station, Psychology Club, Heidelberg Student Education Association, College Middle-Level Association, and German Club. The total fees, including tuition fees, cost of room and board, books and supplies, transportation, and personal expenses, are 45,400 USD. The fees may increase or decrease depending on the use of facilities like- library services, student gym facilities, student centers, technology resources, and campus health centers. There are various financial aids available in the form of scholarships, grants, loans, and work-study programs for all the students. There are Presidential Scholarship, Dean's Scholarship, Faculty Scholarship, and Academic Awards among the many scholarships available.

Name: National University
Overview: Established in 1971, National University is a private non-profit institute in California that focuses on adult education. There are over 25,000 enrolled across 75+ degree programs taught in a four-week class format. The College of Professional Studies, Sanford College of Education, JFK School of Psychology and other departments offer degree and certificate courses like Integrated Marketing Communications, Accountancy, English and Paralegal Studies. The main National University campus is located in La Jolla, and there are other campuses in La Mesa, Fresno, Los Angeles, Pleasant Hill etc. The National University Library houses books, journals, articles, media resources, study spaces and computer facilities. There are over 45 online degree and certificate programs at NU like Public Administration, Allied Health, Computer Science and Integrative Psychology. The Workforce Education Solutions Training & Development program in areas like Hospitality, Management, Data Analytics etc., is an excellent way to get credits or prepare for continuing education. NU provides online and On-base Degree Programs for Military Personnel with financial assistance for servicemembers and their families. English Language Programs like English for Academic Purposes and English for Specific Purposes help develop language competency. The National University Early College allows school students to take college-level classes at reduced prices before graduating from high school. Through National University Virtual High School, school students can earn their diploma online, choose AP/ elective courses, pursue middle school courses and prepare for college. The estimated tuition fee for 500-level courses are USD 442 and USD 370 for credentials/certificates/graduate and undergraduate, respectively. Tuition Assistance, Federal Work-Study, PERKINS Loan Program, College Resource Network-Scholarships are some of the financial aids available. Off-campus housing facilities are available for international students like privately rented apartments, houses and rooms, homestays etc. Several student clubs and organizations like Pride NU, Omega NU, Educators United and International Students Association. National University graduates tend to earn a median starting salary of USD 54,700.

(not mandatory but considered)Eligibility Requirements for Graduate StudentsThe following are the graduate-level entry requirements for international students:A four-year bachelor's degree in a relevant discipline or an equivalent degree with a minimum GPA of 2.5 out of 4 is required.(one of three) English proficiency tests:A minimum TOEFL score of 79 is required.IELTS: A minimum of 6 bands is required.A minimum score of 58 on the PTE is required (above 79 for MBA)Minimum score of 5 on the International English Proficiency Test (iTEP).GRE or GMAT (Graduate Management Admission Test) (optional)

Name: Rocky Mountain College of Art + Design (RMCAD)
Overview: Philip J. Steele founded Rocky Mountain College of Art + Design in 1963, a private college in Denver. The Higher Learning Commission of the North Central Association of Colleges accredits this college regionally. At the national level, the National Association of Schools of Art and Design accredits this institution. The college provides programs in Animation, Fashion Design, Fine Arts, Game Art, Animation, Graphic Design, Interior Design, Illustrative Design, Illustration, Photography. Rocky Mountain College of Art and Design online programs are available in Education Media Design and Technology, Instructional Design Certificate, Music Production etc. Students across all academic programs qualify to practice studio art in any of the 12 Spivak studios of this college. Students can purchase Apple products from RMCAD 24x7. Besides, students can also get free doorstep delivery or pick up their orders from their nearest Apple store. In addition to this, students can purchase other essential items from 'Spectrum' an RMCD store. Rocky Mountain College of Art and Design acceptance rate is approximately 89%. According to the Niche Best Colleges 2022, Rocky Mountain College of Art and Design ranking is 63rd nationally among the 419 best colleges for Design in America. According to the Great Value Colleges, this college ranked 2nd for providing affordable bachelor's degrees in Architecture. It ranked 18th among the top 25 colleges for delivering quality online interior design courses. According to the stateuniversity.com it is one of the recognised institutions to provide illustration degree majors and degree programs. Rocky Mountain College of Art Design tuition fees vary with each program. For example, students enrolled in online graduate programs may need to pay approximately $631/credit hour. Students applied for undergraduate online programs may need to pay around $602/credit hour. Students and alumni can search for jobs on PASSPORT, an online job portal of RMCAD. Students can also find guides on resume writing, interviewing preparation etc., on the institution's official website. Some of the notable alumni who graduated from Rocky Mountain College of Art + Design are – Xi Zhang, Ami Cusack, and Nick Shoulders.

Name: Texas Tech University
Overview: Texas Tech University is a public research university located in Texas, United States. The university was founded in 1923 as Texas Technological College, before changing to its current name in 1969. The university is part of the Texas Tech University System and has established itself as a high research output institution. The university comprises 13 colleges that offer over 150 courses in graduate, undergraduate and doctoral programs. The top courses at Texas Tech University include MS in Civil Engineering, Bachelors in Business Administration (BBA) and MS in Mechanical Engineering. The University's main campus is located in Lubbock, Texas. It is home to the graduate school, law school and medical schools programs, making it only the second campus in the state of Texas to do so. The campus is also renowned for its historical architecture and campus grounds, for which it has won many awards in recent years. Facilities like state of the art labs, training centers and auditoriums provide students with the infrastructure required to pursue their academics. The annual costs of studying at the university vary depending on the duration of the program, averaging around USD 23,600 per annum. The student life on campus is active thanks to the multicultural community on campus. Student clubs, fraternities and sororities promote networking and interaction amongst students, facilitating a well rounded student life. The Red Raiders sports team represents the university in various sports like basketball and American football. It is part of the Big 12 Conference, competing with other elite universities in varsity sports. A number of famous alumni of Texas Tech University have gone on to excel in various fields of science and culture. The most notable names include astronaut Rick Husband, American footballer Donny Anderson and Edward Whitacre Jr., former CEO of General Motors.
Eligibility Overview: The following information will be included in the completed application forms for admission to the Graduate School and the department to which admission is sought (Biological Sciences or Natural Resources Management):GPA: For the last 90 credits of school, all applicants must have a 3.0 GPA (4 point scale).Preparing transcripts and curricula: A four-year undergraduate degree in a field that will prepare you to pursue graduate study in either the Department of Biological Sciences or the Department of Natural Resources Management.TOEFL results: If you are an international student, you must submit your Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) scores with your application. International applicants must have a TOEFL iBT (Internet-based test) score of 80 or above. This is an online degree that does not necessitate a residency requirement.Statement of interest: This one- to two-page narrative should outline your schooling, work experience, long-term professional goals, and how this degree programme can help you accomplish them.Your application must be approved by both the Graduate School and the PSM Graduate Program. You must first apply to the Graduate School and be accepted.

Name: University of Pittsburgh
Overview: Established in 1787, the University of Pittsburgh is one of the oldest universities in the USA. Located in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, the university offers both full time and part-time undergraduate as well as graduate classes to its students. The University of Pittsburgh, commonly known as Pitt, consists of 16 colleges and schools that offer over 200-degree programs. It is also a member of the Association of American Universities (AAU) and consists of around 63 institutions that provide doctorate courses in the USA. The Pitt is quite famous for its help in defeating polio and hence, is known as the second-largest non-government employer in that region. The University of Pittsburgh is quite competitive due to its acceptance rate of 60% for international students. With an enrollment of more than 28,234 students, The US News and World Report ranked the university as 19th amongst the top public schools. The university offers a wide range of courses, which includes bioinformatics, exercise science, petroleum engineering, polymer engineering, biological sciences, dance, and accounting for undergraduates. The graduation courses include business, arts, computing, sciences, education, and engineering. M.Sc. in Computer Science, M.Sc. Finance, M.Sc. in Electrical and Computer Engineering, M.B.A, and M.Sc. in Mechanical Engineering are some of the university's top courses. The university offers various scholarships for international students in the USA, which includes Chancellor's Scholarship, University Scholarship, and many more. Though the fee structure depends on the course a student chooses, the cost of living in Pittsburgh is quite high due to its high standard of maintenance. Except for the graduate students, the campus accommodation facility provided by the University of Pittsburgh is enjoyed by other students. Also, with an average rent of USD 850 per month, the students can enjoy off-campus housing as well.
Eligibility Overview: Students applying to undergraduate programmes at the University of Pittsburgh must meet the minimum requirement criteria, which include:Campus of Pittsburgh:IELTS: Overall 7 bands or higher, with 6.0 or higher sub-scoresTOEFL: A composite score of 100 or higher with sub-scores of 21 is competitive. When looking at applicant applications as a whole, a TOEFL score of 95-99 combined with a strong academic background will suffice.Overall score of 120 or higher on the Duolingo English Test (DET).Campuses in Bradford, Greensburg, and Johnstown:TOEFL: 80-94 or higher overallIELTS: 6.5 bands or higher overallSAT: 560 or above in evidence-based reading and writingACT: 21 ACT sub-score in EnglishFor Graduate Studies:International students must apply to individual schools, each with its own set of prerequisites, in order to be considered for graduate programmes. GRE and GMAT scores are accepted by the university depending on the programme you intend to apply to.What are the requirements for the application?International students applying to the University of Pittsburgh must submit the following documents:Scores on English proficiencyExam results are standardised.English high school diploma or credentials (or verified if in any other language)Transcripts of gradesImmunization status and student health recordsFinancial records:Statements from banksForm of financial responsibilityEvaluation of international transcriptsOther documents you may be required to submit as part of your application include:Recommendations LettersPersonal statementTranscripts from AP, IB, or A-Level classesA certain set of documents may be required by some programmes. Students can visit the programme page on the university's official website for specific prerequisites.

Accommodation: On-Campus AccommodationOn-campus housing is available.On-campus housing options at the University range from residence halls with a wide range of amenities to apartment-style accommodations with a more self-sufficient lifestyle.The University supplies all residents with the basic necessities of modern student life, such as furnishings, cable television, and internet network connection. E-mail kiosks, study and entertainment lounges, fitness centres, food alternatives, coffee shops, free shuttle bus service, laundry facilities, mail centres, and Living Learning Communities are among the other amenities available.Upperclass students have the option of renting an apartment, which provides a more independent living environment with fewer services and conveniences. Apartment-style accommodations accommodate one to four students and feature a kitchen, dining and living rooms. With an acceptance rate of 52%, the university grants around 12,000 degrees (bachelor's, master's, doctoral and professional) every year. Candidates are required to show proof of their English proficiency. In contrast, the highest average fee for a graduate course is USD 46,752. There are different scholarship and financial aid options to explore; aid is available in Academic Scholarships, UW Undergraduate Academic Excellence Awards, Purple and Gold Scholarships, grants, fellowships, loans and the Work-Study Program. When it comes to placements, University of Washington MBA graduates have been known to receive an average base salary of USD 135,146.

Placement: By promoting job openings from schools, universities, governmental bodies, businesses, and other organisations, the Department of Economics helps its PhD graduates find employment. Additionally, a staff member is available to handle various administrative issues linked to placement, and a faculty member is recruited annually to oversee placement activities. The Department enables the filing of letters of recommendation for applications each autumn quarter. To improve their public speaking, students often take part in role-playing interviews and deliver workshops. To build a network of future employers, the Department encourages its graduates to go to the national AEA convention.
Accommodation: There are 3 University of Washington campuses spread out across the state; Seattle (703-acre main campus), Bothell and Tacoma, with different course combinations. To ensure that more students across the globe can benefit from the university's world-class education, UW Online is an initiative that offers several degree and certificate programs and individual online courses. The university offers numerous housing accommodations for students enrolled in different programs; residence halls (undergraduates), apartments (graduates and professionals) and over 50 fraternity and sorority houses. Students also have access to dining services, healthcare services (mental and physical) and numerous recreational activities. There are over ten men's and women's intercollegiate sports teams.On-Campus Accommodation The UW offers a selection of housing alternatives. Everyone has lodging, including traditional residence halls, the most cutting-edge amenities, apartment-style living, and housing for fraternities and sororities.  Undergraduates The UW residence halls provide the utmost in convenience, a friendly atmosphere in which to live and learn, and a plethora of activities for undergraduates to make friends and connect with the community. They are staffed by an award-winning Residential Life team. Graduate & professionals Graduate and professional students, couples, singles, and families can all benefit greatly from the apartments. They are convenient, supportive, offer lots of chances for community involvement and are created with busy students in mind. Fraternities & sororities Fraternities and sororities have been sheltering UW students for more than a century. Facilities provide a wide range of facilities, community, and academic support while housing 15 to 116 members. Each year, one of our 50 residences welcomes more than 1,000 newcomers. For more information, visit: https://www.washington.edu/about/housing/  The accommodation options offered by the university are: Residence Halls Our resident halls offer a variety of accommodation types and price points to accommodate the various lives and budgets of our students. The UW is dedicated to meeting students' expectations of a contemporary living environment while minimising housing expenditures.The most typical form of unit in the resident halls is the double room. For more information, visit: https://hfs.uw.edu/campus-living/9-month-housing  Apartments UW apartments are a fantastic option for students who want greater independence or who need year-round housing in the U-District. The flats give you the chance to integrate into the Husky community while reducing outside distractions so you can concentrate on your academics.The students' various budgets and lifestyles can be accommodated by the variety of price points and room kinds. The university is dedicated to keeping housing expenses as cheap as possible while yet giving students the contemporary living conditions they need.In contrast to many off-campus apartments, our rates are determined by what it costs to operate our buildings due to the nonprofit nature of our organisationThe most typical kind of units in our apartment communities are single rooms in 4-bedroom apartments For more details, visit: https://hfs.uw.edu/campus-living/12-month-housing  Family Housing For enrolled full-time students at the University of Washington's Seattle campus who desire to live on campus with their families, there is a programme called Family Housing. A married couple, whether or not they have children, constitutes a family. In jurisdictions where same-sex marriage is prohibited, same-sex domestic partnerships are accepted. There are several benefits to living in UW Family Housing. living close to classes, campus amenities, and the opportunity to take part in a range of extracurricular activities is convenient. You'll interact with folks from various origins and cultures and make friends for life. For more details, visit: https://hfs.uw.edu/campus-living/family-housing

Name: Regis University
Overview: Founded in 1877, Regis University is a privately owned Jesuit University spread across 90 acres in Denver, Colorado, the United States.
