Name: Richard Bland College of William & Mary
Overview: Founded in 1960, RBC is named after Virginian statesman Richard Bland. It was established as a branch of the College of William and Mary by the Virginia General Assembly. This institute was once under the umbrella of "the Colleges of William and Mary.Although it is self-functioning in nature, Richard Bland College is governed by William and Mary's Board of Visitors. Richard Bland College of William & Mary received accreditation from the SACSCOC (Commission on Colleges of the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools) for awarding the Associate of Science and Associate of Arts degrees. RBC extends academically rigorous programs that are grounded in the liberal arts tradition of William & Mary. This offers the students a solid foundation for transferring to 4-year universities and colleges. Students who earn an Associate Degree from RBC will get the first two years towards the Baccalaureate Degree completed. Some of these degrees that students can earn from this institute include Associate of Science Degree (A.S.), Associate of Arts Degree (A.A.), Associate of Science Degree - Business Administration (A.S.-Business Administration), Associate of Science Degree – Life Science (A.S.-Life Science), Associate of Science Degree – Physical Science (A.S.-Physical Science) and several others. The In-state per-credit Richard Bland College of William & Mary fee lies in the range $270 to $275. Similarly, the Out-Of-State Domestic fees lies in the range $450 to $470 and Out-Of-State International fees is in the range of $720 to $740. All these fee rates are effective Fall 2021. Around 77% of RBC students receive financial aid in the form of loans, grants, and/or employment. Richard Bland College of William & Mary has an innovative program named WorkIT@RBC that is curated to prepare students for the workforce. This program connects them with internships in the local community, and particularly emphasis on employment in the tech space. Students gain specialized training for successfully transitioning to a workplace through the NACE (National Association of Colleges and Employers)-established career readiness competencies.
Eligibility Overview: Official SAT or ACT scores are required (SAT code: 5574, ACT code: 4346)Recommendation LetterCandidates for admission must have achieved an equivalency certificate based on GED examinations or have graduated from an approved high school with a standard or advanced diploma. High school courses, grades, and extracurricular activities are used to evaluate applicants. Four (4) units of English, three (3) units of mathematics (recommended courses: Algebra I, Geometry, Algebra II, or advanced math courses), two (2) units of history or government, and two (2) units of science should generally be included in a high school curriculum. Two (2) foreign language units are recommended but not needed.
Accommodation: Housing on campusRichard Bland College of William & Mary requires students to live on campus for the duration of their studies.All RBC resident halls provide apartment-style living with cutting-edge features such as:A bed, a dresser, and a closet can be found in this bedroom.There is a couch, a table, and chairs in the large living room.A refrigerator, microwave, stove, and oven are all included in the kitchen.Bathroom(s)Washing machine and dryerParking is available on-site.Cable television, internet, and a phone are all available.

Name: Rowan University
Overview: An extension of the Glassboro Normal School, also known as Bunce Hall, Rowan University is a public research institution in Glassboro, New Jersey. A role model for higher education with creative experiences, Rowan University includes 14 colleges and offers 85 graduate degrees, 46 postgraduate degrees, six doctoral degrees, and two professional degrees in streams ranging from business and education to engineering and medicine. The university is classified among R2: Doctoral Universities. Some of the top programs at Rowan University are B.A. in Construction Management, B.A. in Early Childhood Education, M.A. in Law and Justice Studies, PhD in Cell and Molecular Biology, M.A. in Applied Mathematics, etc. Housing more than 19,000 students and spreading across 25 acres, Rowan University has several campuses. The Stratford Campus or the medical campus houses the renowned College of Health Sciences. In addition, there is one satellite campus, the Camden Campus, and the main campus, or the Glassboro Campus. The institution also has research centres including the CAVE Virtual Reality Lab, and the Geospatial Research Lab. Rowan University operates The Supervised Internship Program which offers its students meaningful internships in professional work settings. The average tuition fee at Rowan University is around CAD 26,000. International Students have access to financial aid, merit-based scholarships, and grants. The Whit is Rowana's classic publication. In addition, there is a Student Government Association, the Rowan Television Network, the famous Rowan After Hours campus event, and the Intramural Sports event. Rowan University Accommodation supports on-campus housing with eight residence halls and five apartment communities. There is a flexible on-campus dining facility with various restaurant chains and the Rowan Chamberlain Student Center. Rowan University follows a student-centred approach promoting education and civic duties.

Accommodation: In line with Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 and the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) of 1990, the Office of Accessibility Services offers accommodations and support to students with a range of verified disabilities. For the university to decide if a student qualifies for reasonable accommodations, they must provide the proper documents to meet the university's admissions requirements (i.e., are otherwise qualified to attend the university).Accessible classes, the use of assistive technology, audiotaped books (where available), the administration of exams in conjunction with the instructor, and additional services as considered essential are all coordinated and ensured by the staff. For more information, visit: https://sites.rowan.edu/accessibilityservices/
Course Ranking: This institution is divided into 13 schools that focus on different academic fields. At Rowan University, classes are kept small and taught by professors who care about the success of their students as well as their engagement with them. According to US News & World Report's topic rankings for UG Business, Rowan University is ranked 308 for 2021, 260 for 2020, and 274 for 2018 and 2019. In addition to other considerations, the approach used by US News & World Report to rank subjects includes consideration of student selection (25%), the views of business school administrators (25%), and job outcome (21%).
University Ranking: Rowan Institution was established in 1923 and is a public research university for students who want to follow their passions, advance their skill sets, and get ready for life after Rowan. Over four campuses, the university offers more than 80 bachelor's degree programmes, 60 master's degree programmes, five doctoral degrees, and two professional programmes. When it comes to Rowan University rankings, US News & World Report's Global Universities rating has placed Rowan University at 1,420 for the past two years in a row in 2019 and 2020. The university is ranked 187th in the national universities category by US News & World Report for 2021. Name: Adelphi University
Overview: Founded in 1896, Adelphi University was the first private and co-educational university on Long Island. Its main campus was in Garden City, with three other campuses in Hudson Valley, Suffolk County, and Manhattan Centre. The university provides undergraduate, graduate, on-campus, and online programs. Candidates can choose from over 60 undergraduate courses, including art history, marketing, neuroscience, philosophy, etc., and more than 65 graduate programs in accounting, biotechnology, psychoanalytic supervision, nutrition, etc. Some of the top programs offered by the university are nursing, general psychology, biology, and business administration & management. Some online programs are MA, MS, MSW, BS, and advanced certificate programs in sports, education, management, healthcare informatics, etc. The university has some facilities, including a fitness center, gym, bookstore, computer labs, library, indoor track, and tennis courts. The university also provides off-campus housing around all four campuses, costing around USD 10,000, including meals and lodging. The on-campus accommodation offers the best infrastructure with furnished rooms, utilities, Wi-Fi, and laundry facilities. The college organizes career fairs to help students with CVs and interviews to get jobs and internships, and the International Student Associations arrange events in cross-culture.The fees of the courses offered at the university range from USD 41,500 to USD 46,500 approximately. The university offers merit scholarships, athletic scholarships, need-based grants, federal or state grants, and outside scholarships.

Applicants with international degrees will be evaluated by the Office of International Admissions to see if they meet the Graduate School's requirement of a recognised Bachelor's degree.- An undergraduate weighted mean GPA of 3.0 or better on a 4.0 scale. If the student's undergraduate GPA is less than 3.0, a GPA will be determined based on the last two years of study if the student attended a foreign university, and the last 60 semester hours (90 quarter hours) if the student attended a U.S. college.Undergraduate Admissions at the University of UtahTo study in the United States, the most popular majors at the University of Utah demand academic excellence and competitive results on numerous tests.Admissions Requirements: To be considered for admission to the University of Utah, applicants must meet the following criteria:Application that has been completedTranscripts from High SchoolIf the document is not in English, it must be accompanied with English translations.Scores on the ACT or SATAnswers in a Hurry (Part of Common Application)Scores on the English Proficiency Test must be submitted by international applicants (TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo).Statements of accountSponsor's Financial Support Form Verification/AffidavitGraduate Admissions at the University of UtahGraduate courses have different requirements than undergraduate courses. Name: Case Western Reserve University
Overview: Established in 1826, the Case Western Reserve University is one of the best private research universities in Ohio. Located in Cleveland, Ohio, USA, the university derives its name from the region, which was then known as Western Reserve at Connecticut. Later on, in 1882, the campus was shifted to Cleveland. The university enrolls over 6,674 graduates and more than 5,150 undergraduates in various fields, which include science, medicine, management, arts, law, nursing, and engineering. It offers 51 doctorate degrees, 53 masters degrees, 16 integrated programs, bachelors degrees in more than 40 fields, Biomedical Sciences, Training Program (BSTP), and Medical Scientist Training Program (MSTP). The Case Western Reserve University has a faculty of around 3500 members, which includes experienced and skilled professors. M.B.A, M.Eng in Civil Engineering, M.Sc in Nursing, Master of Accountancy, and M.Sc in Biostatistics are some of the university's top programs. The total cost of tuition fee that a student needs to bear is USD 72,188. The university also offers various awards and scholarships to international students, which include A.W. Smith Innovation Scholarship, Arts Achievement Scholarships, Andrew and Eleanor Squire Scholarship, and Alexander A. Treuhaft memorial Scholarship. This university provides on-campus accommodation to its students, including eight 2nd year buildings, 12 freshers buildings, 18 Greek Life houses, and nine upper-class buildings. The Case Western Reserve University offers excellent placement opportunities to its students. The Office of University Housing offers full-time undergraduate students with summer employment opportunities. There are some on-campus jobs available such as student administrative assistance, student inventory assistant, customer service assistance, and student facility assistant. The average annual salary of a graduate of Case Western Reserve University is USD 75,000

Name: University of Oregon

The university is located in Eugene and Oregon, United States, and is spread over 295 acres, including 80 buildings. The university offers around 316 undergraduate and graduate degree programs and is a member of the Association of American Universities in the Pacific Northwest and the only one in Oregon. The university has eight colleges: Faculty of Arts and Sciences, College of Journalism and Communication, Charles H. Lundquist College of Business, Faculty of Design, Robert D. Name: Lamar University
Overview: A public university in Beaumont, Texas, Lamar University is part of the Texas State University System which remains the first higher education system of the state. Established in the year 1923, it works with a belief in tradition to reinvent the future. Working to develop the custom of hands-on learning for its student in order to produce responsible citizens for the world, the university maintains the lowest annual average tuition fee in Texas. All the nationally recognized and quality programs at Lamar University are organized into five undergraduate colleges, one graduate college and an honors college. These five colleges are College of Arts and Sciences, College of Business, College of Education and Human Development, Engineering, Fine Art and Communication, Reaud Honors College, and College of Graduate Studies. The university has diverse students coming from different parts of the world as it hosts over 100 student organisations while promoting the significance of cultural events and activities to maintain an inclusive environment among the students. There are 139 programmes for undergraduate, graduate and doctorate degrees. The university with an acceptance rate of 84% has some of its best courses in business and engineering programs. Situated 90 miles east of Houston, the university campus hosts thousands of seminars, and cultural and sports events making it a popular choice amongst students. The average annual cost which includes the living charges can come to around $ 30K but with many grants and scholarship programs, the cost can be brought down to $ 20K. The 292-acre lush campus of Lamar University offers residence halls, theatres, student halls, recreational centres, libraries and athletics centres to ensure a holistic experience for its students. With a successful alumni network and an impressive placement rate, it guides its students towards an effective career by ensuring both their personal and professional growth.

Name: Vermont Technical College
Overview: A public vocational institution in Vermont, Vermont Technical College has campuses in Norwich and Randolph Center. Additionally, there are regional campuses in Brattleboro and Bennington, as well as nursing campuses spread out around the state at six different sites. The institution is a member of the Vermont State Schools, a grouping of Vermont's four public colleges run under the authority of a single board of trustees, chancellor, and Council of Presidents, with a president and dean for each institution. The student-to-faculty ratio is 10:1, there are roughly 1,335 students enrolled, and the average class size is 14. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Unassigned. The main campus of Vermont Technical College is located in Randolph. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. Vermont Technical College offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. Placement: The 2021 graduating class from Vermont Technical College had a placement rate of 99 per cent, meaning that they are all either employed or enrolled in post-graduate continuing education courses. The average placement rate at Vermont Technical College since 2014 has been above 97 per cent. 98 per cent of the class of 2021 graduates from Vermont Technical College are employed in their fields of study, as in previous years. Nursing and health professions were indicated as having the most people working in them or continuing their study in the poll, followed by engineering and computing, professional studies and management, and agricultural, plant, and life sciences.Patricia Moulton, president of Vermont Technical College, congratulated the class of 2021, saying, "We are so very proud of you for persevering in the face of great hurdles. "We are very happy to see you already making such a wonderful impact on the world."
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation: Housing requirements are common at colleges and are in line with high-quality standards. According to research, college students on campus are more likely to persist in their studies, earn a certificate or degree, and make the most of their time in the classroom. You'll require access to campus labs and equipment since you'll need to spend two hours on homework or class projects for every hour in class. Academic achievement also depends on having access to the college library and tutoring programmes. Last but not least, Vermont's weather is erratic and can differ significantly from one area to another. When you leave your house in the morning, you can encounter a storm or a sudden drop in temperature that makes driving hazardous. As they race to class on time, students start to worry about their safety. University has discovered that their housing requirement benefits the students for all the reasons mentioned above. Except for those who fulfil one of the following requirements, all students are required to reside in college housing during their first two years:Has earned a Baccalaureate degree2-year housing requirement has been met at Vermont Tech or another collegeHas legal dependentsIs a veteranIs marriedAttends classes at a VTC site that does not offer to houseHousing is filled/there are no available roomsHas a severe medical condition that cannot be accommodated in the residence hall. (A medical assessment from the student's physician is required for review and must be approved by the college's Learning Specialist.)Is 21 years of age or older before the start of the academic yearPermanent legal residence is within a 30-mile radius of the collegeHas part-time statusHas withdrawn or taken a leave of absence from the collegeHas an academic dismissal from the collegeIs under judicial sanction

Name: Hunter College
Overview: Hunter College is a constituent college of the City University of New York. Intending to educate and nourish young talent, Hunter College has been around for more than 150 years. Established in 1870, it is one of the internationally authorized flagship colleges in New York. Hunter College has a student base of 23 000 students admitted to more than 170 streams. There are 550 graduates at Hunter, with more than 6000 postgraduate students. The top programs at Hunter College include BA in Ancient Greek, PhD in Biopsychology and Behavioural Neuroscience, BA in Studio Art, MS in Urban Policy and Leadership, etc. Hunter College is located in the Lenox Hill neighbourhood on the Upper East Side of Manhattan, New York. Hunter College operates the Roosevelt House and Baker Theatre Building with an ultra-modern infrastructure. Student life at Hunter is vigorous, with over 150 inclusive clubs and fraternities, including the Kappa Sigma and InterVarsity Christian Fellowship. The Hunter College Residence Life Program offers accommodation facilities with priority access to the residential community. Besides, the college also operates off-campus housing close to the satellite campuses.The average tuition fee at Hunter College is CAD 2000, with an acceptance rate of 35%. International students can apply through financial aid and Hunter College Scholarships.
Eligibility Overview: Hunter College expects you to have a 3.46 GPA in high school and be in the middle of the class. You'll need a mixture of A and B grades, with only a few Cs. If your GPA is poor, you can make up for it by taking more difficult subjects such as AP or IB. This will help you improve your weighted GPA and demonstrate your college readiness.It's difficult to modify your GPA in time for college applications if you're currently a junior or senior. You'll need a better SAT or ACT score to compensate if your GPA is at or below the school's average of 3.46. This will enable you to effectively compete against applicants with higher GPAs.
Accommodation: Students with disabilities must self-identify and submit evidence to the Office of AccessABILITY in order for accommodations to be provided.This procedure ensures that the student's needs for accommodations, some of which may not be related to the classroom, are met by the office. Faculty are only accountable for providing accommodations that have been approved by the Office of AccessABILITY. The student's disability is private information that only the Office of AccessABILITY has access to. Students can choose who they want to share this information with and when they want to do it over the semester. If they choose to need accommodations at any stage, they must adhere to programme deadlines and procedures in order to get timely services.for more derail click on this link-https://www.hunter.cuny.edu/access/faculty-staff/accommodation-process

Name: Delaware State University
Overview: Delaware State University, shortly known as DSU, was established in 1891. Located in Dover, Delaware, the US, it has four colleges inside the campus, namely the College of Agriculture, Science, and Technology, College of Humanities, Education and Social Sciences, College of Business, and College of Health and Behavioral Sciences. With an acceptance rate of 53%, the University provides 42 undergraduate courses, 21 graduates and five doctoral programs with popular majors in Communication, Journalism, Social Sciences, Business Management, Marketing, Fitness Studies, and Psychology. They follow a semester-based calendar inside the College. The university has a student retention rate of 62%. Total expenses, including Tuition, Room and Board, Book and Supplies, Meal Plan and other fees, come to around 33,117 USD. About 77% of first-year students receive financial aid, for which FAFSA submission is a must.

Placement: The Computer Science Graduate Program offers numerous options to Masters and PhD graduates. Many PhD students will work as interns in government and commercial research facilities while in school. In addition to working for these companies after graduation, some graduates work for startups, join the business, or work in academia as faculty or research staff. Sixty-six per cent have selected industry occupations during the past five years, 31 per cent have chosen academic positions, and 3 per cent have chosen government professions.  The Computer Science programme at N.C. State has the good fortune to have its graduates highly sought after nationally and locally (in the Research Triangle). 92% of respondents to our graduate survey who graduated in 2020–2021 reported having a full-time job (n=232). For many significant global corporations, we are a leading source for new hires. Our master's grads reported an average salary of $116K/year for the 2020–21 academic year (without bonuses, options, moving allowances, etc.).
Accommodation: The main campus of NC State is located in Raleigh, North Carolina. The Raleigh Campus has three sub-campuses divided into the Central Campus, South Campus, and North Campus. The campuses are separated by the legendary North Carolina Railroad. The campus has more than 75 research laboratories, the Hill Library, and the award-winning James B. Hunt Jr. Library. The Witherspoon Student Centre houses the African American Cultural Centre. NC State is known for its esteemed student traditions, including the Krispy Kreme Challenge. The university supports student housing as freshmen are required to live on campus. NC State has several residence halls equipped with state-of-the-art technology and basic amenities. It also has several residence communities, the Living and Learning Villages.On-Campus Accommodation In close proximity to friends, dining options, and recreational amenities, University Housing offers a wide range of on-campus housing options. Residence Halls Residence halls are close to academic facilities, campus amenities, and leisure activities. The NC State dining halls, regarded as some of the best in the nation, are just a short stroll away. The true college experience includes everything from meeting new people over a game of pool to taking a break in the study area to organising a movie night with your neighbours.There are 20 housing halls on campus where you can live. The Living and Learning Village residents may have exclusive access to certain structures. Choices below: Hall-style Buildings In a conventional hall-style building, the room opens to a corridor connecting to the rest of the floor and has one or more communal bathrooms accessible to all floor inhabitants. Most halls are coed but have sections for each gender. The housekeeping crew daily cleans the communal bathrooms, stairwells, and hallways. These areas are less private than suite-style structures because each room opens to a long hallway. Alexander Hall Global Village students reside at Alexander Hall, which is a short distance from Talley Student Union and directly across the street from Carmichael Complex. A large kitchen and conference room are available to residents. The acronym TOTA, which stands for Tucker, Owen, Turlington, and Alexander, is used by locals to refer to this area of campus. Bagwell Hall  Bagwell Hall is next to Clark Dining Hall, just steps from Pullen Park and the Gregg Museum, and right next to the Quad Commons (formerly Honors Village Commons), which contains a service desk, computer lab, and meeting space. It is one of the four structures that make up the campus's Quad. Becton Hall Becton Hall is near Clark Dining Hall and only a short distance from Pullen Park and the Gregg Museum. It is situated next to the Quad Commons, formerly known as Honors Village Commons, which contains a service desk, computer lab, and meeting space. It is one of the four structures that make up the campus's Quad. Berry Hall Berry Hall is near Clark Dining Hall, Pullen Park, and the new Gregg Museum. It is also close to the Quad Commons (previously Honors Village Commons), which contains a service desk, computer lab, and conference space. It is one of the four structures that make up the campus's Quad. Gold Hall Gold Hall, one of the three structures that make up the Triad on East University, is the only all-male residence hall on the campus. A courtyard and pavilion are shared by the neighbourhood, which also comprises Syme and Welch halls. Pullen Park and the Quad Commons, formerly known as Honors Village Commons, which houses the service desk, are close to Gold Hall. Owen Hall The Carmichael Fitness Center and Holmes Hall, where the 24-hour service desk is situated, are across the street from Owen Hall. The acronym TOTA, which stands for Tucker, Owen, Turlington, and Alexander, is used by locals to refer to this area of campus. The Exploratory Studies Village is housed in Owen Hall, which is exclusively accessible to villagers and their roommates. Syme Hall The Triad on East Campus is made up of three buildings, one of which is Syme Hall. The neighbourhood's courtyard and pavilion are shared by Gold and Welch halls. The College of Education, the College of Design, and the Quad Commons (formerly Honors Village Commons), where the service desk is situated, are all near Syme Hall. Tucker Hall Holmes Hall, where the service desk is situated, and Carmichael Fitness Complex are nearby. TOTA, an acronym for Tucker, Owen, Turlington, and Alexander, is the name given to this section of campus by locals. Only villagers and their housemates are permitted to enter Tucker Hall, where the Exploratory Studies Village is located. Turlington Hall Residents of Arts Village live in Turlington Hall, which is close to Holmes Hall, the service desk, and the Carmichael Fitness Center. The acronym TOTA, which stands for Tucker, Owen, Turlington, and Alexander, is used by locals to refer to this campus area. The Inter-Residence Council (IRC) offices are located in Turlington Hall. Welch Hall Welch is one of three structures that make up the Triad on East Campus and is the only exclusively female residence hall at NC State. The neighbourhood's courtyard and pavilion are shared by Gold and Syme halls. Welch Hall is far from Clark Dining Hall, Pullen Park, the Gregg Museum, the Quad Commons (formerly Honors Village Commons), and the service desk. Suite-style Buildings In suite-style buildings, there usually are two students per room, and the suitemates and their guests are the only ones who use the shared restroom. Suites may accommodate eight to fourteen students and are gender-specific. The bathroom is regularly cleaned by housekeeping employees. Compared to hall-style buildings, suites provide a more private, cosy ambience. Bowen Hall Bowen Hall, along with Carroll and Metcalf halls, makes up one-third of the area known as the Tri-Towers, which is conveniently situated in the centre of campus close to the Talley Student Union and Carmichael Complex. Holmes Hall houses the Central Campus service counter. Bragaw Hall The EcoVillage is located in a section of Bragaw Hall, which features one of the country's biggest installations of energy-efficient LED lighting. There are two communal kitchens, two lounges, a conference room, pool and foosball tables, a sand volleyball court, and study rooms for residents. The Student Health Center, Fountain Dining Hall, and Witherspoon Student Center are close to Bragaw. Bragaw Hall houses the West Campus service desk. Carroll Hall Carroll Hall takes up one-third of the area known as the Tri-Towers and is conveniently situated in the centre of campus, steps away from Talley Student Union and Carmichael Fitness Complex. Holmes Hall houses the Central Campus service counter. Lee Hall Doak Field in Dail Park, the site of NC State baseball, the J.W. Isenhour Tennis Center and Fountain Dining Hall are all close to Lee Hall. In close proximity to Bragaw Hall is the West Campus service desk. Metcalf Hall One-third of the Tri-Towers area is made up by Metcalf Hall and is conveniently situated in the centre of campus, steps away from Talley Student Union and Carmichael Fitness Complex. Holmes Hall houses the Central Campus service counter. Sullivan Hall Doak Field in Dail Park, the site of NC State baseball, as well as the J.W. Isenhour Tennis Center and Fountain Dining Hall, are all close by to Sullivan Hall. Near Bragaw Hall is the West Campus service desk. Watauga Hall For upper-class students (sophomores and above), Watauga Hall is a historical structure that provides a variety of room arrangements, including single rooms. The Belltower, Hillsborough Street, North Hall, the Court of North Carolina, and the College of Design are close to Watauga Hall.  Wood Hall In addition to having a community service desk, Wood Hall is conveniently positioned close to the Talley Student Union, Case Dining Hall, Carmichael Fitness Complex, Dail Soccer Field and Track Complex, and Talley Student Union.  Hotel-style Buildings A room with a bathroom is shared by two students. People congregate in a common area next to the service desks for academic and social events. Avent Ferry Avent Ferry Complex is a hotel-style housing option close to Avent Ferry Road and Western Boulevard. It consists of five structures with port-related names from North Carolina, one of which is devoted to the Black Male Initiative. Swan Quarter Hall's foyer houses the service desk and computer lab. There is a private bathroom in each room. North Hall North Hall is one of two hotel-style living alternatives and is conveniently situated on Hillsborough Street across from the Belltower. In addition to meeting space for events on the top level, the lobby also houses a service desk and a computer lab. There is a private bathroom in each room. For more information, visit: https://housing.dasa.ncsu.edu/find-a-community/residence-hall-options/  Apartment Options The comfort and convenience of the own apartment with the convenience of dorm life. Living in an on-campus apartment gives you independence and access to community and university resources. Choices are: Wolf Ridge Apartments Students interested in entrepreneurship work and play in NC State's only LEED Silver-certified green community. You can take advantage of outdoor dining and study spaces, convenient access to the Wolfline and a brief bicycle ride to the Wolf Ridge NC Farmer's Market, which is close to the cutting-edge Hunt Library. Wolf Village Apartments You may enjoy all the benefits of apartment living close to Western Boulevard at Wolf Village. Access to university resources, study spaces, resident advisors, a fitness centre, and volleyball fields are all available to you. The campus's academic buildings and Fountain Dining Hall are only a short distance away by foot, bicycle, or bus. E.S. King Village Apartments E.S. King Village is a varied, ethnic neighbourhood that offers more than just a place to sleep. You share your residence with graduate students, non-traditional undergraduates, visiting faculty, and academics. In the community garden or on the tennis, basketball, or volleyball courts, get to know your neighbours and make new friends. Western Manor Apartments With graduate and postdoctoral students, faculty, and staff employees as neighbours, Western Manor offers a peaceful neighbourhood close to the Main and Centennial campuses. The Wolfline, GoRaleigh, and GoTriangle buses are nearby and easily accessible. High-speed internet and cable are included. For more information, visit: https://housing.dasa.ncsu.edu/find-a-community/apartment-options/   Off-Campus Accommodation These two-bedroom furnished townhomes are conveniently situated 0.5 miles from CMAST. Apartments come furnished with a modern sofa, lounge chair, dinette table, four chairs, refrigerator, stove, and oven. Four students can stay in our two-bedroom apartments, which have extra-long twin beds, dressers, and built-in wardrobes.  For general enquiries, visit: https://housing.dasa.ncsu.edu/

Name: Bradley University
Overview: Bradley University is a top-ranked private university located in Peoria, Illinois. The university is accredited by the HLC (Higher Learning Commission). It was established in 1897 and comprised six undergraduate and five graduate colleges. The university offers more than 185 undergraduate and more than 30 graduate programs in their specific branch college. Some highly preferred courses at Bradley University are Business, Marketing, Management, related support services, Education, Communication, Journalism, Engineering and Health Profession and associated programs. The main campus of Bradley is located within Peoria, with an area of 84 acres. The university offers outstanding quality education and world-class research opportunities. The six undergraduate colleges at Bradley University are the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences, College of Education and Health Sciences, Caterpillar College of Engineering and Technology, Slane College of Communications and Fine Arts, Foster College of Business and Turner School of Entrepreneurship and Innovation. In addition, the Graduate Schools offer Master's degrees in Business, Education & Health Sciences, Communication & Fine Arts, Liberal Arts & Sciences and Engineering. All the Bradley graduates can take advantage of various career-related opportunities like internships, campus employment, part-time jobs, jobs at home and full-time jobs. These opportunities are provided by the Training & Placement Department of the University, The Smith Career Center, which is established to guide and assist students in exploring and defining their true career potential. The student-faculty ratio at Bradley is 12:1. Bradley's annual average cost of attendance is about USD35,480, excluding all the extra overheads. The university also provides students with need-based financial aid, grant awards, or scholarships for full-time undergraduates. Bradley University provides on-campus residences with 12 residence halls with 2,140 students. Most first-year students reside in campus residences. University also has a Student Apartment Complex and off-campus apartments for students with different choices.

Placement: Before enrolling in a language course at Bradley University, students who studied a foreign language in high school or at another college or university must complete a placement test in that language. To get credit for language coursework, students must enroll for courses at the placement level or higher. To be eligible for the B. A. degree, students must complete WL 201 (third semester) (see Undergraduate Catalog for details).To qualify for the B. A., students who test at the 202 level or higher must finish only one course at that level. Students may choose to take a course at a level higher than the listed placement level with the instructor's permission. Native and near-native speakers of the department's languages are placed individually based on their native language's level of linguistic proficiency.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation The university provides a safe and peaceful place for students who choose to study over here. The university ensures an inclusive environment where students can have fun and make memories together. Residence halls provided by the university are: Geisert Hall The Hilltop's pinnacle is occupied by Geisert, making its top floor one of the highest places in the Peoria region. The basement houses a cafeteria on campus. First-year and upper-level students live in Geisert together. With 385 students living there each year, it is co-ed by floor. For more information, visit: https://www.bradley.edu/campuslife/reslife/housing/geisert/  Harper Hall Bradley's main door is also visible from Harper, a seven-story dorm. With 282 residents each year, it contains a mixture of first-year and upper-level students. Wyckoff and Harper share a lobby. For more information, visit: https://www.bradley.edu/campuslife/reslife/housing/harper/  Heitz Hall Bradley's Global Living Learning Community, which unites students interested in learning about various cultures through global experiences, professional interests, and campus activities, is located in Heitz. On its four floors, the co-ed dorm houses 187 students, most of whom are sophomores. For more information, visit: https://www.bradley.edu/campuslife/reslife/housing/heitz/  University Hall Bradley's student-run Hilltop Studios are located in University, a five-story dorm, and Lydia's Lounge holds events all year long. 354 first-year students are housed in the co-ed dorm on each floor. For more information, visit: https://www.bradley.edu/campuslife/reslife/housing/university/  William's Hall The Honors Program Living Learning Community at Bradley is located in Williams and offers a dedicated academic atmosphere and events for Honors Program students. Williams also includes a cafeteria and a restaurant called Center Court. The five levels of the co-ed dorm, which has 381 predominantly upper-class residents, are each co-ed. For more information, visit: https://www.bradley.edu/campuslife/reslife/housing/williams/  Wyckoff Hall 170 first-year students live in Wyckoff, a five-story dorm. It shares a lobby with Harper and is coed by the floor. This building houses Bradley's Open Housing. There is no elevator in this building. For more information, visit: https://www.bradley.edu/campuslife/reslife/housing/wyckoff/  Single's Complex Three single-room dorms for upper-level students make up the Singles Complex: Elmwood, Lovelace, and Wendle halls. 162 students are housed in the building's coed floors overall. For more information, visit: https://www.bradley.edu/campuslife/reslife/housing/singles/   Student Apartment Complex (SAC) A non-smoking, six-story building on campus with 100 apartments is called the Student Apartment Complex. Each unfurnished apartment has a living area, a kitchenette, a bedroom, and a bathroom. For more information, visit: https://www.bradley.edu/campuslife/reslife/housing/sac/  St. James Apartments This off-campus housing complex for upper-class students is owned and run by Bradley University. The 16-building complex offers roomy one- to four-bedroom apartments with full kitchens, dishwashers, and electric stoves. There are laundry rooms in each building. For more information, visit: https://www.bradley.edu/campuslife/reslife/housing/stjames/  Main Street Commons The five-story, 197-bed Main Street Commons student housing complex is one block from the university. The complex offers two and three-bedroom homes open to sophomores, juniors, and seniors (coed living is optional). For more information, visit: https://www.bradley.edu/campuslife/reslife/housing/main-street/  For general enquiries, visit: https://www.bradley.edu/campuslife/reslife/housing/
Course Ranking: According to US News & World Report's Subject Ranking for 2021, Bradley University is ranked 201 for enrolling in UG Business courses. Before 2020, the university was ranked 167. The approach used by US News & World Report to rank subjects includes, among other things, considerations such as student selection (25%), the views of business school administrators (25%), and employment outcome (21%).

Name: Michigan Technological University
Overview: The Michigan Technological University is a university located in Houghton, USA. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Business. The main campus of Michigan Technological University is located in Houghton. The university offers over 10 undergraduate programs and 4 postgraduate programs. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. Michigan's premier technical university, consistently ranked among the best institutions in the nation for return on investment, provides more than 120 undergraduate and graduate degree programmes in the arts, business, and economics, as well as science, technology, engineering, and computing.Estimated average tuition and fees excluding miscellaneous expenditure for an international student is around 31,000 USD. Michigan Technological University offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. Read more details about Michigan Technological University on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.
Eligibility Overview: Admissions to the undergraduate programmeStudents must have a high school diploma from a recognized school or institution that is equivalent to a high school diploma in the United States. In the admissions process, your high school's cumulative GPA is taken into account. In terms of admission and merit-based scholarships, if you have both a weighted and an unweighted GPA, the university will use the one that is best for you. The university will not recalculate your GPA; rather, if your institution employs a different grading scale, it will convert it to a 4.0 scale. Apart from that, MTU accepts either the SAT or ACT score and makes no distinction between the two.Admissions to Postgraduate ProgramsAll programmes at MTU's Graduate School have minimum degree requirements. Additional requirements for each graduate programme may exist, which can be found on the course pages. In general, international applicants must have a bachelor's degree from a recognised university that is equivalent to a bachelor's degree earned in the United States. According to the course requirements, GMAT or GRE scores are required.Furthermore, in order to be considered for direct admission to a degree programme, all international graduate applicants from non-English speaking countries must demonstrate proof of English language proficiency.
Placement: For the year 2012, the placement rate at Michigan Technological University was 92.3 percent, with a knowledge rate of 68 percent. The average wage reported by 72 percent of Michigan Tech graduates in 2012 was roughly $35,000, with a median pay of $41,000.More than 70% of Michigan Tech students who graduated in 2012 obtained full-time work within six months of graduation. There were extremely few part-timers, although a small percentage - 15% - were accepted into elite universities for higher education other than Michigan Technological University.

Course Ranking: Only 70 of the more than 100 courses that Michigan Technological University provides at the undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral levels are provided by its graduate school. There are a variety of courses available in subjects including business, engineering, science, communication, etc. Michigan Technological University's UG business courses are ranked 350 by US News & World Report. The rankings have changed over the last two years; in 2019, the rating was #312, fell to #292 in 2020, and then rose to #350 in 2021.According to specialisation, the PG Engineering and Technology courses have been named among the top 100 Engineering courses in the USA for 2021. Chemical engineering comes in at 72, mechanical engineering at 65, and civil engineering at 55. The popularity of these specialities among applicants and the rise in the number of admissions applications led to the ranking of these specialisations for the first time in 2021.
University Ranking: According to US News & World Report's ranking for 2021, Michigan Technological University is ranked #153 nationwide in the USA. The rankings have risen from #136 in 2019 to #147 in 2020 and ultimately to #157 in 2021. The 74% acceptance percentage for the 2020 Fall intake is the cause of the rank position's ongoing rise. Because Michigan Technological University pays more attention to letters of reference than to a student's GPA or class rank, this selectivity rate is more acceptable there. Michigan Technological University is ranked #756 in the world according to US News & World Report. Similar patterns of rank improvement have been observed over time, with positions ranging from #734 in 2018 to #756 in 2021.Michigan Technological University ranks 601-650 according to the QS - World University Ranking 2021. It does relatively well in terms of citations per faculty (40.3), faculty-student ratio (27.9), academic reputation (only 5.8; 16.8 for overseas students), and employer reputation (7.2). This university has no overall score because it is ranked in the 700s in the QS World University Ranking.

Name: State University of New York (SUNY) at Oswego
Overview: Founded in 1861, the State University of New York (SUNY) at Oswego is a public university in Oswego, located in the northwest of Syracuse. Initially founded by Edward Austin Sheldon, as Oswego Primary Teachers’ Training School is now one of the largest institutions of Oswego. State University of New York (SUNY) at Oswego offers 70+ undergraduate majors, 70+ minors and more than 40 master’s programs. It has an average class size of 24 students, and 88% of the full-time faculty holds the highest degree in their field. A few of the most sorted subjects at State University of New York (SUNY) at Oswego are Accounting, Anthropology, Chemistry, Computer Science, Creative Writing, Finance, Geology, Geochemistry, Information Science, Journalism, Meteorology, Physics, Public Accounting, Theatre, Zoology and others. Apart from these programs, the university also offers certificate programs, 5-year programs, online programs and opportunities for extended learning. The tuition fee at the State University of New York (SUNY) at Oswego varies for in-state and out-of-state residencies. For example, the average tuition fee for NYS residencies is $7,070, and for out-of-state students, the tuition fee is $16,980. The student population at the university is represented from 40 countries with approximately 6,700 undergraduate students and 1,000 graduate students. Additionally, the State University of New York (SUNY) at Oswego has invested $750 million in modernizing and state-of-the-art buildings and facilities. State University of New York (SUNY) at Oswego offers scholarships for its students to make education more affordable. With financial aid and scholarships combined, the university provides awards worth $80 million annually. Additionally, about $7.4 million merit-based scholarships and awards are disbursed, and about 87% of students received some form of student aid. Thus, the State University of New York (SUNY) at Oswego offers a range of courses on disciplines like Spanish to Software Engineering and Theatre to Psychology. Students can choose their preferred subject from more than 70 minors.

Name: Dongguk University
Overview: Dongguk University Los Angeles (DULA) had its beginnings in Dr. Hong's clinic in Koreatown, Los Angeles, in 1976. The Royal University of America evolved from the clinic. Dongguk University Korea, a famous institution in South Korea, joined Royal University in January 1997. At its 30th anniversary celebration in 2009, the university was rededicated as Dongguk University Los Angeles.The university's mission is to create a network of knowledgeable medical professionals and to offer affordable healthcare to the local population. It is committed to excellence in clinical training, learning, teaching, and producing highly qualified medical professionals. Dongguk University's main campus is located in Los Angeles.For different courses, the average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ. Scholarships, work-study, and other forms of financial aid are available to students at Dongguk University. In addition, the institution has a Career Planning Service team that assists students in developing a CV and locating employment, whether it be after graduation, part-time work, summer work, or an internship.The anticipated tuition for Dongguk University Los Angeles' Master of Science in Oriental Medicine (MSOM) program is $51,201. Name: Missouri State University
Overview: Missouri State University founded in 1905, is located in Missouri, United States. There are 26,001 students in total in the university, out of which 20,681 are undergraduates and 3,709 are postgraduates. There are two campuses of the university, one being the Springfield campus and the other being in West Plains. Having a campus size of 225 acres, Missouri State University( MSU) follows a semester-based academic calendar. The college provides various programs- graduate, undergraduate, master's, and doctorate along with 100 majors and 50 minors. Some of the popular courses taught here are- Accounting, Agriculture Education, Anthropology, Computer Science, Counselling, Business Administration, Chemistry and many more. Each class has a student- faculty ratio of 21:1. Missouri State University provides on-campus accommodation as well as meal plan options for its students. It lets the students choose from the 8 different residential halls and 2 apartments available. Students are provided with amenities like- community-style bathrooms, a microwave & small fridge in the room, cable tv, WIFI, community TV lounge, community kitchen, and 24-hour computer lab. There are over 300 organizations where students can engage in. They are responsible for planning and organizing concerts, lectures, special events, etc. The different organizations include- Advertising Club, Advocates, Agronomy, Aerialists, and many more. Missouri State University's tuition is 7,750 USD for in-state and 15,910 USD for out-of-state students. This amount includes tuition fees but the amount may increase or decrease depending on the utilization of amenities like- library services, student gym facilities, student centers, technology resources, and campus health centers. Both need and merit-based scholarships or financial aid are provided by the MSU. Need-based aid is determined by the student's family's demonstrated ability to pay for college, as calculated by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid, known as the FAFSA.
Eligibility Overview: Missouri State University's eligibility criteria and English language requirements for undergraduate and postgraduate admissions are as follows:Indian Undergraduate Academic RequirementsThe following eligibility standards must be met by Indian students:Students must present a statement of grades or examination certificate from a recognised examination board, such as a higher secondary certificate from the CBSE, ICSE, Delhi Board, or other state boards.Certificates of 10+2 or intermediate level education are necessary.Indian Postgraduate Academic RequirementsThe following eligibility standards must be met by Indian students:A recognized institution or university must award a bachelor's, master's, postgraduate diploma, or certificate.Individual mark papers from approved institutions, comprising subject grades and courses for all years of post-secondary education, are required.Other Requirements for UndergraduatesThe following are the minimal requirements for undergraduate admissions:English, mathematics, social studies, science, fine arts, and academic electives should all be included in the high school core curriculum.On a scale of 4.0, a 3.23 GPA is necessary.Some courses require the SAT or ACT.Additional Postgraduate PrerequisitesThe following eligibility standards must be met by students:A bachelor's degree from a well-known university or college is required.A 2.75 grade point average out of a possible 4.0Some courses need the GRE or GMAT.

Name: University of Hartford
Overview: The University of Hartford, established in the year 1957, is a private university. It is affiliated with the National Association of Independent Colleges and University and Space Grant. In a suburban setting of 350 acres of land, the university is located in West Hartford, Connecticut, USA. With 7 schools and colleges on the campus, the university has a student-faculty ratio of 9:1. The University of Hartford offers 82 bachelor's degrees, 10 associate degrees, 28 graduate degrees and 7 certificate or diploma courses. Popular majors chosen by the students include Business Management, Visual and Performing Arts, Engineering, Marketing, related Support Services, etc.; students can opt for either full-time or part-time or online programs. An Annual Cost of attendance at the University of Hartford will be 56,599 USD. The university provides financial aid in the form of Academic Scholarships, Talent SCholarships other need-based scholarships. It has an acceptance rate of 76%. The campus is followed by a semester-based academic calendar. There are also 100+ clubs, including fraternities and sororities, on campus for students to explore their talents. The Hartford athletic team, known by the name Hawks, participates in NCAA Division I. There are 18 varsity sports teams, 9 for men and 9 for women, which actively engages in intercollegiate competitions. The university provides on-campus accommodation for students in various complexes, apartments and villa-style apartments. A general library, called Mortensen Library, serves academic purposes on-campus.

Name: State University of New York at Old Westbury ( SUNY Old Westbury )
Overview: State University of New York at Old Westbury ( SUNY Old Westbury) is a public institution established in 1965. It is situated at 223 Store Hill Road Campus Center H-310, Old Westbury, NY 11568, U.S, and accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education (MSCHE). The council on Education for Public Health accredits the B.S in Health and Society at the university. The college offers 43 undergraduate and 16 graduate courses and 3 certificate programs, utilizing a semester-based academic calendar. Popular majors and minors the student receives are business administration, liberal arts, criminology, psychology, biological science, visual arts and other professional studies, along with getting micro-credentials in several spheres such as business taxation, forensic accounting, etc. State University of New York at Old Westbury academic catalogue highlights all the necessary information about the institution's policies, maps, directories, and curriculum. State University of New York at Old Westbury’s acceptance rate is 78%, and both the in-state and out-of-state tuition fee ranges from ($8,122-$18,032). State University of New York at Old Westbury ( SUNY Old Westbury) has gained recognition by securing several prestigious titles. According to U.S News, the institution has ranked (131-171th) in the 2022 edition of Best Colleges in Regional Universities North, 11th in Top Performers on Social Mobility. The college has received the 2021 Higher Education Excellence in Diversity (HEED) Award from INSIGHT Into Diversity magazine, marking it one of the colleges indebted to diversity and inclusion. The university ranked among Study.com’s list of Top 50 colleges based on Racial and cultural diversity. Apart from providing a plethora of facilities, State University of New York at Old Westbury ( SUNY Old Westbury) offers numerous student services, including accommodation, nonremedial tutoring, placement service, etc. The college aims at fostering academic excellence through exceptional training facilities and interaction among the students and the facilitator.

A minimum score of 550 on the paper version, 213 on the computer version, or 80 on the Internet version is necessary for graduate entrance.On the International English Language Testing System, a minimum composite score of 6.0 is required (IELTS). A minimum IELTS score of 6.5 is required for graduate admissions.

Name: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State university
Overview: The Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State university is a university located in Blacksburg, USA. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Business. The main campus of Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State university is located in Blacksburg. The majority of students who are accepted have completed more than the minimum requirements and have a grade point average of at least a B+.Language Requirements in EnglishApplicants whose first language is not English must take ONE of the following examinations to establish English competency.English as a Foreign Language Exam (TOEFL)The International English Language Testing System (IELTS) is a system for (IELTS)The Pearson Tests of English (PTE) are a set of tests developed by Pearson.DuolingoInternational students whose first language is not English must submit an IELTS, TOEFL, PTE, or Duolingo score to demonstrate English language ability.To be eligible for admission to Virginia Tech, students must achieve an IELTS score of at least 6.5 with no subscore below 6.5.Students taking the PTE must get a minimum score of 53.Virginia Tech requires students to have scores of: Depending on the type of TOEFL utilised, Virginia Tech wants students to have scores of:At least 80 on an internet-based test, with no sector sub-score below 16.At least 233 points on a computer-based testAt least 550 on a paper-based testStudents who take the Duolingo exam must achieve at least 105 out of 100.

Name: Jacksonville State University
Overview: The Jacksonville University (JSU) in Jacksonville, Alabama, is a public, not-for-profit institution. The university is located between Atlanta and Birmingham. The main campus is at Appalachian Foothills in Northeast Alabama, with two satellite campuses: The Little River Canyon Centre Campus and Mcclellan Campus. The institution offers bachelor's, master's, Education Specialist and Doctorate Degrees and Continuing Education Opportunities and Certificate Programs. The university offers 95 academic programs, over 40 online programs for distance learning, 46 undergraduate programs, and 31 postgraduate programs. It provides studies under the following schools: Arts and Humanities; Business and Industry; Education; Nursing and Health Professions; Human Services and Social Sciences and Science. Its most popular courses are Liberal Arts and Humanities, Business and Nursing. The estimated cost for an undergraduate study would be 24,040 USD annually, and for graduate degrees would be 32,820 USD annually (including tuition, application, health insurance and textbooks). The estimated cost for housing/dormitory would be 5,500 USD (approx.) per year, with meals costing 3,520 USD (approx) per year. There are scholarships available for students and research opportunities, and are provided by private organisations in the USA and India. After graduating from the university, the average salary is 30,300 USD per year, and it is estimated that after ten years of graduating, it increases to 37000 per year (average), which is 8% higher than the national mean of 34,000 USD per year.

Name: Tuskegee University
Overview: Tuskegee University, or TU, is a private university in Tuskegee, Alabama, established by Lewis Adams & Booker T. Washington in 1881. TU is the first African-American college popularly known as a National Historic Site and Registered National Historic Landmark. TU offers more than 60 programs organized into three schools and five colleges with bachelor's, Masters, and Doctoral programs. The popular majors are Psychology, Aerospace, Aeronautical, Marketing, Agri Business, Biology, and more. Tuskegee's campus is spread over an area of 5,000 acres having a cultural environment surrounded by various historical places. In addition, the three schools are The School of Nursing & Allied Health, The School of Education & The Robert R. Taylor School of Architecture and Construction Science. At Tuskegee, the student-faculty ratio is 14:1. Tuskegee offers mandatory accommodation for Sophomore & first-year students, and in the junior & senior years, they can stay off-campus. At the same time, you study, full-time, part-time jobs, paid internships and training for the overall development of students. In addition, University has a placement cell known as Handshake that brings in various career opportunities for students like work. The average university cost of attendance is about 22,614 a year which can differ in different courses. They also offer financial assistance to students through loans, scholarships based on other criteria, and grants.
Eligibility Overview: The preferred applicant will have earned a 21 ACT Composite Score or 1080 SAT Score (Evidence-Based Reading and Writing + Math) and an unweighted 3.0 cumulative high-school grade point average. While the decision is based upon the factors listed above, students must have completed the following course requirements in their high school curriculum:English - Four (4) yearsSocial Studies - Three (3) yearsMathematics - Three (3) years (This must include one year of Algebra I, one year of Algebra II, and one year of Geometry, Trigonometry, Calculus,or Analysis)Science - Two (2) years (This must include one year of Biology and one year of a Physical Science)Note: Course requirements differ for students seeking to major in Nursing, Health Science, or Occupational Therapy.Preferred high school curriculum for students seeking to major in nursing, health science, or occupational therapy:English - Four (4) yearsSocial Studies - One (1) yearMathematics -  Two (2) years (This must include one year of Algebra I and one year of Algebra II, Geometry, Trigonometry, Calculus, or Analysis)Science - Two (2) years (One year of a Chemistry and One year of Biological Science)
Placement: Career Education and Leadership Development CenterTuskegee University's Career Education and Leadership Development Center's main goal is to help students achieve their professional and personal goals through internships, cooperative education, full-time employment, or admission to graduate or professional institutions.It is the campus entity in charge of teaching students self-evaluation and career planning skills. It offers students on-the-job training, limited financial aid for university studies, and assistance in finding full-time employment.Employers and graduate/professional school teachers can also use the center to develop human resources for full-time job opportunities. The Center focuses on establishing and deepening relationships with employers and graduate schools.Check: https://www.tuskegee.edu/programs-courses/career-development-placement

Name: Mercer University
Overview: Mercer University is one of the oldest institutions of higher education in the United States of America. The main campus of the university is located in Macon, Georgia. Every year, it enrolls around 8759 students in its campus area of 150 acres. The student population comprises about 13% of international students from around 56 countries around the globe. In the beginning, it was known as Mercer Institute when it was founded by several Georgia Baptists in 1833. Later, it gained university status in 1837. Around 12 colleges and schools are run under Mercer University that offers a variety of subjects. It has more than 15 student organizations or clubs. Other campuses of Mercer University are located in Columbus, Atlanta, and Savannah. The campus has several recreational areas such as a swimming pool, meeting halls, basketball area, etc. Pharmacy, Human Services, Pharmacy, Theology, Nursing, Engineering, Music, Medicine, Liberal Arts, Health, Journalism, are popular subjects offered in the university. Students can enroll for master's, bachelor's, and doctoral degrees. Mercer University has been ranked among the best private colleges in the US. Several renowned personalities were the students of this university such as James Henderson, popular author Steve Berry, John Birch. It also ensures that students get placed at renowned companies. For this, it provides assistance to guide the students for resume making, mock interviews, and many more. The campus placement rating is around 92% for the graduates. It is mandatory for the students to live in the hostels up to age 22. Students are free to opt for full-time, part-time, and online programs as well. The average tuition fee can cost around 37,508 USD every year. Hence, after opting for the hostel, and other miscellaneous charges, the average cost of living can be around 52,592 USD per annum.
Eligibility Overview: Standardized Test Scores: An SAT score of 1280 is necessary, as well as an ACT composite score of at least 27.Official transcripts from a high school or college degree with a 3.94 GPA or above. Placement: The University's Center for Career and Professional Development is in charge of all campus students' placements, and it makes use of the handshake online database and software to do so. The specialists at the centre can help you prepare a resume, prepare for interviews, and efficiently search for opportunities.Employers are also invited to visit the university to place students. In comparison to the national average of USD 33,028 per year, 92 percent of college students are able to find work within two years of graduation, earning roughly USD 48,200 per year.
Accommodation: Students in their first, second, and third years are required to live on campus until they reach the age of 22.There are four traditional residence halls with community restrooms, five type accommodation halls, and four apartment-style residence halls with kitchens on campus. Name: Yeshiva University
Overview: Yeshiva is a private university established in 1886 and located in New York. It is an independent institution accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education. It has four campuses within the city - Wilf Campus, Israel Henry Beren Campus; Brookdale Campus; and Jack and Pearl Resnick Campus. Yeshiva University has four undergraduate schools - Yeshiva College, Stem College for Women, Katz School of Science and Health, and Syms School of Business. All of these offers a dual curriculum inspired by Modern Centrist Orthodox Judaismäó»s Hashkafa (philosophy) of Torah Umadda (Secular knowledge), combining academic education with the Torah study. The University also supports 3 undergraduate schools, 7 graduate and professional schools with renowned affiliates such as Albert Einstein College of Medicine (first university-funded hospital in New York) and Rabbi Isaac Elchanan Theological Seminary, a diverse multitude of academic centres and institutes. Presently the university offers education in several disciplines, including Business, Law, Economics, Psychology, Social Work, and Medicine. The majority of students are of the Jewish faith, except students enrolled in the Cardozo School of Law, The School of Business, Graduate school of Psychology, mostly are not Jewish. The university has residential facilities separately for men and women. It has in-house dormitories, rental housing facilities outside and close to the campuses are also available. The estimated yearly hostel and meals expenses would cost 9,712 USD. Scholarships are provided on a need-based standard. Two university graduate schools offer full fee waiver scholarships to the YU alumni accepted to the Albert Einstein College of Medicine and the School of Law. The application cost for international students to the university is 65 USD.

Placement: Internships Internships are a great method for students to obtain significant work experience and explore career options in fields related to their major while also fulfilling their degree requirements. Several degrees require an internship, and students might choose to complete more as an elective. Students can obtain internships on their own, with the help of the faculty internship advisor, family and friends, or the Vocation and Professional Development office. Students' Instructions Before you may register for the internship class, you must first acquire an internshipInternship requirements include 120-150 hours of learning new skills (depending on your major). This could be accomplished through a company-sponsored internship, a part-time job, or specific tasks at your existing workplacePlease arrange an appointment with Career Services through Handshake if you need help finding an internship  Placement Policy for Mathematics Students who have not had college-level math transfer credit will be placed in courses based on their math SAT, ACT, or TSI scores when they first enrol at Concordia. It will be decided by the score that positions them at the highest level. Students who do not have math test scores or who want to improve their placement must complete the ALEKS assessment.    The three developmental math courses offered at Concordia are MTH 0220 Developmental Quantitative Literacy, and  MTH 0313 Fundamentals of Math, MTH 0320 Intermediate Algebra. Students enrol in these courses for two to three hours of credit, but they do not receive college credit (as indicated by the 0 in the course number, e.g., MTH 0313); as a result, their GPA is unaffected. These courses are graded as CR (credit) or NC (no credit) (no credit). These credit hours are added to the amount required for scholarships, grants, and other financial aid.  Placement Policy for English Students who have not had transfer credit for college-level English will be placed in courses based on their Reading/Writing SAT or Reading/English ACT scores when they first enrol at Concordia. It will be decided by the score that positions them at the highest level. A placement level is not allocated to a student who does not have ACT or SAT scores.

Name: University of San Diego
Overview: The University of San Diego is a private Roman Catholic university in San Diego. The university was founded in 1949 as two different institutions, the San Diego College for Women and San Diego University. After completing the unification of the two universities in 1970, the university now has nine undergraduate and graduate colleges. They offer 89 programs, including 43 undergraduate and 34 graduate courses. The top courses at the University of San Diego include Masters in Business Administration (MBA), MS in Applied Data Science and BBA in Marketing. The average annual cost of studying at the university comes to around USD 71,000, with the fee structure varying from course to course.

Undergraduate students must meet the following subject-specific requirements:Indian Students' Country-Specific RequirementsA Class 12 Board exam or a plus two qualification is required. Admission requires official transcripts from the respective university. A minimum of 3.4 grade points is required. The documentation required for admission must be written in English. They must be translated into English if not. Additionally, students must demonstrate their English competence.Indian undergraduates: Depending on the course, the general requirements may be greater. ACT and SAT scores will not be considered until the fall of 2024.Indian Graduates/Postgraduates: Students must pass the GRE or GMAT, depending on the department's requirements. Name: Northwestern University
Overview: Northwestern University in Evanston, Illinois, is a private research university founded in 1851. Comprising 12 undergraduate, graduate, and professional schools, Northwestern offers 124 undergraduate and 145 professional programs. About 96 majors, 89 minors and various certificate courses are available. Economics, Law, Medicine, Chemistry, Business, Materials Engineering, Journalism and Communications are some of the most sought-after courses. Also, many undergraduates enrol in dual programs that the university offers under its interdisciplinary learning. Northwestern Pritzker School of Law is one of the nation's best law schools, and almost all graduates are offered great jobs.Northwestern University is one of the founding members of the Big Ten Conference and has 19 athletic teams and many club sports. The acceptance rate of 9% implies how selective admissions are to the highly ranked university. The average undergraduate tuition and fee is 76317 USD, while that for graduate programs varies per the school and program.Companies visit the campus in huge numbers and recruit many graduates giving excellent opportunities and well-paid jobs. On average, 95% of graduates get employed within six months of graduation with an annual salary of 82,000 USD.
Eligibility Overview: English Language ProficiencyFor applicants whose first/primary language is not English or who did not attend secondary school in English, an English proficiency score is necessary. English proficiency results cannot be self-reported; they must be submitted as part of the application to the relevant testing organisation.Official scores from the following exams are accepted by Northwestern:Duolingo English Test (DET)IELTS, including IELTS IndicatorTOEFL IBT, including TOEFL IBT Special Home Edition but not TOEFL ITP Plus for China SolutionWhile Northwestern does not have a minimum score requirement, successful applicants have a high level of English proficiency and often score in the upper range on all areas of the exams we accept.
Accommodation: Housing ModelsResidence halls and residential colleges are the two most common accommodation options. The main distinction between them is the level of faculty participation. Residence halls provide all of the programmes and services that a student requires to have a positive residential experience. Residential colleges provide more chances for faculty engagement and programming, as well as community continuity, thanks to a culture of returning residents and long-term academic affiliations.Check here: https://www.northwestern.edu/living/incoming-undergraduates/housing-options.html
Course Ranking: Popular majors offered at Northwestern University include in neuroscience, psychology, political science, journalism, econometrics, and quantitative economics. Some of Northwestern University's most well-known graduate programmes are the Pritzker School of Law, the School of Education and Social Policy, and the Kellogg School of Management. Northwestern is well-known for its athletic programmes in addition to its academic achievements. Students, employers, and ranking services all laud Northwestern's business courses. For four years running, Bloomberg has ranked Northwestern among the top 10 business schools in the US.Since 2018, QS has also placed it among the top 15 global MBA programmes. For the past four years, US News has also listed it as one of the US's top 10 graduate business schools. Its Engineering and Technology ranking has risen in QS rankings, which heavily weigh an educational institution's academic and employer reputations. THE, on the other hand, places a greater emphasis on teaching, research, and citations and has seen a decline in its PG Engineering and Technology position from 23rd in 2018 to 30th in 2023.
