Name: Southern Methodist University
Overview: Southern Methodist University or SMU is a private university located in Texas, Dallas. It has a top-rated global research centre offering 100 majors and 85 minors for undergraduates, and for graduates and professional degrees, 120 programs are designed for a wide range of fields. Some popular undergraduate programs at university are Computer Science, Economics, Business, Psychology, Accounting, Electrical Engineering, Applied Physiology & Health Management, and Journalism. The Main Campus of the University is located in Highland Park and University Park in Dallas-Fort, straight west of US Route 75. Apart from this, there are two more branch campuses. One is the Taos Campus situated at Fort Burgwin, outside Taos, New Mexico, where classes between semesters and intercessions are held. And the other one is Plano Campus, located in Plano, Texas. This branch campus hosts SMU Guildhall, Video Game Design School and other Graduate level courses. At Southern Methodist, the student-faculty ratio is 11:1. The annual in-state Cost of Attendance at SMU for undergraduates is about USD58,540, exclusive of additional expenses. The university also offers some need-based financial help to undergraduates in financial aid or grant awards, like USD22,114. The university provides residential facilities to students having a capacity of 3000 students in the campus. In addition, there are about 7 upper-division halls and 11 common residences. Southern Methodist University provides students various opportunities to enhance their theoretical knowledge, skills, potential, and earn while studying there. The Official Placement department of the University, Handshake job board, brings in career options for students like Career Fairs, Internships, On-campus and off-campus employment, Work-Study jobs, SMU Telephony and Resident Life and Student Housing jobs for the students while they reside in the campus accommodation.

Name: Colorado State University
Overview: Established in 1870, Colorado State University is a public land-grant research university. Located in Fort Collins of Colorado, CSU is a leading public institution that ranks 153 in National Universities and is named as one of the best doctoral universities. Occupying an area of 4,773 acres, the university has an expenditure of $ 407 million in research and one amongst the few universities in the U.S. which is regarded as Innovation and Economic Prosperity University. CSU offers more than 300 academic programs, including 70 major degrees, 80 minor degrees, and pre-professional advising courses. Most of the major degrees offer concentration options as many as 140 vivid courses. Apart from curriculum and academics, CSU provides housing to more than 5,000 students in its residence halls and university apartments. Depending on students' needs, various types of residence halls are there in CSU, starting from Academic village with suite-style rooms to Durward Hall consisting of community-style rooms. The eight colleges, namely Agricultural Sciences, Business, Walter Scott, Jr. College of Engineering, Health and Human Science, Liberal Arts, Natural Sciences, Veterinary Medicine and Biomedical Sciences, and Warner College of Natural Resources, have almost 2,000 faculty members. Students also get involved in the 325 vivid student organizations, 30 sports clubs, and 34 honor societies for a holistic appeal. The cost of attendance for a full-time off-campus undergraduate Colorado resident is $ 28,401, and that of an on-campus student is $ 29,595. COA for a full-time undergraduate Colorado non-resident is approximately $ 50,000. If students can manage for financial aid via scholarships, the cost goes down to $ 20,000, as well.
Eligibility Overview: Students must complete the major requirements as well as the All-University Core Curriculum in order to graduate. A major is a set of courses in a subject area or discipline that, when combined with the necessary supporting courses, leads to a degree. A major requires a minimum of 27 semester credits. The completion of a major appears on the student's diploma as well as their academic record (transcript). Students might choose to fulfil the criteria for two or more majors at the same time. Students must complete all prerequisites for each degree in order to graduate with more than one major (some majors will accept, as fulfilling their own category 4A-C requirements, the fulfilment of the category 4A-C requirements in another declared major the student completes).Common requirements may count toward each major's curricular requirements, but each major must have at least 27 distinct credits. Check out the criteria for multiple degrees as well.for more information click on this link-https://catalog.colostate.edu/general-catalog/graduate-bulletin/admissions-requirements-procedures/

Use the links below to learn more about the resident halls and university flats, as well as specific services provided by Housing & Dining.for more information click on this link-https://housing.colostate.edu/housing/

Name: New York Film Academy
Overview: The New York Film Academy was founded in 1992 and is currently in New York City. The WASC accredited the college and a for-profit film and acting school. With more than 5,000 students annually, the New York Film Academy has been beaming in its glory. The college offers multiple programs at the undergraduate and postgraduate levels. Popular subjects include filmmaking, cinematography, musical theatre, digital editing, acting for films, 3D animation, photography, etc. The school's infrastructure has been impressive, providing an array of exciting facilities for the help of the students. These include library access, a learning resources director, high-speed Internet access, a DVD movie collection, a screening room, etc. The students receive personalized lessons from the tutors. The New York Film Academy has been instrumental in inviting international applicants. Their acceptance rate of 100% makes selection easier for international students. The college conducts classes across ten locations and campuses, including Australia, Italy, France, China, and Russia outside the US.While the student-faculty ratio of 20:1 might sound slightly high, it justifies the increasing number of international students in the college, currently at 2,390. The healthy partnerships with leading brand names in the show business help gather jobs with high pay and flexible time schedules.Moreover, the New York Film Academy fee structure is affordable for most students, ranging between $10,000 and $15,000. An application fee of $75 is also included in this amount.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Requirements: All applicants to New York Film Academy programmes and seminars must have a high school diploma or an accepted equivalent. There is no minimum GPA requirement, but students must be able to communicate in English and have a strong desire to learn more about the art and skill of visual storytelling.An Admissions Committee member will interview applicants in English over the phone or in person. English Requirements:

Placement: Because of the rigorous, project-based curriculum, New York Film Academy students accomplish more in less time than students at other acting and film schools. In a single year, a filmmaking student at this university will write, film, direct, and edit eight films and work on the crews of 28 others.The New York Film Academy's Industry Lab gives students hands-on experience working on substantial projects for business clients.Netflix, Universal, Elle Magazine, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, NBC, Fox, HBO, BBC, Colombia Pictures, Warner Brothers Inc., ABC, and many other well-known organisations are among the top employers of the New York Film Academy graduates. The Bill Duke Media Foundation, Twinkie Byrd, and Jenny Lewis are some of Industry Lab's clients and endeavours. Regardless of the client or project, students leave with a new learning experience and a deeper appreciation for their vocation.Graduates typically earn USD 55,000 in their first job (4,266,402 INR).
Accommodation: Off-Campus Accommodation: In total, 20% of the students live in a student housing complex that Educational Housing Services owns and operates. In New York City, lodging is typically pricey in the USA. For students who wish to reside in a dormitory, the New York Film Academy offers double room accommodations and a minimal number of single rooms. Depending Student housing costs approximately $1800 per person per month. Another depending on how long the programme is option is apartment living. A furnished shared apartment in the New York City area typically costs between $1000 and $2500 per person per month. Studio apartments can be had for as cheap as $2200 per month when furnished. For both long- and short-term stays, students can rent shared apartments.

Name: Rice University
Overview: Private research university Rice University, sometimes known as William Marsh Rice University, is located in Houston, Texas. Chartered in 1891, the university has seven schools: the School of Architecture, School of Humanities and The Shepherd School of Music. There are over 50 undergraduate majors and several graduate programs, like Bioengineering, Philosophy, Music History, Data Science and Energy Economics. Over 300 continuing studies courses (for professionals, educators and students) are offered across 20 study areas like Effective Public Speaking, Liberal Studies, Aerospace and Aviation Academy etc. Interdisciplinary programs, certificate courses and professional programs include Military Science, Civil Leadership, Pre Law (Advising), Undergraduate Business Minor etc. Rice Business Executive Education offers courses like Corporate Innovation, Finance & Accounting and Effective Strategy Formation. Rice Online allows students access credit courses, degree programs and professional development courses like Computer Science, Foundations of Mindfulness and America Through Foreign Eyes. The estimated undergraduate cost of attendance is USD 71,745, and the tuition for graduate students is USD 26,035 per term. Financial aids include loans, scholarships, grants, student employment like Grad PLUS Loans, Federal Pell Grant, Merit scholarships, Rice Work, etc. 88% of Rice University MBA graduates find employment within three months of program completion and earn an average base salary of USD 123,786.
Eligibility Overview: There are national eligibility requirements for Rice University. The following qualifications are listed as acceptable for Indian students: Requirements For Undergraduate Studies In addition to the midterm results for Grade 12, applicants must also provide authentic transcripts for grades 9 through 11. The application must, by law, be accompanied by the board test results. The university accepts results from the CBSE, CICSE and State boards. Rice looks for students who exhibit intellectual vibrancy through their course choices and academic achievement. Most applicants will push themselves by making use of the challenging coursework offered to them. Students must finish the following requirements at a minimum: Obtain high SAT or ACT scoresObtain high school credits: 16 in total Requirements For Graduates A minimum 3.0-Grade Point Average is required to graduate from an accredited university to apply for a master's degree. Additionally, some courses could ask applicants to submit their GRE or GMAT results.  PhD Requirements and Research-Based Courses The following are the primary academic prerequisites for enrollment in a graduate research or PhD programme at Rice University:Research-focused master's degree; orA first- or second-class bachelor's degree with honours;Demonstrated ability to carry out independent PhD-level research.Additionally, candidates must present a compelling research plan. English Proficiency Requirements

Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation Rice University's Housing Services department encompasses Undergraduate Housing, Residential Dining, Graduate Apartments, and Summer Conference servicesRice University's undergraduate experience is structured around the residential college system. The residential college system is organised into 11 colleges and is one of the university's self-governing componentsGraduate students can choose from furnished apartments with a range of floor layouts, and the Rice Shuttle Service offers quick access to and from campus, nearby supermarkets, and retail centres. On-campus housing can be found here. Off-Campus Accommodation The average monthly rent is between USD 750 and USD 950Studio flats, 3 bedroom apartments, 4 bedroom apartments, and shared apartments are also availableHardwood floors, granite countertops, a washer/dryer, refrigerator, microwave, range, dishwasher, couch, coffee table, dining room set, bed frame, desk and chair, and closets are included in each student apartmentWithin this safe gated neighbourhood with 24-hour security, the apartments have all of the required conveniences Off-campus housing link
Course Ranking: When it comes to course rankings, major rating publishers really like Rice University's business courses. From 2016 to 2019, Bloomberg maintained Rice University's ranking among the top 50 business schools in the USA. But Rice's ranking on Bloomberg has fallen from eighth in 2016 to thirty-first in 2019. From 2016 to 2020, Financial Times will continue to list Rice among the top international MBA programmes. The 2020 FT rankings have Rice at 57th place. In its Accounting & Finance ranking, QS (Top universities) placed Rice between 151-200 in 2020 and 2021. From 2018 to 2021, QS has ranked Rice in the top 100 global MBA ranking services.Since 2018, Rice has been ranked among the top 50 graduate business schools in the USA by US News & World Report. This information shows how well-known Rice University's business programmes are in the US. Moreover, Rice's MBA programme enjoys international repute. Since 2018, THE has ranked Rice among the top 100 universities for postgraduate engineering and technology. In terms of its rankings for several engineering courses, US News has also ranked Rice among the top 100 universities. Since 2017, THE has ranked Rice in the top 100 in its PG Computers list. In addition to the business courses, ranking providers also like Rice's computer courses.
University Ranking: Famous private research institution Rice University is headquartered in Houston, Texas, in the United States. From 2016 through 2019, the Academic Ranking of World Universities (Shanghai Ranking) ranked Rice outside the top 100 institutions. It was reduced to 101-150 in 2020, though. From 2017 through 2021, Rice was ranked by QS (Top Universities) as one of the top 100 universities in the world. From 2017 through 2019, Times Higher Education (THE) ranked Rice among the top 100 universities worldwide. The THE lowered Rice's position, nevertheless, to 105th in 2020 and 124th in 2021. This illustrates a decline in Rice's performance on key ranking factors like teaching, citation, and research.In its list of the top international universities, US News & World Report has also moved Rice down one spot, from 108th place in 2020 to 128th place. However, since its publication of its national university rating in 2018, US News has consistently maintained Rice University among the top 20 institutions. When it comes to research universities in the USA, Rice is a well-known institution. Rice University Ranking

Name: University of Florida
Overview: The University of Florida is a public research institute in Gainesville. With an acceptance rate of 37%. It has approximately 57,841 students across undergraduate, graduate and professional degree programs. The university offers 100 undergraduate majors, 200 graduate programs and 30 certificate courses. The UF Distance Learning initiative also allows students to participate in off-campus programs around Florida.International students must provide proof of their English Proficiency by taking either IELTS or TOEFL.The University of Florida International Center's study abroad programs enables students to study in over 70 nations worldwide. The estimated undergraduate cost of attending is USD 21,430 for in-state students (additional USD 22,278 for out-of-state) and graduate tuition fee is USD 29,440 for in-state students (additional USD 17,394 for out-of-state). Students can apply for financial aid like grants, loans, scholarships and student employment. Some options include Florida Bright Futures, Graduate PLUS, Federal Pell Grant, Douglas Turner Grant, Ryan McKee Scholarship etc.
Eligibility Overview: English proficiency is required of all applicants, regardless of citizenship. Non-native English speakers are encouraged to take English proficiency exams such as the TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo English Test, although they are not necessary for freshman entrance. All freshmen applicants must provide their SAT or ACT scores.
Accommodation: University of Florida housing is available on and off-campus and comprises suites, apartments, singles, doubles and triples with dining and recreational services. Accommodation is available at Beaty Towers, Cypress Hall, Keys Complex and more. Students can engage in several extracurricular activities with around 1,000 student organisations (194 cultural and fine arts clubs) and 60 intramural and sports clubs.On Campus AccommodationAll students, including UG, PG, and students with families, have access to on-campus accommodation.All students have access to a dining facility at the university.Laundry, World Class Wireless - High-Speed Internet Access, Cable TV, Nighttime Security Patrols, and 24/7 Area Desk Services are among the amenities available.All of the residence halls are within walking distance of the university.Visit:- https://housing.ufl.edu/Off Campus AccommodationThe average monthly rent is between USD 500 and USD 800.Students can choose from one to four bedroom flats.Wifi, gas, laundry, cable, water, electricity, and air conditioning are examples of major amenities.The units are mostly fully equipped.Near the University of Florida and Santa Fe College, the majority of the apartments are available.Visit:- https://www.apartments.com/gainesville-fl/500-to-1000/student-housing/http://www.trimarkproperties.com/gainesville/apartments/uf-student-apartments/
Course Ranking: Business courses at the University of Florida are highly ranked when it comes to course rankings. In the 2022 QS rankings, the Global MBA course is ranked 63rd. The Business and Economics course is ranked 86th in the 2022 Times Higher Education rankings.Engineering and Technology are ranked between 200 and 250th in THE subject rankings when it comes to the University of Florida's engineering courses. When we compare the rankings of this course in 2022 to those of the previous two years, they have fallen. According to THE, the Engineering and Technology course was ranked between 176 and 200 in 2021 and 2020. Similar to this, the ranking for the computer science course has dropped. In 2022, it occupies the 301–400th position, up from the 201-250th position in 2021.
University Ranking: According to the Best Colleges Rankings published by U.S. News & World Report in 2022, the University of Florida is a top 5 public research university. One of the top colleges in the country overall, it fosters knowledge that shapes the future, discoveries that change lives, health care that saves lives, and community development for the state, the country, and the entire world.When it comes to the University of Florida's ranking, U.S. News & World Report places it in the 28th spot among national universities in 2022. The University of Florida is ranked 99th in the world among universities according to U.S. News & World Report. When compared to U.S. News' rankings from the previous year, the ranks in both categories have improved. In the area of international universities, the University of Florida was ranked #107 and #30 in the US in 2021. Consult the University of Florida Admissions page.The University of Florida is ranked #173 in 2022 and 188 in 2023 by QS. Academic reputation, citations per faculty, employer reputation, faculty-to-student ratio, and foreign student-to-faculty ratio are the variables that affect the QS World University rankings. According to the Times Higher Education rankings for 2022, the University of Florida is ranked 154th globally. Its ranking has fallen two positions when compared to the THE rankings from the previous year. The university held the 152nd place ranking in 2021.

Name: University of Sioux Falls
Overview: The University of Sioux Falls is a university located in Sioux Falls, USA. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Unassigned. The estimated average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenditures for an international student, are around 25,28,096. The University of Sioux Falls offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. Read more details about the University of Sioux Falls on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.

Name: Florida Polytechnic University
Overview: The Florida Polytechnic University is a university located in Lakeland, USA. It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Engineering. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programs for distance education students.The estimated average tuition fee for graduate courses is $19,998. Florida Polytechnic University offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students.A minimum of 6.0 is required in IELTS to be eligible for admission.Florida Polytechnic University graduates earn an average of $57,900, one of the highest salaries among all state universities. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship.
Eligibility Overview: Applicants must demonstrate English proficiency by University policy, and will be required to submit satisfactory evidence to demonstrate English proficiency based on the following options:TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) scores unless the country of origin uses English as the official language.A minimum score of 173 is required on the computerized TOEFL, 61 on the Internet-based TOEFL, and 500 on the paper-based TOEFL.Completion of the IELTS (International English Language Testing System, www.IELTS.org) with a minimum score of 6.A score of 77 on the Michigan English Language Assessment Battery (MELAB)Receipt of an Associate of Arts (AA) degree from a Florida public institution Graduate AdmissionsMaster’s Degree Program Admission Requirements:Admission decisions are based on consideration of the applicant’s academic records, letter of interest, and letters of recommendation. The following are the admission requirements:A bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Applied Sciences, or a closely related discipline from a regionally accredited universityA minimum GPA of 2.7 in the last 60 semester credits attemptedGraduate Record Exam (GRE) may be required for applicants with an undergraduate GPA of less than 3.25.A letter of interestTwo letters of recommendation
Placement: The university provides career development opportunities to the students which enables them to receive employment, explore careers, prepare for jobs and internships and receive career guidance. It uses a handshake program to provide jobs and internships to its students and holds an annual career and internship fair.It organizes CODES which is a series of workshops to assist students with career development skills and has also partnered with Microsoft to hold weekly professional development workshops. The job placement rate was around 90% as per Niche and the median annual salary was USD 52,100 as per Payscale.Top companies offering placements are Coca-Cola, Motorola, Lockheed Martin, and General Electric.

Name: Florida Atlantic University
Overview: Located in Boca Raton, Florida, USA, the Florida Atlantic University is a public research university founded in 1961. The University has got affiliation from Southern Association of Colleges and Schools (SACS), the Oak Ridge Associated Universities (ORAU), and the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB). It is also affiliated to NCAA Division I for sports. Around 30,000 students are enrolled in this University in various fields, including medicine, public administration, computer science, architecture, social work, humanities, business, science, engineering, nursing, and education. The campus of the Florida Atlantic University is spread across 850 acres of land at six different locations. Boca Raton is the university's main campus, followed by the campuses at Davie, Dania Beach, Fort Pierce, Fort Lauderdale, and Jupiter. The University offers more than 170 programs to its students and consists of 10 colleges. The University has formed a great partnership with various research organizations to provide practical knowledge to their students. Courses offered at the University include bachelor's, master's, combined degrees, doctoral, and other certificates along with post-baccalaureate courses. B.A. in Architecture, B.S. in Business Economics, BBA in Accounting, M.S. in Bioengineering, MBA, and PHD in computer science are some of the top courses offered by the University. Scholarships and financial aids are provided to the international students studying at the Florida Atlantic University, which includes the Depan International transfer student scholarship, Pathways Scholarship, Depan International freshman student scholarship, and many more. Around nine residential houses are provided by the University for on-campus housing. The students can also opt for part-time jobs provided by the Career development centre of the University to earn their cost of living. Around 90% of the students get employed within two years of graduation with an average salary package of $64,595.
Eligibility Overview: FAU admits students based on their high school GPA, grades in core academic courses, course choices, college preparedness in math, writing, and reading, class rank, and standardised test scores. FAU may also consider unusual talents through audition, portfolio, or tryout in some situations.Middle 50% of Admitted Freshmen Information on the ACT/SATIt is not an institutional decision to need an ACT or SAT test result for admissions consideration. Florida Atlantic University, like Florida's other 11 public universities, is bound by Florida Board of Governors admissions regulation 6.002, which mandates that first-year applicants present an ACT or SAT test result.

Name: Lehigh University
Overview: Lehigh University is a private research university located in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania. It was founded in 1865 by Asa Packer, who believed the university could provide education that could make positive changes in society in the future. The university is made up of five colleges that offer over 100 undergraduate degrees and 87 graduate and doctoral degrees. The top programs at Lehigh University include BS in Accounting, Masters in Industrial and Systems Engineering, BS in Finance and BS in Marketing. The university is divided into three campuses in the scenic Lehigh Valley of Pennsylvania. The Asa Packer Campus is the main campus, while Mountaintop Campus and Murray H. Goodman Campus are home to most of the university sports facilities. These campuses share a border and cover a total area of 2,350 acres. The average annual cost of studying at Lehigh University comes to around USD 72,000. The fees structure varies across programs depending on its duration as well as the program chosen. The university has been classified as a doctoral university for its high research output. It has a dedicated research site that covers a total area of 72 acres on campus. The Murray H. Goodman Stadium is the main arena for sporting events with a capacity of 16,000. Other sports are promoted in the Ulrich Sports Complex and Lewis Indoor Tennis Facility. The university has 13 sororities and 8 fraternities that help students build a network amongst their peers and alumni. It is also home to over 200 different student clubs to promote interaction and holistic development in creative fields of theatre, music and sports. Notable alumni from Lehigh University include Lee Iacocca, former CEO of Chrysler, astronaut Terry Hart and Ali Al-Naimi, who served as the Saudi Arabian Minister of Petroleum and Natural Resources.

Name: Cleveland State University
Overview: Cleveland State University, located in Cleveland, Ohio, is a public research university founded in 1964 as a state-aided institution where it adopted the curriculum, campus, and staff from Fenn College and holds accreditation from the Higher Learning Commission (HLC). The Institute constitutes ten schools and colleges established to provide education in various streams and offers 1000+ graduate, undergraduate, professional certificates, honors, and continuing education courses, including undergraduate, law, doctoral, and other joint programs. The main campus is spread across 85 acres, inclusive of 40+ buildings that are equipped with high-graded infrastructure to offer A-star facilities to students and faculty. Established to serve underprivileged students, CSU focuses on imparting a good quality of education to all, which helps students from different streams learn about various fields having other fee structures. CSU's average in-state tuition fee is $11,096, whereas the average need-based scholarship granted is approximately $7,790. The student-faculty ratio at CSU is 16:1.The nineteen-story Rhodes Tower comprises several faculty offices, a university library, and fully equipped classrooms. Aside from academic amenities, the CSU campus offers various sports like golf, basketball, soccer, fencing, swimming, tennis, volleyball, and more. It also houses Fenn Tower, Mather Mansion, and a Student Recreation Centre featuring group fitness classes, modern workout equipment, and arrangements for several extracurricular activities. For about 57 years, CSU has been the hub for conventional and contemporary teaching approaches, providing a top-notch education. The institution also offers inside outgrowth and development of students.

Name: University of Houston
Overview: The University of Houston, or UofH in short, is the 3rd largest university in Texas and caters to more than 46,000 students within its 667 acres of area. As a flagship public research university in southeast Houston, it has an R1 classification for Doctoral Universities with very high research activities. Over 282 degree programs, including law, pharmacy, architecture, art, natural sciences, optometry, technology and medicine, are offered in its fourteen in-campus academic colleges. Over forty on-campus research institutes offer interdisciplinary research on space commercialization, biomedical sciences, artificial intelligence, superconductivity and more Cynthia Woods Mitchell Centre and Cullen Performance Hall organize theatrical performances and other musicals. At the same time, Blaffer Art Museum exhibits works of students and international artists. The on-campus residence is available for first years at Cougar Village I and II and Moody Towers, for sophomores and above at Cougar Place, The Quad and Moody Towers, and there are also University Lofts and apartments at Bayou Oaks, Cullen Oaks and Cambridge Oaks. The campus also has the Hilton Hotel staffed by students and a library system including Music Library, Quinn Law Library etc. Housing rates can vary and cost approximately USD 6400 and USD 2300.Listed among the top universities and with notable alums including Elvin Hayes, Elizabeth Warren, Jim Parsons and Lizzo, the University of Houston also has the most prominent collegiate natatorium in the country.
Eligibility Overview: Before applying to any UH programme, graduate students must first obtain a bachelor's degree. Course-specific subject and scoring criteria apply.International students must apply with their Grade 12 score for undergraduate programmes. Score requirements vary according on their chosen major/subject, however an equivalent GPA of 3.0 or better (on a 4.0 scale) is commonly required. Only a few exceptional programmes require SAT/ACT scores. Furthermore, any of the following scores is required to determine English language proficiency:TOEFL - 79IELTs - 6.5Duolingo - 105
Placement: The University of Houston is ranked 7th on the CNBC Make It list of the best institutions for money, with 47,000 students, 2800 faculty, and an average placement of $56,000. The University of Houston is a research-intensive institution with 255 undergraduate and graduate programmes.Visit:- https://uh.edu/hilton-college/careers/Placement%20Reports/

Chemical engineering is one of these specialisations, along with civil engineering (#64), electrical engineering (#75), and others (#36). THE has also placed the University of Houston's PG Computers courses in the 301–400 category for 2021.
University Ranking: One of the best universities in the USA, the University of Houston, is well-known abroad. Name: University of Notre Dame
Overview: Founded in 1842, the University of Notre Dame is a private Catholic research institute located in Indiana with an acceptance rate of 16%. It offers 75 undergraduate majors across eight colleges and schools known primarily for the Theology and Philosophy departments.Students can apply for undergraduate, graduate and professional degree programs and pursue courses such as Engineering, Architecture, Global Affairs, Law and Business.To provide students with a global academic experience, the university offers over 50 international study programs and 11 Global Gateways and centres worldwide. The average undergraduate cost of attending is USD 78,347, while the average graduate-level tuition fee is USD 58,190 per year.Students can apply for University of Notre Dame financial aid; undergraduates need to submit the CSS Profile, Institutional Documentation Service (IDOC) and Free Application for Federal Student (FAFSA) Aid, while graduates need to submit the FAFSA. Some scholarships and grants available are the Federal Pell Grant, Notre Dame Club Scholarships, Federal Supplemental Educational Opportunity Grant etc.
Eligibility Overview: What are the requirements for participation?International students must achieve both program-specific and general standards to be considered for admission to the University of Notre Dame. The following are the precise eligibility conditions for each programme level:Requirements for Undergraduates:Although there is no requirement for a minimum grade point average or class rank, above-average high school achievement boosts the university's chances of selection.Four units of English, three units of Mathematics, two units of foreign languages, two units of science, and two units of history and social science must be completed during high school.The unit distribution may vary depending on the chosen programme of study, as well as the SAT or ACT scores.Participation in extracurricular and community-based activitiesOne letter of recommendation from any subject instructor; a counsellor recommendation is optional but encouraged.Essays are examples of writing supplements.Some creative undergraduate programmes may demand an example of talent.IELTS Academic: A band score of 7.5 or higher is required.A TOEFL iBT score of 100 or above is required.A score of 70 or higher on the Pearson Test of English-Academic (PTE)When candidates score 650 or higher on the SAT's Evidence-Based Reading and Writing exam, and/or an applicant scores 26 or higher on the ACT's English or Reading portions, English proficiency scores can be waived.Requirements at the graduate level (Master's and Doctoral programmes):The university's prerequisites for admission to graduate programmes vary depending on the programme. However, the following are the general requirements:A bachelor's degree is required (or equivalent as recognised by University of Notre Dame)On a 4.0 scale, an undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher is required.Scores on the GRE General Test and the GRE Subject Test (as per specific programme requirement)Intentional statementA resume, often known as a curriculum vitae, is a document that listsThree recommendation lettersIELTS Academic: A band score of 7.0 or higher is required.TOEFL iBT: An overall score of 80 or above on the TOEFL iBT, with a minimum score of 23 in the Speaking portion.

Course Ranking: Regarding the University of Notre Dame's course rankings, US News & World Report has given the university's business programmes high marks. The Graduate Business School was ranked 30 for 2021 and 2020, the MBA Business Analytics programme was 21 for 2021, and the UG Business programme was 12 for 2020 and 2021.The engineering programmes have also received high rankings from US News & World Report, with PG Aerospace Engineering coming in at number 21, Biomedical Engineering at number 71, Chemical Engineering at number 28, Civil Engineering at number 38, Electrical Engineering at number 39, and Mechanical Engineering at number 37.US News & World Report has ranked the PG Computer Engineering at 45 for 2021 in computer courses. The approach used by US News & World Report to rank subjects includes, among other things, considerations such as student selection (25%), the views of business school administrators (25%), and employment outcome (21%).
University Ranking: When it comes to rankings, the University of Notre Dame has often maintained a consistent place over time. The university is ranked 211 overall for 2021 according to the QS - World University Ranking. The university was formerly ranked 210 for 2020. In the 2021 THE (Times Higher Education) - University Ranking, the university is rated 170. The university has previously been ranked 157 for 2020. While Times Higher Education (THE) accords equal weight to Research, Teaching, and Citations at 30% each, QS places the greatest emphasis on Academic Reputation (40%) followed by Citations per Faculty at 20% each and the Faculty/Student Ratio. According to US News & World Report's Global Universities, the university is ranked 238 globally for 2021 and 223 globally for 2020. The university is mentioned in the National University Ranking by US News & World Report, where it is ranked 19th for 2021. In addition to other rating factors, the US News & World Report bases their rankings on the number of publications cited, global research reputation, and regional research reputation (12.5% each). View: Courses & Costs at the University of Notre Dame.For 2019 and 2020, the university received a ranking from ARWU (Shanghai Ranking) - Universities Rankings between 301 and 400. In the Shanghai ranking, universities are not ranked according to their standing among academics or employers; instead, they are ranked according to the calibre of academic research they produce and the number of Nobel Prizes its team has earned.

Name: Global Language Institute
Overview:
Global Language Institute is located in the metropolitan area of St. Paul / Minneapolis, Minnesota, U.S. The institution has been providing world-class training and instructions since 1990. It provides intensive English language training through a range of courses focusing on high quality training and student satisfaction. The courses offer professional training along with special group and youth programs. With a 100% acceptance rate, the institution is one of the least selective ones.
Global Language Institute courses comprises some special training programs such as, an intensive 30-hour program, a customized one-to-one training of GLI’s Executive English Program with a group interaction of a dynamic oral communications and many more academically focused curriculum. GLI offers an enhanced learning environment with warm, friendly and well-trained faculties. The teachers are professional and highly qualified with years of experience. The average size of the class is 8 students among them at least 6 are representing different countries.
Being located in the "Twin Cities" which is the home to more than three million people, the students can easily avail safe and affordable home stays. In addition, the cities offer excellent theater, professional sports, restaurants, entertainment, and the United States' largest shopping center, the Mall of America. Students can also enjoy the grand Mississippi River which is just a minutes’ walk away. 
Global Language Institute is easily accessible from Minneapolis/St. Paul International Airport due to continuous and frequent  service from both Europe and Asia. Moreover, the institution helps people by providing an intense English language training along with developing the confidence of the students by preparing them for the international parameters.

Name: Piedmont Virginia Community College
Overview: Established in 1890 by Norwegian immigrants, Pacific Lutheran University is a private Christian university situated in the Parkland neighbourhood of Tacoma in Washington. It is sponsored by the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America. PLU provides 54 minors and 44 majors, along with professional and graduate programs in creative writing, finance, marketing analytics, marriage, education, nursing, business administration, and family therapy. This institute sees a total enrolment of roughly 3100 students. Out of these, 38% are international students, who represent 28 countries and 38 states. The average student to teacher ratio in a classroom at this institution is 13:1. In the last 5 years, this university had an acceptance of more than 80%. For the class of 2024, the average GPA is 3.0 on a scale of4.0. Pacific Lutheran University ranking consistently features among the top 20 in U.S. News & World Report’s Best Universities in the West. This institute was recently named fourth in the West for Best Colleges for Veterans. The Washington Monthly College Guide also ranked it in the top 4% of Master’s universities nationwide. Around 98% students from PLU received financial aid and for the year 2020-21, the average financial aid offer was $37,197. The total costs of the year 2021-2022 was in the range of $55,000 to $60,000. Out of this, the tuition fees were in the range of $45,000 to $50,000 and the cost of meals and room featured in the range of $10,000 to $12,000. Notable alumni include American film, stage and television actor Connor Trinneer, a renowned American epidemiologist William Herbert Foege, and former American competition swimmer and Olympic Games gold medallist Megan Jendrick. Since 1975, this university has produced 100 Fulbright Scholars. About 90% of the students of Pacific Lutheran University have received employment or are in grad school six months after graduating.
Eligibility Overview: Individuals who are high school graduates or the equivalent (GED) or who are 18 years of age or older and able to profit from community college studies are eligible for admission to PVCC. The Governing Principles for Dual Enrollment Between Virginia's Public Schools and the Virginia Community College System govern how dual enrollment students are admitted. Other applicants who do not fulfil these admissions requirements may apply to the College for special consideration.PVCC accepts students as either curricular or noncurricular students. A full formal application for admission (with the appropriate Social Security Number) is required for all students. Students pursuing a degree (curricular students) must also submit transcripts from all previous institutions and universities. High school transcripts may be required for admission to nursing, emergency medical technology, surgical technology, radiography, and diagnostic medical sonography programmes.

Eligibility Overview: Urbana University welcomes students with a GPA of 3 or lower. It's fine to have a B average with some A's thrown in. It's better to stay away from Cs and Ds, as application readers may wonder if you can take the pressures of college.If you're a junior or senior, changing your GPA in time for college applications is difficult. You'll need a better SAT or ACT score to compensate if your GPA is at or below the school average of 3. This will enable you to compete effectively against applicants with better GPAs.Requirements for the SAT and ACTEach school has its own set of standardised testing standards. The SAT or ACT is required by most schools, and many also need SAT subject assessments.To apply to Urbana University, you must take either the SAT or the ACT. More significantly, you must do well in order to submit a strong application.Requirements for the SAT/ACT Writing SectionAn optional essay section is included on both the SAT and the ACT.Urbana University hasn't stated how they feel about the SAT Essay/ACT Writing, although it's likely that they consider it optional. As a result, you don't need to be concerned about writing for this school; but, other institutions to which you're applying may demand it.

Name: Thomas Jefferson University
Overview: Thomas Jefferson University in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, the USA, is a private university with a ranking of 176 in National Universities. Established in 1824 as the Jefferson Medical College, it was in 2017 that the Philadelphia University, established in 1884 as Philadelphia Textile College and the Thomas Jefferson University, merged to form Jefferson. Jefferson is an award-winning model professional private university offering core programs in architecture, design, business, engineering, science, social science, health, fashion, and textiles. The university has 160+ undergraduate and graduate programs and 30+ online degrees and certificates in organizational leadership, sustainable design, etc. Jefferson has a ranking of 109 by the US News in the best colleges for veterans and has 13 schools and colleges like the Sidney Kimmel Medical College, Colleges of Nursing, Rehabilitation Science, Humanities, and many others. The university records a 97% success rate of undergraduate students securing jobs or graduate schools onwards. There are two extensive campuses: the East Falls campus and the other is the Center City campus. The East Falls campus is spread across 100 acres with more than 50 buildings designated for academics, library, housing, and recreation. On-campus, accommodation is available at the Barringer residence hall, Martin residence hall, Orlowitz residence hall. Accommodation cost ranges between USD 7,000 to 16,000 per year as per occupancy, demand, and availability of housing facilities. Jefferson university's 96% undergraduates and 65% graduates receive financial aid for smooth educational facilities. It offers merit scholarships to deserving students ranging from USD 4,000 to USD 20,000. The estimated approximate tuition fee is USD 41,000. It has a strong alumni network of 63,500+ members comprising eminent faces like NASA astronaut James P. Bagian, soccer player Adrian Brooks, doctor William Willams Keen, and many others.
Eligibility Overview: English Proficiency RequirementsFor overseas applicants, a 3.0 GPA is required. However, for easier entrance, it is recommended that you aim for a cumulative GPA of 3.6. Applicants for admission to Thomas Jefferson University must additionally have a TOEFL iBT score of 80 to demonstrate their fluency in the English language.Check here: https://www.jefferson.edu/admissions/graduate/international.html

Name: Queens College
Overview: Queens College is a reputed institution in New York, USA. This is considered one of the most culturally diverse colleges in the USA. More than 20,000 students are enrolled in this college from various countries. This college is well known for offering quality liberal arts and sciences education with Bachelor's, master's, doctoral, and certificate courses. Apart from offering full-time and part-time courses, it is also known for offering online courses. Queens College is a part of the CUNY Honours University and offers education to its students in the fields of Arts and Humanities, Education, Natural Sciences, and Social Sciences. In addition, students who are interested in the field of mathematics can be a part of TIME 2000. The college campus is spread over 80 acres of land, consisting of a music building, laboratories, and the Rosenthal Library. The college is popularly known for maintaining a sustainable environment. It is also the most popular college that produces qualified graduates who become principals, counsellors, and teachers. The college is ranked 9th among the top public schools in the USA by the U.S. News and World Report 2020. B.S. in Computer Science, MS in Risk Management, BBA, and M.A. in Computer Science are some of the top courses offered by the college. MFA in neuroscience, music, speech pathology, education, and creative writing are some exceptional courses offered by the college.The college started offering new courses, including B.A. in Classics, B.A. in Chinese, and M.S. in Photonics. Scholarships are provided to international students. Queens College does not provide on-campus accommodation. However, the student can always opt for off-campus housing associated with the college.
Eligibility Overview: English Language Requirements
Eli Table:
TestMinimum Scores

International English Language Testing System (IELTS)

Score of 6.5 on Academic Module with no band below 6.0

Please note: We accept IELTS results in either of the two following ways:
Electronic Test Report Form (TRF): Queen's E-Transfer Institution is Queen's University (preferred)
OR
Test Report Form (TRF) number:  Email Undergraduate Admission and Recruitment at admission@queensu.ca a scanned (PDF) copy of your TRF results or your TRF number.

Queen's University Undergraduate Admission does not accept IELTS Indicator.

Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL)

TOEFL (Home Edition)

Institution Code: 0949

iBT (Internet Based TOEFL)/88 overall: 24 Writing, 22 Speaking, 22 Reading, 20 Listening; Paper Based TOEFL (PBT)/580 (TBC)

Canadian Academic English Language Assessment (CAEL)

Overall band of 70 with no band below 60

Queen’s School of English

High standing on 12-week English for Academic Purposes advanced level English courses

Pearson Test of English Academic (PTE Academic)

Overall score of 60

Duolingo English Test

Minimum score 110

The Duolingo English Test is an online English proficiency test that can be taken online, on-demand, in under an hour for only $49 USD. The test is taken via a computer with a camera and includes a proficiency score, video interview, and writing sample which are shared with Queen's University when you send your results . Certified results are available within 48 hours of the test session.

Cambridge English

175, with no component below 170

Apart from the Erasmus building, all Queens' main site lodging is built using the classic staircase pattern. Name: Widener University
Overview: Established in 1821, Widener University is a public university with its main campus in Chester, Pennsylvania, along with the other three campuses in Harrisburg, Exton, and Wilmington. With an acceptance rate of 65%, the institution has over 6,500 students. Widener University has been categorized into six academic colleges offering 50 undergraduate majors, 40 minors, and over 50 postgraduate programs in diverse disciplines. Dual degrees and joint majors are also provided in psychology, health sciences, and environmental science courses. The online programs have been ranked 6th among all universities in Pennsylvania, and the courses in Healthcare Management, Engineering, and Social Work are also highly ranked. The university has an Exploratory Studies, Leadership, and Civic Engagement program. Around 94% of graduates from Widener University get employment within six months of graduation, with an average median salary of 53,400 USD.Students are provided on-campus accommodation in 17 residence halls with fully-furnished traditional and suite-style rooms with amenities like closets, desks, and free laundry. The campus also has laboratories, classrooms, the Taylor Memorial Arboretum for research-related activities, the well-equipped Wolfgram Memorial Library, health centers, museums, and dining options.The average tuition and fee amount to 47,770 USD, and financial aid through scholarships worth up to 27,000 USD are awarded. The You Are Welcome Here Scholarship Program, which waives off almost 50% of the tuition fee, benefits international students and other merit-based scholarships worth up to 100,000 USD and Honours Program scholarships worth 2,000 USD.
Eligibility Overview: Applicants for Freshman EngineeringFreshman engineering applicants must meet one of the following math requirements in addition to the usual university criteria for admission:Score 3 or higher on Widener's free online math assessment.A minimum SAT Math score of 540 is required (or the equivalent ACT Math score of 21)For credit, present the requisaite IB/AP exam scores.Applicants for Transfer EngineeringStudents who have completed college-level courses and are transferring into an engineering programme must achieve all of the following requirements in addition to the usual university admission requirements:All post-secondary colleges attended had a cumulative grade point average of 2.50 on a 4.0 scale.Calculus I* with a grade of "C" or aboveA "C" or better in one of the following subjects: General Chemistry I, Physics I, or Biology I*.Calculus I and the science requirement course must be satisfactorily completed on the final official transcript. You may be conditionally admitted if courses are in progress at the time of application, but you must demonstrate successful completion of the courses before matriculation.Any NACES approved organisation can do a comprehensive, course-by-course credential evaluation including GPA calculation.
Placement: Recruiting CompaniesJP Morgan Chase | Boeing | Du Pont | KPMG | Lockheed Martin Corp. | Merrill Lynch | Siemens | Verizon | Johnson Johnson

Overview: The UBridge@COM campus is located in Kentfield, Marin County, California, in College of Marin. Name: University of Connecticut
Overview: The University of Connecticut is a public research university in Connecticut, United States. The university was founded in 1881 as the Storrs Agricultural School. It took on its current name in 1939 when it achieved university status. Commonly known as a Public Ivy, it is also part of the Universitas 21 network, a global network of research-intensive universities. It comprises 14 schools and colleges offering several undergraduate, graduate and doctoral programs across various fields. The top programs at the University of Connecticut are Masters in Business Administration (MBA), MS in Mechanical Engineering and MS in Biomedical Engineering. Research facilities like the George Safford Torrey Life Sciences Building and the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center have helped the university establish a reputation for high research output.The average annual expense of studying at the university costs around USD 35,000.
Eligibility Overview: The following are the minimal program-specific eligibility requirements that overseas applicants must achieve before applying to the University of Connecticut:Eligibility Requirements for UndergraduatesBasic Instruction:Secondary school in a relevant discipline from a recognised institution (equal to US 9–12 grades)Proficiency in English (either):IELTS: 6.5 band minimumA minimal TOEFL score of (either of):79 out of 100 in an internet-based testTest on a computer: 213550 on a paper-based testDET (Duolingo English Test): A minimum score of 100 is required.Exams that are standardised (either):SAT or ACTEligibility Requirements for Graduate StudentsBasic Instruction:A four-year bachelor's degree in a relevant discipline from a regionally accredited college or university with a minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale English Proficiency (any of):IELTS: 6.5 band minimumA minimal TOEFL score of (either of):79 out of 100 in an internet-based test550 on the old paper-based testNew paper-based test: 22/30 in each of the parts of listening, reading, and writingA minimum of 53 Standardized Exams on the PTE Academic:The GMAT is required for MBA applications.GRE (Graduate Record Examination) is a subject test for MS applications.
Placement: Six months after graduation, the University of Connecticut has a good employment outcome record, with a 90 percent success rate for 2021. A full-time job was held by 64 percent of students with an advanced degree, while 5 percent worked part-time. Twenty-seven percent of advanced degree holders are still looking for work. Sixty percent of full-time job holders work in Connecticut, while Massachusetts is the second most preferred state for them to work in. UCONN has been ranked among the top 25 public universities in the country by U.S. News & World Report's America's Best Colleges (2022).The typical pay for graduates working full-time is $60,000 to $69,999, while part-timers earn $20,000 to $29,999.
Accommodation: On Campus AccommodationThe University of Connecticut (UConn) believes on-campus housing to be an important and fundamental aspect of its students' overall education. The Residency Requirement was created after careful study.For the academic year 2021-2022, all undergraduate first-time freshmen and undergraduate international freshmen admitted to the Storrs campus for the fall and spring semesters must live on campus.Visit:- https://reslife.uconn.edu/Off Campus AccommodationThe average monthly rent is between 750 and 950 dollars.Studio apartments, three-bedroom apartments, four-bedroom apartments, and communal apartments are among the residential types.A laundry facility, internet access, bike parking, and other amenities are available in the student homes.The apartments are in a great location, only 4 miles from retail malls, grocery stores, and other local businesses.Visit:- https://www.apartments.com/mansfield-ct/https://www.forrent.com/find/CT/metro-Central+CT/Storrshttps://amberstudent.com/places/search/mansfield-connecticut-united-states
Course Ranking: In its 14 colleges, the University of Connecticut offers more than 115 majors at the undergraduate, graduate, and doctorate levels. Popular courses offered by the institution include those in media & communication, business, architecture, engineering & technology, sciences, arts & humanities, and sciences. Due to student demand, courses at the University of Connecticut have been ranked. For the year 2021, US News & World Report ranks the undergraduate business programme at number 53 and the graduate programme at number 74. The University of Connecticut's PG Business & Economics courses are ranked in the range of 401-500 by THE, while QS places its Global MBA programme in the 151-200 level for the year 2021. The University of Connecticut's PG Engineering & Technology courses are ranked by THE in the range of 251-300 for 2021. Different PG Engineering & Technology courses are ranked among the top 100 for 2021 by US News & World Report. Chemical engineering is ranked at number 53, mechanical engineering at number 56, civil & biomedical engineering at number 64, computer engineering at number 69, etc. The University of Connecticut's PG Computer courses are ranked by THE between 401 and 500 for the year 2021.
University Ranking: According to US News & World Report, the University of Connecticut has been ranked among the top 100 universities in the USA for the previous four years, not only in 2021. US News & World Report has the university's national ranking at #63 for the year 2021. According to US News & World Report's ranking of global universities for the year 2021, the University of Connecticut comes in at number 332. The University of Connecticut has an average acceptance rate of 56%, and higher end ACT and SAT scores were required for admissions in 2020. These statistics have a significant impact on rankings. The University of Connecticut is ranked by THE between positions 401 and 500 for the year 2021, with a negative trend line. due to a dramatic increase in the range from 2020 to 2021. The university receives a maximum score of 61.4/100 for citations, followed by a score of 54.5/100 for global outlook. According to QS rankings, University of Connecticut has a below-average overall score of 29.6/100 and is ranked between 501 and 550 for 2021.

Course Description: University of Connecticut is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. University of Connecticut was founded in 1881. Located in Mansfield,USA the university is home to about 8200 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.University of Connecticut is ranked 139th in Top Universities by Webometrics - World. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. Name: St Ambrose University
Overview: St. Ambrose University is a university located in Davenport, USA. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Computer Engineering. A minimum of 6.0 in IELTS or 79 in TOEFL is mandatory for admission.The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. The estimated average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenditure for an international student, are around 3039409 INR. St. Ambrose University offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. Students must submit an additional free application to be eligible for Scholarships. The university also provides loans and assistantships.The university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. 91% of the students were employed within 6 months of graduation.Read more details about St. Ambrose University on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.

Placement: InternshipsAn internship is a short-term job that provides you with training and experience in a field related to your major. It's an opportunity to learn more about other vocations put what you've learned in class into practice, and obtain valuable experience to add to your résumé. The majority of SAU students interned while still in school. It's a fantastic opportunity to gain helpful experience while earning free credit.During their undergraduate years, more than 75% of SAU students participate in at least one internship or experiential activity. They work in hospitals, accounting firms, social service organisations, multinational corporations, banks, laboratories, museums, and theatre production companies, among other places. They work in commercial, government, and non-profit organisations, contributing and learning on the job. Types of Internships You can intern full-time or part-time and for periods ranging from 90 days to a semester or longer. The university posts internship opportunities on Handshake, and you should have your resume completed by the end of your first year so you may start applying for jobs. Make an appointment with a career counsellor today, and the university will ensure that you are well-prepared and informed.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation It provides a safe, supportive, and empowering environment in which you will be challenged and supported. It's about as lovely as it gets when living on campus at St. Ambrose University.Enjoy the best suite living, apartments, and close access to everything you need to excel in college in modern resident halls (some of the best in the Midwest). The Advantages of Living on Campus are:Safety and security have been improved. Front desks are staffed, residents live on each level and lead security and police patrol the site regularlyClassrooms, the library, sporting and recreational facilities, the cafeteria, faculty/staff/administrative offices, and other amenities are all close byWeekly housekeeping, utilities, and Internet access are all includedThere is a network of staff ready to help you with your needs (Residence Life, Security, and Physical Plant) Academic Community North Hall North Hall, which houses our Academic Community, is our newest hall and offers traditional and apartment-style living to standard and preferred housing students.Each preferred apartment has four single bedrooms, a shared living room, kitchen, and bathrooms. The traditional home consists of a suite with two double rooms joined by a large bathroom. The total number of residents is 204. Amenities provided are: Private bathroom and shower in each suite and apartmentDressers, closets, and desksCarpeted floorsAir-conditioningADA Accessible RoomsWireless and ethernet hookupsCommunity laundry facilities  Residence Halls Bechtel Halls Bechtel Hall, first opened in 2004, is a coed residence hall for first-year students. It features suite-style living for two people. The total number of residents is 140. Cosgrove Halls Cosgrove Hall, which was opened in 1969, is a six-story structure with four levels of suite-style accommodation for first-year men and women. A bathroom connects two rooms. The rooms are for two people. The total number of residents is 224. Davis HallDavis Hall, the campus's second building, was completed in 1927. It is now a female-only residence hall. There are 121 seats available. Franklin Hall This $7 million residence hall, which opened in the fall of 2005, houses sophomores in suite-style living. The total number of residents is 204. Hagen Hall Apartments for four and six people with single bedrooms, a communal living area, kitchen, and bathrooms are available for preferred housing students. The total number of residents is 140. Tiedemann Hall It was built in 1996 and provided an apartment-style living for students who choose it. Each apartment has two bedrooms, a shared living area, a kitchen, and a bathroom for four students. The total number of residents is 124. McCarthy Hall McCarthy Hall, which opened in 2008, provides apartment-style housing for students who choose to live on campus.Each apartment has two bedrooms, a shared living area, a kitchen, and a bathroom for four students. Some units have two bedrooms, a communal living area, a kitchen, and a bathroom for two students. The total number of residents is 96. Rohlman Hall Rohlman Hall is a classic coed residence hall that houses sophomores predominantly. It was renovated for $5 million in 2001. The Rohlman offers suite-style living for two people. The total living area, kitchen, and bathroom capacity is 202. The total number of residents is 96.  Houses Houses are a distinct feature of life in St. Ambrose. In Davenport, junior and senior students can live in their own campus houses while still being part of the campus residential community.Students taste life beyond college by living on campus, emphasising responsibility and personal growth. Residence life and campus security maintain the safety of the residents by conducting walk-throughs and thorough rounds of the area. Townhouses The Andrews, Strub, Schneider, and Sudbrook townhouses, erected in 1990 for preferred housing students, are two-story townhouses.Each unit features a kitchen, a common living area, four double bedrooms, and two bathrooms for eight students. The total number of residents is 104. For more information, visit: https://www.sau.edu/student-life/residence-life/residence-halls  Graduate Housing Full-time graduate students at St. Ambrose University can live in various SAU-owned Houses. Housing is billed daily to accommodate graduate academic schedules. Requirements for Graduate HousingSt. Ambrose University has accepted me into a graduate programmeObtain a bachelor's degree from St. Ambrose or another authorised school of higher learningKeep the Student Code of Conduct in mind (found in the Student Handbook)   Off-Campus Accommodation Full-time students must live on campus until they have finished two years of post-secondary education at St. Ambrose or another recognised institution of higher learning (community college, college or university).Students who live within 50 miles of campus with a parent or legal guardian may be excluded from the residence requirement.The residency requirement may be removed for students who start college more than a year after graduating high school. For more information, visit: https://www.sau.edu/student-life/residence-life/housing-options

Name: Fordham University
Overview: Fordham University in New York City was established in 1841 and is a private Jesuit research institute with an enrollment of 16,364 students. The university has an acceptance rate of 46% and has 9,399 students in undergraduate and 6,965 students in graduate/professional degree programs. Students can enrol in one of the nine schools, like the Gabelli School of Business, Graduate School of Education and School of Law, and study majors such as journalism, Philosophy, Women, Gender and Sexuality Studies, Music etc. The study abroad programs offered by the university comprises more than 110 courses, including virtual learning programs in 52 countries; students can go to London, Granada, Rome etc. Moreover, the Fordham University Online Learning offers six fully online degrees and multiple courses, including a Master of Social Work, Master of Science in Management and Advanced Certificate in Real Estate Finance. The estimated undergraduate tuition fee is USD 54,730. Financial aid is available for undergraduate and graduate students, and those who wish to avail of it must first fill out the Free Application for Federal Student (FAFSA) form. Aid comes in scholarships, grants and loans such as the Fordham Tuition Award, Metro Grant, Need-Based Grants, Presidential Room Award, The John M. Bach Scholarship etc.Placement reports show that 89% of undergraduates found employment, acquiring packages with an average starting salary of USD 61,660.
Eligibility Overview: Fordham University needs you to have a 3.64 GPA and be above average in your high school class. At the very least, you'll need a mix of A's and B's, with more A's than B's. You can make up for a low GPA by taking more difficult classes, such as AP or IB.Fordham admissions is competitive, with a 53 percent acceptance rate. Fordham accepts students with an average SAT score of 1230-1410 or an average ACT score of 27-32. Fordham University's usual admissions deadline is January 1. Students who are interested can apply for early action or early decision.
Accommodation: During the winter and spring breaks, the Rose Hill campus' undergraduate residence halls are normally closed. As a result, if you plan to live on the Rose Hill campus during the holidays, you will need to make other arrangements: Spring Break, Thanksgiving (late November), Christmas and New Years (a week in March)University housing is unable to accommodate married students.for more detail click on this link-https://www.fordham.edu/info/21324/new_arrival_information/5097/housing
Course Ranking: The business courses are fairly well-liked and have received respectable rankings from leading publishers. From 2016 to 2020, Bloomberg placed Fordham among the best 100 b-schools in the USA. Fordham's ranking by Bloomberg has significantly improved, going from 57th in 2019 to 19th in 2020.Fordham must have made improvements in all four of the key metrics used by Bloomberg to determine the best business schools in the US: salary, network, entrepreneurship, and learning. Fordham is ranked 95th globally for MBA programmes by Financial Times in 2019. The top 100 Master in Finance programmes according to Financial Times' rankings for 2017 and 2018 are also included.Fordham's global MBA ranking fell from 101-110 in 2018 to 131-140 in 2021 according to QS (Top Universities). It demonstrates how poorly the university has succeeded in regards to important factors like return on investment, entrepreneurship, and employability. Fordham is ranked between positions 401 and 500 in the 2019 PG Business and Economics category by Times Higher Education (THE). Fordham was ranked 18th in MBA Finance by US News & World Report in 2021.Additionally, in 2018, 2019, and 2021, US News named Fordham among the top 100 graduate business schools in the US. Additionally, US News ranked the university 19th in their global MBA systems for 2021. From 2018 to 2021, US News placed Fordham among the top 100 undergraduate business schools. We can infer from the aforementioned statistics that ranking publishers favour Fordham University's business programmes.
University Ranking: Fordham University, a private institution in New York, New York, USA, was founded in 1841. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.Baker College is ranked 6711th in Top Universities by Webometrics - World. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 3 undergraduate and 1 postgraduate programs. Baker College has 3 intakes in Sep,Jan,Jun. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 4 years and master’s degree courses is 1 years.The average yearly tuition fee of Baker College is around 22260.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Name: University of New Haven
Overview: The University of New Haven is a private university in New Haven, Connecticut. The university, formerly known as the New Haven YMCA Junior College, was founded in 1920. It comprises five colleges offering science, arts, and business studies programs. The university offers over 100 undergraduate programs and 50 graduate programs. The best programs at the University of New Haven include B.S. in International Business, MS in Data Science, and M.S. in Forensic Science. The university's main campus is located in West Haven. Some prominent buildings include the Marvin K. Peterson Library, Bartels Student Activity Center, and Forensic Science Learning Lab. The main campus is home to the Henry C. Lee Institute of Forensic Sciences, which offers several forensic research and education facilities. A secondary graduate campus is located in Orange, Connecticut. The tuition fee structure varies depending on the program chosen and its duration. The average annual study cost at the University of New Haven ranges from around USD 60,000.The university has over 160 clubs on campus, promoting activities and discussions outside of academics. This ensures the holistic development of students throughout their education. The university also has many sororities and fraternities that help students build networks amongst their peers and alums, helping them establish strong professional networks. Intramural and club sports are also promoted within the campus. The New Haven Chargers represent the university at various national collegiate sports tournaments. Famous alums to have attended university here include baseball player Dave Wallace, lawyer Lubbie Harper Jr., and John M. Picard, the former mayor of West Haven.

Name: Southern Illinois University
Overview: Southern Illinois University is a public university located in the city of Carbondale in Illinois, United States. Founded in 1868 as the Southern Illinois Normal College, the university has grown over the years and has received wide acclaim for its research output. With ten different schools and colleges under its name, the university offers over 200 programs in undergraduate, postgraduate and doctoral studies. The best courses at Southern Illinois University include MS in Electrical and Computer Engineering, MS in Civil Engineering and Masters of Business Administration (MBA). The university's main campus is spread across 1,136 acres of land in Carbondale, Illinois. It is home to numerous libraries such as the Morris Library, Great Western Library Alliance and SIU Law Library. Students can access these facilities to obtain the latest literary material and books to assist their curriculum needs. The university also has a Health Center dedicated exclusively to education in the medical sciences. The annual costs of studying here average around USD 30,000. Students enjoy a vibrant life focused on a holistic learning experience on campus. The SIU Student Union is one of the most significant union buildings in the country, promoting interaction and collaboration outside of their education. Students and athletes of the Salukis, the university sports team, can use the Student Recreation Center to maintain their physical fitness with facilities including an Olympic-sized swimming pool and over 180 fitness stations. Students can participate in over 400 clubs, organisations, fraternities and sororities, participating in various events during their stay. Notable alumni to have graduated from South Illinois University include stand-up comedian Hannibal Buress, astronaut Joan Higginbotham and former basketballer Walt Frazier.
Eligibility Overview: International students must meet programme and country requirements. Note that the subject-specific score requirement varies depending on the major chosen by a student.
