Placement: Candidates completing their studies at Southern Illinois University are sought after by top US businesses, organisations, and employers. The university has a moderate graduation rate of 63 per cent. The Boeing Company, the U.S. Air Force, SWS Technology Partners, and the U.S. Navy are some of the organisations currently employing graduates from Southern Illinois University. Business majors in finance, accounting, business administration/management, and computer science are among the most sought-after bachelor's degree holders for employment, with at least 60% of employers hiring them.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation Residents get to meet new people, develop lifelong friends, participate in extracurricular activities, connect with instructors and staff, and much more. 1. Residence Hall areas a. East Campus The Student Health Center, Student Recreation Center, and downtown Carbondale are close to East Campus. Mae Smith, Neely and Schneider Residence Halls Approximately 600 students are housed in these 17-story high-rise housing halls. The single and double suite-style rooms in these high-rise structures have two bedrooms divided by a private bathroom. East Campus provides student lounges, kitchenettes, laundry facilities, and desk service around the clock. Trueblood Commons The Department of Public Safety, the Mae Smith, Neely, and Schneider Hall's mail rooms, a dining hall, and the Residence Life Office are all located in Trueblood Commons. b. West Campus Campus Lake and Thompson Woods are close to West Campus, often known as Thompson Point. Thompson Point Residence Halls The west campus region has eleven resident halls, and the Commons Building provides suite-style accommodations, with two bedrooms separated by a private bathroom. The eleven three-story resident halls (Abbott, Bailey, Baldwin, Bowyer, Brown, Felts, Kellogg, Pierce, Smith, Steagall, and Warren) include single and double rooms (two bedrooms divided by a private bathroom), lounges on each floor, and laundry on the lower floors. For students who have mobility issues, there are accessible rooms available. Lentz Commons The neighbourhood office, a dining hall, a mail room, a student lounge, and an additional accessible laundry room are all located in Lentz Commons. For more information, visit: https://housing.siu.edu/housing-options/residence-halls/residence-hall-areas.php  2. Apartments Wall & Grand Apartments, Elizabeth Apartments and Evergreen Terrace are the university's three apartment communities on campus. The university has apartments that are suitable for students who are married, in domestic partnerships, have children, are single graduate students, or are over the age of 21. For more information, visit: https://housing.siu.edu/housing-options/apartments/  3. Speciality Housing The goal of University Housing is to serve the students.  Accessibility The university ensures that student requirements are met adequately by collaborating closely with Disability Support Services. Co-ed Housing Provides co-ed apartments in Evergreen Terrace Apartments and Wall & Grand Apartments. Gender Inclusivity Provides gender-inclusive accommodation in the Campus Pride Living Learning Community (LLC), allowing students to live with roommates of any gender. For students who could identify as transgender or who are unsure of their gender identity and do not want to conform to gender stereotypes, this LLC offers a housing option. Veteran services Wall & Grand Apartments, junior/senior housing in University Hall, Evergreen Terrace, and conventional residence halls are just a few of the on-campus housing options available to veterans at SIU Carbondale. In most areas, we provide personalised contracts, all-inclusive living, and convenient locations. For more information, visit: https://housing.siu.edu/housing-options/specialty-housing.php  For general enquiries, visit: https://housing.siu.edu/

Name: Green River College
Overview: Green River College, established in 1965, has a wide range of programs to offer, where engineering, business, and computer science are the most popular ones. Also, its 2+2 transfer program is well recognized among international students who come from over 60 countries. Students get to acquire in-depth knowledge about the courses they have opted for and develop good English language skills as well. This mid-sized institution is situated in Auburn, Washington, in the Seattle Area. Online classes are available for these students, and all the study materials are usually sent over mail. Apart from that, Green River College students also get access to online resources that can be found with the help of the college. The institution has bagged the 9th position in 2-year colleges in the U.S. for international students enrolling. (IIE 2018/19) Green River College's acceptance rate is 100%, and the admission process is not that difficult, considering the SAT/ACT score is not required. However, the applicants need to have a sound academic record of getting in. The admission procedure involves applying online with all the necessary documents and TOEFL/IELTS scores. 49% of the total students receive financial aid from the college. 81% of students get employed within two years of their graduation. All international students are required to present the most recent I-20 while transferring from other U.S. schools.The tuition fees can go up to around $1,000—$5,000 per quarter; however, there are no scholarships available for international students.
Eligibility Overview: 1.You must be enrolled in a public high school. Students who are homeschooled or who attend a private school should contact their local public school system for enrollment information.2.Be a high school junior or senior, according to the district's grade level placement requirements.3.Be at least 16 years old at the time of admission, or turn 16 during the first quarter of Running Start enrollment.4.Meet the minimal placement requirements (for additional details, read below).Placement in EnglishTo participate in Running Start, students must be eligible for Engl& 101. At Green River, many students can use their Smarter Balanced Assessment scores, placement reciprocity, or the College Success Assessment. For additional information on all placement choices, go to the placement page.TOEFL iBT 61 or higher on the international TOEFL or the iBT Special Home Edition while TOEFL testing centers are closed during the COVID-19 pandemicIELTS 5.5 no band lower than 5.0

Our residential life team strives to create a warm, welcoming environment in which our residents can form personal relationships with their neighbours and participate in a range of events and programmes at CCA and the main GRC campus.CCA's apartment units are comfortable and modern, and are located directly across the street from the campus. Students will have the option of living in townhouse or flat-style apartment units with up to four other students. Residents are encouraged to participate actively in CCA. Residents and CCA staff collaborate to provide fun programmes, encourage responsible decision-making, and settle conflicts.for more information click on this link-https://www.greenriver.edu/campus/campus-resources/student-housing/

Name: Utah Valley University
Overview: Utah Valley University (UVU) is a public university in Orem, Utah, first established in 1941 under the name Central Utah Vocational School with a primary function of providing war production training. The university has a main campus in Orem and satellite campuses in Heber City, Spanish Fork, North Orem, Provo Municipal Airport and Lehi. UVU is a part of USHE (Utah System Of Higher Education), with the following schools and colleges: College of Humanities and Social Sciences; College of Science; College of Health and Public Services; College of Engineering and Technology; School of Arts; School of Education; and Woodbury School of Business.The university offers 44 certificate programs, 65 associate degrees, 91 bachelor's degrees, 11 master's degrees, and 30 online programs. The school provides studies in a vast discipline of subjects, such as Accounting, Art, Aviation, Business, Science, Social Studies, Performing Arts, Languages, Technology, Health and Public Services, Education, Environment, Medical, Trades, Culinary Arts, Digital Media, Computing, Agriculture and Forestry among others. The university provides accommodation facilities within the campus. It has 30 residential complexes with various facilities, including recreation halls and gyms. The average hostel and meals expense would be 10,691 USD. The average tuition and fees for non-residential students could cost 8,403 USD per semester; for residential students, it would cost about 2,953 USD. The institute also offers scholarships with an average financial aid of 17,588 USD. The university is ranked highest in Utah for alumni earnings. After the placements, the typical annual income was 43,800 USD.

Name: Wichita State University
Overview: Wichita State University, or WSU, is the first Municipal University of Wichita, founded in 1895. It is located in Wichita, Kansas, and is governed by the Kansas Board of Regents. Wichita University offers 51 bachelor's, 10 Engineering, 24 master's, and 10 business programs in their six colleges. Some popular majors at Wichita State University are Biological & Biomedical Sciences, Education, Health Professions & related programs, Engineering and Business, Marketing, Management, and related support services. At Wichita, the student-faculty ratio is about 19:1. The average annual in-state tuition & fees at Wichita State is $8,074, and out-of-state tuition & fees are $17,799 yearly, excluding all the other expenditures. In addition, the Full-time undergraduate at WSU can receive some need-based scholarship or financial aid up to $5,231. Students at Wichita State University can also take up various career opportunities in the form of internships, inter-campus development, full-time and part-time placements, and co-ops. In addition, Wichita State University has some good study-abroad networks with renowned institutions that enable students to swap cultures, campuses, or even countries for an academic year or a semester.

Name: Wilmington University
Overview: The main campus of Willington University is situated in New Castle, Delaware. It is a private university that offers more than 100 educational degrees and programs. Other than the main campus, it has 7 locations in New Jersey and 6 campuses in Delaware too. Wilmington University was established by Dr. Donald Ross in 1968 as Wilmington College. The name was changed to Wilmington University after gaining University status. It offers educational programs for over 30 master's degrees, 40 bachelor's degrees, and 12 Ph.D. courses. Other than that, it also offers short-term courses and certifications with online education. The postgraduate programs include subjects like higher education, Accounting, Cyber Security, and many more. Students can opt for financial aid and grants for up to 3,925 USD. Also, the score of ACT/SAT, GMAT/ GRE is not necessary for admission. Now, more than 20,000 students take admission to this university every year. It has several professional faculty members with an adequate ratio of 17:1. The renowned subjects offered by Wilmington University are technology, Sciences, Psychology, Arts, Behavioral Sciences, Health, Business, and many more. It has a huge space with several recreational and sports clubs where students can meet and interact with each other. The average cost of studying at Wilmington University is around 9,144 USD per annum. Wilmington University also offers private loans for students. Along with that, the students who graduate from this college enjoy several benefits. They get discounts for shopping, traveling, etc. Several renowned companies arrive to offer placements to the students every year. The average salary of graduates of the university is around 37,000 USD. Also, the Wilmington University doesn't offer on-campus housing for students. But, it provides assistance to get a suitable accommodation on-rent.

Name: Davenport University
Overview: The Davenport University is a university located in Grand Rapids, USA. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Engineering,Human resource, nursing, legal studies, financial accounting, etc. The main campus of Davenport University is located in Grand Rapids. The university offers both undergraduate programs and postgraduate programs.In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. The university's tuition fees is 3rd lowest among Michigan private colleges. Estimated average tuition and fees excluding miscellaneous expenditure for an international student is around $13,275. Davenport University offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. At Davenport, more than 95% of students receive financial help and scholarships in some capacity. 91% of students get scholarships or other forms of financial help each year, and unlike student loans, these money are not subject to repayment. Every year, they give out more over $15 million in Foundation scholarships, Michigan merit scholarships, and DU scholarships. This includes the late President Gerald Ford's full-tuition Ford Scholarship, given in his honour to Davenport students who he briefly taught and mentored.Read more details about Davenport University on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.

Name: SUNY Fulton-Montgomery Community College
Overview: Fulton–Montgomery Community College is a public community college situated in Johnstown, New York. The college is a campus of SUNY (State University of New York) and is a member of the NJCAA. Students receive two-year associate degree programs along with getting certificate programs. The college has an acceptance rate of 100% and is famous for its successful transfer programs among other SUNY community colleges. SUNY Fulton-Montgomery Community College transfer program is one of the integral features of the institution, with students going on to gain baccalaureate and graduate degrees. The college is known for offering popular majors in Business Administration, Business Marketing, Criminal Justice, Entertainment Technology etc. and is accredited by the Middle States Association of Schools and Colleges and follows a semester-based academic calendar. It has a student-faculty ratio of 18:1 and small class sizes. Fulton–Montgomery Community College provides a full-time Intensive English Language Program for students who have a rudimentary grasp of the language and for those who want to prosper studying in English for career upliftment and social engagements. Mock exams are conducted to determine the student's knowledge of the language. Applicants can opt as full-time learners for an academic program only after successfully completing the ESL course. Students will be offered placement according to their ESL, IELTS, and ITEP scores of 109, 5.5 and 4 respectively. The Fulton–Montgomery Community college enrolls nearly 125-150 international students every year, contributing to the diversification of the campus. Apart from offering excellent facilities, the college also provides multiple services to the students, such as the fitness center, performing arts theatre, computer and science laboratories etc. 48 percent of undergraduates receive grants and scholarships. Students can also opt for distance learning.

Name: University of Arizona
Overview: University of Arizona, established in 1885, is a public land-grant research institute and the first university in the Arizona Territory. It has an acceptance rate of 85% and offers over 300 majors across undergraduate, graduate and certificate programs. The university, with about 46,932 students enrolled 36,503 undergraduates and 10,429 graduates and has a 46% diverse student body. With 20 colleges, 12 specialized schools and academic departments, some of the famous University of Arizona courses offered include Arts & Media, Culture & Language, Animal & Veterinary Sciences, Interdisciplinary Studies etc. Arizona Online is an initiative to enable people worldwide to avail the same courses available on-campus but from home without paying out-of-state tuition. A few of the popular online courses are Accounting, Law, Entrepreneurship, Military Families and Public Health. The University of Arizona fee structure is quite flexible and it charges no out-of-state tuition; the undergraduate cost of attending is USD 500-610 per credit while the graduate cost of attending is USD 650-1332. Financial aid is available in scholarships, grants, and loans for which students must submit the Free Application for Federal Student Aid. Scholarships Universe is the university's scholarship-matching tool, and Arizona Online students can avail of Direct Student Loans and the Federal Pell Grant. Moreover, the Bridge Scholarship is available for transfer students. The University of Arizona offers state-of-the-art classroom amenities to its students, including several libraries like the Main Library, Law Library, Fine Arts Library etc., along with fitness centers, swimming pools and sports courts. University of Arizona housing comes in 23 dorms comprising singles, doubles, apartments and suites with multiple dining options. Moreover, graduate housing is available at La Aldean (1,2,4 bedroom apartments) with all the necessary amenities. There are more than 600 student organizations and clubs and 18 intercollegiate sports teams (men's and women's).

Eligibility Overview: International students requiring an I-20 must submit official documents by June 1 for the fall semester and November 1 for the spring semester. In addition to the program's prerequisites, the following items are required to execute an admissions application:A TOEFL score of 550 or higher on the paper exam or 79 or higher on the Internet-based test; OR an IELTS Academic test score of 6 or higher; OR a DUOLINGO English Test (DET) score of 100 or higher. Scores from tests done within the last three years are required. The submission of a lower than minimum TOEFL, IELTS, or DET score would be considered when accompanied by an SAT score above 1000 or an ACT score above 22.Students who are native nationals of countries where English is the primary language are not required to show proof of English competence. Students who present evidence of at least one year of high-school or higher-level education with English as the language of instruction may be granted a waiver of the requirement to provide evidence of proficiency, provided that the student's performance was the equivalent of a GPA of 2.5 or higher and the English-language education was completed within the last three years. Official SAT or ACT results must be submitted by students who are not required to present evidence of English language ability.Transcripts from institutions outside the United States or Canada that do not follow a U.S. or Canadian curriculum and/or are not in English must be evaluated in English by a member of the National Association of Credential Evaluation Services on an overall and course-by-course basis (NACES). In lieu of official transcripts, this evaluation must be provided directly from the evaluation service to the Office of Admissions.Georgian Court University Financial Support Documentation; and Before receiving an I-20 form, students must submit a nonrefundable tuition deposit of USD $250.00 upon acceptance to Georgian Court. Applicants must request full-time employment (12 or more credits per semester). International students who need an I-20 form must submit their enrollment deposit by June 1 for the fall semester and November 1 for the spring semester.Students must pay the US immigration SEVIS I-901 fee after receiving the I-20 form. Please visit http://www.fmjfee.com for further information about this fee. After that, the student must go to an embassy or consulate to get the visa and any further information. Additional information is available at http://www.uscis.gov. If in the United States on a student visa, international students can only attend one online course every semester.Check: https://catalog.georgian.edu/undergraduate/admission/admission-requirements-international-students-f-1-student-visas/

Name: California Institute of Technology
Overview: The California Institute of Technology was established in 1891 as a private institution with a 124-acre campus in Pasadena, California. The university is spread across six academic divisions, namely, the Division of Biology and Biological Engineering, Chemical Engineering and division of Chemistry, Division of Geological and Planetary Sciences, Division of Engineering and Applied Science, Division of the Humanities and Social Sciences, Division of Physics, Mathematics, and Astronomy. The institution offers nearly 28 undergraduate and 30 graduate degree programs. The university provides bachelor's, master's, engineering, computers, science, humanities, business, BSc, BBA, MS, and BTech courses. The institution offers majors in applied and computational mathematics, geology, astrophysics, biology, business, economics & management, chemical engineering, and chemistry. Some of the university's most well-known courses are a bachelor of physics, a master's in bioengineering, an MS in civil engineering, and an MS in planetary science. There are also computational and neural systems, computer science, economics, electrical engineering, and applied science, among other majors. The average cost of tuition fees is between USD 77,718 and 91,594. In addition, the university collaborates with UCLA David Geffen School of Medicine, USC Keck School of Medicine, and Kaiser Permanente Bernard J. Tyson School of Medicine to offer joint degree programmes. The California Institute of Technology provides scholarships, loans, awards, and grants only based on the student's needs and helps them locate work while studying to support their finances.Graduates can access career services through the institute's Career Development Center. The centre offers counsel, resume writing workshops and tips, pre-health and pre-professional advising, networking strategies, and higher study options to the students.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Requirements: Undergraduate: The university accepts admissions from students who have completed the university's approved programme. It contains the following items:Students must obtain an A or B in three courses in IGCSE, AS, and A-LevelsInternational Baccalaureate (IB): Students must achieve an IB exam score of 6 or 7Advanced Placement Courses (AP)Cambridge Pre-UniversityQualifications in the local education system are comparable to those in the United StatesStudents must have a solid academic record, particularly in math and science, to be admitted to UG courses, as well as:Completion of a high school curriculum equal to that in the United StatesMathematics for four years (including Calculus)Physics for a yearChemistry for a yearThree years of English instruction (four years recommended) Aside from that, Caltech expects students to be prepared for the core curriculum, which includes:Students must have taken the most advanced and complicated English classes availableStudents studying in the United States must have taken at least one course in American history or government. For students studying outside of the United States, it is not compulsory Graduate: For graduate courses, applicants must have a GPA of 3.5 on a scale of 4 to be in the top 5 to 10% of the class. A bachelor's degree or equivalent in a comparable discipline from a tier-1 or tier-2 university or institution, as well as advanced coursework in Math, English, and Science, are necessary. It is essential to highlight that applicants already hold a PhD will not be considered for a second PhD. English Requirements: Admission does not require a minimum score on an English proficiency test. An ESL instructor will examine the overseas applicants' English test scores during orientation. The instructor may recommend that the applicant enrols in an ESL (English as a Second Language) course based on the evaluation. The university accepts the following English tests:DETTOEFLPTEIELTSCAEL
Placement: The institute's Career Development Center offers its graduates and alumni specialised career services. Counselling, resume writing seminars and suggestions, pre-health and pre-professional guidance, networking methods, and higher study alternatives are available to students at the centre. Linkedin labs are supplied to students for them to connect with employers. The California Institute of Technology, the PhD is the highest-paying degree, with graduates earning an average of 10,226,000 INR. Graduates with a Masters in Science degree from the California Institute of Technology receive the lowest income, with an annual salary of 8,300,000 INR.  The average wages of Caltech graduates are listed below by job profile:  The graduate students are assisted in searching for jobs. Within two years of graduation, 89 per cent of institute alumni can find work, with the highest average wage of 210,000 USD per year. Overview: Incorporated in 2002, California State University Channel Islands (CSUCI) is a public university and the youngest one in the CSU family. The Accrediting Commission accredits it for Senior Colleges and Universities of the WASC (Western Association of Schools and Colleges). This institute provides various kinds of student housing on campus. The four major housing village types include Santa Cruz Village, Town Centre, Santa Rosa Village, and Anacapa Village. Santa Cruz village offers a housing facility to upper-division students. Santa Rosa Village is for freshmen and second-year students. Town Centre and Anacapa village are majorly meant for junior and senior international students. The various fields in which students can opt to pursue a major or minor at CSUCI include Applied Physics, Biology, Art, Anthropology, Chemistry, Communication, Early Childhood Studies, Global Studies, Liberal Studies, Mathematics, etc. CSUCI has a 22:1 student-to-faculty ratio and an admission rate of 84%. Name: Pepperdine University
Overview: Pepperdine University is a private research university located in Malibu, California. The university was founded in 1937 by George Pepperdine, a prominent entrepreneur and philanthropist. The university, which is affiliated to the Church of Christ, has an undergraduate school known as Seaver College as well as four graduate schools offering specializations in law, business, public policy and education and psychology. They offer undergraduate, graduate and doctoral programs as well as certificate courses. The best courses at Pepperdine University include Master of Laws (LLM), BS in Physics and BS in Accounting. The main campus of the university is located in the Santa Monica Mountains of Malibu, California. Covering a total area of 830 acres, it is known for being one of the most beautiful campuses in the world. The campus is home to state of the art academic facilities like the Payson Library and Tyler Campus Center. Other campuses are located in West Los Angeles, Calabasas and Irvine amongst other locations. The university also has international campuses located in Buenos Aires (Argentina), London (UK), Lausanne (Switzerland), Florence (Italy) and Heidelberg (Germany). The average costs of studying here can come up to USD 75,000 per annum, with the cost of tuition depending on the course structure and duration. Students enjoy an active campus life based on Christian principles and values. The Pepperdine Waves represent the university at national collegiate tournaments in a number of sports and are responsible for conducting intramural tournaments within the campus. Students can also participate in fitness programs, outdoor activities and spiritual retreats to enjoy a holistic student experience during their education. Notable alumni to have graduated from Pepperdine University include former tennis player and coach Brad Gilbert, actor Chace Crawford and James Hahn, judge and former mayor of Los Angeles.

Name: Troy University
Overview: Troy University is a public university located in the state of Alabama in the United States. It was founded in 1887 as the Troy Normal State School to help train and educate upcoming teachers in the region. Over the years, it has become the flagship university of the Troy University System. The university consists of seven schools and colleges, which offer numerous degrees in undergraduate, graduate and doctoral studies. The best programs at Troy University include Masters in Business Administration (MBA), Master of Science in Nursing (MSN) and Masters in Criminal Justice. The main campus of the university is located in Troy, Alabama. It is also home to the Confucius Institute, which promotes the Chinese culture and languages, as well as the Center for International Programs to promote cultural exchange on a global level. The campus in Montgomery is home to the Rosa Parks Library and Rosa Parks Museum, a tribute to the Civil Rights activist of the 20th century. Other campuses of the university are located in Phenix City and Dothan, conducting various programs of the university. The average annual costs of studying at the university come to around USD 22,000. The university has an active student life with a major emphasis on recreation and sports. Students can access the Trojan Fitness Center and Recreation Center Gym to maintain their physical health. The university also has a number of fraternities and sororities that help students build a professional and social network amongst their alumni and peers. The Trojans represent the university at a number of national sports tournaments. Over the years, they have achieved success in American football, soccer and baseball. Notable alumni to have graduated from Troy University include astronauts William G. Gregory and Kevin A. Ford, as well as American footballer DeMarcus Ware.

A valid passport is required.5. Proof of financial assistance for two semesters of study is required. Students can get conditional admission even if they don't have the required test scores. In order to matriculate into academic programmes, these students must take the ESL placement test and pass the criteria.
